review_body: Just returned from a fabulous stay at the Crowne Plaza Barcelona during Barcelona Pride.The hotel itself is very central, close to the Plaza de España - two metro stations just a short walk away.The hotel itself is very modern with the focal point being the stunning rooftop pool/bar terrace. Views of the city from the rooftop were incredible. Such a lovely chilled experience.Firstly I just want to congratulate the management team. Every staff member in the hotel was wonderful, so friendly and accommodating and couldn’t do enough constantly making sure our stay was a memorable one. All our special requests were noted and we were really made to feel welcome.The room was very spacious with a great view - I would definitely recommend requesting a high floor if you do book.Beds were very comfy, bathroom a really decent size with great amenities (bath robes, pillow menu etc).Had a lovely stay, it’s a really wonderful property and would rebook without hesitation if I ever return to Barcelona.Thanks so much for such a fabulous stay :)
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location, only a few minute walk from the magic fountains. My family and I chose to take the hop on hop off tour for 2 days and the bus stop was very conveniently located down the street from the hotel. The rooms are MASSIVE!!! Not quite sure why hotels in Spain do not allow you to have 4 people in a room. I'm not at all comfortable with leaving my pre-teens in their own room. In North America, you would never find this. Nevertheless, the rooms again, are HUGE and can definitely accommodate 4 people. The swimming pool was not a "pool" according to North American standards. I would classify it as an aquarium for adults to sit and relax in. Beautiful view from the rooftop...if you have some time to relax, definitely go to the top, grab a drink and enjoy the view of Barcelona. All in all, fantastic hotel...pricey for sure, but well worth it!
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is very well located 5 mins walk from Plaza de Espana, and a great choice for conferences and business. Food is excellent and service well trained and friendly. Rooms are very spacious and beds high quality. The roof top terrace and bar offers stunning views over Barcelona. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is not a central hotel but it is located in a perfect location for the business district ,the Olympic park ,cruise terminal and Barcelona football club.As a regular visitor to bcn and sitges we regularly stay in hotels in bcn . This one was chosen based on location to the cruise portWe payed for a club room and was not disappointed . The room was huge and the TVs even bigger ! The bed was alSo supersize .Nothing more to say about the room - ticked every box - twice! Bathroom excellent and the corridors to the room smelt lovely .The night we stayed athletico Madrid also stayed at the hotel - thought I recognised one good looking fella
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a modern, clean, efficient hotel with helpful, professional, friendly staff in an good location on a quiet street.The rooftop bar is a good place to unwind at the end of the day.Highly recommend this hotel for business trips.Booked as part of a bundle with an air ticket it was great value.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the excellent Crowne Plaza fira centre from 26th May to 1st June 2019 and from the very start, we knew we had chosen the right hotel.All the staff were very welcoming, we had booked a club room and were escorted to the Club Lounge to check in, while the staff member offered us an array of drinks and we settled on a very nice glass of champagne.Check in was seamless with the very helpful Cansin, who was very polite, helpful and informative. Cansin and Marc and all the staff were great.We have stayed in many different hotels with Club or Executive lounges and this is definitely one of the good ones! Juices and alcohol, including champagne all available from 7 am till 11 pm, along with light bites at various intervals.Breakfast is quite a feast, lots of choice and plenty of it.The hotel is well situated for sightseeing, very close to the Magic Fountain and the old Bull Ring, where there are lots of great restaurants, and easy access to the hop on-hop off buses.Up at the roof bar & pool area, all the staff gave a great service, Dinesh, always with a smile and Jordi went out of his way to give a great service, both remembering our drinks. We had a great evening meal just before it got dark, great views, made even better as night fell and area's lit up.The Crowne Plaza is excellent value in a great location, we would highly recommend it and would definitely stay again,
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the end of May at this hotel and I think it is one of the best Crowne Plaza (I stayed on various CP and other hotels from IHG ).Even though my reservation was with Reward Nights, I was upgraded to a larger room with access to the Club Lounge , because I am a Spire Elite member. In the Club Lounge I enjoyed an excellent breakfast , drinks, and different tapas during the day . The staff was very nice and helpful, from the beginning til the end of my stay. The room was excellent, with a big and very comfortable bed. The rooftop has a nice pool and a bar where you can have a drink/ meal with a great view over Barcelona.I will definitely come back to this hotel during my next vacation.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time to Barcelona and loved it. A hip, clean, laid back city. Stayed at the Crowne Plaza and loved it. Great location. Easy to get in and out of. Hotel and staff are TOPS..they greeted us when we got there. Were friendly and polite. Never had any issues they could not solve. Hotel is modern, clean and very relaxing. The rooftop bar was our favourite. With the bar/restaurant as well as pool topside, it was the perfect place to watch the sun go down and see the city come alive.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So were touring Europe with a South Korean KPop band and we land here for the last gig. A wonderful hotel with amazing facilities, including a rooftop bar and pool. This is where they missed a too score for the coffers. We finished our show at the Palau Sant Jordi and the load out was done by 0200 hours, at this point at least120 hungry and very thirsty roadys get back to the hotel wanting copious amounts of alchohol and nibbles. The hotel staff wouldnt open the roof bar, or any bar for that matter, and consequenlty the hitel missed out on about £3000 worth of business (we can drink a lot after a last show). Great hotel and location though, great rooms and staff.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This has to be one of the best Crowne Plaza hotels for service globally. Such a warm welcome and impeccable service from start to finish. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to use the club lounge which served breakfast then food and drinks (including Champagne) through to 11pm. The room was great and the rooftop bar with outdoor pool and wonderful view over the city just made it. Would recommend anyone visiting Barcelona to stay here.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was lucky that the conference was attending was at this hotel - it’s well set up for business but enjoyable for leisure too.I had a club room which was Huge albeit very dark. It had a balcony but you would never use it as it was always in the shade.The bed was very comfy. Fluffy towels. Large shower cubicle. Free WiFi. Nespresso maker in the room. Good amount of power and computer jack slots.Breakfast had a good spread but quite average.Club room a little soulless and food in the evenings somewhat scant and boring.Roof top pool small but great for a dip - there is a full pool and spa for a proper swim. Had a delicious pulpo in the roof top restaurant.Reception could be very busy and often a wait - but staff gracious and helpful.Would come back when next in Barcelona.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is ~25 minutes from the airport costing around €30 by taxi. It is a quick taxi ride to downtown Barcelona, but we chose to walk, which takes 30 minutes at a moderately fast pace. On arrival as we had booked Club level rooms we were taken up to the Club Lounge, where we were immediately offered a drink and the check-in was very smooth.We had a suite. The bathroom had doors from both the sitting room and the bedroom. The room was very clean. The bed was king size and extremely comfortable with plenty of pillows. Some of the cupboard storage was in the sitting room. There is a decent size safe big enough for a 15 inch screen laptop.The Club Lounge was well worth the extra money. Breakfast, whilst the same each day, had a good range of hot and cold food. Drinks (both soft and alcoholic) were available throughout the day, including Moet et Chandon, spirits, soft drinks, tea and coffee. At lunch/evening there was a small buffet of mostly cold foods,which were different each night.There were minor problems with the rooms which we reported and none of them were really resolved - noisy aircon, a non-functioning razor socket, milk and face cloths not being replenished, the wastepaper bin not being emptied. Nothing disastrous or inconvenient, but it suggests that the systems and processes the hotel use are not quite where they should be for room cleaning and maintenance. Irritating.Overall a very good stay and the minor niggles would not put us off staying there again.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed there with my partner on my second visit to Barcelona, this hotel was my second choice as the first was not available. My hopes were high due to its standard. we made requests in advance and were assured via email to be accommodated accordingly, guess what when we arrived after all that tiring flights and trains a very very slow moving reception welcomed us. After a long while its our turn and we found out that she was just reading what we requested and made calls to relevant staff to get the room ready although the room was free as guest already had checked out. Now She told us one hour to wait in the lobby until the room is clean and ready to go. After completing full one hour we went to reception and reminded them about us, then started the procedure of check in another 15 mins and we finally got the key. We were given a nice room okay i am happy about that. later that night TV remote stopped working, we requested night receptionist to just get us new batteries and guess what he came to our room and suggested us that you need to get up from your bed come closer to TV then remote would work, i confirmed again if he really suggested us to do so and he actually said yes. we remained quiet and decided to sleep instead of watching TV. Next morning i went down myself with remote and told the lady to get me new batteries and she called the maintenance guy who quickly changed the batteries and it sorted i was happy with maintenance guy who would rather solve the problem instead of suggesting this and that. Dinner ordered and guess what we got a lonely small chunk of meat floating in a big plate, and chips soaked in blood oozing out from steak. order was wrong we had to call again to get it corrected. at every point we were dictated by staff like we are idiots. to be very honest i stayed in other hotel in my last stay they were like family and ensured we leave happily but here staff was so dry and dictating. At checkout the lady Maria was quite diplomatically active girl which is a plus point to business to keep the customer engaged. She did welcome our feedback and took care of us. Overall its okay experience. they have a roof top as a bonus point with a small swimming pool, i loved that area, room was good, a housekeeping girl Ranjit was nice always ready to help better than the ladies at reception. I would highly suggest customers to confirm about the food what comes in plate as it is not clearly mentioned in the menu e.g. size or weight of sirloin steak, plus what it comes with, eesh i get goose bumps when i imagine that lonely steak served to me. Plus points, Breakfast was great large options, room was good and i think their F&B manager was quite nice and active i noticed he was so polite and kind with his staff if i am not mistaken a guy in black suit came in the restaurant during breakfast time. Looks like their GM or Ops with grey hair was also active. but whats the point when your staff is not really active, communication gaps especially at reception, dictating guests night staff, slow moving, staff with partially tied hair in the restaurant during breakfast not good although girls were nicely smiling. things could go much better with staff. Trust me i have been to hotels where nothing right about the hotel but staff and i left happily due to incredibly attentive staff. Pay Attention!!!
hotelName:

Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The first room I was assigned was not finished - this can happen and was probably more unpleasant for the reception than for me. The second room was big but with an unappetizing dirty carpet (this would have to be changed urgently). On the 6th floor I had a wonderful view. Bathroom with bathtub and separate shower. Nespresso machine. The hotel has a spacious parking garage. The Ramblas can be reached faster than I expected with the help of a city map (intermediate roads). There are also minus points for the roommates who are very noisy after 9 o'clock (probably intentionally).

review_body: Stayed for 3 nights over Easter weekend really nice hotel with decent sized comfortable rooms,however there seemed to be almost constant noise ,people pushing trolleys about at night which really disturbed my sleep.Also the prices in the bar were really steep,about 3-4 times dearer than the local bars.

review_body: I have been visiting Barcelona a lot during last 5-6 years and this hotel killed me by check in at 15.00 and the worth room service I have ever met in Barcelona. I was telling this to reception but really it was just "ok" from them or making phone calls to someone, no more. Also they are only focus for club members and of you are a not a club member, you can forget of a lot of things.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza for three nights at the end of an road trip, and were really happy about the stay. Location is great in an area of Barcelona that we hadn't been to before, and there are a lot of great restaurants around.We stayed in a one bedroom suite, and therefore checked in through the Club Lounge. Check in process was pleasant, and the lounge itself of great quality. We ate breakfast there in the mornings and although not the largest selection, it had all the essentials and I would therefore rate it higher that the full ones on many other hotels we stayed in. We were under the assumption that there would be food in the evenings also, but the one day we tried there were neither any food nor any people there, so maybe we misunderstood.The room was of decent size with a nice balcony, bathroom with both tub and shower and a comfortable bed. The view was straight into the Fira Center so not too much to write home about, but the weather wasn't too balcony friendly anyway. For the same reason we only had a quick view at the rooftop bar and pool area, but I'm sure it would have been a great place to be on a hotter summer day. Only slight disappointment was that I ordered a large taxi through the lounge well ahead of our scheduled departure, but when we arrived with our luggage no one had heard about it and the taxi was not there. We were never in any risk of losing our flights, but had to sit cramped together in a small taxi because of all our luggage. Not a big deal, but still an improvement area with regards to communication. If you don't have any special preference when it comes to taxis though, there are pretty much always some waiting outside. All in all though we will definitely consider returning again next time we're in Barcelona.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here on a recent family break in Barcelona and found everything to do with the Crowne Plaza as excellent.Upon checkin my status was recognised and taken to the club lounge to take us through what was needed. This meant for our stay we had been upgraded, even though the room was on points, to get lounge access and a much bigger room.The room was very large and as a suite meant we had sleeping areas for ourselves and the separate room for the kids. The decor was modern, rooms all spotless and the sleep quality was great with a quiet location.The facilities were also great with plenty of eating options, roof bar where the pool is and also a gym and option spa if you want that.The staff were all super friendly throughout, breakfast in the lounge had plenty of options and was a great place to spend some time over the day or in to the evening.Will be back to Barcelona and back to the Crowne Plaza!
hotelName:

Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here on our first time in Barcelona and it was amazing.Great selection of food for breakfast. The staff are very nice and friendly, especially the lady at the buffet breakfast entrance was very nice to us and our little girl. Rooms are spacious and well maintained .Unfortunately the rooftop swimming was closed on all four days of our stay there due to bad weather. Really enjoyed our stay and can't recommend this hotel enough.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the Gothic Quarter last week. Due to change in plans we moved from the Wittmore (they were booked) to Crowne Plaza. We're glad we did. The neighborhood is residential and lovely. The Catalan National Art Museum is a couple of blocks away. Walking is a joy as there are few tourists, no crowds. The hotel is a little worn, but the bedding and beds are top notch. The staff is super. The value if unbelievable. We have a very large suite with club level priviledges. The club has a full bar, wine, champs, soft drinks, snacks- all day! Twice a day snacks turn into sandwiches, wraps, and kababs! There is a buffet breakfast thats pretty good. The best is the dedicated club concierge. They solve problems like well oiled machines. We wanted to extend our vacation, our other hotel (which we loved) had no room! The Crowne Plaza made lemonade out of our lemons!
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have to start with the manager who was on charge on the day of our stay, tall thin gentleman with grey hair, I feel sorry not to remember his name: he was extremely helpful and friendly with us, he made my kid very happy by some favors and he also saved us money by being generous on some services. He made me a future returning customer for sure. Reception staff was also nice and the same applies for the young trainee in the rooftop bar, which is a great spot by the way.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here on business. Huge room, well appointed and spotlessly clean. Small problem with the toilet flush was fixed immediately I reported it.Super-helpful staff on reception, can't do enough for you. Delicious toiletries. Free water.The only small let-down was breakfast. The breakfast room feels a bit institutional and the food was oddly set out at different points around the room. An omelette/waffle station would be nice, but I know breakfast isn't a big thing in Spain!Located at the bottom of Montjuic just a few steps from the Magic Fountain and from Placa Espana, with plenty of great eating places nearby.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would've expected to pay double for the quality, location and service we had at Crowne Plaza. I haven't loaded my Trip Advisor account up for years. But staying here made me want to re-load it back up. We stayed for 3 nights in a standard room. Which has 2 double beds AND a seating area. The bathroom had all we needed. There was a separate hall between the front door and room itself. Huge TV. Free Wifi too. Breakfast was a little pricey at 19 euros for a basic buffet but it's convenient.The pool top bar and swimming pool are perfect for couples who want a chilled weekend in-between sight-seeing. It turns out that we were in the same hotel as the Athletico Madrid players too. Which was a bonus sharing a lift with them as the prepared to play Barcelona. The only slight downside is that the Spa opens at 11am, which is peak time for sight-seeing. So we couldn't really make use of the offers they had. But that was a minor set back. A great hotel. 5 minutes walk from MetroTaxi Rank outsidePlenty of shops and restaurants within stone-throwing distance.

review_body: Stayed for one night after travelling from Australia, as an IHG Member I was granted an early check in which was a welcome treat! Hotel is well situated for ALL the sights and sounds of the city, Poble Sec underground is 5 mins away. Rooms are fabulous and well equipped, very large comfy beds and all you need after a long flight and indeed for a comfortable stay. Staff were great and I would like to thank them for the warm reception and certainly for allowing me an early check in and an upgrade. Well done, a credit to the chain and to the hospitality of this city. Definitely recommended.

review_body: I had a good time in this hotel, the rooms are very big and have a nice bath room. Breakfast is good and you have everything you need. Wifi is free to use and taxi s are just outside the door. Very nice fitness area and swimming pool.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A bit away from old town but was a nice area as it had several Michelin star well known restaurants around the area such as tickets and their sister branch. Hotel roof top bar was empty and bar below was closed . We had a paella at their restaurant and it was nice. City has lots to offer and so much to explore ! Loved the Cotton hotel as well
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We travelled to Barcelona to celebrate my wife's birthday. The hotel was of an excellent standard with staff where friendly, polite and helpful; nothing was too much trouble for them. In the restaurant they remembered it was a birthday and my wife's desert came with a candle and a blazing 'firework'! In the Club Lounge we were met at breakfast by 'Merce' who brought us our hot beverage; after the first morning she had memorised our requirements and we were met by her with our drinks as we sat down. I noticed she did this for others too - a great feat of memory and one of those little touches that makes you feel welcome away from home.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 3 nights. Hotel is primarily aimed at business through its location but is good for the tourist too.Standout service throughout our stay and fantastic attention to detail by all the staff. Room spacious and well fitted with usual amenities.Breakfast good, great views from the bar on the roof. Barcelona is big so no location is going to cover everywhere. This is out of centre and good for walking to exhibition centre, magic fountain, port and mountain cable cars, museum of art, Olympic stadium etc. 10 mins walk to metro at Poble Sec and then 5 mins to Rambla, 35 mins to Parc Güell, 25 mins to Sagrada Família by metro
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife stayed here for two weeks (Jan 2019) for work commitments and I joined her for a long weekend break. The hotel is very clean with state of the art facilities and is well located to alot of nearby attractions which are easily walkable (Magic Fountain/ MNAC) and is only 5 mins walk from Plaza Espanya stop (metro or Aerobus bus stop to / from airport which is 20 mins). Only a 15 mins walk to Las Ramblas / Gothic quarter district.The room was spacious with the huge flat TV and free Wi-Fi throughout the hotel and the view from 3rd floor lobby lift area is unbelievable.Have to say the one of the most friendly and very helpful receptionists (Judith) to answer all our common tourist questions (mainly due to taxi strike) but the main attraction for us was the barmen (Walter) as he was just lovely and very friendly every time we visited the bar which was most evenings and he is a great asset to the hotel but be warned the prices a bit high but Walter compensated for this.!!! Also, a good range of breakfast choices but we never got to use the main restaurant.Overall, great hotel, good location, great friendly (English speaking) staff. We were very pleased with our stay, and we hope to be back in the future.Definitely would recommend this hotel to family/friends.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a surprise, hotel was fabulous, great smell as soon as you enter, helpful staff, business lounge was great service impeccable, great location close to a lot of attractions easily walkable , very impressive , food was so so , spa was ok too not as high end as I expected, there is a fee to access spa

review_body: We stayed one night at Crowne Plaza Fira. The hotel is 10 min walk from Plaza Espanya and Montjuic Fountain. The room was large with a huge smart TV. We really appreciate the kindness of all the staff (multilingual), especially Suzanna who attended us at The Lounge. We will probably reconsider this hotel for our future stays in BCN.

review_body: Crowne Plaza Barcelona is a class establishment no doubt about it. Rooms modern and comfortable. Service efficient and extremely business-like and if that suits your character this is the place to be. It lacks heart and soul though in my opinion. Very clinical service and no one really prepared to go that extra step to ensure a warm welcome. Would I stay again yes for the cleanliness and comfort but as a holiday maker I just desired a little more personality and the occasional smile.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this hotel for two nights prior to going on a cruise. The hotel was clean, very nice rooms, large in fact considering some european rooms are. The bathroom was very spacious as well! The only issue we had was that the air did not work in our room and we could not get anyone to come up and fix it. Due to the time of year it was this was not to bad there was just no air flow at all.Our first night we had dinner in the main restaurant on the ground floor and the service and food was amazing! We then went up to the rooftop lounge for a night cap. The view was beautiful! Wonderful atmosphere!Perfect way to start a trip through europe. I would stay at this hotel again.

review_body: Excellent location a 5-10-minute walk from the metro. The hotel is a very good Crown Plaza, Large impressive public areas, along with a well serviced club lounge (worth paying for the higher-level room to gain access)

review_body: I visited this hotel for a conference which was also being hosted in the hotel.The rooms were huge with all the facilities you need on a business trip. The facilities generally were great and staff very helpful. Food was great too
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a lovely hotel in the city, it's a great base for exploring the sights or visiting for business. Upon arriving the staff were extremely welcoming and I was surprised at the size of the rooms, the room was huge which is quite unusual in Europe. The bed was very comfortable, lovely lounge area and TV as well as a lovely big bathroom. One of my favourite parts of the hotel was the rooftop pool which is built in such a unique way and has a gorgeous view of the city. From here you can see many of the major sights and have a drink or snack at the bar. It's close to the underground stations and only a few minutes walk from the magic fountain which is a great show to be seen at night. Overall, I'd definitely recommend this hotel and would stay 100% stay again.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice and spacious hotel. Good size rooms with big screen TV and workplace. Lower floor rooms have limited view,so take in mind. Hotel bar is expensive so take in mind. Breakfast was very good and everything was present. Would stay again...
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at this perfectly located hotel after a long day of touring and couldn't have been happier upon entering the lobby. The hotel is clean, modern and chic. Staff were immediately helpful--from the bellman to the desk clerks to the manager--and made us feel welcome and cared for. We were upgraded to spacious, immaculately-clean, comfortable rooms on the third floor and given Club Lounge Access. We had drinks, yummy tapas and delicious desserts for dinner in the Club Lounge and enjoyed an abundant and tasty breakfast--complete with Moet Champagne at both--the next morning. The bathrooms were large with great water pressure and huge, fluffy bath sheets as well as really nice bath products. The room also had a complimentary drink tray with bottled waters, coffees, teas, and hot chocolates. From this excellent location, we walked out of the hotel, to the left for three minutes and arrived at the Font Magica where we viewed a truly magical light/music/water show. The Bull Ring was seven minutes by foot and Los Ramblas about 15. We all agreed this hotel provided the perfect final night of our vacation.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This modern structure that was formerly the Fira Palace, impresses from the outside even before entering thru the revolving door. A doorman invites you in, and the front desk is where the staff makes you feel like a VIP. We were greeted by, Michella and Jeanine, (please forgive any miss-spellings). Explaining all of the IHG benefits available, we left with some sweets to our room.We decided to visit the 173 roof top terrace (separate TA review) for a light meal before getting a good night's sleep. The beds are firm and comfortable, the various pillows can be arranged to help you achieve la la land. The modern bathrooms rates a ten plus. Everything about them, layout, easy to operate fixtures, and lighting were perfect. The only hiccup was housekeeping neglecting to leave two wash cloths, fixed later by staff.The buffet breakfast at L' Aria was a great way to start all of our travel days. Mostly mediterranean, with "english breakfast" style hot food, and some asian cuisine. I found it had enough of a selection to satisfy. Attentive staff constantly refilled my coffee "americano". Also juices, fruits, and lots of baked goods to chose from. Note to us fussy americans, nothing is seedless, or pitted, so you know. This place only serves breakfast from 7:00 am. till 10:30 am. Earlier the better is recommended. Even though the Crowne Plaza Hotel is primarily set up for the business traveler, it exceeded expectations in comfort, and has many amenities for all purposes. It was our ideal base of operation. With a queue of cab drivers just out side the front to whisk you anywhere. It was an easy walk to some major points of interest. You will feel safe and secure here, as it is next to a police station, (did not hear any sirens). Room safes are always a plus. Room temperature was easy to adjust.I must go back to service. Jeanine was exemplary on more than one occasion. She walked into El Mall, when no one picked up the phone, to see if a table would be available for us. Her level of customer service was "five diamond" as they say. we were able to have a late check out time, allowing for seamless transfer and boarding of our cruise ship. I will whole heartily recommend the Crowne Plaza- Fira Center, to all friends and family who venture to world class Barcelona.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Crowne Plaza -Fira Center is a great hotel! I highly recommend it for anyone visiting Barcelona that wants to be somewhat removed from all the craziness of the Ramblas district! The facility is state-of-the art and is very well maintained. The rooms are large, comfortable and very clean. The bathrooms (especially the shower) are exceptional. We only had one minor problem during our five night stay. For whatever reason, we were unable to get face towels in our room despite repeated requests. Beyond that, all was very good!I want to give special kudos the Jeannie at the front desk. Although a new employee, Jeannie provided exceptional service to us. She was gracious, kind and very welcoming to us after a very long journey from Los Angeles. Jeannie was very helpful and answered all my questions straightaway. She is a true asset to the hotel's team! Very well done, Jeannie! The hotel's public places are spacious and comfortable. The amenities (spa, restaurants and business center) are all very good. (Food in the restaurants was also excellent.) I would certainly stay at the Crowne Plaza -Fira Center again when I visit Barcelona. The employees and management are true professionals and are genuinely committed to providing a high level of service to their guests. Thank you!
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We would like to thank Judith at the front desk for her very pleasant welcome as we arrive at the front desk. Judith was very helpful and answered all my questions. The lobby is spacious and has a business centre with computers. The room is very spacious and comfortable. We enjoyed our stay and the hotel is next to Magic Fountain and very convenient located. Everything is great about this hotel and the only comment I have is housekeeping is not as friendly.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights for business.The hotel is located just right next to Fira Centre (an exhibition ground) and just a very short walk to the Fountain and the Italian Twin Towers. A short walk to the main road and there are plenty of restaurants and eateries. It is also not far from the airport (20 minutes by taxi) and the Renfe high speed rail station (about 8 minutes by taxi, or walk for about 1.5 km).Room was spacious and up to date. Buffet breakfast has a good spread and cater to Asian palate also. The hotel is also stayed by air crews from a few Chinese airlines.The top floor of the hotel houses a restaurant bar. It has a great view of the city day and night.Though I wanted to try to spa centre, I was told that it was fully booked and impossible to have walk-in customer. Must be a very popular place for the locals to relax..Room was of a very good size to accommodate a sofa (bed). Overall, it was a very pleasant stay except for a few minor points below:1) My friend and I checked in past midnight. It seems that there was no update of information after we have checked in. Rooms were not made the following day, and our names were not in the breakfast list though we have paid for it. We were even charged for the 1st day breakfast though we have paid in advance.2) The roof garden bar/restaurant was understaffed and the poor waiter/bartender had to do a lot of thing by himself. He was very apologetic for it. It was not a problem for me as I am used to some self service back home.Overall, it was still a very good place to stay. The surrounding was safe and well know. Near to everywhere we need to go in Barcelona.Will stay there again if happens to travel to Barcelona.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited here for our anniversary, this is an amazing hotel with a central location! Can’t be any more impressed nor can I recommend this hotel more! The roof terrace is amazing with perfect views across Barcelona!
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel's location is around 15 mins from La Rambla by cab. There are cabs outside the hotel. The rooms are quite spacious. I saw a post on Wi-Fi connection being abysmal. On the contrary, I felt it to be quite good. We did not do breakfast. The restaurant on the top floor was closed. We were told to try it, so I guess the staff was not aware it was closed. The Front Office and Housekeeping staff were quite good. I was impressed with them. The Room Service order taker hurried you. I would also like to mention the Spa, amazing service, we tried the massages. Also, the aquatonic pool was wonderful. The elderly gentleman was very professional! Great staff. Definitely will stay at this place again. There was no signage that said where the gym is at the spa, took me a while to figure out that it was on the first floor.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was here for a conference. The room was spacious and comfortable. The amenities were good. However the wifi connection was extremely poor. I kept being disconnected and it took ages for emails to load. Apparently this was because the hotel was full and everyone was connecting to the wifi. I think for a hotel of this stature and in this price range this should not happen. They should be prepared for the event of the hotel being full - especially since this is a conference hotel.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel, located right at the center of events, just a 15 minutes walk and you are at the center. Great staffs and a wonderful recognition for IHG Ambassadors. The breakfast room is marvelous and lovely.The rooms are quite big when compare to standard rooms in other hotels except that cleaners are not that good at their job.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located near Fira Conference center, 20 min away from the airport. The room is bigger then usually, clean and quite. If you are licky you will have nice view from the room. On the breakfast you can enjoy very big veriaty of Spanish and European food. Definitely would recommend.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Crowne Plaza Fira for my wife’s 30th birthday and we loved our stay. When we arrived we was greeted by a very friendly lady who upgraded us as it was my wife’s 30th which was really appreciated. She also helped us with the tourist attraction and gave us a map and circled the must dos when in Barcelona. On our first night cake was delivered to our room for my wife’s 30th as a surprise and what a grateful surprise it was! We also used the spa on our stay and that was very nice too! The rooms are very spacious and have nice views of the city. The hotel is only a short taxi from the main centre and is in a great location to the magic fountains and very close to a shopping centre. Thank you for a great stay and hopefully see you again soon!
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here pre cruise for a couple of days. We found the hotel to be very nice and modern, but a little bit out of the way but not a huge problem. The room was very nicely laid out and the buffet breakfast very nicely done. Would probably stay here again.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Crowne Plaza hotel is in a very good location with excellent transport links. We were only a 5 minute walk to the Magic Fountain. We were here for 5 nights and we managed to do a lot of sightseeing. I would recommend you all to book this hotel as it’s 5 stars from me!
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Recently stayed for a business trip The breakfast restaurant area doesn't have enough tables when the hotel's busy. The staff are unable to clean the tables fast enough, so you have guests wandering around trying to find a clean, set table. Having said that, the waiting staff generally could do with some customer training. The two waitresses were excellent, all the men were off-hand and seemed to resent being there. The male manager made fleeting appearances and didn't actually do anything apart from pose at one end of the room or the other.Food at breakfast was very ordinary. No fresh cooked section, yet calling itself a 4 star business-friendly hotel. I don't think so. Ran out of cereal spoons twice. Cold meats not replenished very quickly.Reception staff were in a different category. Really good. Nothing too much bother. Chambermaids too were great, happy to fetch extra tissues or toilet rolls or hangers. Can't fault them.The hotel has a problem with it's flat roof sections. A downpour led to flooding in one of the main conference rooms, with water streaming through the ceiling. Needs some maintenance.All in all, disappointing. Good in part, poor in others.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Crowne Plaza is very good located, you only have to walk ~5 minutes to arrive at the Magic Fountain. The staff was very polite and helpful. We absolutely loved the beds, they were very cozy, even better than at home! Moreover the rooftop offers a great view over the city. The fitness room is very modern and clean, and they have free water for the guests.Great place to stay for a city trip!
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best location, wonderful staff, was very welcoming and easy to get to, would stay again, also they gave me complimentary late check out that was the best, i would highly recommend this hotel, great stay
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 2 nights for a conference. I had a suite which had a small bar area with a nespresso machine, kettle, minibar etc. There is a dining/meeting table, massive TV in the living area in addition to another TV in the bedroom (although the remote for the large TV didn't work - could be battery fault, as the remote in the bedroom worked on both TVs). There's a desk with a super comfy executive chair with leg/foot rest. There's a balcony, but the sliding doors are tricky to lock, although there is a security latch.I had 2 double beds in the room. The whole place had lots of mirrors! The bathroom is separated by a door - bath, toilet, bidet on one side, sink and shower on the other. Toiletries included separate shampoo and conditioner, shower gel, body lotion, bar soap. Slippers and bathroom provided. Huge towels - always a sign of a good hotel! The air conditioning was super efficient! There's separate air conditioning for the bedroom and the dining/living area. The lifts are really quick. House keeping are patient and efficient - I was in and out of the room during the day, and they still managed to find a gap to clean the room!Breakfast was OK, had adequate provisions, although for a great hotel like this, I thought the breakfast was only average, but certainly satisfactory.I had room service, which took an acceptable 20 minutes, but unfortunately was rather tasteless - thankfully pepper and salt were provided, I had to use a lot of them!Check in and check out was easy. I had to leave at 4am, and they kindly organised a taxi for me, but there are often taxis just outside the hotel. 20 minutes away from the airport.Minutes walk away from the popular Magic Fountain, the adjacent areas are worth exploring. The Olympic Stadium is also nearby. There are plenty of stairs everywhere though!For keen runners, look out for the running maps by the reception desk, provided various running distances.
hotelName:
0    Crowne Plaza Barcelona - Fira Center
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 1 night and had a pretty good experience. I loved the design of the room - modern, clean, spacious and plenty of storage. Rooftop pool was small with a limited amount of lounge chairs. Unfortunately, I wasn't able to order a drink in the evening on the rooftop deck because there was no one available to take drink orders. Also, the pool and rooftop close promptly at 9pm. Hotel is in a good location - walking distance to Sagrada Familia.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything in the hotel was best - great location, big and clean rooms, small but amazing pool with bar, beautiful sun roof terrace with nice flowers, comfortable beds, big, clean and modern bathroom!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My third time to visit Spain and exactly Barcelona. it was wonderful place to stay in Barcelona. Staff were helpful and friendly from the start to end. What imprinted this further was when I had an accident and broke my arm, their support with everything was phenomenal. The manager and the owner both found us to offer support and genuine concern. When the arm is better then we will definitely be back. This hotel made all the difference to what was almost a total disaster
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent two nights there and it was awesome. The hotel was only a 5 minute walk to Sagrada Familia. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was very spacious with all amenities necessary for a great stay. The breakfast was €15 a person, but it was all you cam eat, and all you can drink mimosas.The room was slightly humid, and the beds were spilt even though though we were a couple. The shower pressure was really nice, and the happy hour was a nice gesture. The only problem with it was that it was only for 15 minutes, and only a sample of wine per person.Overall, this was a very nice property with great amenities and wonderful staff. The location was ideal near la Sagrada Familia, and it was an amazing stay.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Look no further than this modern hotel in a great location As soon as you arrive you will not be disappointed, and the rooms are excellentPool is a little small, but there is plenty of roof top space to sit with views across the city
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the minute we walked into the lobby, I knew we picked the right hotel. It smelled wonderful and was uniquely decorated. Location was great as it was a 5 minute walk to Sagrada Familiar. The room was a sufficient size and the entire hotel was spotless. The rooftop pool and lounge area was great. If I have one negative thing to say it will be that if they say Happy Hour is at 5pm, be there at 5pm because 5:15pm you are out of luck. Same with breakfast. Breakfast served until 10:30am and if you get there at 10am, what ever is left over is what you get. No additional items will be put out.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved it, the selfie floor with a spectacular view and a pool, the room design, service .... all was great. The location may seem far from the old town, but cabs are super cheap. This location is quite thre
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located in a local area away from the fray of tourism. It's a nice hotel and the rooms are extremely clean. The views aren't lovely, but we didn't expect it. You are there to have a central, safe location with a nice room, not for views. The room was comfortable, good tv options, great shower, and the breakfast brunch was great! We loved the quality and selections. Sagrada Familia is a five-minute walk and there are taxis waiting outside the hotel if you choose to avoid the mass transit. We heard pickpocketing is horrific at the stations so we chose to use taxis. They were convenient and fairly reasonable. The fitness room had a glass wall so you could job on the treadmill and people watch. It was great! Highly recommend the hotel.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A hotel that is brand new, great crew, comfortable and large bedrooms, great bathrooms. The rooftop was the best place to relax in the whole city, fabulous pool, great seating area with a scenic view of the Sagrada Família . The crew was super helpful and great attitude.We will be back soon, very soon
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my office corporate hotel and I am still staying here when writing this review. Overall for the past 10 days, the experience is not too bad from breakfast and upkeep of room. Just got back from lunch and it is now 3.39 pm and the room is still not tidy up. Do housekeeping closes on Sunday too like most of the shops????
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for the last two nights of my vacation to Spain and I wished I had stayed here for my entire trip. The room was modern, spotless, and comfortable. Excellent service from the staff. The rooftop is absolutely gorgeous with a stunning view of Sagrada Familia. There are free yoga classes on Wednesdays, daily wine tastings, and the hotel food is actually quite good. It's in a quieter area, which I liked, and has easy access to the city center via metro. I will stay here again on my next trip to Barcelona for sure!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Newly refurbished, this hotel is superb. POSSIBLY could be considered to be slightly off the beaten track from the city centre, but issuperb value for money. Great views of the Sagrada Familia which is adjacent.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful hotel, chose it based on design and its sustainability. Location was a bonus as we were literally 2 min walk away from Sagrada Familia. Staff is very friendly and attentive and nothing was too much trouble. We would definitely stay here again. Thank you
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very pleasant stay in this hotel very close to La Sagrada Família. Close to the metro and many cafes, restaurants and bars but a quiet and pleasant area. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms clean and comfortable. Lovely roof top terrace. Would stay again
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked two rooms for three nights. Check-in was quick. Found the front desk personnel very professional, always eager to assist especially with great restaurant recommendations, and friendly (well most of them). A great lobby with a cool vibe. Fantastic rooftop pool and lounge area with a view of the Sagrada Familia. Rooms were nice sized and well appointed. Really nice, large bathrooms. As others have mentioned, the location is great for touring the Sagrada Familia, but is away from the old town and beach areas. With that said, there were always taxis in front of the hotel with rides typically 8-10 euros to get to most places. Will stay here again next time in Barcelona.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently completed a two week trip and by far this was my favourite place to stay. The hotel is situated a block away from the Gaudi Basilica Sagrada Familia and is very modern and clean. The rooms were spacious and well equipped with the usual amenities. The pool and sun deck on the roof top make it an amazing place to chill out and enjoy the view (it also has an amazing view of the basilica from the roof top as well). The staff were also very friendly and accommodating. Although we travelled as a group of friends, the hotel would be suitable for couples and familes. Will definately be back on my next trip to Barcelona.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well not sure where to begin. 25 th anniversary surprise set up by the blokes..After choosing 1882 as the stay over, bearing in mind there is a great deal of choice, I went for a Sa Grada view. Well “if its good enough for Gaudi its good enough for me”.The staff have been awesome they changed keys for us to allow the surprise to unfurl before the girls eyes, great at the bar and the door Anna gave us a recommend for Bar Mut- just don’t buy wine there The hotel foyer is welcoming with great looking seating - not the leather look that makes you look out of place when sat in it. Spend a couple of hours from 5pm on cheese wine order more drinks then hit the restaurant of your choice. Don’t forget to book if its special...Rooms are clean and functional beds are good guys but this hotel should be enjoyed on the roof in the pool lounging taking selfies looking across Famillia Barca. Then later downstairs in the bar area. Breakfast is a great set up with all that you could want in choice. It will get you to the first cafe stop of the day..I’m staying again when in Barca see you then 1882...
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff is friendly and helpful. We had an incident with the bartender ( who doesn't work there anymore) and The manager was quick to remedy. Be sure to book with the morning breakfast buffet. Once afternoon we ordered the assortment of croquettes, grilled octopus with candied potato and the Iberian ham with bread and tomato with Cava and beer. The food is very good and all is reasonably priced. Go to the top floor deck for the great views, there is a pool, we didn't use as it was cold. The bar will run up drinks to you if you ask. There is a free walking tour- don't miss this & the gentlemen was wonderful. The hotel lobby and bar area is relaxing and cozy, we stopped here each evening just to sit with the house vermouth before heading to bed. Our room was also cozy ( we did take the peanut dish to use for the soap dish and took face clothes from another hotel bath room as these are not available) shhh..... don't tell.. The towels and product are nice, I rented a robe for 10 for the week and was worth it. My husband and I didn't have an issue with the bathroom as others have indicated in their reviews. The bed was comfortable and we slept well each night, having an inside room ( which didn't have any views) we were okay with that. Cheers to the staff who were very helpful - getting us directions and making suggestions to where to go. We had a fabulous experience at this hotel and would book there again. Please share the hotel scent- seriously this place smells so GOOD!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked this hotel for a Monday- Friday trip with my boyfriend in May. Overall 5*Advantages:- Good location for Sagrada Família - Good location for hop on hop off tourist buses - Good value for money- Rooms are nice, decorated well and very modern, comfy bed -Staff are helpful and friendly - rooftop pool and terrace- a lovely private area to enjoy relaxation time -Daily housekeeping service - Security At the hotel/ feel safe -Smooth check in/check out services and happy to store luggage Areas of improvement- rooftop pool isn’t heated (sometimes bloody freezing) - Better communication about what/when bars- restaurants are open (very confusing at times) - About a 35 min walk to plaza d’ Catalunya (the main square) would be good if the hotel put on transport (maybe even just one bus in the morning and one in the evening) Overall a fab stay! If I were to return to Barcelona I would return to this hotel!!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An amazing location 2 blocks away from the Sagrada Familia. A very attentive staff and high quality service. We have enjoyed a wonderful time and will come back soon. The terrace and the swiming pool on the roof are magnificent. One word : perfect !
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this hotel for its proximity to the wonderful Sagrada Familia and we were very happy to say that this hotel definitely exceeded our expectations! This was one of the best places we have ever stayed on our frequent European travels, in all facets of room, staff, breakfast and location. Cannot recommend this place highly enough and the location is absolutely perfect.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself & 2 friends booked a triple room for 3 x nights. The hotel is beautiful inside with lovely decor. Lots of comfy seating in the bar area. The bedroom was spotless, comfy beds & spacious with lots of storage for clothes. Check in was easy & the staff are all very helpful & friendly. They gave us a walking map & ideas for places to see etc. We booked room only & decided to have breakfast on the 1st morning until we got our bearings. The breakfast is €15 and in my opinion well worth the money. There was everything you could want, so much choice & even a chef cooking fresh omelettes/eggs to order. Barcelona is a beautiful city & I would definitely stay here again. ( 5 R’s)
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great spot with view to Sagrada Família.Clean and smells good.Caretaker and nice employees. We like the food and the space.Excellent and wonderful breakfast.It was a couple trip and we really like it the hotel and recommend it.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good hotel, perfect location, lovely atmosphere, helpful staff, great breakfast, free cycles if you want them, umbrellas when it rains, staff can't do enough for you! Room was good, bed really comfortable
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel in central location - excellent room with 1st class breakfast. Hotel has excellent facities including gym and pool . They can provide cycles if you want to try out Bracelona's cycle network plus a walking tour of the area on a Saturday . Staff very helpful and gave advice on loval resturants.Would highly reccomend and will stay there again if Voyage Prive can provide the deal
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The 1882 is a really special place to stay. Everything was perfect. I appreciate the guided walk, the design, the pool. Breakfast is just great. I recommend the hotel to any kind of traveller, friends, couple, family.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is only two blocks from the Segrada Familia and within walking distance to many other sites. The rooms are nice and very clean, the bar, restaurant and sitting areas are lovely, the food and wine quite good, and the staff is absolutely amazing! Each person we interacted with was professional, extremely helpful and very friendly. Special thank you to Mirela who provided several fantastic recommendations, as well as the front desk staff who located cabs, provided directions, recommendations, etc.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The property is in a excellent location. Very close to the Sagrada Familia and reasonable walking distance to other areas like the Gothic Quarter. The hotel itself is beautiful. Smells very nice, incredibly clean and the rooms are updated and incredibly comfortable. I would highly recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful, well presented hotel with extremely helpful staff! Stayed with my friends at the beginning of April and it was just amazing. Its very central and close to loads of restaurants/ bars/ tourist attractions and there are two metro stations within 5-7mins walking distance. The room itself was gorgeous! Very high quality. The same goes for the hotel as a whole - everything about this hotel is 1st class. Will definitely recommend to friends and family and will 100% stay here again on my next trip to Barcelona.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Hotel Barcelona 1882 in April 2019 just before catching our cruise in Barcelona. The hotel is clean and staff are friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast there. A little pricey but it’s worth the money. Convenient location. A short walking distance to the famous the Sagrada Familia and close to the metro! We will stay there again next time we go to Barcelona!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked online after using trip advisor. Always take ratings with a bit of skepticism. No skepticism here. All was excellent! Friendly staff, clean room, convenient lobby bar. Room overlooked an interior courtyard, while not vista views definitely allowed for peace and quiet for sleep.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Cannot fault this hotel - amazing location, staff and views. Cleanliness of the hotel is spot on, non expensive bar and friendly staff. Thank you for a fab stay. Definitely take a trip to the roof top, it is totally worth it bit it isn't staffed so get your drinks downstairs first.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay in Barcelona was an adulthood gift for my doughter and this hotel was great choice: modern, chic, just few steps from Sagrada Família (dont miss the hotel selfie point on 7th floor) and even other turistic points in walking distance (Park Guell 30min, Placa Catalunya 20min...). Hotel offers really great breakfast bufet and nearby there are many good places to eat and have a drink. During our stay the weather was not enough warm, still we really enjoyed the roof terrace with the pool - really relaxing place! The hotel staff is helpfull - ready to book/order for you hop-on-hop-off bus or entrance tickets, print your boarding pass, provide you with the city map ... Cherry on the top was guided walk around Sagrada Familia (Saturdays 18:00 free of charge).
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We jumped on a can't-miss-out awesome deal to Barcelona Spain and our package included a stay at the Hotel Barcelona 1882. This boutique hotel is in a central location to all night life, restaurants and the Sagrada Familia. Breakfast daily with a beautiful choice of local hot and cold dishes along with a pleasant dining room made it enjoyable to talk to other travelers. The room was comfy and very stylish. The bed was perfectly soft and the shower was an amazing rain shower head with plenty of hot water. A roof-top lounge and pool is perfect for reading a book and the staff...the staff is amazing and always accomodating to all of your questions!! This is the place to stay when in Barcelona. This hotel is: 2 blocks walking from Sagrada Familia - a short taxi ride to the Mediterranean Sea - a half hour from La Rambla - 45 mins from FC Barcelona stadium - 10 mins to shopping at Passeig de Gracia - Hop On Hop Off Bus is located next to Sagrada Familia, HOT TIP: don't buy your tics for hop on bus online, buy them on site save $$.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the WORST experience I’ve had at a hotel. I will never ever stay at this hotel AGAIN. My sister and I walked into the hotel after hours of flying. We are two small girls and we had multiple bags with us. We were struggling to carry our bags to get into the hotel. The men at the front desk saw us visibly struggling to carry our bags and not one of them tried to help us.Once we checked in I asked if there was someone that could help us with our bags. The man at the front desk stated that “there was no one to help us with our bags” but I saw multiple people that worked at the hotel lounging around... the hotel also messed up our room. We requested two beds but they assigned us with a room with one bed.. and stated that the hotel was fully booked for the night.. I also had an issue when I was checking out. They stated that they would be charging my card 18 euros for “national calls” that I made. The only calls that I made was locally and that was to call the tourist office for an excursion I booked. The man at the front desk was very rude and I overall had an HORRIBLE experience at this hotel. I recommend anyone that is considering to stay at this hotel to find somewhere else. There are MUCH nicer hotels in Barcelona that actually have great hospitality. I repeat STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL. They have the worst hospitality and the people at the front desk have the nastiest attitudes. This hotel is money hungry and will try to charge you for everything!Stay away from this place and use your money towards a nicer and classier hotel. Because this hotel AINT IT!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely incredible hotel. Everything about it was excellent. The lobby is stunning, the rooms are so stylish, there is an amazing roof top pool with the best views. I would love to stay here again.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is within walking distance to Sagrada Familia, lots of restaurants and - if you are as adventurous as we were - Park Guell.The lobby is comfortable and inviting with a nice bar and plenty of windows for people watching. The rooftop oasis has a lovely plunge pool and chaise lounges for hot days. The breakfast buffet is extensive and there is a private, walled garden with tables for those who wish to eat outside.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very happy with this choice of hotel for our stay in Barcelona. The rooms are really spacious and well set out and the hotel itself is only 2mins walk from Sagrada Família. The view from the hotel rooftop is a little disappointing but other than that the public areas of the hotel are also clean and comfy. Cooked breakfast could be improved for the price but there were lots of other choices (cereal, pastries etc) and the hotel did well catering for all dietary needs. If you prefer something similar and cheaper there are a few good sit-in bakeries nearby. The bar was cheap for drinks, and the bedrooms again comfy and quiet allowing for a decent nights sleep after miles of walking. Overall I would have no problem recommending this hotel.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very goog location, quiet at night and near Sagrada Familia and Metro station, a variety of good Restaurants nearby. Nice room, good service even the bikes for free were in a good condition.Thank you for our good sleep :-)
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Brilliant location for a family holiday to Barcelona. Fantastic hotel, great facilities & friendly staff. Very quiet & calm despite being in a city. Spacious rooms & comfy bed to relax in after busy sightseeing. Great transport links nearby to make this city accessible & enjoyable for all the family
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice new Hotel a couple of blocks away from the Sagrada Familia and the Subway that will take you anywhere in the city.Quiet roms, good breakfast and reasonable prices (ok, we got a promotion discount so it was really cheap for that kind of hotel).You can reach the roof top, day or night, to relax next to the pool. Our stay was to short to enjoy all the accomodations and treats they offer, hopefully another time.And people were very helpful and kind .
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely stunning hotel with wonderful interior! Staff were attentive and friendly. Good selection of food and drink on offer at an affordable price. Hotel rooms were well equipped and clean. Would 100% recommend!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: + We stayed at Hotel Barcelona 1882 for 4 nights and really enjoyed our stay. It was our first time visiting the city, the staff were very welcoming and we were given maps and directions to lots of places of interest on arrival. The hotel itself is one of the nicest we’ve stayed in - very modern and sophisticated. The rooftop terrace was beautiful, lots of places to sit with great views of Sagrada Familia. We also took advantage of the complimentary cheese/wine tasting (every day at 5pm) which was a lovely touch. - On our 3rd night we had to wait over 3 hours for an iron so make sure you request one early to avoid disappointment (and creased clothes)!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location - not far from central Barcelona and also Gracia. Superb breakfast, really friendly and helpful staff, great rooms. Only a stone's throw form Sagradia Familia. Nice rooftop area with an unheated swimming pool.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Went to Barcelona for a weekend and booked a room at this hotel without much research, what a gem! We loved the clean rooms, the tasty breakfast and a service with good attitude. Very friendly place and a good point to continue and explore. Our trips were pre-booked with barcelona-trips.com which was a great experience, loved every minute of it and would recommend without hesitation
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: + nice, quiet rooms - the only sound you hear is the carillon from the Sagrada Familia+ good bathrooms, with goot hot showers+ everything is very clean+ good location - two subway-stations are less then 10 minutes away, and the subway in Barcelona runs ~every 3 minutes and is cheap (especially with the T-10 ticket)+ nice view from the rooftop on the towers of Sagrada Família + friendly and helpful staff +- breakfast has a high quality, but expect to queue at the coffee-machine and at the custom-made omletts ; a good (simple and more economic) alternative is the cafe&apat right opposite the street
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow!! Simple perfect...this hotel is as beautiful as Barcelona itself can offer...design of the hotel is just spot on...modern, vibrant and calming...room was comfortable, breakfast tasty and a great choice for everyone...and the rooftop terrace overlooking the city is just stunning...I can just recommend this hotel!!!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is marvelous. The rooms are clean, shower is spacious. Front desk staff is helpful and multilingual. Easy enough to walk to attractions. Familia Sagrada is a short walk away. Had a hot stone massage by the hotel masseuse which I definitely recommend to anyone staying here. The pool was freezing but there are great views from the roof.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing hotel, we were very impressed as soon as we walked into reception. A few minutes walk to Sagrada Família/restaurants and bus tours. Very nice wide selection at breakfast. Make sure you go to the terrace On the roof and take in the views, I could sit up there foe ages. the pool was a bit to cold for a dip but it was March. It’a lovely up there, so much so my partner proposed on our second morning. We both can’t wait to return. Thank you hotel 1882!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel in close proximity to the Sagrada Familia (two blocks away). Modern and tasteful decoration inside with clean and decent sized rooms. Did not have the pleasure of testing the roof pool area because of the weather but it looked great. I would recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wow, what a great stay we had at this beautiful hotel! The first you notice when you enter the hotel is the beautiful but discreet smell. Really pleasant, it makes you feel well. Then there is the staff. Everyone we met were super nice and very helpful.The rooms are new and very delicate. Nice and clean and functional. Great beds too.The location was great for us, only a few hundred meters from the Sagrada Familia with its great Metro connections. Even though the hotel have a central location, we found the area quiet and comfortable.Dont even consider to have breakfast elsewhere. The breakfast at the hotel is super and offers a rich variety of fruits and various delicacies. We already miss that!But best of all is the fantastic terrace on the 7th floor. Fabolous views to Sagrada Familia. Very nice furniture, a lovely pool and simply a magical place to relax. We were also very impressed by how clean the hotel is, no matter where you are, its totally spotless.Highly recommended!
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really cool hotel, great service and loved the free bikes. Location is next to Sagrada Familia and lots of breakfast/lunch rooms around. Best view from the seventh floor at the selfiespot. Near the swimmingpool
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location that everyone first visits Barcelona can dream of. Very near to the Sagrada Familia. The hotel was newly furbished and everything in very good shape. The room is spacious and comfortable. Great decor, excellent facilities, enormous bed. Lovely view at the terrace. Breakfast was yum with wide range of choice. Staff are helpful and friendly - ask for recommendation of restaurant and you won't be disappointed. Definitely would return if we got any chance to be back to the lovely Barcelona.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was our first stay with HB 1882 and I can't recommend them enough. All the staff were friendly and helpful (and spoke English if your Catalan/spanish is a bit rusty like mine) . Our room was a good size for a couple, modern with a large double bed which was very comfy, it had wardrobe space, a chair, shelving and large tv (if you feel the need to watch tv in Barcelona) the room also had a mini bar, hair dryer etc.. The shower was great and fitted with both a large shower head and small one, great after walking the city all day... The bar and lounge area is fabulous, very stylish and comfortable just great for chilling out with a glass or two and our barman Sergi was brilliant, and price of drinks were very reasonable. (The lounge area is also equipped with laptops to use and there are plenty of books to read too). We didn't partake in the breakfast so can't comment on the food, but from what I saw it looked very nice. The icing on the cake for us is HB 1882's roof terrace, it is absolutely amazing with great views of the top half of the La Sagrada Familia. Plenty of selfie opportunities (depending on time of year sunrise on the terrace is great).. Lots of comfy seating up there too, so grab a coffee or a glass of wine and sit back and relax, because thats what this hotel is made for.. They do have a gym etc (but didn't use it) the pool did look very inviting but might have to come back in the summer to use that . We easily walked to the Familia in 10 minutes from the hotel.. (I also recommended taking a walk back to the Familia at night, it's beautiful when lit up) Thank you to all the staff at Hotel Barcelona 1882 for giving us a warm welcome and making our stay in Barcelona more enjoyable, we will definitely come back for another stay.Thanks again, Marie & Brian Simpson.
hotelName:
1    Hotel Barcelona 1882
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in the hotel for 1 night for a business trip. The rooms are very nice and clean, beds are comfortable and breakfast good. I had dinner at the hotel bar at the terrace and enjoyed the nice ambiance. Would recommend.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic hotel with great transport links. Roof top pool was great, drinks up there very reasonably priced. Lady behind the bar very pleasant and friendly, always smiling. Breakfast is buffet style and was always refilled. Never a problem with seating or food. Staff very helpful if you needed anything. Coffee out of machine was lovely. Fresh fruit as well as pastries and cold meat. Reception staff helpful and informative. Advised us of transport links to Barcelona’s football ground. Always welcomed you with a good morning or hello. Metro is literally around the corner and beach is 10 minute walk away. Management are helpful and brilliant. We had a problem with waiters from a restaurant following us back to hotel over a dispute with bill. Police were called. Management very supportive, helpful and reassuring. Would highly recommend this hotel. Thanks for all your help, we had great stay.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is only a few blocks from the beach with many great restaurants! It is close to the on and off bus. Our room was quiet and clean. The staff was very helpful. Great pool and bar on the top floor! Barcelona can be over whelming. Leave lots of time for traveling within the city. Traffic is bad, to say the least! The hotel is not close to old town, but we found the taxi`s to be reasonable. If you plan on seeing any of the sites, sign up for a tour, The crowds are huge! Downtown is not safe so keep your valuables in a purse kept under your clothes. We spoke with several people who lost there wallets to pick pockets.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
