review_body: The ladies on reception went out of their way to make this a special trip for my daughters birthday.Free cake and lots more!Have told everyone about this place and will he returning !Also perfect location, we walked to the beach daily Xo￼
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned from a three night stay at this hotel with our two boys (13 and 10). When we booked we knew the hotel wasn’t in the thick of things but the pull for us was the inter-connecting rooms and roof top pool. This meant our two boys could have their own space (rather than sleeping on a sofa bed which many of the other hotels offered). It also meant after a day of a lot of walking and sightseeing we could sit by the pool for a while. The hotel is situated right by the metro which is easily navigated and cheap. It’s a 10-15 min walk straight down to the beach/marina area where there are loads of restaurants to choose from. The hotel itself is modern and stylish. The rooms are large with very comfortable beds. Shower worked well too. Breakfast is held in the reception area and is continental (cheeses, ham, tortilla, pastries, bread, cereal, juices, fruit, coffee machine). There were nice touches for smaller children too, high chairs, a small children’s area with puzzles and books. The rooftop pool had a bar where you could get your drinks and pool towels. The staff were hardworking and very friendly. We all had a great time in Barcelona and it was good to know that we could go back to a nice hotel which was good value. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would return.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel, 8-10min walk to the beach. Friendly staff, but slow service - I requested 3x times extra duvet (3pm,5pm and 10pm - when finally i got it!), free wifi, good breakfast. For 2*star hotel very comfortable bed and really perfect raining shower. On the roof is nice pool with bar and view. Good for short stay.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can't say enough good things about this hotel.It's clean, it's comfortable, it's very stylish and modern, the rooms are huge, the shower was wonderful (rain shower in addition to adjustable shower head), there's a 24-hour bar and outdoor terrace downstairs as well as a rooftop terrace with a bar and infinity pool, it was quiet even though it was busy...just fabulous.It's far-ish from the Sagrada Familia and Las Ramblas, but walkable if you really feel like walking, and there's a metro station right around the corner. The metro is very easy to navigate and reasonably priced. It's close-ish to the waterfront. If you like to be right in the thick of things, this is not the hotel for you, but if you need to get away from the crowds at night, this is perfect.The hotel staff were all very friendly. We arrived very, very early in the morning, while most people were checking out, and they worked with us to be able to check in early and take a nap! They also called us a cab when it was time for us to go to the airport.Breakfast is quite good too. Not fancy, but tasty. Always crowded.I'd stay here again!
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great little hotel and very well priced. Nice pool on the roof, nice bar and courtyard for relaxing after a long days sightseeing. Staff very friendly and hotel spotlessly and clean.Metro is 5 mins walk, get the 3 day pass for 10 euro, its fantastic and cheap for getting around the city. Beware of pick pockets!!!! it's a huge problem in Barcelona, we heard of some many incidents while we was in town. Don't let it put you off just make sure you have hold of wallets and bags at all times.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a very enjoyable stay at ibis styles Bogatell having booked hotel based on reviews. Hotel has a real modern feel to it from the reception area to the rooms.Rooms are modern / very comfortable bed / walk in shower. Hotel staff are friendly and always on hand to help.Breakfast is good- plenty of fruit / toast / breads / croissants / ham / cheeses available with a range of juices and hot drinks.Pool area is nice / great for relaxing - personally i think more sun loungers rather than deck chairs should be up there but that’s just personal preference.Location - right next to Bogatell metro line which makes getting to most places pretty easy.Highly recommend!
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: if i were to do this again, i would probably opt to stay in the heart of the city near the Ramblas, we choose this because it was "walking distance" from the Gaudi Church Sagrada Familia. it wasn't even that close, and the walk was more than i expected.the hotel was just fine however, the rooms were clean, the service friendly and professional, just a little out of the way.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The table under the TV had lot of liquid residues with suggar. My phone and computer got dirty. Breakfast was poor as well. Hotel located in a industrial area with the only advantage to be walking distance to port olympic.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed there as a family. The area is residential and quiet at night but 15 mins walk will take you to the Olympic Port area which offers a large selection of restaurants and bars. The walk felt safe at night.The hotel is only 2 years old so clean and modern with funky public areas. The rooms are nothing special but clean and functional. The real shame is the low quality of the mattresses. I do not normally have problems with hotel's mattresses as they always seem to have good quality ones which last longer but this hotel has very soft and uncomfortable mattresses and the 4 of us complained of it which is a first ! Would not stay for more than one or max. 2 nights on that basis. The staff was friendly and breakfast was typical of a 2* property with some cold meats, cheese/cereals and pastries. Nothing exceptional but adequate.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room is lovely and modern as is the rest of the facilities. Unfortunately the air conditioning is as cold as........well. It wasn't......there's no refrigerator or safe. The rooftop pool sounds like a perfect reason to vouch for this place but even a 22°C temperature was enough to keep me out of the pool because they must pipe the water directly from Antarctica which made it uncomfortably cold even in the Spain beautiful weather. So to be perfectly honest. I didn't have a pleasant stay here. Which is a shame. Because the look of the hotel would suggest otherwise. Staff are great also. Breakfast was ...meh. I guess it's ok if the location suits you best. But as an honest review I'd say look elsewhere
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at around 2130 on the Friday evening for 3 nights bed and breakfast. Check in was quick and easy, we’d booked via Booking.com and paid on arrival. The reception area was welcoming and looked appealing. Restaurant seating area on the left, bar and comfy seats on the right. Upon entering our twin room we were pleasantly surprised, bright airy room which was very modern. Bathroom looked amazing, very clean and light. The beds are very comfy, plugs next to each bed. Our room was at the end of a corridor so didn’t have much noise from neighbours or people walking along the corridor. Only negative was the rooms were very warm at night. Breakfast is continental which we were aware of, choice of cold meat, cheese, yogurts, cereal, fresh fruit and coffee machines. On race day the hotel provided extra fruit and cereal bars which was a nice treat. Plenty of seating, we were a group of 18 and all managed to sit on one long table. Tea and coffee are available all day long and if there empty the reception staff will refill promptly. The bar is very reasonable, €2.20 for a glass of rose, €3.50 for 0.5l of lager. USB ports around all the seated areas which was good.We chose this hotel as it was close to the start and finish line of the half marathon and we definitely chose right, 10/15 minute walk, although it took slightly longer on return due to sore legs!! Close to metro stop and a 10 minute walk to the beach. Would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for two nights. The rooms were clean and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was a good size. The breakfast was very good with a lot of choices - meats, cheeses, breads, fruit, cereal, etc. The only issue we had is that the heating system overheated our room and we had to sleep with the window open, not a good option on a Saturday night in Barcelona.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am already a fan of Ibis Styles and this hotel was no exception. Friendly staff, good modern rooms with great mattresses and good breakfast. We chose the location for the Barcelona half marathon and appreciated that they set up breakfast extra early on race day and had bought plenty of bananas and muesli bars! Also a nice touch with the 24/7 coffee and water. I didn't travel with my children this time but also noticed the kids' corner with a number of games, puzzles etc to borrow.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Greeted by pleasant staff on reception who were helpful. Our room was very clean and pleasant. The hotel is walking distance from the beach and also many bars and restaurants. The city centre is just a short metro ride away, it was nice to be able to go there and then return to a peaceful hotel. The area is very quiet. Breakfast was nice and there was a good range of items, including local specialties which was a nice touch. The rooftop pool is small but ok for sunbathing and a quick dip to cool off, however we preferred the beach as it could get a bit crowded at times. I would definitely stay here again if i returned to Barcelona.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best part about this hotel is its excellent location.Just 10 mins from the la barceloneta beach and also the metro station is also a 5 min walk.This place is very good for budget travellers.Room size is ok.Staff is very good and helpful.Wifi connectivity is good.Breakfast has plenty of options.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 4 nights and our rooms were interconnected - it was a great solution for our family. The rooms had everything we needed, reception was always helpful, breakfast was great and the pool on the roof was very special.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell in September 2018 for a city break. The hotel was on it's own but a short stroll to the beach and around 4-5 blocks away from Las Ramblas (you could easily walk it).The hotel was lovely, very modern and staff were very welcoming and polite.The rooms were sound proof and beds were very comfortable.They have a bar where you can buy drinks, bar snacks and other dishes such as pizzas, nachos etc. very convenient after a long day sight seeing!There is a tube station just around the corner, which will take you to all the main attractions!Unfortunately we didn't get chance to go to the roof top pool however it did look lovely!
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a good budget option in Barcelona. It is right next to a metro line that will take you to the center of the city in a few stops. You can actually walk to the city center - it is around 35-40 minutes. Also close to the beach and Ciutadella Park. Overall: location is a plus.We stayed three people in a room with flip-out beds. With those beds out, space was very cramped. The hotel is clean, however, and the bathroom is nice.Breakfast was very decent - I would not pay €10 as it did need some warm options, but as an included option, it was definitely fine.Overall: a recommended budget hotel.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything's perfect there!!All the staffs at the Receptions, House Keeping, Breakfast Restaurants, were so nice and professional.Check-in was very smooth and I felt welcomed. Rooms were very clean and tidy.Breakfast was decent. Enjoyed the lobby lounge decorated as a real cafe so much.!Me and my friends enjoyed staying at Ibis and we are eager to visit there again!!Thank you for all the good things I had! ^
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would like to thanks all the team for the very warming welcome. Everyone has been helpful and so kind. Moreover the hotel is perfect : clean, Modern, breakfast is very good. The swimming pool must be awesome in summer!I wish I could come back!
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We travelled to Ibis with a baby and we couldn’t have asked for better service from all the staff at this hotel. So friendly and knowledgeable, staff would speak with us in the morning and remember where we had been that day and ask us about our day! They remembered our baby’s name and made an effort with her every day. Breakfast was lovely and always being replenished, the room was compact but clean and well maintained. Security was good in the hotel. Location is great on the L4 line of the metro - anywhere is accessible in Barcelona on the metro. There’s a lovely roof top pool and seating area and a nice courtyard for guests too. A lovely hotel away from the madness but close enough to dip into the city, visit the zoo, take the metro and tram. Really happy with our stay.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just come back from a 3 night break at this hotel. Its away from all the hustle and bustle of the centre but just a 10 minute walk to the beach and lots of public transport nearby. The friendly staff were very helpful with directions, travel, places to eat/drink etc. Nice size rooms that were very clean and tidy. Breakfast was ample with food to suit all tastes. 24 hour menu was sufficient, serving pizzas, omelettes, chicken etc. Roof top pool was a nice little sun trap but as this was November, the water was rather cold. It is a bout a 45 minute metro journey to the Nou Camp with a Station approx 200 metres away from the hotel. All in all a perfect stay for the reason we went to Barcelona.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 6 nights. It was ok, but nothing out of the ordinary. Rooms are clean. The WiFi is ok and the breakfast decent. The hotel could not offer any breakfast pack (take away breakfast) when we had to depart before the breakfast opened. We were welcome help ourselves to whatever the breakfast staff had ready, but they could not provide any bag or box to carry it in.The underground station is literally around the corner which is great.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I spent 3 nights here and found the room to be quiet and functional. The hotel offers a very good breakfast and is 10 minute walk from the beautiful beaches and aquarium. about 15 minutes from the familia? church Some nice but inexpensive restaurants a short walk away as well.We would stay here again
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good stay in this hotel for one night. Outstanding breakfast. Easy walk to beach. Rooftop pool is lovely if a little small and was cold but that’s to be expected in October!Nice communal area. Only down point was size of room and pull out bed for two kids.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited here for a long weekend with friends. This hotel is a lovely little gem. Slightly off the beaten track but close to the beach and metro stop so easily within reach of the City centre. We walked quite comfortably. The staff were lovely, friendly and really helpful. They give the guests a wonderful welcome. Rooms are clean, funky and comfortable. There’s not oodles of storage but enough for a long weekend’s clothes. No safe in rooms but free safe boxes are available behind reception. Breakfast was tasty and staff were very good at keeping tables clean and cleared and keeping the food plentiful. We loved the all day coffee and pastries which guests could help themselves to.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Needed a one night stop over before our 7 day Western Mediterranean Cruise so this is how we ended up here. FYI: 15 euro for the taxi to the port. Typical hotel room, a bit tight for a family of four but the beds were comfortable and there was a nice breakfast. Staff were helpful and the beach was nearby. Rambla del Poblenou was 20 minutes away. Nice restaurants and walk to the beach.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The most positive aspect of this hotel imo is the location.....and that is down to the extremely reliable Metro system. As for the accommodation? I think it's over-priced.The room was very small and very basic.....the plus points were the bed was comfortable and the shower was powerful. the towels were tatty and very old. We didn't enjoy the breakfast at all....... I accept that it's Spain and is continental, but I thought the ingredients were cheap and cheerful to say the least.....the coffee was awful !The food from the bar was poor in our opinion......frozen pizzas and 'again' cheap ingredients.The beer was averagely priced at 3.75 euros per pint.The roof-top pool is a nice addition.....albeit very cramped and my relaxation was spoilt by a large group of very loud French tourists.....why they have to shout every sentence is baffling!?If I came to Barcelona again, I would consider staying here, but only if it was half the cost of what I've just paid?
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is really nice. It’s a short walk to the beach and the metro is really close also. The rooms were really nice and clean. The staff were all lovely and helpful. The breakfast was really nice with food choices such as different breads, fruit, yogurts, cereal etc. The pool is really nice and there wasn’t a lot of people using the pool when I was there so it was mostly empty which was nice.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice clean hotel. Bonus of a rooftop terrace pool and bar (although pool is very cold).Quirky with fun features such as courtyard with table tennis.Decent buffet breakfast also.Well located to jump on the Metro, less than a five min walk to the station. Only 10/15 min walk to the beach too so best of both worlds. A good few restaurants around the hotel too.Was perfect for our 3 night stay to get out and about see and do everything we wanted to.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there before boarding a cruise, well equipped and clean. Rooms small and clinical but if only staying a night or 2 its perfect. bar and outside area were lovely and the prices for Food and drink were cheap. best of all was the staff very helpful and polite, especially to non Spanish speaking Guests as we were.Only Downside was its Location not much around and area was a bit untidy
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved staying at this hotel. Everyone was sooo nice and it was a very convenient location to the beach and metro transportation. The breakfast was very nice and the common areas very comfortable and pleasant. The pool was sweet too. Thank you!!!
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm not fussy about a lot of stuff but some things just weren't right... We decided on Ibis Styles for the location and the swimming pool and did not disappoint on that matter. As you walk into the hotel there a very strong smell that is not very pleasant, in my opinion. The room was very small and the windows didn't allow a lot of natural light. After a shower, all the bathroom floor would be wet which was a bit annoying...Also, the breakfast area is extremely busy and a bit disorganized, I think. I felt like I was bothering other people who were sitting there having their breakfast because I had to queue next to them for the coffee or bread. On the other hand, the swimming pool is beautiful and has a nice view over the city and it's only a 10-15 min walk to the beach. Downstairs bar a little bit high priced as it's about 30min walk to the city center and the attractions and there is not a lot of cafe or restaurants around the hotel.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great rooms, nice rooftop floor with a pool and bar! The beakfast had many nice alternatives but was too crowded because of poor logistics. The hotel is a little bit off from the city but we walked anyway, no problem with good shoes. Close to the beach!
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Most things in life are good or bad by comparation with their referrals. The problem with this ibis - that is not bad per si - is just that you have a lot more options around these days, in walking distance and on the same price range that are not your classic 2 stars hotel - not that there is any problem with 2 stars hotels. It just is not the same thing.Also of note, I stayed for 14 days or so, working every late night for the 14 days and I slept in most of the days. I had problems with the cleaning service because there was no way for them to clean after I leave, because there is no service after 2 pm, and no way for them to arrange it for me. This might be a very specific complain, but if you are thinking about late night parties or have to work late like me do not go for this hotel.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We first got a room with a large white wall as the only view, it felt like we were in a prison. Asking the reception for another room resulted in a free upgrade to a room with a terrace. What a splendid service! Thank you so much!
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice location, metro station is like 2-3min walk away. All needed for a sleepover in barcelona. Would recommend it; the surrounding seems to be a little bit weird but hey! Graffitis are everywhere in Barca.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel has all the amenities you need for a nice stay, the rooftop pool is probably the highlight, really enjoyedThe buffet breakfast included with the rate is good and well presented, just need to be early enough to find a good seatThe staff was friendly, particularly the crew at the restaurant during dinner timeLocated a block away from the Bogatell Metro station and a 10 minute walk to the Port Olympic / Beach area
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 4 nights in August 2018 and very pleased overall.Service was hit and miss, some staff were great and others a little rude. Was surprised to have to pay a deposit to use the iron and carry the iron and board around the busy hotel myself but perhaps this is normal in Spain?Was disappointed to find no safe in our room, fortunately we were able to lock valuables in our suitcase when we were out.Rooftop pool is small and there are only 2 sunbeds and about 8 deck chairs plus some tables and chairs by the bar. Mostly though we had no issue getting somewhere to sit. The bar was very reasonable at 2.50 for beer, wine & soft drinks.Location was good being around a 10 minute walk straight down 1 road to the beach. 30 mins walk to Las Ramblas and slightly less to the zoo and Sagrada Familia. I recommend downloading the MyTaxi app which lets you book, pay and tip from your phone and was very quick service. Also check out Donkey Republic which allows you to hire bikes for 24 hours and unlock with your phone!Good restaurants in all directions, can recommend La Carmelina & El 58.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You really do get what you pay for, you pay cheap prices to stay here for a reason, rooms are small with very little storage for belongings, rooms are very basic with no a safe which in a city notorious for theft I found alarming. The rooms were however very clean and well kept, only one English Channel on the tv though! The bag with the hair dryer in was growing mould, and stank of damp. Staff were not very helpful or welcoming on arrive and throughout our stay. We were also given incorrect times with regards to breakfast & the pool, going up at 8.30pm to find the pool closed after being told it was open until 10pm. The pool was crowded, very little seating, and everyone crammed in but it was a pretty little pool and seating area, also provided towels! Very well situated for the metro, which takes you everywhere in the city! The hotel was literally a stones throw away around the corner, and we had no problems finding the hotel by ourselves using it. however the area is very derelict with graffiti everywhere, we also stepped off the metro to a child in the middle of the street no older than 10 intimidating us by waving his genitalia around laughing and pointing at us. stay vigilant throughout your stay in Barcelona and watch your bags, locals do NOT like tourists.Breakfast was a continental cold breakfast which was enough to tide you over until lunch with a couple of different choices, however everything was disposable with regards to cups and cutlery, and the plates were not very clean with dried food still compressed under most.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is absolutely fantastic! We stayed here for four nights (August 2018) and I can not find a fault with the hotel. The amenities, staff and food were all outstanding. Furthermore also a great location; 10 minutes (max) to the beach and the Bus Turistic stop. A highly recommended hotel.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really enjoyed the artwork and design throughout the hotel. I also liked the small restaurant/coffee shop area where you could sit and meet other travelers. It’s close to the waterfront and the old Olympic village area.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights with the gf to see the sights. Decent location a little away from the centre and the loud tourist spots. 15 minute walk from the beach and 30 second walk from metro station on the yellow line that leads to the gothic quarter.Room was a good size with a large extremely comfortable double bed, black out curtains, modern bathroom with a great shower (shower gel included). Easy to use air con was excellent and a life saver when you come in from walking around the whole day in the heat. Good size TV with local channels if you need it. Hairdryer could’ve been a bit more powerful, no in-room safe, minibar or ironing board, however. Roof terrace and pool is nice for a short bit of sunbathing or reading, with a small bar serving a small selection of drinks, if you’re lucky enough to find a sun-bed. View from the terrace isn’t spectacular but can’t complain. Both the terrace and shallow pool are very small compared to the capacity of the hotel - not ideal if you want to use it as part of a family/big group.Breakfast is very good compared to other places - selection of breads, hams, cheeses, fruit, hot drinks and juice - best to get there early though as it gets busy. Reception has a outside lounge area with table tennis and 24/7 bar with very good prices. Multilingual staff were very helpful and friendly and had no problem storing our luggage on the last day while we went out. So good in fact we left a present for them in the room which I hope they drank. Would definitely stay again but should probably upgrade the terrace and pool.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was on a 12 day bus tour. We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. The hotel is conveniently located near a metro stop. However, the location of the hotel is not near too many restaurants or stores, The lobby is very welcoming as there were hot drinks and snacks available, It is a nice meeting place for friends. The security is very good as a key card is necessary to use the elevators. The staff was very helpful. The breakfast was ample with many choices. My sister and I had lunch in the small Pub located across from lobby area. The staff seemed to be overwhelmed and disorganized with 10 of us ordering food. I felt that they should have been used to small groups. We waited a long time for our order and then we found out that they ran out of our choices. We had to order something else and wait again,
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is well located, in a quiet neighborhood. the staff is friendly, there is nice indoor terrace with ping pong table, baby foot & chill-out area. There’s also a rooftop terrace with a small pool. Was a nice surprise. Check it out ;)
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just came back from 5days holidays in Barcelona staying in this beautiful hotel brand new with all comforts you can need for a sea side break. Bedrooms are very cleaned and spacious, beds super comfortable and clima working perfectly. The rooftop swimming pool is amazing! You can enjoy a great sangria with the sea view in a relaxing terrace just going up with the lift. Perfect! The breakfast buffet is very rich and intercontinental with croissants and jam on iberico included. The staff is really friendly and helpful too. I think this hotel deserves more than 2stars!
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We found this hotel and it offered all we could wish for. We had a drink at the rooftop bar, a great and peaceful nights sleep and a fab breakfast. Parked the car safely too in the underground car park
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, 15 min from the Port, 25 min to the airport, 15 min to the sea, 30 seconds to the Metro, 15 min to the centre of the city. Roof top pool, great continental breakfast, rooms with a Terrace are a good idea. Very clean, very comfortable, very quiet. Staff very friendly and helpful.. Great place to stay and would stay there again.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very nice hotel. I would give it at least 3 stars. Room is big comparing to Ibis hotels in Paris for example. Simple, but well equipped, very comfortable bed and good bathroom.The breakfast is quite unvaried: pastry, yoghurts, fruits, ham, cheese, cereals. Some eggs were really missing.Good location: 10-15 minutes on foot from the beach and 4-5 metro stations to the city center. Bogatell Metro station is just round the corner.Small rooftop pool is nice, although there are only 4 real beds for sunbathing, others are just chairs (chaises longues). So a couple of times I had to put the towel on the floor and take the tan this way.One disturbing thing: I got bitten by some insects 2 times. Maybe it was during the night out, but I felt like it was in the hotel. These itchy red spots appeared twice in the morning and not at night.The water is very mild, so it feels like you still have some shower gel on you even after you wash it off really well.Also the price was a quite high, but I believe if you book in advance or if you stay not at very high season it would be fairer.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After reading the star rating i was a little dubious.However was pleasantly surprised the hotel is fantastic- very modern, clean, great location yards away from the metro.The transport system is excellent in barcelona we didn't wait more than 5mins for a tram. The hotel has a pool on the 7th floor which is well maintained and a lovely surprise .Breakfast is fresh and plentyful.The staff are extremely helpful and very pleasant .This will certainly be my hotel of choice on my next visit to barcelona. I would recommend the travel passes for the metro at around 8euros a day they allow you to travel on the metro anytime and also gets you to and from the airport.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 5 nights. Found the hotel clean and comfortable with a good view across the city towards sagrada familia, with great air con in the room. Buffet breakfast was plentiful with adequate selection available though offered no variation from day to day. Wifi available throughout with no issues. Ideally located 2 minute walk from Bogatell metro station and 10 minute stroll to the beach. Numerous small supermarkets near by, with a couple of small cafe/ bars in the neighbourhood but we didn't use. Roof top pool a bonus, a little small but ideal for cooling off at the end of a long day. Staff friendly and helpful on both arrival and departure.
hotelName:
2    Ibis Styles Barcelona City Bogatell
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best hotel experience I have ever had and I’ve had lots!Will never stay anywhere else in Barçelona.Best location, food service , courtyard garden/ pool an oasis.Roof top drinks/ pool with a view of Guadis Pedera .Do not miss this one ...
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: H10 Casa Mimosa was a perfect end to our vacation. We arrived early due to having to disembark our cruise ship by 9:00am. We knew our rooms would not be ready which was fine, they stored our bags for us which allowed us to wander around Barcelona and then grab some lunch. Wonderful staff that gave great recommendations for dining and provided great directions for those of us who are directionally challenged. When we returned we were pleasantly surprised to learn that we had been upgraded to a terrace room! All I can say is WOW!!! The view was to die for, an unbelievable unobstructed view of the top of Casa Mila, La Pedrera. It was like looking at a painting and one night there was even a jazz band that played, what more could you ask for??The room was top notch, bed was very comfortable with tons of pillows. Robes and slippers are provided along with complimentary water, yes!!! The bathroom was a good size with a very large shower which could fit an army. Really was not a big fan of the sink, too shallow, every time you turned the water on no matter what flow it splashed out of the bowl. The only other suggestion is to provide more towels.I would most definitely stay in another H10 property if this is the norm.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Casa Mimosa for two nights during our honeymoon. We were immediately greeted with a glass of cava and sat in the beautiful lobby while we waited to check in. The check in staff were amazing- I think her name was Angelica. She helped us book a tour for Park Guell. She made sure we had our tickets for other big sites and let us know about the tapas on the roof top. Our hotel room was beautiful- clean and comfortable. We had a great porch and view of La Pedrera. Overall we were so happy with our stay- the location is ideal- we were very close to a lot of the big sites and whatever was not in walking distance we could easily get a cab. Great stay!
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: H10 Casa Mimosa is one of the most lovely hotels I've stayed in for a while. If I'm lucky enough to come back to Barcelona I would definitely stay at this hotel again.Location - Perfect. Easy walk to cafes, restaurants, attractions, the hop-on-hop-off bus and metro. Garden view rooms - Fabulous. Comfortable beds and a lovely view over the courtyard.Staff - Wonderful. The staff at the front desk were always helpful and friendly, whether it was recommending restaurants, things to do, transport options or arranging a taxi to the airport. Would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel, very warm, helpful staff. Restaurant staff were excellent- remembered our favorites day to day. Courtyard was a nice surprise, enjoyed starting our day with breakfast in the courtyard. Pools a welcome retreat in hot July!
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Three night stay in Barcelona at Casa Mimosa and it was lovely. The room was spacious, location was perfect for walking and sightseeing, staff easily communicated with us in English. The balcony was a bit odd (to me), but seems quite normal for Barcelona. Buildings in a given block have an internal courtyard area. All buildings on the block open to a common space, so you're seeing the back of every building including people's laundry, storage, back windows, etc.. There is a small rooftop bar that serves snacks and cocktails, with a view of the Casa Mila rooftop. It's pretty cool, if a bit pricey. The star at this property is breakfast though. A strong cold buffet, hand-made espresso drinks or hot tea, and a cooked-to-order hot menu as well. Everything we had was delicious, and, better yet, included with our room rate. A very nice stay and would highly recommend.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the pleasure of staying for 2 nights at H10’s Casa Mimosa in Barcelona. The location of the hotel is excellent, we were able to walk to all the sights we had time for from the hotel and only used a taxi on arrival and departure to the airport. For a central city location on a busy thoroughfare, and a block away from a main boulevard, this hotel is extemely quiet. We did not hear any noise in our third floor room. The rooftop bar is likewise pleasant and the tapas are inexpensive and delicious. Finally, the staff are all friendly and did a fantastic job of answering questions, helping with restaurants and providing tips on getting around. Several speak excellent English. A very beautiful, quiet and restful oasis from the crowds and energy of beautiful Barcelona. Hope to stay again on a future visit.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My travel agent recommended this hotel for my family visit to Barcelona. It did not disappoint. Location is excellent...we had fun wandering around, finding new streets nearby every day. Plenty of restaurants and shopping within 3-4 blocks. Staff very helpful with suggestions for dining - and also helped me find the nearest laundromat. Rooms are comfortable and, although not super spacious, did not feel too cramped. My 3 teenagers shared a room with an extra bed added and the room was large enough to accommodate. The extra bed was comfortable, too. Roof top terrace with bar was lovely -- we watched a concert on the top of La Pedrera one night. Breakfast delicious with excellent service. Some of the best coffee I've ever had. I am a very particular traveler and Casa Mimosa was a winner. Great location, excellent service, comfortable beds, closet space, effective and quiet air conditioning, good food. Also a nice central location to reach other areas of Barcelona.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is centrally situated in Barcelona so it's easy to get to any section of town by walking or a short cab ride. We stayed in the Suite Condal for 5 nights and it felt like we were royalty. The suite is HUGE, and it has a beautiful bathroom, balcony, living area and bed. The H10 does not skimp on details - each night we received some type of item from the hotel - champagne, desserts, chocolate, etc. I couldn't have asked for anything more. The rooftop terrace overlooks Casa Mila and the drinks and tapas are very good. Service is 5-Star all the way and you won't be disappointed.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was not familiar with H10 Hotels before I booked this hotel. I made my decision to try this hotel & brand based on location and TripAdvisor ratings and rankings. Having now stayed there, I can say without question this hotel is very deserving of their high ratings and rankings....and their location is fantastic!Charming hotel. Friendly and professional staff. Romantic atmosphere. Spacious and immaculate accommodations. We chose this hotel for a short pre-cruise stay. Based on our experience we want to come back and spend more time in Barcelona and stay at this hotel. Just a wonderful experience and a perfect way to start our cruise vacation. Additionally, we would not hesitate to use other H10 hotels.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved everything about H10 Casa Mimosa! The location was perfect...very walkable to everything but also quiet. The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. And our room was wonderful with a private terrace. Highly recommend!
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We paid for rooms several months ago in order to spend a day in Barcelona before we embarked on a cruise. Our flight was cancelled and we were unable to get there until the day of the cruise. We emailed the manager and met with him in person to request that he apply some or all of the money for a room after the cruise. He told us to file an insurance claim! He did offer to sell us new rooms though!
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Garden was the best part. I wanted to eat every meal there. It was quiet and comfortable and casual. Our garden view room was also nice. I really don't understand why the room had two twin beds instead of two doubles. There certainly was room for two doubles in that corner room.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we walked into the lobby we were impressed with this hotel. There was always a lovely smell in all of the public areas and the welcome drink and snack was a pleasant surprise. We had prepaid for our room so the check in process was simple and relaxed. Our room was a touch on the small side but this was made up for with a nice sized bathroom and a gorgeous private outdoor terrace overlooking one of the Gaudi houses. The bed was very comfortable and the room spotlessly clean. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast was comprehensive and the hot items cooked to order. We had never stayed at a H10 hotel before, but in future we will look out for them as it was so good.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In summary, there's not a single fault with this hotel. There is only excellence in every department. My wife and I attended this hotel for a weekend break to Barcelona to celebrate our 10 year wedding anniversary and go to the Spanish Grand Prix. Firstly, the hotel looks great as soon as you step inside. Modern, classy, boutique style.The brilliance of this hotel began in earnest immediately upon our arrival where we were greeted and checked in, with a courteous glass of bubbly each by a genuinely friendly, helpful and informative lady. We stayed in a double deluxe room, with a super king size bed. Again, all clean, fresh and modern. A pretty room, with a double shower, double basin bathroom and toilet hidden behind what looks like a wardrobe door. I have no faults with the room. There was good quality wifi also. The real winner for us though was the amazing options at breakfast. There was a small selection of buffet style food, including unlimited fresh fruit and meats etc. However, the cooked selection from the menu was delicious. All cooked fresh upon ordering, were eggs benedict, a simple fry up, waffles and ice cream, crepes and a host of other food.It was all served and presented to a high professional standard, and again if you wanted rounds 2, 3 or 4 there's nothing to stop you ordering! Whats more, is that due to the relatively small number of rooms at the hotel the breakfast was never chaotically busy. Perhaps only 2 or 3 other tables were occupied every time we had breakfast. Special mention to the waitress Vanessa (I think!?) who couldn't do any more for us every breakfast time. The rooftop bar is nice and relaxing, and we visited this first off, before we went out into the evening. All the staff are great and are more than willing to help with all enquiries raised. The location is great also, fairly central to most of the key attractions and only a 20 second walk to one of the Antonio Gaudi houses that are scattered throughout Barcelona and should be visited.If we were to return to Barcelona, i already know which hotel i will be booking to stay at. Simply faultless. A fantastic stay without a single gripe. Those responsible for managing and running the hotel should be applauded on providing a perfect environment for visiting guests and the staff for delivering the service which they provide.10/10.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel in central area with many bakeries and restaurants around. Beds are comfortable and rooms very clean. It was our anniversary and they brought us champagne and desssert. It was too cold to use pool or patio but beautiful grounds. I would definitely stay here again .
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My brother and I stayed two nights at the fabulous Casa Mimosa hotel in Barcelona. We had an inaugural cruise afterwards. We found the staff very helpful and attentive to our needs which was great as we are not familiar with Barcelona or the area. The beds were very comfortable, excellent quality coffee in the room Nespresso which they were more than happy to extra stock with a small tip. The highlight by far was the location and the upgrade to the top deck/balcony (paid). It overlooked the backside of Gaudi's Casa Mila! Simply devine enjoying espresso in the morning overlooking Mila. I loved the old elevator used for design...this boutique hotel wreaks of culture and history. Amazing.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed two wonderful nights at Hotel Casa Mimosa in Barcelona before our cruise. The hotel staff are wonderfully inviting and kind. Our room was very clean and tastefully decorated. The bed was comfortable too. We had tapas and wine on the roof top area and were very pleased with the food, service and awesome view! Thank you! We hope to return.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: H10 casa mimosa is an excellent hôtel to stay at. Great location, good breakfast and free drink at check in. Newly refurbished and not far from the main attractions. The rooms are well appointed and scent free as requested.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice lovely hotel and staffs were very friendly. The roof top bar is amazing, we are able to see the top of La Pedrera from the there. Shopping areas are very nearby to H10 Casa Mimosa. This is my go to hotel if we vist Barcelona again
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perhaps the best hotel in town with easy access to all the Barcelona has to offer you. ice décor in the room, wonderful amenities and tasty breakfast. Staff was also very helpful. Highly recommended even for a long stay.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We (my wife and I, four nights) really enjoyed our stay at this hotel. The location was excellent for visiting the sites. The room was spacious, clean and well appointed, and the staff was exceptional. We used the concierge/main desk repeatedly for meal and site suggestions and they were helpful and spot on with advice. We specifically want to thank Angelica for service above and beyond with a smile. We wholeheartedly recommend this hotel and, because of our excellent experience, will look at other H10 properties for other trips.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No wonder this hotel is rated so well in Barcelona. A small boutique hotel on the same block as Gaudi's La Pedrera, this hotel beat all my expectations.Location was fantastic. You are right on the main shopping thoroughfare with a ton of restaurants one street over. Barcelona is a walking city, and you can walk anywhere from this hotel.Rooms were fantastic. Very spacious, our room even had an extra large shower with two showerheads! 10/10 would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Barcelona.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quite simply fantastic.a most enjoyable stay.the accomodation clean and spacious,the staff pleasent and helpful.the location could not have suited me any better-just outside of the main attractions of the city.the best hotel i have stayed at for sometime.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Book now brilliant hotel.Garden rooms fantastic.Weather greatWhat more to say we were blown away with Barcelona the most pedestrian friendly city we have been to .we are coming back ***** to see more and we will stay at H10 casa mimosa.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Tremendous location. La Pedrera is visible from the rooftop lounge, and you are walking distance from the Sagrada Familia which means you can stroll over there in the evening and catch it all lit up after the tourist throngs are gone. Room and facilities were first-rate, including indoor and outdoor lounges, restaurant and bar. Metro station is close by as well though we are big walkers and have no issue walking all the way to Barcelonetta from the hotel.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely loved our stay here. From the moment we walked in the door we had the most friendly, welcoming and helpful greeting you could ever hope for in a hotel. This continued our entire stay with all the staff. The location is perfect for Hop on hop off bus's, great resturants and shopping. Our highlight was the breakfast, the food was fresh and extensive with nothing to spare. The menu was great and they cooked all hot food fresh as you ordered it, nothing was left out and the staff were again wonderful! We will look for H10 hotels on our future travels and I highly recommend a stay with breakfast at this hotel.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sister and I stayed a week at the H-10, Casa Mimosa and loved it! The room was large with a massive bathroom and the biggest shower I have ever seen. Everything was spotless, and each day we came back to the room seeing the same standard of excellence as we were greeted with the first day. We were greeted with free bottles of water daily and a couple of individual bottles of wine. We didn’t use the robe or the slippers that were in the bathroom, and the last night, they laid the slippers out next to each side of the bed, letting us know they were ours to keep. If my sister reads this, yes, I accidentally took both pair. The view from the rooftop was spectacular. I loved seeing La Pedrera so close to our hotel. When touring the rooftop of La Pedrera, I could easily spot our hotel. The hotel was located so closely to everything. The metro was close, but we walked much of the time and used the cheap taxi service for quick trips across town. They were so easy to get in front of the hotel, and I did not want to waste one minute of my week in Barcelona. Lastly, a hotel is a hotel. What sets this one apart is the excellent customer service. I cannot count the times I asked their advice for best restaurants, where to buy something, and the best wine store. They gave me the names of local faves, not tourist faves. I wasn’t looking for what I would find in America; I wanted to experience the culture. The front desk, the bartenders, and housekeeping went beyond my expectations to provide a truly memorable experience. I will be back.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel choice in a centric location for anyone visiting as a tourist. Well renovated older building with very pleasant innerpatio and rooftop bar and pool with a view of Gaudi’s “La Pedrera” which is just around the corner. Our room was modern, clean and comfortable. Very helpful staff. Good breakfast but only tapas for dinner (although some are very filling and there are many good restaurants to chose from nearby). It would have been nice to have had the fireplace burning in the lounge area.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is my second time in this hotel and it does surprise me each time. In my opinion it is a full star hotel. It has everthing you want. For me, my wife and my 15 month baby it was a pleasure staying in this lovely hotel once again. The best things about h10 casa mimosa are staff and location. It is simply cozy and like home...
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved this hotel! It was central to everything and overall was a very enjoyable stay! Breakfast was a delight and I remember Noah’s friendly service while checking is in. Thank you very much for a wonderful stay!
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There were 5 in our group and we were all happy to be there. The personnel were happy to be working there and it showed in their smiles, courteous conversations & assistance; I cannot say enough of how lovely we were treated from the front desk to the waiters in the restaurant. The rooms were clean, pretty (boutique hotel type); plenty of room, we had a king size bed and it was very comfortable, the pillows were dreamy :); the area where H10 Casa Mimosa is located is in walking distance of the Hop On Hop Off bus, designer shops, yummy turrones, tons of Tapa Bars and sit down restaurants. We loved our 3 days there.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here from Saturday to Tuesday this March and were so impressed with everything. From the minute we arrived we were given a very friendly greeting and a glass of Cava while we checked in. Despite arriving well before the requested time our room was ready for which we were very grateful.The room was lovely with huge floor to ceiling windows overlooking the garden area to the rear of the property. With a very nice shower room, sleeping area (with huge, very comfortable bed), and adjoining lounge area the room was perfect for our needs.Casa Mimosa is centrally located and proved to be very handy for catching the tour bus for which we had two-day tickets. There is an excellent bakery over the road where you can also sit and have breakfast. There is so much to see in the immediate area and lots of great shops. Just around the corner is the Casa Milà, a building designed by Gaudi and is absolutely stunning. The upper stories and roof of the building can be seen from the gardens of the hotel. The Sagrada Familia is about a 20 minute walk away and this is obviously a must-see. I would recommend one of the guided tours as you learn so much about the building and it’s history.We were very lucky with the weather and were able to sit in the garden area of the hotel and have drinks there. The bar area and lounge are extremely comfortable and the bar staff were very friendly. Actually, every member of staff we met was lovely and always greeted us whenever we passed. This was my first trip to Barcelona (my wife had been before) and I absolutely loved it and we will definitely stay in the Casa Mimosa the next time we visit.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love, love, love this Hotel. Class act all the way and central to so many things but not a super touristy street like by the Sagrada Familia.We had a welcome package, champage & treats were delivered for my Husband’s birthday and on our last night they brought chocolate to say thank you for staying wirh us. Staff is friendly & helpful with everything from dining, excursions & middle of the night taxis! Restaurant is good, breakfast quite spendy but excellent. I would return in a heartbeat!!!
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a "Deluxe Room" and were given 106 on the first floor at the front of the building. We were pleasantly surprised by the amount of space - decent sized bedroom with huge bed and generous wardrobe, plus a small sitting room with sofa, desk and mini bar, and a gorgeous bathroom with large shower, freestanding bathtub, bidet and double wash basins, with nice toiletries, plenty of towels, robes and slippers. The only thing in the room I could think was missing was a kettle, but no sooner had I asked than one was delivered, together with mugs and an assortment of teabags. Chocolates were brought every evening of our five night stay. The breakfast buffet was extensive - freshly prepared fruits, yoghurt, cereals, cheeses, meats, breads and cakes. Tea, coffee and freshly squeezed orange juice were brought to our table in the airy and attractive dining room. There was a long menu of dishes cooked to order and the ones we sampled were good. I couldn't resist the chocolate churros one morning.We didn't use the hotel's courtyard garden or roof terrace during our stay as it was not warm enough but both looked beautiful and very well-maintained. The location, on the same block as Gaudi's residential building La Pedrera, was great. Diagonal metro station, just around the corner, puts many other Gaudi sites within easy reach. We could walk to the Ramblas in 5 minutes, to Placa de Catalunya in 15 minutes and to the Sagrada Familia in 20 minutes. There were plenty of shops, bars and restaurants all around the hotel, ranging from simple to extremely upmarket. Pau Claris, the road the hotel is on, is not too busy but , despite double glazing and lined curtains, we could hear a little traffic noise and a bit of streetlighting filtered into our room. If you are a light sleeper or require total darkness, request a room on a higher floor or at the rear.Every member of staff we encountered was helpful and spoke english. This was our first stay in a H10 hotel and we formed a very good impression of the brand.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After heavily researching the many hotels in Barcelona, I booked this hotel based on the sheer amount of excellent reviews it received and what a hotel it is!We arrived at Barcelona airport (BCN) and found that even though it is more expensive, a taxi is a convenient way to travel for 4 people with suitcases. The cost of the taxi was €35 and it took us to the door of the hotel, which was ideal. Upon arriving at the hotel we were greeted with very friendly faces and a glass of cava whilst we completed our check in. Due to arriving early one of the rooms was not fully ready, but we were assured that it would be once we returned in the evening after a day out exploring. We were however able to use the other room to store our belongings and this is when our mouths hit the floor! The room (Garden Deluxe Room) was breathtaking, with modern/gothic style rooms filled with contemporary furniture and beautiful views of the garden through fully opening doors, we could not believe what we were seeing. The bed and chairs were comfy and the bathroom had everything you needed including a huge shower, complimentary amenity pack and ritual shower gels and shampoo. There were two bottles of complimentary water per day, welcome chocolates, sangria and a nespresso coffee machine (capsules included). As H10 members we also got a voucher for a welcome cocktail each.Not only is the hotel stunning, but the rooftop terrace boasts a lovely pool, and beautiful views including Le Pedrera. The terrace itself has plenty of comfy seating to enjoy the sunset over the buildings.We did not try breakfast, but the cold buffet and al a carte food did look delicious upon walking through the restaurant.The hotel is very close to Diagonal metro station and a lovely leisurely walk of about 30-40minutes past clothing shops and restaurants to the main Las Ramblas. In order to see the main sights we asked to the hotel to book us a two day hop on, hop off coach tour, which was great to see everything that Barcelona has to offer. The area around the hotel felt safe at night and has a 24hr shop and cafes.I will definitely be returning Barcelona and will 100% revisit this hotel.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had the pleasure of staying at this hotel for 5 nights and highly recommend staying here. Perfect location to walk to several locations and restaurants and also close to the Diagonal Metro. Lovely warm welcome on arrival and complimentary Cava, chocolates and macaroons whilst checking in. We had a Garden Deluxe room which was lovely, plenty of room and a lovely bathroom with complimentary toiletries and a great shower! Complimentary water each day and a voucher for a free cocktail and two bottles of Sangria was a nice touch together with each evening having chocolates left in the room. There is a good choice for breakfast and something to suit everyone, a choice of egg dishes can be cooked to order. The only thing I would add would be a toaster and a choice of stronger English Breakfast tea bags, I personally like weak tea but the teabags there were not the best, even with two teabags in the teapot it still did not make a decent cup. We had a superb time staying here the staff were all very friendly and we would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 2 nights in H10 Casa Mimosa, the staff was very-very welcoming, always smiling and available for any request. Thank you all, Atif, Jose Ramon and others. The room was confortable and the breakfast very complete
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was maybe my 10th visit to Barcelona and I hope I found my new home away from home. The location is great, very convenient and close to either metro or walking or taking a taxi (which isn’t that expensive in BCN). The hotel looks quiet new, the rooms are spacious and well maintained. The bed is great, shower has 2 showers in the same room and is very good. The noise in the room although we’re on the street was OK (quiet...). We really loved the personal touch - fresh flowers that were changed twice during our stay, chocolate in the evening, basket of macaroons the night before we left. Front desk people were very friendly and helpful. We’ll RETURN!
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hotel on the strength of other reviews and I was so pleased I did. We arrived at Barcelona airport (BCN) and caught the renfe train into Barcelona getting off at Passeig de Gràcia. The hotel was about a 10 minute walk slightly uphill but do’able with small suitcases. We bought the T10 travel ticket for €10.20 each which gave us 10 rides including the train from the airport. On arrival at the hotel we were greeted with a glass of cava and some goodies to munch on while we completed our check in. Even though it was quite early our beautiful terrace room was ready. The terrace was amazing with views over Le Pedrera and lovely comfy sofa and chairs. The room and bathroom were huge. There were 2 bottles of complimentary water and welcome chocolates. As H10 members we also got a voucher for a welcome cocktail each so its worth joining. There was also an amenity pack in the bathroom containing toothbrushes and toothpaste etc. Breakfast was included and enjoyable with breads, cereals and pastries together with a selection of freshly cooked options available. As a Brit who loves a good cup of tea, unfortunately the tea was awful so I recommend taking some tea bags with you! The hotel is very close to Diagonal metro station which made getting around the city very easy. We managed to visit nearly all the main sites just using our T10 cards. The area felt safe at night.If we return to Barcelona I wouldn’t even think of staying anywhere else.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay at the H10 Casa Mimosa this last weekend.Eli, at the reception provided us with the nicest, professional and personalized checkin experience and helped us during our stay with good advice and recommendations.Our room on the 6th floor with a terrace overlooking the backyard of Gaudì’s Casa Milà was charming and very quiet. It was not very big but comfortable and nicely setup. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom modern.Room service continental breakfast was generous and qualitative. Interaction with all the staff (housekeeping, reception,...) very friendly and professional.We will definitely come back to stay at H10 Casa Mimosa during the warmer season to enjoy the two swimming pools located both on the rooftop and in the hotel garden.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed here for two nights last weekend on our first trip to Barcelona and the only downside was that our stay wasn’t long enough. From the moment we checked in, with a glass of complimentary Cava, the service and facilities were exceptional. All staff we encountered were lovely and professional and nothing was too much. We stayed in room 302, a classic twin facing the road; however it was the equivalent of a king size bed, with a small balcony, and the road noise was minimal - I slept really well. The room was beautiful and clean, with sangria in the room and still water replenished during our stay, and lovely toiletries provided.As suggested by a previous reviewer, I signed up to the loyalty scheme beforehand and we were given a free cocktail, which we had on our first night (mine a scrummy Cosmopolitan and my husband a Pina Colada). We took these to the roof terrace which was very quiet given it was January, but it was mild so we enjoyed the sight of La Pedrera lit up in the evening - there is a bar on the terrace in warmer months, so I can imagine it would be a great place to spend an evening.We didn’t eat at the hotel, or use the pools as it was way too cold, so I can’t comment on these. My husband did book a ‘romance pack’ though for €25 for my birthday, so we came back from our day out to a chilled bottle of Cava and dessert from the kitchen (dipped chocolate strawberries, macaroons and chocolates) which was a lovely touch.Overall this hotel was faultless, and when we return to Barcelona one day (which we absolutely will) I wouldn’t want to stay anywhere else.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A day prior to our arrival, we received an email from them informing us that Taxis had gone on strike and how we should get to the hotel of coming from the airport. We wrote back thinking of taking Uber and they actually responded saying it is better to take the train. We appreciate their professionalism in keeping the safety of their guest a priority.Upon check-in we had welcome drinks at the reception. They were quick to provide & printed information on the timings for the trains back to the airport since we were staying one night only and leaving the next morning.We loved our room. Well-planned, roomy, had a balcony overlooking the garden and someone was playing spain is tunes on the guitar in the afternoon. Lovely bed, wish we could sleep in longer!Not forgetting the complimentary drinks and well-thought out shower amenities and even bathroom slippers (which we didn’t find in other properties in Spain).Wishing we can go back again!!
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I visited Barcelona for a few days, and we were excited by what Casa Mimosa claimed to offer. We did have a really nice check-in experience with José. He was professional, welcoming, and took extra time to pour us a second glass of cava and plot a few points of interest on a map of the city. Thanks José!Our room was a nice size and mostly well-designed. We appreciated the photos of the original building, prior to the hotel renovation. Be careful in the bathroom, as the sinks are prone to splashing water everywhere and the water temperature fluctuates quite a bit in the shower.Unfortunately, there were a few things that soured our stay. After we dropped off our things in our room, we wandered down to the lobby to top up our cava glasses at the nicely decorated “Welcome!” table in the guest area of the lobby. As soon as we touched the bottle, a woman behind a check-in desk walked over and asked what we were doing. When we explained, she told us complementary drinks are only for welcoming new guests, and we’d need to now pay at the bar. The hotel needs to bring the drink bar behind the check-in desks and remove guest signage if they intend for it to be used by staff only. Also, train your staff. At €150+/night, it’s just not worth an embarrassing guest experience to save the partial glass of cava.So, we left our glasses and set out to quickly check out the property. Our first stop was the rooftop terrace, which looks incredible in hotel pictures. It was deserted, heat lamps shut off with no staff around to turn them on, and caution tape sloppily hung around what had been the rooftop dunk pool, which now sits empty and unkept. Bummer.Later that day, we took a great walking tour and our guide cringed and kindly told us we wouldn’t find great Catalan food or really anything “truly Barcelona” near our hotel — just designer retail and tourist traps. After a few days in the city, our experience proved him right. There are plenty of charming hotels much nearer the Gothic quarter and all the action of Ciutat Vella and surrounding neighborhoods. Casa Mimosa is just a block from La Pedrera and a 15-20min walk to La Sagrada Família, but otherwise it’s the center of luxury shopping on Las Ramblas. We spent 20-30min each morning and evening just walking to the more historic, vibrant parts of the city.We loved Barcelona and we’ll be back as soon as we can, but we won’t be returning to Casa Mimosa. I’m surprised the hotel is as highly rated as it is on TripAdvisor.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have tried a large number of hotels in Barcelona and asked to see the rooms in many more. There are a few other good hotels, but with each there is a location problem, at least for us: too intermixed with lower Las Ramblas, too far from the fun areas like upper Las Ramblas, chain like, modern and boring with no style, too dark and kind of creepy with tiny windows, low standards, etc. No, we are not easy, just the way it is. We actually were not going to go to Barcelona last June due to no desirable hotel but discovered Casa Mimosa and decided to give it a try even though it looked too good to be true.But it was true - just as it appears in the photos and the positive reviews and perfectly located in the Eixample, the hidden-in-plain-sight high end yet hip and fun area in Barcelona surrounded by great cafes and a few good restaurants (For the best you usually need a taxi from everywhere.) ....and without the teeming masses and constantly instinctively gripping my handbag.  We liked our modern but still fine room, a Classic terrace room on the 6th floor, but were in shock when we opened the curtains to find not just a lovely terrace with a sofa and table and a planted separator, but as we raised our gaze we saw that we had a full view of Gaudi's Casa Mila. The roof was the same height as our terrace and between its large building and our's was a large sort of piaca below. We never wanted to leave that terrace, but had to visit the hotel's great rooftop area, complete with sand and trees and beautiful. Don't even think of staying elsewhere. Now I can return to what I sat down to do: reserve a room for June. Love Barcelona and now love a hotel there.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the H10 Casa Mimosa hotel in Barcelona for my husbands birthday and enjoyed our stay. Lovely spacious modern room and the staff were very helpful. They even remembered my husbands birthday and presented him with a bottle of cava and small chocolate cake, nice touch thank you so much. The hotel is central and close to some of Gaudi’s stunning buildings. We didn’t eat at the hotel because there were many local coffee shops and restaurants that to be honest worked out cheaper than breakfast. The metro was 5 mins away and very easy to use. Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I could not say enough nice things about this hotel. From the moment you walk in to the lobby, everything is perfect, the decor is beautiful, the staff is very friendly, and there is even a selection of beverages (cava, sparkling water, etc) made available. The room itself was amazing, with a nice balcony, some of the best views of La Pedrera available in the city, and complementary sangria upon arrival. Everything inside the room was clean, modern, and put together, making it a wonderful place to return to each evening. We stayed here for New Year's Eve, the following evening, and then again two weeks later, prior to returning to the US. The staff here could not be any kinder, and truly helped make my first stay in Barcelona an excellent one. I will definitely return to this hotel on my next trip to Spain.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We love this hotel! The location can't be beat and the rooms are spacious and comfortable. Rooms facing the courtyard are very quiet and offer a view of La Pedrera. The staff is friendly and very helpful.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely hotel I totally recommend. Understated but comfortable public area and bar. The bedroom was quite minimalist (but fine) and quite large with a super king bed. Linens were crisp and fresh. The bathroom was modern and quite large (no bath though!). The room we had was 509 and it was really quiet with shutters to keep the noise out. The staff were excellent. Lots of helpful advice on sightseeing and restaurants especially from Alla and Noah - local tapas restaurants recommended were excellent: Vivo and Bar Mut both within a short walk. The hotel was very clean and well maintained. As it was the winter we didn’t use the roof pool nor the terrace but I imagine in the summer we would do. Welcome drinks on arrival was a nice touch and as we had signed up for the loyalty program to get a 5% discount ahead of time we also got a free cocktail each. Complimentary water in the room. My only issue was the breakfast is buffet only and at €23 per Head was a bit steep as all I needed was a coffee and croissant. This was solved by eating at the cafe opposite ( El Fornet)where we had 2 fresh croissants, a large glass of freshly squeezed OJ, a large Danish pastry, a bowl of fruit and 2 cappuccinos for €19. Despite this I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the H10 during a business trip to Barcelona. I love this little hotel. Front desk staff was very helpful and kind to me. Gave champagne when I checked in and helped me get to my room. My room was very modern and comfortable. Loved the coffee and water in the room. Great view of the garden. Additionally, I had breakfast twice at the hotel and enjoyed it each time. I hope to stay here again on my next trip.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed staying in this hotel. The room was comfortable, towels were fluffy and the toiletries were really nice (Rituals). One very nice surprise was the food at the hotel. We had dinner there one night and breakfast as well. The food at dinner was delicious and for really good value. The location is great, and super convenient. Would definitely stay here again!
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice room layout. Very comfortable bed, mattress is medium, not hard nor soft. Good size of bathroom but spacious shower cubicle. There is seating area with couch that may be used for bed, good size for child upto 12 years old i think.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a suite and loved it. Everything was perfect; the hotel, the friendly helpful staff and the location. There’s a mini supermarket shop a few feet away from the hotel & a popular bakery right across the road. It was very quiet at night which meant we all got a great nights sleep. Brilliant from check in to check out. Get this place booked. It’s fabulous!
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The view was breathe taking the pool was always clean the widows were always clean . When you first walk in you are stunned to the limit . Barcelona is a beautiful city and im glad to have visited this wonderful place . The food and the people are so unique and you wont find this anywhere else.
hotelName:
3    H10 Casa Mimosa
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A really great and brand new Hotel (as of July 2019). The rooms are medium sized but very well laid out with great design and good sound insulation.
