They are hi-tech with integrated sound system in rooms and bathroom with the ability to pair bluetooth to the rooms speakers. The rooftop pool is fantastic with all day sun and a bar and was not busy when I was there. Anna at reception was fantastic and made my stay very comfortable and helped me with extra bookings as well as other things. Highly recommended hotel within walking distance of most of barcelonas attractions.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here for 5 nights, and booked directly with the hotel. The communication from the hotel prior to staying was brilliant, and everything was taken care of for our arrival.First impressions of the hotel when we got there was that it was a classy, beautiful and modern with a contemporary twist.Raul on Reception checked us in with a friendly and cheerful personality, and was very happy to help us with any information that we needed.We requested a room with a balcony and we got one, even though they couldn’t guarantee it!!Our room was stylish and elegantly designed, with absolutely everything you would need (and more).It was my wife’s birthday and they had very thoughtfully left us a bottle of Cava and some delicious ginger cake as a celebration!!We checked out the rooftop pool straight away, and it’s a perfect place to chill out and relax with views over the local Eixample area.The hotel is a great location to walk to the local Gaudi sites, shopping etc...and has loads of local Tapas bars to choose from, it’s ideal for exploring and is walkable to Place De Catalunya and Las Ramblas.We asked Amelia on Reception for advice on the best way to get to places, like Parc Güell, and she was only to happy to help us, as she was throughout our stay. She’s a real superstar employee and personified what the hotel is all about - friendly, helpful, happy and relaxed.On check out, we had Amelia helping us, and as we were leaving at 6:00am the next morning, she sorted everything out including a taxi which was waiting for us and a little picnic, as we would be missing breakfast. It was lovely and it’s these little extra details, done with a genuine care that sets the hotel apart from many others we have stayed at across Europe.Honestly, with so many hotels to choose from in Barca, you don’t need to search any further, this is the one for you.If you want a perfectly located, modern with character/style, great food, rooms, service with a great pool - book this now.I’ve just left and travelling home but we’re already planning our return to The Corner Hotel!! Gràcias!!
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff gave us an excellent atention. Were there for a medical review for my mother and we felt like at home, had the chance to make a late checkout because of this special situation. Thank you so much for everything to all of you
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited here for my boyfriends 21st birthday and what a treat it was. From the moment we arrived the service we received was unbelievable. We were upgraded to a big room and a bottle of champagne was left for us cooling in an ice bucket which was a lovely touch. The rooms are so nicely decorated, just so clean and modern. And the bed was the comfiest we've ever slept on.. my boyfriend even wanted to take it home! The bathroom was well equipped and very clean. There was a safe and fridge available too if needed. There's also a rooftop pool which looked amazing but too cold when we went!!On the ground floor where reception is, there's a quiet bar which did amazing cocktails. The hotel staff were so polite and friendly and nothing was too much trouble for them, very quick to answer questions and give information about the local area. The hotel is conveniently situated near two metro stations which is definitely the easiest way to get around in order to see everything !! We never had breakfast in the hotel but so many people we met said it was lovely. I have already recommended this hotel to so many people. Definitely will return again!!
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved the decor of the hotel. The reception is trendy and the staff were welcoming. The corridors are dark leading to the rooms but I think this is on part with other hotels I have stayed in. Personally I would like to see where I need to put my door key. There is much needed iced water in reception on arrival.The hotel is further from the centre than I would have normally liked, this wouldn’t be an issue normally but the obscenely high temperatures this weekend made it impossible to walk much.The room was lovely with effective air conditioning and lovely facilities.Breakfast was a lovely spread with plenty of options. Unfortunately the hot food was barely warm and I think the hotel need to change their warming facilities. The bar was reasonably priced and the staff attentive. The roof terrace and pool were exceptional. I would stay again as I had a wonderful stay. The negatives above can easily be put right.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from a quick last minute trip to this gorgeous modern hotel. As we walked through the door my partner pointed out the similarities between the corner hotel and a nobu. A gorgeous oriental style throughout the hotel coupled with and amazing roof terrace. Or only that but some of the friendliest and most helpful hotel staff I have ever experienced whilst travelling. Asked the staff for recommendations about restaurants and they went above the call of duty by booking it on our behalf as well as hailing us a cab!! Overall an amazing experience and I would return without any hesitation
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A lovely modern hotel with a great roof top pool and bar and seating area - could do with a few more loungers perhaps.Great friendly service from all staff - all young and eager to help all the timeClean functional room - nice shower /big tv / room safe / mini bar etc
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. The hotel is clean, modern, has a great vibe in the lobby, rooms are well sized for Europe and the staff is incredible. Front desk greeting by Rual was one of the best I have ever had (I stay in hotels 50-60 nights per year). He provided the right amount of information for the hotel and City to be helpful without being over-bearing.Room was cleaned very well each day as well.I cannot say enough about this property from design, location and staff. Thank you for a great stay and we will definitely be back.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I tried to book online a room in this hotel for three nights this September. The hotel's online booking service is an outfit called Agoda. When I received the confirmation via email, it had the wrong dates on the reservation. More shocking, rather than three nights, The Corner Hotel/Agoda had me reserved for 14 nights. They charged me a whopping US $3742.54. I immediately cancelled that reservation and made a new one. Agoda advised me that my first reservation was non-cancelable and that I would be charged the full US $3742.54. I tried to find the Agoda customer service number on the website (they don't show one on their website), but through a Google search I found a telephone number. When I reached Agoda customer service, which was an "English-as-a-second-language" service, the agent agreed to contact the hotel for me. After a couple of phone calls, I finally got an email saying that the hotel had agreed to refund my pre-payment. Whew. Problem solved? Not so fast. (See my second posting.)
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Corner Hotel is one of our favourite hotels we’ve ever stayed at. Such well appointed and comfortable rooms, excellent cafe downstairs (the hamburger was incredibly good). The best thing was the amazing and friendly staff who were so helpful. Jordi in particular went to such an effort to make sure we had a good stay and made the most of our quick trip. He even helped us get something delivered we’d left at another hotel on the other side of the country. The rooftop pool was a nice escape too. Great location, really can’t say anything negative.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is good and the location excellent, their breakfast options are limited but they are good and the staff is really friendly, the only thing that they needed is a bellboy to help the people with their luggage.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this hotel. Modern, immaculate, fantastic location, friendly helpful staff, quick efficient check in. Staff could not do enough. The rooms are lovely, breakfast lovely, water provided each day. Lovely building with sun terrace and pool. Bar area lovely. Fantastic area in exiample, many lovely restaurants and great bars close by. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough, so worth booking. A big thank you to the bar staff for their service and the lady on reception at check in and out. A wonderful birthday bottle and cake was such a lovely touch also. Everything amazing. If I could pick one very small niggle. The iron, I would advise bringing one or possibly irons for the rooms? As every morning and evening i had to ring reception to send one to our room, but definitely does not take anything away from this superb hotel and staff. Wonderful,stylish hotel.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Highly recommended. The Corner Hotel was a great base to come back to at the end of a day enjoying everything that the city of Barcelona has to offer. Unusually for a hotel, we both slept really well, even though our room was facing the road, we were didn't hear any traffic noise. The bed was super comfortable. The staff were polite and helpful, even printing train tickets for us.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I didn’t know what to expect when I booked The Corner Hotel. What a wonderful surprise! First of all, I have to mention Anna behind the receptionist counter. She was so helpful in recommending restaurants, helping us to find bus stops, and anything else we needed (I think she was there 24 hours a day ). Secondly, the atmosphere in the bar area. We usually don’t go to hotel bars, but this was special. Live music of high quality. Totally relaxed atmosphere. Our room was clean and well appointed. Everything was in working order and was very well planned. Great shower! Breakfast was included In our rate and was well stocked. Finally, this hotel sits in a very nice shopping neighborhood. Walking the streets in this area felt very safe and secure. Totally impressed!!
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this hotel. Everything was perfect and the smiling, helpful staff made it brighter, especially Jordi and Amelia. The breakfast was delicious and worth the upgrade. I highly recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the Corner hotel for 3 days and the purpose of our trip was relaxing and cosyness and the Corner Hotel lived perfectly up to that. It is a very modern, clean, comfortable and friendly hotel. The rooftop bar and pool is perfect for relaxing in the sun and the food is very good. I would definitely stay here again for our next trip to Barcelona
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very modern, clean, and with attentive staff. There are customers here on business, but this hotel should be considered by the tourist as well. After fighting the crowds in El Gotic, you don't want to hear the revelers carrying on all night just outside your window. A 15-minute walk from Place de Catalunya, this hotel is a quiet haven and is professionally run. We enjoyed our 3-night stay immensely, and there is much good to be said about the bars, restaurants, and shops in this neighborhood.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel itself is beautiful, so clean and modern. The bar was fabulous. I had the best food during my stay in Barcelona at the restaurant at the hotel. Their tapas were delicious. Jara at the front desk deserves a raise for her customer service. I had left some items in a hotel safe in Seville the night before checking into the Corner Hotel in Barcelona. My travel company was if no help. The Seville hotel had my items but was no help in getting them sent to me. Jara took over, contacted a local company that was located in both Seville and Barcelona. They went to the hotel, picked up my items and shipped them to me overnight. All for $20 euros. She was amazing and I am forever grateful.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I haven't stayed in the hotel as have access to an apartment directly opposite however we do go there regularly for breakfast or a mid morning drink and it is a lovely relaxed environment. Also a great place to meet a business acquaintance if you are looking for a quiet comfy place for a coffee.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this hotel—everything from the authentic and personal service to the upbeat vibe made our stay a memorable one. Loves the breakfast, the bar and the comfortable room. Would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of corner hotel is in a safe and quiet location. Walk able to various areas of Barcelona. Very close to Passeig de Gràcia Staff were very friendly. Would recommended the hotel for anybody visiting Barcelona.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No complaints. Good size rooms. Well appointed details. Modern and functional room amenities. Neighborhood was quiet, but close to the action. Easy to get to and from. Recommend as a middle ground between high and low end hotel!
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We very much enjoyed our stay at the "Corner". The hotel is fairly new, very clean and with a modern/fresh appearance. The staff was overwhelmingly friendly and helpful. We were just there for one night, and found somewhat limited restaurants/shopping, but the "Corner" was very comfortable.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is just absolutely fantastic. The superior rooms are great, excellent pillow selection, great rooftop facilities, super friendly staff and the breakfast is a must have. We really enjoyed our stay and will definitely book our stay here next time.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was perfect! We arrived early in the morning and a room was ready for us within an hour wait and on top floor with a nice balcony and view! We even had a nice sweet surprise with champagne and cakes to celebrate our anniversary!! A super comfy mattress, in room bluetooth speaker, bottle of water refilled daily... and everything was flawless!! Big thank you to Amelia - from the expedia communication to check in, she was v attentive and made our stay a great one! Would def be back if visit Barcelona again.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This exceptional hotel is in a lovely neighborhood - close to all of the attractions but far enough away from the hubbub of Las Ramblas. Our corner room was immaculate, spacious and quiet with a divinely comfortable bed. Everything was in pristine working order including the wifi. Among the hotel’s numerous amenities is a clean and secure car park that was quite a surprise and much appreciated. We also had a wonderfully satisfying meal in the restaurant/bar after a long day exploring the city. The staff at the front desk, who quickly attended to all of our requests, exceeded all expectations. No need to search further - this is a great hotel and you won’t be disappointed.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great time at the hotel. The reception and bar staff go out of their way to help. There is a great atmosphere in the lounge area with live music at times. The music around the hotel does get quite annoying after a while as it is of a particular genre and some very strange songs! However if you know what you’re doing you can play your own music through the system in your room. We had a corner room which was lovely with a modern feel. The bathroom however was a bit of a disappointment as it was a wet room with a plastic shower curtain. Not quite what we expected and it meant the bathroom floor was soaked each day and we used towels to mop it up otherwise you couldn’t walk in there as it didn’t drain away well. The cleaners did a great job for which we were very thankful. The roof top area is great and quite quiet at this time of year. A lovely place to sit and enjoy some peace or to have a drink in the sun after a busy day out. The breakfast was great and beautifully presented. Available from 7am to 11am. There could be more space to put your plates to allow you to dish your food and spare cutlery in case you need it, as we did every day. There was nowhere for rubbish or teabags either. Just small things but worth mentioning. The breakfast staff need to smile and be more present around the room to assist people. There were several people trying to work out how to use things and find things. It would be nice if there was someone to help. The above did not detract from our stay and we would return to the hotel again. It is in a great spot with lots of different restaurants and bars close by. Try the pizzeria opposite the entrance and the Indian curry bar Masala 73. Also The Venue steak house but that’s a taxi cab away. The main sights are half an hours walk away but we got a few taxis and they’re very reasonable. The roads are superb and the city is so clean. We were very impressed with all it had to offer from the parks to the beaches and history. What a wonderful city and we will go again.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent six nights here and it is an excellent hotel - clean, quiet and modern. Very pleasant and helpful staff. Lovely buffet breakfast and food/drinks in the bar area. Great location, away from the hustle and bustle of crowds but still convenient to attractions via foot or metro. Also within 10-15 minute walk of aerobus stop. Lots of excellent restaurants nearby, particularly for pizza and pasta lovers. Would definitely recommend and stay here again.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 8 nights at the Corner Hotel. Can't say enough great things about the hotel and staff! Great location for access to surrounding La Rambla shopping and El Raval and Gothic Quarter restaurants and nightlife. Staff is friendly and accommodating. In terms of amenities, there is not a gym or office area. However, the downstairs lobby/bar seem to be a local hangout for students and business people alike due to beautiful interior design/free Wi-Fi, and food/coffee. An added bonus was free yoga once a week on the rooftop. There is a pool and bar on the rooftop, too. Rooms are clean, on smaller side, but it's Europe! Overall, would book again.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited here for 3 nights at the beginning of May with my boyfriend. Having previously stayed in the Eixample area when visiting Barcelona, we were happy to stay in this vicinity and the reviews for The Corner were amazing - we were not disappointed! It is a good 20 min walk from La Ramblas but its a leisurely stroll and plenty to see on the way - easy to get to most places.The service at the hotel was brilliant - they were able to check us in early when we arrived and when we got back to our room they had left a bottle of cava and some amazing chocolate cake to celebrate our anniversary (I had mentioned when booking). This was such a nice gesture and we took the bottle up to the roof terrace which was an amazing place to enjoy the setting sun and relax.We had a few drinks and snacks in the bar, all of which were very reasonably priced and very good. Service again was great.We had a superior room and it was a good size for 2, comfortable bed and the pillows were amazing!! There was a pillow menu on the bedside table. Bathroom was lovely, great shower and toiletries and the wardrobe was huge.All in all I cannot say enough about this hotel and wouldn't hesitate to recommend to anyone.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Visited in Feb 2018. Located two streets away from the popular shopping high street and Gaudi’s masterpieces, the hotel sits at the corner of the street. Easy to navigate to other areas on foot. But will definitely need a cab back at the end of the day if you end up at gothic area or la rambla side.Ground floor is like a co-working space. Modern looking spacious room, clean, and friendly staffs! Ask for recommendations at the reception as they are mostly reliable. Diagonally opposite to the hotel has a delicious Catalunya cuisine. Down the street towards Gaudi’s masterpiece there is a burger place that is packed at night. Laundramat is also nearby if you need to do some washing.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was a very nice surprise on our trip. A great location within walking distance. The hotel amenities were spot on. We enjoyed lounging in the bar, as well as the rooftop bar before going out to dinner. Would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Jada at reception was so helpful with a printing problem. So important when you are on business. The lobby bar is an excellent venue to relax and work. It would be ideal if they had a fitness centre on site.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel for the Bank Holiday weekend, it was very beautiful! The staff were lovely too. It is close to some of the best restaurants in Barcelona and conveniently located to get around the city.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was very central and in a safe neighborhood. Upon arrival we were greeted by friendly and helpful staff. The hotel offered a free welcome drink in the lobby with a small selection of free sweet treats...that was a very nice touch. The rooms were well sized with comfortable beds and the windows were amazing at blocking outside sound. The roof top pool was gorgeous and I wish I could have spent more time there. Definitely hit up the hotel bar here. Rose the bartender was nothing less than a mixology genius! Wow her drinks were fantastic...I recommend going with whatever she recommends and trying something different each time you drop into the bar. I travel a lot and I will say this is a great hotel.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed three nights, and had an amazing experience. From the hotel staff, to cleanliness and room quality, it was a perfect stay. Even had a nice gym down the street, complimentary for all hotel guests.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff are welcoming, friendly, and helpful. We felt looked after throughout or stay. The hotel has a great lobby bar and a lovely roof terrace. We really enjoyed our stay and would stay again. Thank you.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay at the Corner Hotel. Cool vibe, clean rooms, friendly staff and delicious breakfast. Most of the major sites were within walking distance. We even ate dinner at the hotel one night and really enjoyed it. Would definitely come again.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I travelled to Barcelona with his parents and spent 4 days at the Corner Hotel. First thing we noticed was what a stylish and modern hotel it is; the lobby has a bar/ cafe which we spent quite a few mornings and late nights relaxing in as did many other residents and locals. Room was very clean and modern, bed huge and extremely comfortable. Best part about the whole trip was the customer service- particularly Marten (sp?) Nothing was too much and he went above and beyond when we were pick pocketed on the metro, helping us report and with the police report etc. His kindness really made the trip for us. Hotel is a fair walk from the centre (20 minutes from Las Ramblas and around 1 hour from the beach) but the buses are cheap and very quick as is the metro. There are good restaurants nearby so no need to head back into the centre every evening. A nice touch was being welcomed into the hotel with a different free drink every evening from rose to cocktails! Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I adore this hotel. I spent 3 nights on my own in Barcelona. I wanted a nice hotel so I booked this one.Everything is A1I arrived early on my first day so I had to wait for my room to be ready. This wasn’t a problem as I got a drink and went up to the roof top and relaxed for a while. Beautiful roof top with a pool and decent views of the surrounding area. When my room was ready, it was worth the wait.I booked a superior room so it had a huge bed and a beautiful balcony. Shower is powerful. Wish i had a bath.Staff are excellent and very friendly.The atmosphere and food in the bar downstairs are both very enjoyable. Breakfast has loads to choose from. Really enjoyed the breads, cheese and fruits. It was very quiet as well which is a nice change from the breakfast madness in hotels at home.I highly recommend this hotel. If I’m ever back in Barcelona, I will be staying here. Finally location is very safe. 15 min walk to city centre. I walked home every night and it feels much safer than city centre.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location with easy and convenient transportation readily available; very helpful staff; good food and enjoyable lobby/restaurant/bar!will recommend this place to others and hope to return ourselves.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Corner Hotel was all and more we expected. We were welcomed by the staff and any questions or concerns we had were dealt with immediately. Our room was quiet and comfortable and we enjoyed dinner and live music in the lobby at night. We sat up by the pool one afternoon and it was lovely. For the price, we felt we had great value.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: exact location - beautiful lobby/restaurant ordered food to go from lobby bar/restaurant and they delivered to my room in 15 min - food was delicious, wonderfully presented, fresh and hotenjoyed the candy in the lobby as well as the welcome drink
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such a fantastic hotel!! Every 'corner' of this hotel is very purposefully decorated. The staff here are incredibly professional, warm and friendly. We loved the way the rooms were set up and the food exceeded our expectations. We loved coming back to the hotel at the end of the day, and found that The Corner added just as much to our Barcelona experience as the city did. With its superb location, all the major sights and attractions are within walking distance. I cannot praise this hotel enough and would recommend it to everyone visiting Barcelona. Their hospitality truly is second to none.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly and informative folks at the front desk (e.g., Anna).Terrific lounge -- sofas, bar, food, and relaxing alternative (mostly American) music.Breakfast buffet also a big plus.Highly recommended.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just retunred from the most fabulous weekend at this amazing hotel. We cannot praise it enough! From the warm welcome at check-in to the whole weekend experience, we felt very valued as customers from all the staff. The hotel has an amazing vibe, is beautifully decorated and the staff cannot do enough for you.Our room was spacious, clean and beautifully appointed and the whole hotel had the same feel. The roof top terrace with sunbeds and small pool is a littel gem and if the weather had been better, we would have spent a lot of time up there I am sure.Food at the hotel was of an excellent standard. Everything we had was wonderful and the cocktails are amazing. We can also thoroughly recomment the Sunday Brunch. Food was excellent, there was a great live singer and the whole atmosphere was wonderful. We would like to mention the excellent breakfast - so much choice, all beautifully presented (and included unlimited Cava!)All in all we had a truly wonderful stay and will definitely be back to enjoy another fabulous weekend experience.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am writing about a phone call, not about a stay at the hotel. I phoned twice from my home in New Jersey and they actually just picked up the phone and didn't even bother asking me to hold. I held for 5 minutes and then 3 minutes the second time before I just hung up. I call a third time and she just quickly said please hold and put me on hold and I hung up. If the service is anything like their phone service, sad. So I won't be staying at his hotel. It was worth a try.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A nice clean and comfortable hotel with attentive staff. Room a bit small so not much room between bed and desk/chair and water pressure could be better. The bar was a real plus with good music and a nice atmosphere. Other facilities not used.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I really enjoyed staying at the Corner Hotel. From initial check-in, the hotel felt comfortable, stylish, and welcoming. The staff were extremely friendly as well and we could not have asked for more! The breakfast, although not included in our rate, was delicious with a vast selection.Our room was clean and well-decorated, and the only gripe was the inside courtyard view was nothing special. The hotel was walking distance to everything we wanted to do in Barcelona, including a 30 minute walk to La Sagrada Familia, 25 minutes to Plaça d'Espanya, and 30 minutes to the Gothic Quarter.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great Hotel. Good location. Friendly professional Staff. Had some great musical performers the nights we were there. We ate only one night there and the food was delicious. Overall very happy with our choice of this hotel and we would recommend it without hesitation. We would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were invited to the Corner Hotel because of the 30th celebration of my boyfriend.The live music was incredibly wonderful. Thanks so much to the singer who also sang especially for my boyfriends birthday. Beautiful voice. Beautiful atmosphere throughout. The staff was very very friendly and welcoming. The interior is just purely stylish and nice. And the food.... I have no words. I was enjoying every bite. Thank you so much!
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Elegant hotel in the residential Eixample neighborhood, very close to bars and restaurants. The hotel is a good 15 minute walk from the main attractions, but we enjoyed walking around. Very comfortable bed and quiet room. Breakfast was well varied with many options on offer and good quality food. We also tried the bar: good cocktails and great atmosphere, I would definitely recommend a drink there on your way out for dinner. Great experience overall, would definitely stay here again on my next trip.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: LOCATION: The hotel is located in the rather posh area of Eixample, which is both close the centre but sufficiently far-away to be away from the hoards of tourists.PREMISES: Typical 19th Century building restored a few years ago, but it seems like only the facade was kept and everything behind was rebuilt. The lobby has something of a Starbucks athmosphere but is hip and cosy and the same time.SERVICE: Staff is very friendly, helpful and efficient.BREAKFAST: excellent choice of fresh products and various fresh juices and smoothiesROOM: very spacious, clean and efficient, no street noise despite the room facing the street, so the insulation was excellent; the bathroom was spacious and with everything in good working order.WiFi: reliable and very fast in the room and all common placesOVERALL: excellent hotel and good value for money
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was a very very good surprise. Looked nice and clean on the pictures, but well, you never know what to expect. We spent only one night there, but everything was really perfect, from welcoming to check out. The hotel entrance is modern, trendy, the person at the reception desk was absolutely lovely and really helpful. She saw we were french so used her best french to talk to us. That was really sweet. We had a welcoming cocktail, that was actually really good, we can all agree that it is normally awful. The room was huge, very well decorated, very well furnished. The bathroom was as well very nice. You have a sound system in the room and bathroom, you can either listen to the hotel radio (which was soooo cool) or your mobile music through bluetooth. We went in the lobby for a drink before going out for dinner, very good atmosphere, lot of people, a live musician/singer was there, the cocktails were excellent as well. We stayed only one night, but it was just perfect and I know we will go there again if we go back to Barcelona.
hotelName:
4    The Corner Hotel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at the front desk was very accommodating. I arrived at 7:00 am after a long flight from the US. They held my luggage and offered me breakfast service. They arranged my room early and I was settled in by 9:30 am. Service at the bar was good and staff was friendly
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel with nice staff, good location and fair prices. Located in a nice area of Barcelona with restaurants, bars and shops nearby. We really enjoyed the hotel and the staff was nice and efficient.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visited Barcelona recently with my parents and found these hotel chain. Though I have been in Barcelona many times, it wasn't until now that I got a chance to stay in any their hotels. I loved the hotel, it was a good location ( Though I know there are others that are closer to the main city center depending on your budget). The rooms were spacious enough and the perks you get if you sign up to become a member is just great! You get a welcoming drink and also a drink at either 2 of their bars. The breakfast was really great, you get a plentiful choice of hot and cold items, coffee, the awesome orange juice and the attention by the staff was incredible. In terms of the pool...unless is something really important to you..It is small, and is at the rooftop. Everyone was helpful, incredible genuine and friendly. The hotel grounds are pristine and all the small personal touches like the nespresso machine in the room, the complimentary mini bar (if you become a member), the robes...all makes this my new hotels of choice when visiting Spain.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Can't rate this hotel highly enoughLovely welcoming staff in the reception and bar areasSpotlessly cleanLovely room (stayed in room 110, cant speak for other rooms :))Nespresso coffee machineAutomatic lights that are just enough to stop you stubbing a toe in the middle of the night without waking other half upLovely extras like toothbursh, shaving equipment, etcBrilliant location
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is good value for the money I think. I have stayed before a night before a cruise and we did it again. Walking distance to Los Rambles and great coffee shops nearby. Good for short stay. I would stay yet again :)
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came to Barcelona for the birthday of our daughter who celebrated 15-year-old. We were 4 persons, booked 2 rooms for 2 nights. When we are arrived, we were given a room so small that we cannot stand still in the room, we have to sit on the bed. 2 persons cannot be in the same time in the bathroom, you can sit on the toilets and brush your teeth on the sink in the same time. The other room for the children was very noisy and smoking! We were explained that they could not change our rooms. The bedroom is not even 6 M2 ! Just the place to put a bed and one suitcase! Nothing to do with what we saw in their website which shows big rooms. This is pure lies and dishonesty. We are used to travelling abroad a lot but never experienced such a tiny room for 250euros a night!
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 6 nights at this hotel and had a wonderful stay. The room was large and comfortable and the staff welcoming and helpful. The breakfast was a highlight particularly on the first morning when we were able to order hot food off the menu to supplement the cold buffet which had a good variety of food.. The fruit was very tasty and we particularly enjoyed the Orange juice and Nespresso coffees. For the other days the hot food was also buffet style and it was not up to the same standard but the staff were always willing to make us some chocolate con churros. The hotel is in close proximity to a range of good restaurants and Large Ramblas. We were also able to easily walk to Parc Guell, Sagrada Familia and also to the tennis stadium and Camp Nou as they were all within less than 4km. The walks were all enjoyable as the roads and buildings are beautiful.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the hotel the week of April 17th. The hotel is beautiful and original. The room with a terrace for three was a perfect size for us. Very clean, whatever supplies we needed were replenished on time. The cleaning staff, front desk staff, and breakfast staff are very friendly and always available to assist. The breakfast was excellent- great variety of meats and cheeses, juices, cava, hot eggs dishes and delicious churros with hot chocolate.We were concerned with the reviews that mentioned construction noise- but while we heard it, it didn’t bother us. As to the thin walls- again no complaints, even though our room was right by the elevators.The location is right in the center of all. We walked everywhere - no need for metro. Taking a taxi is a great and cheap option.Overall would definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Flawless...that is how I would describe this hotel. Spotlessly clean, with super helpful staff. The decor is amazing and the amount of artwork on the walls if just a joy to behold. It is an art lovers paradise. This hotel is classified as 3 star superior - this is way too low a classification. It goes above and beyond in every sense. I am someone who finds fault in every hotel, but in this one...nothing. Possibly the only niggle was the size of the bedrooms, but the space in the building is confined and they do the best they can with it. That said, I didn't go to Barcelona to spend the day in my bedroom, so it served it's purpose. Would I stay here again? Happily!
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I am a H10 member and travel to Barcelona often. I DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL. I have stayed at H10 before, but like anything, the staff make the product. This staff sucks. The location is a bit out of the hub bub of the city action but close enough to walk.This is a convention hotel - when I say this, that is who they cater to. I walked in every night at midnight, asking for Ice in a glass to take to my room. There was a corporate party going on blocked by barriers. The front desk told me to walk in and get it.... I was shocked. Typically, they say, I will send it to your room. He pointed to the party, continued chatting with his friend and said -" Go ask the Bar."The room was nice - but again, they had a hard time replacing coffee, cream or used cups. I will not stay here again.... I suggest you don't. I LOVE the H10 METROPOLITAN!!!!
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We came in the hotel for one night, we were upgraded to the Junior Suite as it was available and we were only staying for a Night.The room was perfect: Large bubble bathtub, rain shower, giant comfy bed, living room area and very luminous ! Insonorisation is perfect as we did not hear a thing once in the room. Only thing is that the room has no balcony.Staff is very friendly and breakfast is good.One of the best point of the hotel is that it is super well located ! You are at walking distance of many point of interest in Barcelona.I would absolutely come back to the hotel.Quentin
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 4 nights and absolutely loved it! First of all we noticed that the location is fab with it only being a 5 minute walk away from the diagonal/provença metro station which gives you access to every part of Barcelona if you don’t want to walk, and ensures you don’t have to lug your suitcase for miles when going to and from the airport. When checking in we were greeted by lovely and helpful staff who gave us a welcome drink which you choose from juice, champagne or water, and are given a map of the city as well as a leaflet for the hop on hop off bus tour. The room was a good size, very modern and clean with a very comfy bed and huge shower of good quality! The whole stay we kept getting surprised with the lovely small touches by the staff which go a long way, for example when we returned from a day in the city we were greeted with chocolates and cookies on our bed, we got free crisps when drinking at the bar and we got a free drink each at the bar for becoming h10 member which costs nothing to join! The breakfast was gorgeous with a continental range of breads, yoghurts, meats and cereals etc, and then you could order hot food from a menu. We tried pretty much everything over the 4 days including crepes, scrambled and poached eggs, bacon, mushrooms and beans, and we weren’t disappointed with any of the dishes. Everything was cooked fresh, tasted lovely and was presented very well. Overall I cannot recommend this hotel enough and we are definitely going to look out for these hotels when booking anywhere again.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at this hotel for 3 nights and even though it didn’t promise much at the beginning, it turned out to be quite a pleasant surprise!The hotel has a clean look, the rooms are quite spacious and is well located, since it’s close to Metro and FGC stations and also to Passeig de Gràcia.I also have to compliment the food variety at breakfast, which got even better with the hot plates menu (tip: try the Nutella pancakes, they are amazing!).I would only say that the hotel should improve the breakfast organization, since it was quite hard for personnel to focus and fulfill all their tasks, as well as the way to connect to the wifi network, which is way too complicated.Overall, I would recommend staying this hotel if you are looking for a good night of sleep followed by a quality breakfast.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In the end, hotel is about the experience. The many small details make it a non memorable experience. In a so called 4 star hotels, I wouldn’t expect to have to call the front desk to get toilet paper or soap, as there was none after cleaning (more than once). I also would not expect a “you must go downstairs to get your bottle of wine openned” response. All in all, It was way below expectation, nothing really stood out as really good. On the lighter side, location is great.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights. Great hotel and location. Too cold to use the pool but it looked lovely. Breakfast good although waiting staff appear disinterested. Reception staff very friendly and helpful. Will return.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were here two weeks ago, first of all the hotel is very nice, the breakfast and service is good. When we arrived in this hotel we had to pay the bill immediately. We got basic room on second floor, the room was to small and to dark. We have always heard of the use of the toilet in the room above us.Unfortunately the room is very bad for reason we couldn’t enjoy 100% in our relaxing.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent a week at the H10 Art Gallery hotel in Barcelona.Overall our experience was great. The room was small, but we only went in to sleep and shower since Barcelona is such a wonderful city. The other minimal amount of time we spent at the hotel was at the rooftop pool, which was very nice and offered great views. Get there early if you want to get a good spot though as it is kind of small up there.The hotel was located in a fairly quiet area, away from much of the hustle of Las Ramblas. Taxi stand right out front and a metro stop a block away. We chose this hotel specifically on price, which was great. Since we planned to explore the city alot, we didn't require anything fancy, but this hotel went above our expectations. The employees were very nice and the hotel was very clean. The bathroom in the room was also very nice.We did alot of walking and came back some nights very late and never felt as if the area around the hotel was unsafe. Next time we might try to stay a little closer to a more "major" area, but if you don't mind walking a few extra blocks, this hotel is great.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed our 5 nights in this hotel. Rooms were not big but breakfast was great! Location was quiet and near to luxorious shops. Only minus was that the beds were 190 cm, not 2 m long! The junior suite was the only one with 2 m bed...
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A pleasant, modern hotel in the centre of Barcelona. Quite easy reached using Aerobus direct from the airport. I got off at the Placa Universitat stop from which it is a simple10-15 minutes walk once you get orientated. There is also a metro station about 50 m from the hotel from which you can get easy access around the city. Would certainly stay here again- breakfast buffet was very good by Spanish standards
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for one night before going back home. We wanted something decent / economical for our last night in Spain since we had an early flight the next morning. The staff was really nice, and offered Champagne during check-in. I believe breakfast was 15 or 16 Euros which is not that expensive for a hotel. However, I recommend eating outside at a cafe where breakfast typically run 7 to 8 Euros. This hotel is only a few blocks away from Passeig de Gràcia (high end shopping and access to the train.)Overall it was a nice hotel, but the rooms are small. If you are on a budget I would recommend staying here as it's cozy hotel, but don't expect luxury.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We picked this hotel as we have stayed at H10 hotels before and they are always good and it didnt let us down. The hotel was very clean and tidy as we walked in and welcomed with a drink. The room was excellent bright and very modern the bathroom had a walk in shower and spacious. We had breakfast and it was excellent plenty of choice and plenty of it. The staff are very friendly and very helpful they couldnt do enough for us . The decor was good as it was based on different artists very interesting. The manager should be very proud of his staff.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Would not recommend for a business trip. I was in a superior room, which was okay, but I wonder how basic the normal rooms were. The desk was very small, the Wi-fi in the room slow (faster in the bar) and not a proper chair to sit and work at.Service was mediocre the entire time across the entire hotel. The bathroom venting didn’t seem to do anything other than letting the essence of cigarette smoke come in to your bathroom periodically. On my second night I returned to find the voile curtain had been removed, which meant you had to leave the curtains closed in the morning as you would have no privacy. The following day two mismatched ones were installed in their place, but they didn’t fit so left a 30cm gap between them as they were too small; in essence same problem. They had fixed the large window that had a gap large enough to put fingers through, which on the first night I had to pack with tissue paper to reduce the external noise and breeze.Odd lighting situation, where the bedside light worked off the main switch so if you wanted that on you had to have the main ceiling lights on. I did enjoy the welcome glass of cava while checking in though. As of November 2018 there is construction going on next door which seemed to work through the night which while not massively noisy did disturb me. Rooms are small, barely enough room to do a cramped yoga session in the morning. I wouldn’t go back because of these things.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really surprises me that both the reviews and hotel website fail to mention there is a major construction project next door and it is VERY LOUD. Upgraded (and paid more) for a room to face Enric Granados as the interior room was very claustrophobic. The street view room was viewed at lunch and it was quiet b/c the construction was on break. Was awakened quite early the following morning to jack hammers, drills, etc. It would have been nice if the staff had informed of this.Note the interior rooms are quite small and no privacy due to the nature of the window facing the elevator courtyard and all other rooms. It might be good for one night but not for a longer period.The hotel is at a good location, amenities as stated, etc. The breakfast is extensive with eggs and hot dishes made to order, pastries, bread, charcuterie, cheeses, fruit, juices and coffee.In the end cannot recommend staying here due to the very loud construction.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 2 nights as a group of 4 friends. We received a voucher on check in for a free cocktail to redeem in the hotel bar which was a nice touch. We had an internal room, which I was worried about as I have stayed in hotels before where you are looking at a brick wall, but this was nice as you had a door that opened onto a courtyard so it didn’t feel claustrophobic. The hotel is in a nice spot with a good choice of popular bars and restaurants on your doorstep, but it’s a lovely leafy quiet area. About a 15 min walk to Sagrada Família and other sights. Breakfast had a decent selection, can’t complain for what you got, as it was included in the price. Room was a decent size with a coffee machine and docking station and enough wardrobe space. Good bathroom amenities and a lovely shower and a great feature where a little light comes on when you walk in, which is great for the middle of the night not having to search for the light switch. My only complaint about the hotel, which did have an impact on my weekend was the bathroom door!! What a terrible design! It’s a frosted glass door, but it has at least a 1 inch gap where it is hinged so when it’s closed you can see right through. This wasn’t just our door, as our fiends door was the same and that’s the way it’s been fitted. You could hear and see everything, which when you are away with a friend it makes it quite awkward! That is the only reason I wouldn’t give the hotel 5 stars as it really was a hindrance.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: IT's relatively big room compare to Paris hotel. People were nice there. The location is a big plus!!! It's like 10 mins walk to casa mile and 15-20walk to casa batilo. Overall I had a great stay and if I ever visit Spain again, I would come back!
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent four nights in the H10 Art Gallery. Overall I would say that, for what we paid for, it was good value for money. The room, even though it was small and quite limited space, was really clean and well maintained each day by housekeeping. Fresh, modern interior and a nice bathroom with a really good shower. The bed was very comfortable. It has a lovely rooftop pool area which was perfect for chilling in the sun in the afternoon. Location wise, we felt it was well placed in terms of accessibility to all main tourist attractions. We could get to Las Ramblas in 15 minutes easily. We were able to get to all the various tourist attractions and areas of the city on foot, but close by are metro stations and bus stops. The only negative would be the breakfast. There was a small selection of cereals, fruits, toast/croissants etc and you had the option to order from a small menu. We were quite surprised that when we ordered scrambled eggs on toast, we were presented with a small, thin, disc of bread with some egg piled on top. It looked like it was trying to mimic some kind of fine dining. Not really necessary for breakfast. The restaurant manager had a bad attitude and was not welcoming at all. I would definitely stay in this hotel again if returning to Barcelona.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Elegant ambiance awaits you in this luxurious hotel. Comfortable rooms complete with all the amenities you want. Attentive Staff cater to you needs, but are also knowledgeable of the points of interest through the city to direct you where you'd like to visit. If you're visiting Barcelona, this is the hotel you want!
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just recently stayed for 7 nights here and had the loveliest time. Fabulous ambiance from check in until checkout. Great room. Great breakfast. Nice attendant staff especially fernando Lovely rooftop terrace. Great area. Won’t stay anywhere else when we return to Barcelona. Just loved it
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice location in city quite a quiet street. Room with balcony was lovely not much of a view though. The rainfall shower was awesome.  The little issues we found was that on the bedding there was a huge stain on one of the quilts, we left bed unmade next morning with the stain on show and after the room was cleaned checked and it was still there we took it off the bed and left a note to replace they just took it away . Sunday when we stayed took ages we left the room numerous times waiting for it to be cleaned we had no towels , no shower gel , and clean cups , coffee , water . We went down to reception at 3pm and asked and said they would send cleaning up st 4.15pm we rang down to say nothing has arrived , they arrived about 10 mins after that call but couldn’t do much as we didn’t have the facility to anything within the room and had to wait all day pretty much . Breakfast was lovely the selection was great though two out of the five days we stayed we were given a menu for the eggs your own way however no one came and took the order, but for the days we order they were nice . The rooftop pool was a great feature , nice place to relax.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Things you want at a hotel- comfortable bed, cleanliness, helpful staff, quiet sleep, location location location. 10/10 this place has it all including a rooftop pool and a gym. There are excellent choices for dining, nightlife and shopping all around. Extremely walkable.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was ideal, on a quieter street and within walkable distance to some of the attractions. Close to plenty of places to eat. We went to the Italian Restaurant, La Piemontesa which was very good and virtually next door, quite a few times. We upgraded the room and had a balcony although the view wasn't too good so we didn't sit out. You were overlooked from all angles unfortunately. We loved the themed artists' floors. The room itself was lovely as was the bathroom. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We will most certainly visit Barcelona again and stay at this Hotel.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked the hotel on booking.com but cancelled it after seeing the added value of booking directly to the hotel (free breakfast, cheaper price, free WiFi). In the end we still paid 150 EUR for a deluxe room with terrace, which isn't too bad for an August in Barcelona, but certainly not cheap either.We arrived at the hotel late at night, and weren't offered a welcome drink. At the reservation I made 2 requests: a double bed and a quiet room. Unfortunately we were given a tiny room, directly opposite the elevator which was poorly maintained. When I complained about this, the reception said that all the rooms with double beds and terrace were directly opposite the elevator; luckly the manager "found" a room a little further away from the elevator the next day. It was quieter than the first room, so well appreciated. The room similarly showed signs of damage: wall paper torn and stained.Be careful and know that all the rooms are extremely tiny. You cannot open 2 large suitcase in the room. There is only 1 small chair to sit on. The bathroom was OK in size, clean, with a good shower. However, they have annoying lights with sensors that go on an off if someone uses the bathroom at night, causing the other person to wake up. The best aspect of the room was the terrace and the location of the hotel in Eixample: plenty of restaurants and bars very close to the hotel. Don't rent the bicycles of the hotel (20 EUR/bike/day); there are cheaper options a few blocks away. I don't understand why they don't give the bikes for free use... The small pool on the roof of the hotel was nice as well.Breakfast is decent but if it weren't included in the room rate, I wouldn't pay extra for it.The main reason why I won't return is when we got to the room on our 3rd day, the room was made up, but the bed sheet showed a large stain (dried up blood? Melted chocolate? Who knows...) which is completely unaccepable. I went down to the reception and asked them to change the linen while we went out for dinner. 2 hours later we came back and found that nothing had changed. I returned to the reception and 15 min later they sent housekeeping who changed the sheets. No apology was offered at any time. Totally and completely unaccaptable. The small size of the room was a disappointment but my fault (I should have researched better); the unprofessional housekeeping is something I cannot tolerate. There are better options available at that price.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved our visit to this hotel such a good spot for everything with in easy walking distance! The rooms are small but provide all necessities and modern and clean and the air con was great in a very hot City! Lots of restaurants nearby and whilst we didn’t use the Hotel restaurant it looked nice and the reception staff were informative and friendly .. loved the area and would definitely go back ..
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved this H10 hotel. It was near the action, just a couple of blocks from La Rambla, but on a quiet, tree lined street. Our room was very comfortable and well designed. The staff was friendly and helpful. We didn't get up there, but there is a rooftop pool, which I think is not common in European cities. There are a number of good restaurants nearby. The hotel breakfast is excellent.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great place to base your self. Food for breakfast is second to none.The girls get a great view of sexy male waiters.The rest of the pace is good as any 5-star worldwide.Well done to staff and the team running this place.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an amazing 4 nights at the hotel for a city brea. Excellent locations and loads of cafes and restaurants nearby. The hotel was immaculately clean and had an added bonus of a roof top pool!! The best cocktails served in the bar my strawberry daiquiri was one of the best I’ve ever had!! Will defo be back
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this H10 for five nights. We did splurge for a junior suite, and the extra space was fabulous. Our friends were in a regular room which was a little on the small side. Rooms were clean and our bathroom was very large. All the front desk staff were extremely helpful and friendly. We did the breakfast buffet out on the back patio three mornings and it was very nice. Would definitely recommend this hotel.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my second visit to Barcelona, but my first stay at the H10, I would come here again, great location to the metro,very clean hotel, shame breakfast wasn’t included in the price, was given lots of quotes, 13 Erous via email, then 18 and then 24,so we decided not to go ahead, bit confusing Staff were friendly on reception, nice pool area to sunbathe, overlooking roof tops,We had a meal at the bar,nice man served us with a smile, which I like to see,Only the downside was the chambermaid,The floor wasn’t cleaned, so we had to wear footwear, And the sheets weren’t changed,and no instructions how to use the coffee machine in the room, And we were only told there were no taxis to go to the airport, when we try to order the night before, a note in the hotel to the would have been great, like myselfI have a bad leg, and it was hard to struggle to get to the airport, But apart from the three hiccups, we had enjoyable stay,
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed at the H10 for our recent trip to Spain. Firstly, the decor of the hotel is absolutely beautiful. I love the art theme, and how each floor is devoted to a particular artist. The front desk upon arrival were very helpful and friendly! Our rooms were very clean, and cool (which is great during the summertime in Spain). The location of the hotel is excellent. It's in a more quiet part of Spain and in walking distance to many restaurants and bars. Each restaurant we tried were in this particular area and they were very good. We also loved just the atmosphere of this area. Further, the location is right by a taxi stand, which is super convenient when having to go to the train station or airport. The breakfast was good as well. They had a nice variety to choose from and all were very good. I also love that we were in walking distance to so many important sights in Barcelona. This is a place we will definitely stay in the future because were really enjoyed our time here!
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a room for a few nights in the hotel. Rooms are very stylish and service was excellent. Lovely pool at rooftop, would highly recommend. The hotel is also very central, walking distance from main landmarks and only a block away from the metro station. They made us feel very special during our stay.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a fantastic experience at this wonderful hotel. We booked online direct through the hotel & signed up to their rewards program. We got a better rate than all the so called on line discount websites such as booking.com etc. On arrival the hotel had upgraded our room to a deluxe room. The rooms are not huge but nicely furnished with a great balcony. Beautiful bathrooms. Clean & refreshed everyday. The inclusive breakfast is amazing, so much choice and the staff super efficient and friendly. Situated a 5 minute walk from the designer shops of La Rambla. Highly recommended. Oh and a huge plus for me free champagne (Cava) every morning for breakfast. Win , Win.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very clean, modern hotel with an extremely friendly and accommodating staff. You are welcomed within the first few seconds as you enter the hotel. They have wonderful, clean common areas, a great pool deck and a very nice bar. The coffee makers in the room were such a nice touch. Espresso in the morning is a wonderful way to start the day. The hotel was within walking distance of shops and wonderful restaurants. This hotel set the tone for our visit to Barcelona.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We absolutely loved this hotel, the staff here are fantastic and really care about its guests. We arrived around 10am but check in wasn’t til 3 but we were greeted with a choice of drinks and given maps and directions and they took our bags to store. The hotel is in a lovely area with a great selection of places to eat and drink and close to main attractions.When we came back around 4pm our rooms weren’t ready and we had to wait in the lobby for around 15 mins however for this “inconvenience “ we were given a voucher for 2 free cocktails in the bar.The rooms here are small but perfectly formed and there are very nice “Rituals” toiletries in the bathroom. Although this is a very popular hotel in a good location, it never felt crowded. While on our last day my wife fell over and was quite poorly, the staff on reception did everything to get us to the best hospital. It was also the day we had to check out but once again they came to the rescue finding the best price for another room on their website instead of just putting us on the rack rate.They also liaised with a supplier to get her a wheelchair when she came out of hospital - I couldn’t have thanked them enough!We had room service that night - just a club sandwich but it was tasty and flavoursome and not bad price for room service at 9.50€ - it came with a huge bowl of crisps.The breakfast here though was amazing - get the rate including breakfast as it will last you through lunch and all the way to dinner. Check my pictures but it doesn’t do it justice.... the bespoke omelettes are to die for!Planning another trip to Barcelona next year but will only stay here!!
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, friendly service, very comfortable and decently-sized rooms. Breakfast was definitely on the expensive side, but plenty of cafes nearby. Easy to get to the airport and elsewhere in Barcelona and surroundings.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel in good central location.Just a little disappointed with the room size. We had the internal facing room and it's not big enough for two suitcases without having to step over them.Rooftop pool was nice but also small and gets crowded with just a handful of people.The outside beer garden is really nice and a good place for a cocktail and to get away form the bustling centre of Barcelona.Would stay again but on an outward facing room with balcony. But maybe the price will go up and there would be better options?
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As soon as I walked in the hotel I was already in love, so much beautiful art on the walls & the interior was so sophisticated.. the staff looked so well dressed and welcomed you with a smile which is always promising.Our room was perfect with a cot already made up for my baby, and tv had an English option! Each floor of the hotel is based on a certain artist and their work which was fascinating.. and it just got a lot better when we went on the top floor & stubbled across a pool sweet little pool & gym.Breakfast here was amazing.. so yummy & plenty to choose from..the chefs clearly take pride in presentation cause it all looked 5*I would highly recommend this hotel!
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was absolutely perfect for our first stay in Barcelona! It was modern, central and the friendly staff made us feel very welcome. Yes the rooms are on the small side but you don’t feel claustrophobic like some of these reviews make out. It’s close to lots of bars and restaurants and near to the metro station if you want to travel further in to the city. I can’t recommend this place enough!
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a nice and pleasant hotel. Unlike the luxury hotels we usually stay at, it is unique in its design and decorations. The location is very good, there are many good restaurants nearby. We had the terrace room, which has a balcony that leads to a big backyard. It's lovely!Special praise to Helena, who is very helpful and patient in giving us directions and advice on restaurants nearby. She is the most friendly staff at the hotel. We will stay there again if we visit Barcelona next year!
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this hotel a week ago for 4 nights on the 3rd floor facing the street. The room was fantastic, service wonderful especially Victor on front desk.Returned yesterday for an overnight stay and did not receive a warm welcome at check in. Went to my allocated room only to discover it was a disabled room. The shower did not have an enclosure and consequently water would have covered the floor, the floor surface is already slippery. When I returned to reception, the gentleman knew that he had allocated me a disabled room, wish he had told me before I went to the room, he did apologise. I requested another room, Hotel was at capacity and I was allocated room 107. This was a very small room, and I mean small, facing an internal atrium, you can’t open the curtains as you look directly into another room, hence no natural light. Very disappointed. I really rated this hotel on my first visit as the room and staff were lovely, on this overnight stay I have been very disappointed, even considered changing hotels. Sadly, I am not sure about a return visit.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was clean and staff friendly . Due to a flight cancellation we missed a night there but were charged 190 Euros for a *no Show ". We booked through Booking.com and advised them as soon as we were aware of the problem . We were advised that it was Hotel's policy and it was suggested that we claim back from Airline. ( that is still in progress) Frankly I feel a little disappointed and would just make travellers aware of this policy. Generally not in my opinion the best location for a city break but perhaps depends on what you want to do in the City. I am unlikely to return there and now have an issue with H10 hotels and their charging policy . Their short sighted approach to an unavoidable delay has resulted in this review , whereas a more helpful an understanding view , looking at the big picture might have provided a less negative view. Customers beware !
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great stay at this hotel everything was perfect very clean room, my husband he really loved the terrace in our room comfortable bed, very helpful staff, good service. close to metro and tourist spots. swimming pool on the top of the hotel was fantastic breakfast was good. we will definitly be back to this hotel. Well recommended to our friends who gonna visit barcelona.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a real gem. It’s beautifully decorated and the art motif is well-carried out, with an extra bonus of an atrium and glass elevator. The breakfast room was elegant and serves full or continental breakfasts. The hotel is well located near the Plaza Catalunya and the Gothic quarter on a quiet street. The only downside is that our room was small. I would highly recommend this hotel to anybody wanting a quiet room in a good location.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: L'Eixample is the most convenient place to stay in Barcelona, and Enric Granados Street is one of the quietest avenues. This H10 hotel is on a street with only 1 lane of traffic, with trees and ample pedestrian walking areas. Many good restaurants are within a couple of blocks. Two major metro stops are within 3 or 4 blocks. From an itinerary planning standpoint, this is an excellent location. The reviews you read in Trip Advisor are accurate, however -- the rooms are, in fact, small. That shouldn't matter if you are running around on business or on vacation. The bed was comfortable, and that's basically all that matters. (Of course, we booked the room at a good price, and that makes the cramped quarters more bearable.) It took us a while to figure out how the A/C system works. Our room opened into an interior courtyard, so it was usually too warm to leave the windows open. The bathroom was adequately sized and modern. Each floor of the hotel is decorated in the style of a different artist (we were on the 5th Floor, which reflects the work of Roy Lichtenstein). The staff was helpful. The rooftop pool was a bit cool but refreshing for dangling our feet in the water after a long day of walking.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had five days in this dry friendly hotel. My wife is disabled and the offered lots of help without being condescending . The room was arge for a city centre with spotless bathroom ad a king sized bed. The lounge areas, bar and restaurants were adorned with original works of art... or prints, reliefs and sculptures. Even the shower walls in our room was a piece of art. We were close to the Legarda Famiia, the city centre, any some lovely restaurants. The help and advice we received was excellent, and we thought the breakfast offered great choice and good quality.
hotelName:
5    H10 Art Gallery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Brilliant location, near metro which is super easy to use. We got a 3 day HOLA card which allows you to use on bus & metro & the metro even takes you to the airport so you’re all set for 18 euros each. Bargain. Citymapper helped lots, could use on our EE normal data package. The hotel was comfortable, so clean, little luxury details from bathroom range to treats by lobby. Service was always friendly they held our luggage after checkout as we had time to explore before return flight. As it was over Valentines Day we came back to a champagne bottle & chocolates on day 2. So sweet. Rooftop terrace has pool & views of city with a bar! Beds are so comfortable, balcony a bonus with city views. I would defo return! Got this on a deal via booking.com otherwise h10s can be pricey!We went to so many delicious food spots there is so much choice! From Paella, Tapas to Brunch & Churros! Bakeries are yum!Best bakery near beach: baluardBest brunches: MILK in Gothic Quarter & MARMALADE in Raval great decor food coffee & live djWe had tapas from La Pepita & its a tiny spot gotta squeeze in. Prob better for drinks!There are cute places everywhere so go for a wander! I also went to see Sagrada Familla catherdral and had a lovely coffee about a 7 min walk up the hill. Sunny although Feb! Cant wait to return!
hotelName:
6    H10 Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was very excited to check into this hotel due to the photos and other reviews. It lived up to every expectation plus more! The rooms all feel brand new and have such divine decor. The whole hotel is beautiful and has a lovely feel to it. Beds are very comfortable, rooms can be made pitch black and bathrooms are large with double showers. Staff are very helpful and attentive for taxis and restaurant bookings. The roof top is a beautiful place for pre dinner drinks and sunbaking. An easy lovely 10 minute walk to las ramblas and surrounded by little cafes. Only recommendation would be to have space/stand in the room for large bags to be rested on.
hotelName:
6    H10 Madison
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I just got back from Barcelona where we stayed at the H10 Madison for two nights prior to our cruise. This beautiful boutique hotel is located in the Barri Gotic section of the city and exactly 1 block from the Barcelona Cathedral. The amazing location, gorgeous lobby, spotless, large room and enormous bathroom (we stayed in a junior suite), rooftop pool & bar with breathtaking views of this magical city are just a few things I wanted to mention. It is the perfect place to stay. However, the real gem is the friendly staff and impeccable service this hotel provides. Pedro and Naima went ABOVE AND BEYOND for us....before, during and even after our stay. They are two of the loveliest people I have ever met. My daughter had accidentally left a pair of new Nike Air Force One sneakers in the room after we checked out. I had called the hotel after boarding the cruise to see if they found them, which they had and Naima told me they would be happy to hold the sneakers for me to pick up upon our return from our cruise. When we went back to get the sneakers, hauling all of our luggage with us, they were kind enough to hold our bags until we needed to depart for the airport so that we could go out and explore the city, shop, eat lunch...all without having to lug our bags around.
