Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location for walking around centre; not so good for metro or car. Extremely nice staff and decent room even though walls were thin and we had noisy neighbours. But good value and a positive experience overall.
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a lovely stay at the Barcelona Gotic. The location was perfect for exploring Barri Gotic..and feeling immersed in this unique part of Barcelona. The room was spotless and the cleaning staff were excellent..it was so nice to have a cleaned room everyday with fresh towels and refilled soaps. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom was modern. We had a balcony which was nice (although a little smaller than we had hoped). The staff are very helpful and friendly. It is very relaxed..you can come and go as you please as the desk is 24 hours. It is excellent value for the price. Just be aware of the extras - wi fi in the room, (it is free in the communal area), the room safe is 1 euro per day and breakfast is 3 euros per day per person. We would definitely stay again ..hopefully later this year !! Thanks Barcelona Gotic!
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for three nights. We chose it for the location and price. It was really hard to beat. I'll start with the positives. Clean room and our shared bathroom was V clean. Rooms got cleaned daily. Breakfast was pretty good for a continental in a hostel. Staff were pleasant. Location is superb. The Gothic quarter is somewhere that is perfect for tourists. As central as can be. Some nice bars and cafes nearby alongside cheap supermarkets. Ok now for the cons. Obviously when paying a low price there will be trade offs. Walls were thin. Thin enough that we could hear the people in the room next door whispering. Not an exaggeration. I'm a heavy sleeper though so it didn't bother me too much. Security was a major turn off. Had I realised before how security worked there I would not have went for it. So you get a key for your room. You have to give the key into reception when leaving the hostel and ask for it back when returning. Seems like a very insecure method as there was no verification required for collecting a key. We were also handed the key to the room beside us on one occasion. There were no safes in our room to add to this so we really did not feel like our things were secure in our room. If you want to use a locker it is €2. I probably wouldn't book again mainly due to my thoughts on their security. Also they have emailed me that they are having a competition for leaving review. The prize is a mini iPad. To quote the email "But remember… participate will be possible as long as the person has stayed here and can appreciate her o his experience publicly." Incentivised reviews are often misleading. I'd recommend this place if your on a budget but don't leave your valuables in your room.
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: great place to stay, lovely rooms, perfect location, ideal base for the city centre and near all the bars with cheap drinks. Building was hard to find, lots of small roads leading to the guesthouse so easy to get lost and at night the main door is locked and you have to press the door bell. plan your journey to the Barcelona gotic. Rooms are basic but that doesn't matter when the city has so much to offer. comfortable beds, balcony above the road and bathroom was clean and spacious.
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: All I wanted was a simple, clean, cheap and safe room in central Barcelona. And this place has it all. You get what you pay for. Recommended for budget travelers (especially solo travelers as they have single rooms as well).
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel location was just perfect near La Ramblas!. Really comfy and clean beds, Our room had a shared bathroom when I booked it, but they gave us a room with a private bathroom for the same price. The staff were extra friendly and helped us with everything.
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay was awesome, price to conditions is super good, I've really enjoyed living in this hostel. The best thing about it is the location, it is close to the best spots. Staff is very nice, cleaning room everyday very carefully changing everything. Hostel style is nice and fancy.
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best thing about this hostel is the location. Right in the center of Barri Gotic, and quite close to the beaches and metro stations. We stayed in room Picasso which was quiet and really big. The staff was also really helpful.If I ever come back to Barcelona I would choose the same hostel and the same room.
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our private room was clean and cozy. I liked the atmosphere and energy of the old building. Location was really good and staff really friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay here again. Thanks a lot!
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great experience this was. Location was so good near evrything you need. Very clean place, nice rooms, friendly staff! We defenitley go back there!!! I realy enjoyed staying in the old part of town...
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want to be in the middle of hipster place this is your place.Important thing that it is very quite in the rooms as they are Not facing the street with all the shops and bars. We had a room with bathroom in there but the community bathroom&toilet is very clean! Bad service (this is how Catalonian people are).There is a Breakfast for 3 euro but very poor.
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best thing about this place was the staff! So so lovely and accommodating and happy enough to speak Spanish or English. Very clean and we ended up with an ensuite after booking a shared bathroom so that was great. Great central location and the cocktail bar next door was such a perk! A little noisy but nothing unbearable.
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In the centre of the gothic quarter, the hotel is in a great location and nearby are some cheaper bars and cafes to eat in. Staff at reception were very friendly and welcoming. The room was small with a few little scuffs and marks but like the whole place, very clean. A modern bathroom with hot water, what more could you ask. The communal bathrooms were also very clean , although if a messy person has been in this might not be the case. I think it is excellent value for money and would stay again.
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This guesthouse is in a great location in the Gotic Quarter and the staff were very friendly. It is nice and clean but unfortunately both me and my friend found we didn't sleep well as the mattresses were uncomfortable. But this is a budget hotel so you pay your money and take a chance. We had a private room and it was quiet apart from the water pipes when others turned on taps. I need my sleep so for this reason I wouldn't stay again but perhaps the beds are more comfortable in other rooms.
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in Guesthouse for 8 nights and everything was great! Staff was realy nice and very helpful. There is no kitchen for visitors but you can buy a breakfast for 3 euro person/day and you can eat as much as you want. The location is great because there is 5 minutes to metro station (there are 2 metro station nearby) and 5 minutes to La Rambla.
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great base to explore the Gothic Quarter and city centre, and just a 15 minute walk downhill to the beach. Friendly staff on hand round the clock and room cleaned to an excellent standard every day. Cool courtyard in the middle too!
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed at the Guesthouse for 4 days and enjoyed it very much. The rooms are clean and are cleaned regularly. The balcony, though small, is enough to enjoy the gothic streets of Barcelona. There was a sink in the room, a ceiling fan and a safe. The bed was wide and confortable. The only downside was some noise from next door, but there was no noise from outside. But the best part is the location of the Guesthouse - its right in the middle of Barcelonas Gothic quarter (next to the George Orwell sq.). And all that for a reasonable price! highly recommended!
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The guesthouse is located really close to the city centre,only a five minute walk away form La Rambla and inside the beautiful Gothic Quarter!You can walk almost everywhere from there.The staff was amazing,so helpful kind and smiley,they really provide the perfect atmosphere!!The rooms where modern and cute and superclean(people came everyday changing sheets and cleaning up) and there were two fans for the hot days.Last but not least they offer a breakfast buffet for only 3euros per person that is just perfect (and with a nice variety) which is exactly what you need to start your day!I highly recommend it to everyone,you would be more than satisfied!
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights at guesthouse Barcelona gotic and were wowed by the location, the friendly staff and the value that you get for your money. The nights were quiet and everything seemed to be very authentic. This is easily the best hostel of our trip!
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed their during beginning of our trip in Spain and at the end also for a total of 14 daysWe were on the 3rd floor and had to carry our two suitcases up the 63 stairs and our two handbags... we asked for help and were told help is not availableThe ceiling fan did not succeed to bring the temp. below 29ºC/84ºF at night... most of the time it was 30/86 or 31/88 even if we kept the door open with a stopper and the balcony door wide openThe lady at the desk is very helpful and nice... but her hands are tied... she does her best to answer your tourist questions, but anything related to help with luggage, frig. that does not work or intolerable heat in the room... she knows that the owner does not want to do anything about that .... you can ask 3, 5 or 10 times you will never get an answer with a solution to your requestOn top of the wardrobe there was ¼ of an inch of dust and moss... possibly too high for the cleaning lady to see or reachWhen we came back for our second stay, it was always there even if we put something on top of the wardrobe so tat she will see it
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was exactly what we needed. We had shared shower rooms which were always very clean. Breakfast is basic but all you need with toast, spreads, plenty of fruit juice and water, and some small muffins/pastries. The rooms do however get very hot (especially if you're from Scotland!) and as a result we didn't sleep very well at all despite a ceiling fan and another plug in fan. The hair dryer was good to have however it is quite small and as a result took far longer to dry my hair. A couple of time I had to air-dry as someone else in the hotel had it and hadn't given it back yet!All that aside I would definitely book again but maybe take my own hair dryer and something to help cool down the room at night!
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a very good option if you look at the price-quality for a couple days. The location is perfect in a nice neighborhood. The hosts of the hotel are the sweetest en try to make it the most comfortable for you. The rooms/bathrooms are very clean. Besides the squeeky bed there are really no complains. Breakfast is basic, but not also not expensive and optional. I consider to come here again if I'm back in Barcelona!
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was a bit impressed with the facility. The people over the counter were helpful. The place was clean. The rooms were too. Our room was cleaned everyday we were there. There was breakfast but you had to pay for it. There was no AC, just a ceiling fan and regular fan. The window to the balcony was nice but it would have been nice to have an outlet near it so we could get the regular fan near it to get fresh air in the stuffy room. Really fast internet. The other downside was the minute you left the room and want to leave the fans on or leave your phone charging, the electricity would turn off! Even the refrigerator! The beer we left in there was so warm from leaving the room all day. Overall - it was good. Could improve on some things.
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic for three nights in a single room with shared bathroom. The location was perfect being within walking distance to la ramblas and also the monuments in the gothic quarter. I was a bit sceptical about sharing a bathroom with another room, however it appeared to be clean every time I used it. My room was also cleaned daily and I was provided new clean towels on both days.
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly staff, very clean and tidy. Cheap too! The only downside i could think of is that it is a little hard to find at night and that the breakfast could be a lot better. Would recommend this place to anyone.
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice staff, room was clean and tidy. Didn't have a/c but had a cooling fan. Can come and go 24 hrs a day, there is always someone at the reception. Wifi works on the top floor. Really good location but Google maps the place beforehand so you know what the place looks like and how to get there. Would defiantly say there again
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed there with a friend of mine for a couples of days. Super location! We had a warm welcome, and the warm and friendly vibe remained throughout our stay. Our thanks to the staf (and especially to Sophie), who were 24h a day available at the desk! Great recommendation for when you're staying in Barcelona!
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was cleaned daily, staff was lovely and helpful. Also the location was very good, near the beach and center! My sister and I stayed for a few days on a vacation. Establishment offered free wifi and price of breakfast buffet was reasonable. Option to leave luggage in safe on first and last day of travel.
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time staying at this hotel and boy what an experience!Firstly finding it in the busy streets was an absolute nightmare, hotel signs? Nope!! Name on door? Nope! I walked past it about 4 times before stopping locals to ask for help. Press the bell and the door opens so then to make my way upstairs to the reception. I was greeted by a man and woman who were nice enough, he did say when you leave the hotel leave my key with him.8 am I woke up and left the hotel to meet someone, no one was at reception so I just nipped downstairs, it wasn't an issue because I was only a few minutes!Only to find, that upon my return with my friend and I was to be greeted by this vicious woman who was very upset I had left the hotel with the key, this is the key which was in my hand that I opened the door with, the last thing I thought about was keeping her happy and pressing the bell to give her the room key...She was not impressed! In fact her attitude was shocking! She was refusing my friend into my room. Whilst I packed my case because he wasn't a guest, she told him to sit in reception and be quiet!?!? She then continued to follow him telling him to be quiet, his repbecause your the one making me talk...To be honest I wouldn't stay at this hotel ever again and certainly would NOT recommend staying here... This woman who claims to be the manager is a horrible woman who is rude and quite honestly Nasty!Oh did I mention that someone has wiped the nose up the wall in a little shelf set into the wall and I had to sleep next to that...Pay a little more and stay some where which will show you a little more respect as a paying customer. The actual hotel was not bad, clean bathroom and communal areas, the room was alright for the price paid.Ypu do get what you pay for so I can't really moan about that.After I wrote the above the actual hotel manager has been emailing asking for details and in his and the hotels defence he seems to be talking time to look into this with some seriousness, so for those wishing to book then maybe give it a go and you will receive a better experience than myself. Have a nice trip:)
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: excellent location of this hostel was main reason that my girlfriend and I chose Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic. But when we arrived, turned out that even more excellent was service, personel create very homely atmosphere. Big + for everyday cleaning of rooms. Certainly we'll come back to Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location for people who are eager to visit the city, 4 minutes walk to Las Ramblas, 8 minutes walk to the Barceloneta, quite street in the centre of the most beautiful Gothic area. The staff at the reception desk was very helpful and friendly, they speak in many different languages. Room was ready for our stay and VERY CLEAN! Towels are changed everyday, as well as the whole room is cleaned daily. Extraordinary quality in reasonable price! I definitely recommend this place
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the hostel is absolutely ok and advisable. it is very well located in the city center - old town. service is perfect. rooms fit their description. everything is clean. the price is very attractive. no noise, no disturbing guests, everything ok.
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in this apartment for 3 days. And we really enjoyed it! The apartment was clean, cheap and in great location.Clean toilets , tovels changed everyday. Excellent for my purpose, In the future I will recommend the hostel to other people!"
hotelName:
10    Guesthouse Barcelona Gotic
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is in the PERFECT location!!! Very easy to get to /from the airport. It’s Directly across the street from the main Rail station, in which the rail station includes restaurants, variety of shops, Hop On Hop off bus, taxis & if u want to take a day trip via Rail or metro or bus into the city center. The hotel also has a grocery store around the corner, & restaurants within walking distance. The neighborhood is very safe as I was a solo traveler & felt comfortable walking after dark. The hotel itself is under construction but noise of the construction was very limited as I was on the 10th floor. The room was nice and spacious & very clean (1003) with AC. There was a mini bar with a variety of drinks & snacks. I did not get my room serviced the 1st day & upon returning to my room late the front desk called to confirm that I did not need any additional amenities. The ice machine did not work on my floor but room service brought me ice with no extra charge. The front desk clerk was very attentive and remembered by name from me previously calling the hotel to confirm reservations & each time he seen me addressed me by my name. Upon check in the lobby was busy and he was the only person working. He handled the stress with professionalism and got everyone checked in expeditiously, including assisting a gentleman of Asian decent where there was an apparent language barrier that he handled with ease. There was two types of refreshing beverages in the lobby and sweet treats which was a plus. The only thing that would have made my stay even better was if there was a pool to use. With the Spa closed due to renovations there was no access.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently spent two nights at this hotel and we loved every aspect of it.The hotel was near the railway station,the rooms were comfortable and very well appointed and everywhere was spotlessly clean.The breakfasts and evening meals were of an excellent quality.Most of all we will remember the staff,especially Camilla and Andy.They were all so kind in helping us to sort out a problem we had encountered on route.We hope to return one day perhaps for a longer stay as we have fond memories of this hotel.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel had a great location and was very clean. We were a 15-45 minute walk to the main highlight locations of Barcelona. We were a 10 minute walk away from the Pride festivities that were going on the day we were there. The only negative was the room was pretty hot. Barcelona was going through a heat wave and the air in the room couldn’t keep up. The front desk was great and put a fan in our room so everything worked out!
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is fantastic, it is located by the Barcelona Sants station, this will get you all around the city. The rooms are amazing and give a beautiful view (depending on what floor you're on).The staff are friendly and make you feel welcome.All the rooms have access to WiFi and have a mini bar
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was impressed with the size ofThe room, it was very clean. It is nice for my family.The Crew has hosted us well. It was convient place to say The hotel is under remodel, so the Car entry not easy to find
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We’ve just come back from spending two nights at this hotel, and couldn’t recommend it more. Great location close to the train station and two metro stations making it very easy to get about the city. Very attentive staff, and a lovely room. Amazing view of the city, and the most comfortable bed - would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for a couple of nights whilst travelling with work. The hotel is well located close to Sants station. Costs about €25 from the airport in a cab. My room was large and clean & I appreciated having ironing facilities in the room.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent 5 nights at this hotel with my husband & adult daughter. The rooms were clean, spacious & well equipped, & the staff were polite & helpful. A kettle & tea/coffee were provided immediately on request. Our rooms were in the front of the hotel looking out on to the street below which was great,the rooms at the back had a less attractive outlook.The current refurbishment was not a problem other than the fact that the top floor restaurant was closed. Amazing location with the main station 5 minutes walk to the right & the arena & MNAC a 15 minute walk to the left. I would stay here again without hesititation.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel looked nice in pictures, but we were sadly disappointed. Our room was filthy. There were multiple hairs in the sheets - one even looked like a pubic hair. The bathroom floor had spots all over it as if it hadn’t been mopped in a month and had trails of fluid drops everywhere. The trash cans were filthy. Really, everything in our room was gross. It was hard to even get comfortable to sleep. They need to hire new maids or a new cleaning manager. The hotel is also under construction, so it really was not worth the price. I would not stay here again or recommend it to anyone I know.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms are spacious and comfortable. Entrance is through the back of the hotel as front being refurbished as well as rooms above 11th floor. There is no grand reception hall with marble floor and sitting area. Although bar area was squashed into restaurant there breakfast was served, the hotel has lots of potential and could be a5 star hotel after refurbishment. If you can not justify paying 300 euro for the hotel in the centre, this one is a perfect value-for-money. Train station is 2min away. Barcelona City Tour bus is stopping on the other side of the train station. Customer service is fantastic: we had late check out which was arranged with no problem. Member of staff contacted us to offer their services such as taxi , football match tickets, concerts and o ask for our preferences 2 weeks in advance.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was very helpful and friendly. The room was bright and clean. The bathroom was great -- large walk-in shower, separate soaking tub, bidet, double sinks, complementary toiletries, such as toothbrushes, toothpaste, shower cap, shampoo, conditioner, lotion, shower gel, Q-tips, sewing kits. Good wifi. Neighborhood just okay.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was booked for us by our agent in the UK. After booking, we were told by the hotel that the spa and gym were out of operation and accepted the booking on that basis as the hotel is conveniently situated near Sants AVE station. However, we arrived to find the hotel in a far worse state than advised. The roof top restaurant on the 23rd floor is closed, as are all floors above the 8th, so there are no panoramic views. The hotel is surrounded by a wooden fence and a construction site, there is a painted wooden tunnel from reception to the lifts and all public areas are out of use, except for a small seating area. The room was comfortable but tired and the air con was not working - apparently not switched on until the outside temperature reaches 20C - but our room was too hot at 25 C for easy sleeping. Breakfast was good. The staff were friendly and attentive. The hotel is overselling itself at present as the facilities on the web site are not available. We think it will be OK when refurbishment is complete. At present, it is best avoided as a holiday hotel.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with my husband and daughter and we had an amazing stay. Totally recommend. Great location, food and nice staff. Defenitly coming back soon :) just wishing it was a little more affordable....
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently had a chance to visit the hotel. I was surprised by the intuitive personnel especially David and Mihail who showed their empathy, genuine interest and professionalism. The food was delicious. I will definitely come back some day for the same experience that made my family feel good.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights and loved our spacious, clean and modern room. Location is fantastic and we could walk to restaurants, cafes and public transportation. We stayed on the 4th floor and had views of the Sants Transportation Station. Hotel staff went above and beyond to make our stay the best. We used the hop on hop off bus and there is a stop just 1-2 minute walk away for both companies that offer the hop on bus. Great place to stay!
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We chose this hotel because we arrived Barcelona on a Renfe Intercity Train from Malaga.To our pleasant surprise the hotel is also well connected to the city via metro and trains.The hop on and off bus stop is also nearby.The rooms are spacious and our corner room 419 is especially nice with 270 degrees view of Barcelona Sants Train Terminal and surrounding squares.The room been recently renovated so it is filled with nice built in cabinets and nice bathroom.The floor finish is marble,so it can be an issue in winter but he HVAC system is good and functional thermostat control.I cannot comment on the other facilities because I did not have breakfast there.There are many cafes and restaurants 5 minutes especially within the Sants.There is a major renovation going on but all nicely cordoned away from guests.The noise is bearable but we are out during the days anyway.Staff are friendly and ever willing to help.You have my strong recommendation to stay here.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here 15th to 17th one complaint i wish we could have stayed longer.The reception staff were so helpfullThe room we had on the 11th floor had a panoramic view that you didnt want to leave the room.The room itself was massive and all marble .The bathroom with separate shower bath and double sinks was a room in itself.The beds were so comfotable and the toilters were of the highest quality.The room itself was immaculate.Will return.These were the views from our window
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hotel in a very convenient location opposite Barcelona Sants station and close to the metro which will take you directly to the coastal area of Barcelona. Travel to and from the airport with ease or travel onwards to many locations by train. The hotel is good at the moment as it is being refurbished but is soon to be excellent judging by the amount of work being carried out. No disturbance from renovation works. Plenty of insulation against outside noise so makes for a good nights sleep. Stayed here many times over the years and would recommend it to anyone.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Breathtaking views of the city and friendly staff. Short walking distance from Barcelona-Sants station and several good restaurants. Unfortunately, the upholstery on most the furniture was filthy. Notified reception immediately and the bench was replaced. However, other furniture was not. There were also a few issues in the bathroom. Disappointing for a hotel with many stars.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is all about the views from the hotel rooms and the dining room. Make sure you get a room with a view over the station and the city - it's astonishing. And if you think that's good, wait until you see the panorama in the breakfast room. Staff were enthusiastic and friendly. The hotel is in process of being refurbished too, but that will not affect your visit. Recommended.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A wonderful hotel in a very convenient location near to the train station and walking distance to major attractions. Excellent facilities including restaurant. Beautifully clean rooms with great views.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent one night at this hotel, for a business trip in Barcelona.Good location, close to Saints Station.The building is undergoing restructuring and entrance is a bit hidden. But, internally the hotel is nice.Room was comfortable, clean and well equipped, with a good view of the city.Recommended.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros:spacious room and bathroom with all the things you would expect in a hotel. There is a supermarket outside of the hotel as well as lots of places to eat. Reception staff were so helpful and very nice. Me and my sister had a great time. Thank youThis is tedious but having a plug socket near the beds would have been useful.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here the night before I took the AVE train to Madrid. It's so close to the train station. But the hotel is a delight. I got a pretty good rate, because it was not "in season" but I still would have loved it, even at a higher price. The room was a generous size, I had a great view of the city. I had a wonderful bathroom and just a great place to relax. There were good restaurants and a grocery store close by. The staff was super helpful. I would recommend this to anyone, my second favorite hotel of my trip.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wonderful hotel that is conveniently located next door to Barcelona Sants. A Metro station is available across the street.Large rooms were clean with plenty of closet space and comfortable bed and linen. Our room was located on the 15th floor which gave us a wonderful view of the city.Bathroom had a double sink and large vanity. The Interesting bathroom setup was large with separate cubicles (frosted doors) for the toilet and the shower. The bathroom included a bathtub. A great breakfast buffet with made to order omelets. Wide range of vegetables, cheeses, breads, cereal, juices, sweets, etc. Located on the second floor overlooking the Barcelona Sants Plaza.First Class staff with immediate response to our concern about a non-working in-room safe.Highly recommended.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I took the bullet train from Madrid to Barcelona - and this hotel was literally in front of the station! Great location! The Metro is across the street - so it is easy access to the metro to go to City Centre of Barcelona.Very clean hotel - it is under renovations - i had an amazing view on the 11th floor. Lovely hotel! I was traveling solo - so I was safe. There is a market and cafes around the corner too. Quiet area. The City Bus Tour hop on and off is nearby to take as well!
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was a bit dated, but is in the remodeling process.The staff was very courteous, and accommodating. Our room was great, with a good view of the city. We would definitely stay there again. The Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya is within walking distance to a former "Bull Fighting Stadium" which has been converted into a magnificent shopping mall and great restaurants on top! Michael Jackson was part of the conversion process before he passed away.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located right next to Sants train station, it is also close to a huge shopping mall with lots of places to eat, the rooms are huge lots of amenities, toiletries, the bathroom has a separate shower and huge soaking tub. staff was very friendly and helpful. The restaurant was amazing.Our room had a great view of Barcelona and  Mount Tibidabo room 1506. the beds were comfortable and the rooms were fresh and clean with lots of space. I would defiantly recommend staying here.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked via Agoda more than a month before. I was only notified that they are not able to provide me a room because the hotel is fully booked, just two weeks before the travel date (Dec 19, 2018).I suspect it's due to coupon code that adoga has applied for pop-up sales, which they dont want to honor. But I hope it's just a system glitch.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at this property for several nights in the summer of 2018 and it was lovely. Perfect location, great rooms, very professional service at the reception, fantastic restaurant.Totally recommend!!
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms all have really great views of the city below, and we had a corner one which is really the best. They are at present undergoing very big alterations but the general running of the hotel is not affected by this and the staff are always so very kind and helpful. It is super as it is very close to the station, taxis and buses which makes getting around very easy. There are also plenty of places to eat close by and they have just opened a new super market just around the corner from the hotel. I will always go there regardless of the price should it increase!!
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is conveniently located about 200m away from sants station. A metro station (sants estacio) to the north of the hotel that will take you to downtown la rambla is a mere 2 minute walk (290m). This would be the best hotel if you don't intend to stay in Barcelona for too long.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at 2 different hotels before and after the cruise. This is the one we stayed before the cruise for two nights. I wondered why there were mixed reviews when I was checking this hotel and now I know. First of all, when we got to the lobby, it is like 3 star as it's small, carpet is very dirty and outdated. We booked a comfort double room and was given a room on 6th floor. The room is outdated and the bathroom has mildew and rust. This room was not what was advertised on the website as the pictures and description have indicated a nice view. However, the room we were given was facing a parking lot. To make the matter worse, the bed is hard and the pillow is of the lowest grade. We were kept awake the whole night by a machine or something that is moving up and down the whole night. We finally figured out it is the elevator. Our room is down the hall by the renovated side and the wall insulation must have been removed. The next morning, I expressed my disappointment at the front desk. The lady was nice to hear my concern and said all their rooms were sold out. So I asked to talk to the manager. The front desk manager finally called me and said they will move me to the 18th floor. She was not very nice about it on the phone. The room on the 18th floor is much nicer like the pictures advertised on the expedia website. The bedding and pillows are of much better grade. If you go to the hotel website, they have different types of rooms but expedia only have one type of comfort double room. The higher floor rooms have been updated and do match the 4 star category. The lower floors room are like 3 star motel and not nice at all.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 2nd visit to this hotel and not disappointed. The hotel is undergoing a fairly extensive renovation project over the next 2 years, working bottom up from what I can gather. Other than the spa and downstairs bar being out of action, the hotel is doing a good job to reduce any impact of these works.Rooms are good, spacious and have fantastic views. Breakfast is worth the money just for the views but the quality it is very good, with Good choice throughout; although the hot area wasn’t necessarily to the full tastes of a British palate, but still fine nonethelessThe front of house staff are excellent; friendly, attentive and very helpful. Although I gave the hotel 4 starts, these guys deserve 5 stars
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is just across the street from one entrance to the Barcelona central railway station which is why we chose it. But when you get off the train, there are no signs to the hotel. We ended up taking a taxi.When we pulled up outside the hotel, the entire facade was under construction and covered with scaffolding. Yikes! But a hotel employee was there to take our luggage in so what the heck. The lobby showed no signs of the construction and the reception was super friendly. The hallway to the elevator had one plywood wall but once we reached our floor there were not signs of construction.The first view of the room is breathtaking. Floor to ceiling windows on two whole sides with fabulous views over Barcelona. Everything is done in marble. The bathroom is one of the nicest I have seen in any hotel. Excellent beds.The price was very reasonable for what you get. We would stay here again anytime and not worry about renovations.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was worried when I pulled up in front of the hotel, as the building had loads of hoarding and was getting repaired. Still, the staff were cheerful and my room was large.I did slip on the bathroom floor, so watch out for the slippery floors when wet, apart from that it was fine.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Desipte of maintenace and renovation of this hotel you can feel home at this 4* hotelThe staff are warm and ready to help, I hearer this hotel now belong to one legend of hollywood anyhow you will find anything in the room which well decorate and organized.I just impressed by the panaromatic view at the top of building which make a great combniation with your breakfast. Let me suggest you to go up there and see the barcelona from thereThe breakfast is amazing quality and varietyLet me to special thanks from the hotel personal with our memorise stay.The only thing which must be consider by hotel management is refrigators which need to be replace with new one.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: SUPBERB EXPERIENCE!!! We were on the 15th floor, paid for the smallest room which is 419 Square Feet, huge. Our room, like all the other rooms in this hotel had marble floors & a marble bathroom. The bathroom is spa like, with an extra large shower that fits about 10 people, no exaggeration & the bathroom included a separate bath tub, too. Our room had Panoramic breathtaking views of Barcelona & even the bathroom had gorgeous views of the City. The Hotel has all forms of transportation at its' doorstep, yet it is quiet & peaceful inside the hotel. The Sants train Station & taxis stops are across the street. Bus stops are located on the corner to the right of the hotel, steps away. The Restaurant is on the top floor, floor 23 with incredible mesmerizing views of Barcelona. Breakfast was super high quality, varied & super delicious, not to be missed!!! The hotel is very clean, which is so important!!! All the staff are professional, polite, welcoming & super accommodating!!! We look forward to returning to this hotel in the near future.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Surprised us on our anniversary trip to Bcn, with champagne and cake delivered to our room! we got a great view of the city! amazing experience!!! very nice and accomdating staff! great location walking distance from Sants Eatacion.. amazing people !
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, directly opposite the Sants train station, and convenient metro connection to the center of town. I had a corner room on the eleventh floor with views in two directions. Bathroom had a separate tub and shower. The restaurant, where breakfast is served, is on the 23rd floor with a spectacular panoramic view of the city. The express bus to the airport was a ten minute walk away, and there are a number of good restaurants in the neighborhood. What more could one ask?
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a business trip - its just opposite the Sants Station. Helpful and friendly staff - the hotel is clean and fairly modern. The rooms are quite simple - was expecting a bit more luxury but its convenient enough. The breakfast bar is fantastic - wide range of food and an excellent view of the city - its was the highlight of the hotel. Sadly the pool was closed due to current renovation - which was disappointing. Nice place but I would stay nearer the centre, however, they are renovating to modernize the place.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just across from Sants Station in Barcelona this is the perfect place to stay in Barcelona. Handy to make day trips to Girona, Figueres etc this hotel is meticulously clean. The showers, bed, linen all perfect. Can not complain. View from top floor restaurant is lovelyCatching metro is also across the road.The staff are super helpful. Sebastian was ever so kind along with Valeri who was sympathetic when we arrived exhausted from a flight from Morocco. During the day Andreii was so helpful with information.The staff make this hotel very special and location is worth coming here.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms in this hotel are very big for Barcelona, and the staff couldn’t be more accommodating. The location is slightly out of the centre but there is a metro over the road which takes about ten minutes to get to the rambles, the main train station is also opposite the hotel so getting to and from the airport is really easy. Some noise can be heard inside the rooms facing the front but this is negligible and isn’t really a problem, I would imagine a room facing the rear would be completely silent, mini supermarket over the road and quite a few restaurants in the area. From here you could walk to Montjuïc, about 2t minutes or get the metro which is about five minutes
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very noisy, next to a metro station and a busy roundabout. Inside you can hear your neigbour next to you and upstairs taking a shower or going to the toilet. You can hear everything in the hallway... Expensive and above all, the fitness and pool were closed due to reconstruction. Looks nice from far but is far from nice!Never ever again!
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a minute from Barcelona Sants station which provides access to trains, metro & bus services. The reception desk staff are friendly and always greet you with a smile and a welcome. In particular they provide the services of a staff member whose role is to provide information about tourist attractions, train services and answer questions which tourists might have. We would like to mention Jesus Lopez who was on duty when we arrived and was a wealth of information about the tourist attractions we should see. He also told us of the T-10 metro ticket which we could purchase for 10,20 euros. This ticket meant we were permitted 10 metro trips between both of us and it can be used until the 10 trips were all up. It saved us a good deal as buying a single ticket costs 2,20 euros. The rooms were extremely spacious and provided ample room for luggage storage. The cupboard space was extremely generous and it had an ironing board & iron stored there. There were 2 tables, several chairs, ample lighting in the room which included bedside lamps. There was a full length mirror in the room. Tea & coffee were provided in the room which was welcomed. On arrival there were 2 bottles of water as well as 4 delicious chocolate cakes and a lovely personlalised note to my wife which was to welcome both of us to the hotel. House keeping left lollies on the bedside table which was a lovely surprise on our return each day. It was cleaned daily The bathroom was larger than any we have ever seen with 2 sinks, a huge shower, a bath, toilet and bidet. Towels were huge and thick. Toiletries were so plentiful and of great quality; they consisted of shower gel, body lotion, shampoo & hair conditioner. New toothbrushes, tooth paste, sewing kit, cotton buds and shower cap were provided each day. The shower gel was fragrant and lathered up really well, unlike the products you tend to get in most hotels these days. It was more than we could use. Free wifi and TV were provided which included the usual English speaking channels such as the BBC. Lollies were provided along with iced cold water in the foyer each day for guests. We would highly recommend this hotel as we were more than happy with it and the services it provided.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gran Hotel Torre CatalunyaBarcelonaGood Value/Excellent Hotel and Staff626233228This was a shot in the dark looking for a hotel in Barcelona on a weekend with a huge football match! The prices everywhere were ridiculous if you could find a hotel. I opted for this hotel because it was next to the Barcelona Sants train station where we were arriving from Malaga. (more later on the four stars)The highrise facade is unassuming but the inside is welcoming. The staff was extremely helpful and friendly! I booked a suite (1 Comfort Attic Plus) which included breakfast daily (more on that later). The room was fabulous with a separate seating area with a television. It was the best sleep I had during our entire vacation and this was the fourth and last hotel. The wall-to-wall windows gave us sweeping views being on a very high, or highest floor. Now let's talk price. Two nights for a suite for 389 Euro plus tax. That's exceptional. The included breakfast is AWESOME. There are so many options for both American and European travelers and the views are incredible. The service was exceptional as well. My favorite place was the hotel bar. It was guest-restricted by key card. It was never crowded, the service was great and food good as well. Why the four stars? It's relatively far from the main attractions (walking). We took a taxi everywhere. At one point, we tried to figure out the metro system because it was raining after a visit to La Sagrada Familia. No luck. Too confusing. And we're pretty much veterans of subway systems. I should have done my homework. Otherwise, I was so happy with this hotel. It was an excellent value for the price and I would definitely go there again even with its location.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel solely cause of the location near the train station. The room was nice but the bed was hard as a rock! We wanted a good night sleep but woke up with sore backs. The hotel is in the process of being renovated and you can tell by the outside. We are lucky we did t book more then one night! Staff were friendly. Definitely did not think the was a 4 plus hotel.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a fabulous location directly across from SANTS train station. The on off bus stop was across the street. The hotel had a wonderful breakfast upstairs on the 23rd floor that was included with our room. The view while having breakfast was beyond amazing. The staff was so friendly and helpful every time you stopped at the desk. The rooms were large and clean. The only issue we had the whole trip was the second day the air conditioning stopped working and a red light came on. I reported it and asked to have someone come look at it. While I was out someone called but did not come see for themselves and said that is just how the air conditioning worked and we could come get a fan. However the day before it was freezing in the room and we had to turn it down, also the red light was on which it wasnt before. We just opened the window and let the fresh air in as it was very not in the room. It can be a bit noisy on the street at night but we are New Yorkers and use to that so it was not bothersome. Lovely place to stay at a very reasonable price.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My son and I had a wonderful 6 nights at this hotel. The staff without exception, was very helpful, courteous and professional - always with a smile. Made us feel very welcome. The rooms were very big and comfortable with great big bathrooms and the views were wonderful. Our room was at the back looking across the city to mountains. The views from the breakfast room must be the best in Barcelona- you can see right across the city to the sea. We walk a lot and we walked to the magic fountains from the hotel and to various other places but you are also right next to a main train station here so can train it anywhere. We bought a 10-trip ticket which we both used for 5 trips each to get around and found that was all we needed for our stay. We also hired bikes and electric scooters which were a fun way to explore.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at this hotel was very warm and welcoming, and tried to be as helpful as they possibly can. The accommodations were comfortable and clean. It is situated close to everything....restaurants, pastry shops. hop on/hop off bus kiosk, train station and shopping. Kudos goes out to Jesus Lopez who recommended an outstanding restaurant about two or three blocks from the hotel called "Zarautz". One note: If you request them to print out your boarding pass, make sure it is the boarding pass and not just the confirmation of your check-in. This will save you a lot of hassles and confusion when you arrive at the airport..
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location near Central Train Station, short walk to Plaza Espania. Rooms are large with gorgeous views, XL double vanity all marble modern bathroom, many closets, C/A, very clean, crispy clean linen. It was a very pleasure stay in Barcelona.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in this hotel for a weekend in September. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. I had a very nice specious, clean room. Breakfast is amazing on the top floor. There was a large selection of hot an cold food and the room has beautiful panoramic views of the city. The hotel is beside the main railway station and there is a metro station across the street from the hotel with two direct lines to the city's main attractions and city center activities.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came to explore Barcelona and was glad that we eventually decided to stay at this hotel, given the choice of hotels. Views from 16th floor were spectacular, however even these paled into insignificance when we dined on 23rd floor. Air con in the room was also fantastic, given how hot it was outside. Staff very helpful and friendly, nothing too much trouble for anyone that we had dealings with. Would definitely come back.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a dinner last August, in a 23th floor so the general view of the city of Barcelona was superb. If you like Barcelona, you must go there. But now it's under construction... I hope that the workers will finish their job soon.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From arriving to leaving, everyone was very pleasant and courteous. The room (1519 ) was clean, tidy and because it was a corner room, we had over 180° spectacular views. Breakfast caters for everyone and is situated on the 23rd floor, doesn't really get much better with the views to start your day. Received a nice touch as it was my wife's birthday. We got delivered to our room a bottle of wine and a cake, balloons and a message from the staff. Thank You. Hotel situated in a great location and although the roads are busy outside, we had no problem with noise.Thank You Barcelona and especially to all at the Torre Catalunya
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel ambiance was nice, clean, and bright. The receptionist staff made it easy and efficient to check-in. The rooms were spacious, modern, and definitely clean. The bathroom was also spacious and had dual sinks (which I love)! I liked that the bathroom also offered extra toiletries in case you forgot something (ex: toothbrush/toothpaste (gel form), Q-tips, sewing kit). The bed and pillows were comfy and provided a great night sleep after a long day of walking and sight-seeing. The hotel is in a great location! It was easy and convenient to get around Barcelona because we were next to the main train station (Barcelona Sants). My boyfriend and I took the train to get to places we needed to go. We stayed in Barcelona for a few days and decided to buy the T-10 ticket which allows you to use the ticket 10 times. We bought 1 ticket to use between the two of us and each time we finished one, we would buy another one (cost was about 10 euros). You can have one person insert the ticket to get through first, then you pass the ticket to the second person to insert right after. You save a lot of money by purchasing the T-10 ticket so you don't have to purchase individual ones. Also, if you plan to do the Hop-on Hop-off Bus, the stop is walking distance from the hotel. You can also opt to take the street buses which has one right outside of the hotel. Thank you to the staff at Gran Torre Catalunya! We had a lovely stay and would definitely recommend this hotel to our friends and family.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We needed a hotel near Sants due to an early morning Renfe train to leave Barcelona. This hotel was ideal. The rooms are a bit outdated and there is no restaurant, but there were a lot of positives-room was large, bed comfortable, great views, friendly and helpful staff, aircon and wifi worked fine. There were many restaurants and cafes nearby and the metro was also very close, This was an ideal base for us to explore Barcelona and Catalonia.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a great hotel which was conveniently located across the street from the train station. Our room was on the 17th floor with beautiful view of the city. Spacious room and very clean. Very professional and helpful staff. Loved it!! Wish we could stay there more than 2 nights. I will definately go back to stay there.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved our 3 night stay at Torre Catalunya in Barcelona. Prior to our visit they provided us with information about how to get around Barcelona. Very convenient near subway and we took advantage of the 10 ticket Metro pass. The hotel is also close to a Hop On Hop Off tour bus stop and we enjoyed the 2 day pass. Our room was modern and spacious. The reception staff were very patient and helpful. The included breakfast was excellent - so much variety and top quality. Aĺl staff were excellent and our server Yeslinda went above and beyond each morning. Lovely experience
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in an excellent location and has amazing views of the city. Very easy to get a bus or train/metro to visit any part of Barcelona. The hotel staff were polite, courteous and friendly. They were also very knowledgeable about transport and could quickly tell you the best way to reach a certain destination. A very special thanks to Adriana at the Wellness Room who gave me an excellent massage and left me feeling like I was walking on air! I fully plan on returning to this hotel when I next decide to visit Barcelona, and can't wait to see what the new spa looks like! ¡Muchas muchas gracias!
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is right opposite Sants station which is Barca’s main central station . Easy links to and from the airport and trains/metro to literally everywhere in the city.Recommend you buy a travel card ticket for your duration of stay as it’s much cheaper and faster/convenient to travel rather than using taxis. The station is literally opposite so do not waste money on taxis and use the public transport. If you are stuck with how to use their transport system , as their stations especially Sants can be a bit confusing for tourists , then download and use CityMapper app as it works a treat in Barcelona (and most big cities).We booked the suite and it was huge, stunning and with amazing views of Barcelona.Breakfast was not included and quite pricy but well worth it - they have 360 degree panoramic views of the city and it really was 5* breakfast so I highly recommend getting this as it’s worth the price.The spa was amazing and the highlight of the hotel - I believe this is complimentary to guests staying in the suites but may be extra to use for other guests. We used the facilities including a hydro pool, which has various different jets to massage particular areas, sauna, steam room, and a massage shower pretty much every day. Our flight back home wasn’t until the evening so the morning we checked out they kindly allowed us to store our luggage in their lockers and use the spa facilities in the evening to freshen up before our flight back home to London.The rest of the hotel itself such as the lifts was a bit outdated, but still in very good condition and there was nothing wrong with it at all. I would definitely stay here again especially due to the spa, spectacular views and close proximity to Sants station. Sants is also one of the stops which is on the Hop on Hop off tour which is a must - it stops at all the must sees and is well worth it for the entire day out.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I stayed here for my birthday, which was a lovely surprise from him!We even received an upgrade to a double suite on the top floor and it was amazing, so thank you for that!The views were fantastic, service was faultless and the food was incredible, we didn't want to leave!We will be back when we next visit Barcelona!
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First of all the hotel has really lovely views, especially from the breakfast restaurant on the top floor and it also is so convenient for access to the train station. However, the hospitality from the staff was just simply amazing. Andrey at the front desk was exceptionally helpful and courteous. I left some documents in my room and Cristina, from Lost and Found, ensured that I received them in time - although the company they used to send my documents, Komunika, was completely incompetent and uncontactable. Thanks for a lovely stay guys.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Gran Torre Cataluna is in such a convenient place – 2 minutes walk from the main railway station if travelling by train and from where there is convenient and regular train access to the airport. The rooms are of ample size and the bathrooms are exceptionally good: full-length bath with shower overhead; separate shower room; separate toilet. The views from the 23rd floor restaurant / breakfast room are truly spectacular as was the breakfast selection. My only negative comment is that the very charming breakfast staff should not also be expected to serve coffee & tea – just does not work and results in the customer being restricted in caffeine intake in the early morning, which may to some seem like the healthy option, but alas not to myself and probably many others. Educational comment – some hotel key cards can apparently be demagnetised if kept in the same pocket as your mobile – I was locked out after breakfast.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The spacious corner room made all the difference. We enjoyed the beautiful views from both our room and the breakfast room.Breakfasts were good, and all.the hotel staff excellent. The hotel was under construction at the time, but it did not really bother us.Will use this hotel again! Close to the metro, other train services and loads of taxis. Lovely to have stayed out of the too busy tourist hotspots.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Torre Catalunya was very nice. The rooms are spacious and modern; the bathrooms as well. It was clean and mostly quiet, and situated across the street from Barcelona's main train stations (which is great if you are traveling via train to the hotel or anywhere else in Europe). There was some construction at the time so there were not as many amenities, but we were primarily there for the rooms.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location to Barcelona Directly across the road from the main train station and the metro is just round the corner Staff could not have been more helpful Betty at reception was most helpful and gave us plenty of recommendations and explained the metro.The room was very spacious and spotless One very small issue we were getting a late evening flight and there was no room available for us to freshen up, we ended up in the gents toilet. Might be something to consider in the future.Would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel and thanks again Betty
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel exceeded my expectations! The friendly young man at the front desk (forgot his name) was a delight to talk to. The room was huge by European standards and very comfortable. Breakfast was great. The Location was great for catching the train or subway. The hub was across the street! The place was busy with tourists checking in or out but I didnt had to wait long check in, or for the elevator. There was always a staff member that understood my American English accent. Yea! I had some trouble with communication in most other accommodations in Spain. The price was reasonable as well.I will be back!
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were staying at this hotel after disembarkation from MSC cruise ship. The hotel is under renovation but I could not see anything to bother the guests. I found the Visual restaurant on the 23rd floor the best thing about this hotel. The breakfast quality was also good while enjoying a panoramic view of Barcelona.The train station next to the hotel makes it accessible to anywhere you want.Just if the hotel could make some renovations on the facade of the building it could be without doubt one the best 4-star hotels in Barcelona. Though yet I do suggest it to others.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is undergoing renovations (lower floors), so it may look closed from the street, but it is not.Prices are moderate, the rooms are really clean and more than adequate. Good beds. Hotel wifi is actually quite fast (no kidding, REALLY!)The staff is surprisingly friendly. I have to be in Barcelona for business quite often, tried different hotels, but this is the one I’m sticking with.Breakfast is often a disappointment, but not here! And... the VIEWS! Having breakfast at the top floor (23) with Barcelona at your feet is an incomparable way to start your day!Fully recommended!
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel after reading other reviews. Given that I am not a small person, and have traveled through much of Europe, room size was a major consideration. The location was surprisingly convenient, right next to a major train station and also right next to the on and off bus (especially if you are a tourist). The hotel was more than we expected, the rooms were beautiful, the views were amazing and the room was the largest I have stayed in (in Europe). The staff spoke very good English and were extremely helpful. The only negative was that the ice machines did not work, so we had to call room service for ice, otherwise I considered this a perfect visit.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a great location right across the street from the metro and RENFE SANS train station. We arrived from Madrid and were literally next to the hotel. The front desk gave us a very warm welcoming and accommodated us on a high floor to enjoy the beautiful city of Barcelona. We walked that night to the magical water fountain, which was an astonishing spectacle. The metro blue line right across the hotel will take you to La Sagrada Familia. This hotel is currently four stars and it’s being remodeled to become a five star hotel. I honestly thought it was already five stars. High ceilings, spacious room, extensive variety of cable tv channels, marble floors throughout the room and a separate shower and tub makes this place a truly remarkable hotel. I went during high season and found it to be reasonably priced for it’s high quality and location. I totally recommend this hotel. There is a pay laundromat like two blocks away. The locals are super friendly too. Oh BTW the room was always super clean. We stayed four nights with my teenage son and he slept comfortably on the extra mattress.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Gran Torre Catalunya Hotel (GTC) for one night on the 13 April 2018. The decision to book the hotel was made due to two previous stays there: the first time in June 2010 for one night, the second time for in May 2011 for 5 nights (see my TripAdvisor review dated 21 September 2011).The purpose of this trip was to see Roger Waters at the Palau Sant Jordi Arena. My first stay at the GTC in 2010 was to the see Aerosmith at the same venue.I was as delighted with my experience stay in the hotel in 2018, as I was in 2011 and 2010.The RoomI booked a Comfort Double Room through Agoda.com. In 2011, I opted for a Suite (with an adjoining lounge), which I would encourage you to do if you are staying for multiple nights and have the budget to match. For one night the Comfort Double sufficed. The primary difference was the size of the room, but the quality of the room and the (marble) bathroom were exactly the same. As before, the housekeeping staff maintained the room to an exemplary standard when it came to cleanliness.The Common AreasBeing a somewhat aged 4 Star hotel, the GTC does suffer from the passage of time, with the interior’s aesthetic appearance resting comfortably in “dated” territory. However, this is adequately compensated for by staff ensuring all the common areas are kept to a 5 Star standard of cleanliness.The official hotel website confirms that during 2018, the hotel will be in the process of moving towards its complete transformation into the new, unique Nobu Hotel Barcelona. So, the GTC’s owners, the Selenta Group have thankfully seen the need for an extensive refurbishment, which can only bode well for 2019 onwards.The StaffTo find the staff displaying the same warm cordiality, with their firm commitment to enthusiastic and knowledgeable customer service on stay number three was both refreshing and laudable. It is no mean feat to achieve that level of optimal service quality over an eight-year period.The RestaurantThe Restaurante Visual and Bar Lounge on the 23rd floor of the GTC are undoubtably the jewel in its crown. The Visual is apparently the highest 360° roof lounge restaurant in Barcelona. On a clear day, the panoramic views of Barcelona are breath-taking and add a uniquely special ambience to the breakfast or evening dining experience.Due to flight time constraints, I was not able to take dinner on this trip, but the Concierge came up trumps with recommendation of the La Tagliatella Italian pizzeria restaurant at Arenas de Barcelona shopping complex a few blocks walk away, on the Gran Via de les Corts Catalanes. I will write a separate TripAdvisor review for this.The Restaurante Visual buffet breakfast continued to be a veritable treasure trove of choice and exceptionally good value. The cold and hot menu is equally suitable for vegetarians (I am) and meat-eaters alike. Upon finishing breakfast, I have always left Visual sated and ready to embark on the day’s adventures, so much so that I usually skip lunch and use the gained time to enjoy the city even more. The LocationUpon disembarking from your flight at El Prat International Airport, you have a mere 30-minute train to Sants Train Station. And if that was not enough of a bonus, the icing on the cake is the two-minute walk across the Plaça dels Països Catalans to the GTC.If you want to chill out in a park during after breakfast or lunch, there are two lovely parks in the neighbourhood: the Parc de l'Espanya Industrial at the side of the hotel and the Parc de Joan Miró a 5 to 10-minute walk away.If a music concert or sporting event at the Palau Sant Jordi Arena or the Estadi Olímpic Lluís Companys (where the 1992 Olympics were held) are on your schedule then, the GTC is a perfect place to stay. The hotel is walking distance of the Pl. Espanya, at the foot of Parc de Montjuïc, where these venues are situated.The Parc de Montjuïc has myriad other sights for visitors to relish: Fundació Joan Miró (Modern Art Museum), the Torre de Comunicacions de Montjuïc, the Museu d'Arqueologia de Catalunya, Jardí Botànic Històric, Park Jardins de Joan Brossa, Jardines de Laribal, Castell de Montjuïc (a 17th-century fortress and military museum). On the other side of the hill you can find, the Jardins de Mossèn Jacinto Verdaguer, the Park Jardins de Joan Brossa and the Jardins Mossèn Costa i Llobera (Botanical Gardens). There is a cable car that you can take from Montjuïc to the Puerto de Barcelona (Port), where there is a fantastic Aquarium.Thus, you can easily spend two days in the GTC part of the city and not get bored.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We love to come back to this hotel because it boasts some of the largest rooms for its price. Floor-to-ceiling windows mean you have lots of natural light and great city views too. For us this time it was also very convenient to have the main train station (and metro station too) right next door, as it allowed us to move around and do our chores in the city much faster. Staff is professional and attentive. Rooms are large, clean and well appointed. Although the city itself didn't feel as clean and welcoming as we had remembered it, the Grand Hotel Torre Catalunya provided the little oasis we needed. For our next trip to Barcelona, we will once again consider this hotel at the top of our list.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms were quite large, considering the price, and as we were on the 14th floor, we had a good view. We didn't try the restaurant, but the restaurant on the top floor appears to have nice views. The rooms were adequately equipped but given that the hotel rates itself as a four-star hotel, lack of amenities such as a coffee machine and room slippers was a bit disappointing. Same with the hotel lobby--clean and adequate, but not exactly four-star. The location of the hotel is fine--not within walking distance of tourist attractions, but all within a short taxi ride (less than 10 Euros), so no problem. It's a good value for the price and I would not hesitate to return here but to me, the hotel should be rated three-stars rather than four. But that's not a big deal. One issue we had was that there appears to be an amusement park or a roller-coaster ride close to this hotel. On Saturday night, the roller coaster was still operating when I went to bed after 1AM, and the sound of the roller coaster and the people screaming was annoying. This did not appear to be a problem on nights other than Saturday, so not sure what the deal was.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent a lovely week here last month and found it to be wonderful. The staff were especially friendly, courteous and responsive. We took one of the family suites which was very spacious and offered a terrific view.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros: location, great staff, room size and the views and WiFi.Cons: it feels a bit outdated and I think it is being renovated currently. So the gym is closed:-( and two top floors are going through renovations.The price of the breakfast buffet is too much! 22 euros?! It should be half of the price.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very nice, and has great spacious rooms, but it´s too far away from the center of the city.As mentioned in other reviews the center of Barcelona is far away.... the neighborhoodwas not so clean, and there was building work done at the time of our arrival.Although this hotel is very nice, and the rooms very spacious, I suggest something closer to the center of the city...
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: On arrival to the hotel, the outside was a bit daunting as they are undergoing renovations, which cannot be helped. Inside the hotel is beautiful, spacious rooms and wonderful views. We were on floor 11! Bathrooms are a great size and room was kept very clean. Restaurant on top floor is very large, we didn’t eat here as the choice of menu wasn’t to our taste and was quite pricy. The reviews are right in saying that this hotel is very close to Sants station. I didn’t find the metro system so easy to work, got on the wrong metro 3 times in the one week. Also, this hotel is a 40 minute walk to La Rambla, so if you’re hoping to enjoy a nice meal down that way it is a long walk back! Unfortunately the full week we were in Barcelona the taxi’s were on strike which was an inconvenience when staying in this hotel, as at night time I didn’t feel comfortable taking the metro at all, therefore it was difficult to go down La Rambla for a meal and drinks as you were limited as to how you got back to the hotel. Bar’s near this hotel also close at midnight and restaurants near this hotel are limited(or maybe we just couldn’t find any).
