This hotel was beautiful, but not as close to the centre as I would have liked, which is not the hotel’s fault what so ever I just thought I would make people aware! I would recommend this hotel for people on business trips or looking for a quiet holiday. Service from staff was also great and they were very friendly.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our hotel was booked months ago and we wanted an indoor pool, just in case our youngest child fancied a dip after a long day seeing the sights. When we arrived we found major building work being carried out and informed they didn't have a pool, but its still on the website. Other than this we found the hotel to be very good. Our room was large and we had great views of the city. Breakfast being served on the 23rd floor was another highlight, each morning great views whilst enjoying a very good breakfast. Service was excellent both in dining room and on reception. Being so near to main train station was the reason we selected this hotel, and yes would definately go back, will be pretty smart when all alterations are completed.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Reservation made over proximity to Sants Terminal and the Barcelona's views. It was our 32 wedding anniversary celebration and on arrival we were upgrade to the 18 floor and a welcome drink waiting for us in the room,a beautiful gesture from the hotel staff. Very comfortable rooms with a gorgeous bathroom suite. We were surprised by the fact that there was not pool, but soon realized that might have been due to renovations going on. The staff is exceptional, very helpful and knowledgeable about anything goin on in Barcelona
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not the fault of the hotel but they’re undergoing major renovations and this impacts the enjoyment of the hotel no matter how hard the staff try to please - and they’re super helpful as a rule. No pool. No reception area etc etc. price is pretty similar to what I paid when it was all in top condition so I was left a little underwhelmed. On the upside I had a great room - very large with a great bathroom suite. Wifi is super fast. Breakfast is great and service excellent across the board. Bit of an ugly duckling building but if you like business class reliable hassle free hotels like me then still worth considering notwithstanding the reno. But make sure you get a room high up in the building.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 9 nights at the Gran Torre. We had a bit of a rough first night, the mattress we slept in was defective. We brought this up to the staff the next morning and they immediately responded, moving us to an even bigger, better room (when all we wanted was a new mattress!)The staff was always helpful with any and all of our queries, I want to give a big shout out to Jesus and Agnes at the front desk -- top performers these two. Excellent people. As for the other stuff, hotel is perfectly situated. Close to the Sants train and metro stations. Good enough distance to walk to the city centre. Some nice places to eat nearby too. Again, very much recommend this hotel!- Marco
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has it all, located next to a main train station for easy access to the airport and Metro lines. A short walk to the magic fountain and great restaurants/ bars nearby. We had a room on the 17th floor and the view we had everyday was just such a treat. We didn't have breakfast or dinner at the hotel but the view is even better from the floor of the restaurant.The Expo hotel next door has an outdoor roof bar which we visited daily.We ate at the Arena shopping centre a 15 min walk away a couple of times, the restaurants are located on the top of the centre which give you great views and we recommend Quinto Quinta.The bedrooms are huge and very comfortable, only downside is lack of available tv channels apart from BBC World news and no coffee/tea facilities in the room but that I could live without when you have the whole of Barcelona to explore. The aircon was excellent which was much needed after walking around in 30c and above temperatures.Finally, the staff were brilliant, always friendly, helpful and cheery.We stayed there whilst there were renovations going on to the spa area but this didn't create any issues with noise or inconvenience. We will definitely be staying again.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is ideal if like me you were arriving for an early AVE train the next morning. Its only hundred metres at most to Barcelona Sants station. However there are still lots of cafe's around for a relaxing drink in the sun and some pinchos. The room was large, effective air conditioning (thankfully) and a good sized bathroom with lots of countertop. My room was on the 21st floor and had a great view of the city, the windows were huge so it was nice to watch the city lights from my bed without closing the curtains.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this hotel mainly due to its proximity to Barcelona Sants Station. But to our sirprise found the hotel to be having large rooms. Our room had a panaromic view of the city and the hills. The old Royal palace turned iiti museum now is rlight in the middle of this view with montains in the background. The roof top restaurant in the 23 rd floor has a 360 degree view of the city. The food is delicious in the restaurant. The hotel staff is wuite friendly and helped us a lot in planning our visits to the city. Overall it was a great experience and would recommend everyone to try this hotel.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot say enough about this hotel!! Barcelona is my most favorite city thus far in Spain! My second time in Barcelona for my birthday March 2018 It's been must the last 2 years for me.This time I wanted to stay near the city centre and everything walking I needed within walking distance. I was excited when I booked my stay here and even more excited when I seen it in person! Unbelievable gorgeous views. I had the superior double room (suite). Rooms comes with Robes and slippers.The room was perfect. I was able to capture the sunsets and sunrises. The service was superb and all the guest service attendants were absolutely the best and so very helpful. They made my birthday very special. I can't thank everyone enough. I received a cupcake and champagne! I was all smiles the entire stay. Front desk offered suggestions where to go for anything I wanted to do or go. I walked everywhere as most restaurants were in walking distance, stores, sites I wanted to see. I started off early in the morning with great breakfast from the top floor with a panoramic view that is to die for to get me going. Alot of selections to choose to your liking. I loved that Fresh juice was served. The servers were awesome there as well. I did not get the chance to use most of the amenities like the spa, pool, and bar..because I was mostly out adventuring outside. This hotel would definitely likely be my 1st choice when I visit Barcelona. I just hope the pricing stays moderate as I know the more popular the hotel will become.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice large hotel with spacious rooms in Barcelona. The buffet breakfast has many offerings including an egg station, fresh fruit, bacon, ham, cheese, yogurt, cereal, breads, and pastries. There's also a restaurant but we didn't eat there because there were other restaurants nearby. There is a nice park adjacent to the hotel and the underground is about one block away from the hotel. The underground in Barcelona is very easy to use.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently booked this hotel for a weekend away for my partners birthday.Having read the reviews and seen the photos I had high expectations of this hotel.Upon arriving check in was quick and seamless. Receptionist were warm and welcoming.We then headed to our room. The room at 1st appearances seemed just as lovely as the photos..spacious and bright.I however then went to the bathroom where my review turns sour.I noted that there were a number of "pubic hairs" on the toilet and bath!!I called reception straight away and someone was sent up and confirmed my findings.We were then taken to a further THREE!!! rooms were again hairs were found around the toilet. These were obviously not cleaned with a meticulous eye!Never have I stayed in a hotel where i have had to ask to be moved due to cleanliness and this being a 4* hotel i expected more.After being in the hotel for an hour we were finally moved to an upgraded room which they cleaned before sending us up.Inma Rodriguez was very helpful during this time however it should have never happened!After an annoying start to our weekend the room was lovely and the hotel was in a great location!Also to note that the gym and spa was closed due to renovations which meant my partner had to seek alternative places to work out at extra cost to us. Although it does state it is closed on the website reception staff say it closed 1 month ago..not helpful as we had booked just over 1 month ago.Would recommend on location but personally wouldn't stay here again in fear of the cleanliness of the hotel.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I chose the hotel as I was in BCN to see Guns n Roses at the Olympic Stadium, and also to get the train to explore the towns around the city.The location was perfect to achieve my goals. The stadium is a 20 minute walk, and the train station is within 2 minutes.The hotel itself is large, bright, and with good amenities. I didn't go to the gym as I usually would instead running to the beach. My room, 1419, was large with dual aspect views. The shower was separate from the bath and huge. Overall the room was superb.The staff were polite, efficient, and helpful all the way from checkin, left luggage, and the bar. It is the bar that is the only real let down. Unfortunately it lacked any atmosphere.All in, a superb hotel in a great location should you wish to explore.
hotelName:
11    Gran Hotel Torre Catalunya
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was really helpful and warm. They arranged the room for me prior to check in hour on my demand when booking so it would arrange my early arrival. Everything was made so my stay was smooth and nice.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was great. Good location next to a 24/7 convenient store where you can buy 1.5 L water for .70 Euros. Some good tapas places near the hotel. Really easy to get to and from airport with the bus line.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this hotel. Good location in a quiet neighbourhood away from the hustle and bustle but still close enough to all the spots you want to see when visiting Barcelona. Public transport links close by and taxis aplenty. Friendly staff. Our room was comfortable and the bed was amazing. It might only be a ‘2 star’ hotel but we enjoyed our stay just as much as we have in other more ‘luxury’ places. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel within a walking distance from Catalunya square and Sagrada Familia.The rooms are clean.Staff is polite and willing to help in case it's needed.Haven't tried the food, but the breakfast is 9 euros/person.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For the price, there's very little to not like about this Hotel. The location is a 10 minute from the Sagrada Familia and about 30 minutes to La Rambla, everything is easily accessible and its surprisingly easy to navigate your way around the city with the grid like design it has. There is a 24 hour supermarket 1 minute walk away where you can buy essentials and a few local restaurants around which were nice and good value Hotel staff very friendly and happy to give recommendations of places to eat, things to see and even flag down taxis for you.The rooms are adequate with nice bathroom facilities.All in all i think it represents good value for money.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really great hotel, it was fantastic for a 2 star, I personally felt it was more of a 3 star. Really friendly staff that would always say hello and smile. Spotlessly clean, great sized rooms, delicious breakfast. 30 min walk into the centre good location, metro station a 5 minute walk.We accidentally flooded the bathroom on day one of our stay and the staff were very understanding and helpful, additionally always available to help with directions. Would stay again on a trip to Barcelona. Thank you!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel had a very thorough check-in process. Just after booking, I received a few instruction and information emails, and even an option to book transportation direct from the airport. They also requested confirmation of arrival times and if any special needs were required, etc. I really appreciated this. A day or two before my arrival date, I again received a follow-up email confirming that nothing had changed.The staff here was just lovely and everyone was very helpful with the exception of one female staff member (maybe she was just having a bad week?) who we eventually just avoided asking for help at all, and that solved that! Our room was cleaned daily and we never had to request fresh towels or linens. For two travelers, there was ample space - keep in mind that the rooms all over Europe are often much smaller than what many are accustomed to. We never turned on the tv, but there was one in the room, along with a safe and a writing desk and chair. The beds were stiff but comfortable. My only complaint is that the walls were very thin and even thinner from the bathroom! In fact, we could hear our neighbors very clearly, when we stepped into the bathroom.The location is good for the price. You'll find you're about a 8-10 minute walk from both the Sagrada Familia and the Arc de Triomphe. For those that have purchased the double decker bus tickets or metro pass, you can find stations at both of these attractions. The major train station is only about a 6 minute walk away as well. To get to Casa Mila or Casa Batllo, it's about a 25 minute walk. Montjuic/ Magic Fountain, about 55 minutes. I took a walk to the bunkers one morning, and even at a pretty quick pace, it took me about 45 minutes. But this city is spread out and you'll need to expect to do some walking no matter what. Plus, you'll want to get in some extra activity after eating all of those tapas!For the frugal traveler who's always looking for a deal, like myself, this place was perfect. It was a decent location with good accommodations and enough space for 2 people comfortably. There are small markets just right across the street, for water, snacks & essentials. The ease of public transportation was also a big plus.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great Location and friendly staff. 8 min walk to Sagrada Familia. The Room is comfortable and clean. we were there in Mar, so the evening is still a bit cold, the Room was warm and shower facility was good, Disabled friendly.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was nice, centrally located near great tapas bars and la Sagrada Familia. Price was decent, was misinformed about the breakfast though, it is not free so I suggest you eat somewhere else. Overall it was very clean and the staff was accommodating.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Comfortable and inexpensive accommodation near the city centre. Room had heating and air conditioning and shampoo, soaps provided. Bed was comfortable and the hotel very clean. We didn’t try their breakfast. Staff helpful and friendly. Will come back for a return visit.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a pleasant, satisfying stay here. Nothing fancy, just plain and simple decent service. Exactly what you would expect for a mid-level (3-4 star) hotel. Practical. Not cheap, not expensive. Not exactly in the hectic city center, but close enough to be convenient. Very near one metro station...it was easy for me to explore the city by foot or by train. Nice and helpful guys at the front desk. Everything works in the rooms. No fancy features but that will encourage you to get out and see this beautiful city !
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was a bit out of the way for me but it had more reasonable prices. I received a very large room, which was very practical but not fancy. Breakfast could be a bit more varied. All in all, no complaints.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I got bargain tickets with ryanair for a weekend in Barcelona, booked this cheap hotel when I got the flights.Location is good - central and close to bus and train links.Hotel room was ok, clean and as good as it gets for the price.Helpful staff, no problems explaining where we needed to go.Barcelona was very hot, but we really liked it, especially the tapas bars.Recommended for trips like ours.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location Near to Sagrada FamiliaNear to Arc de Triumph 2 bus stations and 1 metro station Helpful and friendly stuff Many restaurants and supermarket are available around Little bit expensive for value Major comments:No refrigerator No kettle Minor comment:No balcony
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Was so pleasantly surprised how good this hotel was for the price. Spotlessly clean and the staff were just marvellous and couldn't enough for us. Fairly central and very close to Sagrada Familia. Would definitely go back there.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 2 min walk to monumental station and 15 to 20 min walk to sagra familia . Big supermarket and one fruit store and plenty restaurant near that - the best thing was its staff- the man I think was the chief staff help me to change my 500 euros because at barcelona you cant spent that. Our tripple room was strange ! Two separate small room one of with twin bed and another with single bed approperiat for families with snorring dad !! What a pitty rooms had not refrigerator or kettle but had safety digital box - the breakfast was very good for 2 star hotel and had fresh fruits .only dis advantage was at night when you want to sleep . The noise of other rooms annoying . Generally that was memorable. Thank you HOTEL ACTA ANTIBES****
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is great, just a few minutes from the subway. The staf is great and very helpful. Price is reasonable (yet considering the quality of stay, it could be lower). Now the cons: The breakfast selection is ad, wifi connection is problemmatic in the rooms. The rooms are outfashioned. Cleaniness of the rooms is not good (especially the bathroom). The worst thing is that the room door has no isolation. You can literally hear everything and everyone in the aisle: People walking, talking, laughing and so on. This is soooo disturbing at night and in the early morning. The hotel management must definitely do something on this.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very conveniently situated - only 15 mins walk from La Sagrada Familia & 20 mins walk from Plaça de Catalunya (the main city square). There's a 24h supermarket two doors down the street, and a metro station (Monumental) only 2 blocks away (less than 5 mins walk) which will take you downtown or up to La Sagrada Familia. The staff at the hotel were amazing (especially Eduardo) and the breakfast had plenty of choice and was regularly topped up. The room was small, but was clean & tidy. Unfortunately, the window of our room had no view at all (other than a brick wall and a fire exit), so very little light got into the room, but this wasn't of much concern as the room is only for sleeping in - not for sitting looking out the window all day. The beds were comfortable and clean, the aircon was good, there was a wardrobe and a safe. The bathroom was very very compact but had a sink, a bidet, a toilet, and a bath with a good shower in it. The only thing that would have been a nice extra would have been a small fridge to store drinks in, as it was quite warm and being able to keep drinks cold would have been good.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a great find. It is about a 20 minute walk to Placa Cataluyna but there is also a metro station close by. It doesn't look anything special from the outside, but don't let that put you off. The staff are friendly and helpful. The rooms are large, quiet, comfortable and really well equipped. Best wifi I had in the three weeks in Barcelona. They have all the little extras that make you feel at home. Great wardrobe with full length mirrors (necessity for females), comfortable bed, TV had lots of english speaking channels. Great desk, safe and the bathroom was lovely and big too. I cannot believe that this is only a two star hotel. I am coming back to Barcelona and will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was so impressed with this hotel! Yes, the rooms are smallish, and the bathrooms are very small, but everything was clean and well-presented. Despite having a room at the front, overlooking the street, the double windows kept out the noise and my sleep wasn't disturbed by traffic at all. The only disturbance was from people using the lift, so I'd recommend requesting a room away from that area.The very best thing about Acta Antibes was the friendliness of the reception staff. Without exception, I found them extremely accommodating, welcoming, and helpful, with advice about using public transport, finding places to eat, and general information.The location is great! The closest metro station is only a very short walk away, and a local bus stop is also close for an alternate way to get around. It's in a walkable and safe area, which is very important to me, being an older solo traveller.Breakfast is nothing special, but it's more than adequate and a reasonable cost for Barcelona standards.Yes, it's only a 2 star hotel but it presents as well above that. I've stayed in 3 star places that weren't as good. If I head back to Barcelona, this will definitely be the place for me.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good & Clean room, good noise-proofgood location, only few minutes walk to the metro station which leads to the major transportation hub Passeig de Gracia and the city center , one station away from the famous impressive one-and-only Sagrada Familia!Quiet area but safe, good & reasonably- priced local cafes and restaurants in the local neighbourhood Very helpful and understanding staff who take time to help guests book tickets, give advice on transportation, to tourist attractions, share good tips on visiting the gorgeous city of Barcelona, Flexible and kind to accept my early check in given the circumstance of my arrival I really enjoyed lovely chats with the knowledgeable hotel receptionists at Acta Antibes , about the attractions, the city, and the Political crisis that is gong on , All and all, such n enjoyable experience I had with both the places and people in Barcelona which I sincerely wish to still remain unchanged next time I come back.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is really well located, close to the metro stop. The staff was friendly and helpful, rooms and bathrooms are small but clean and houskeeping came everyday. In my opinion, for 2* we really got something good. Only things why I didn't give 5 points, that the walls are really thin, you can hear every single world from the neighbours, and the breakfast(optional 9 euro/person) didn't include any vegetables. Anyway everything was ok, we were satisfied choosing Acta Antibes.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good value basic accommodation and breakfast. The outstanding feature of this hotel is that the staff are exceptionally helpful and friendly, going way beyond the call of duty to be of assistance. The locality is very close to the Gaudi's Sagrada Familia temple and is also close to Barcelona's exceptional metro system. In the locality there are several good local restaurants, both Spanish and international cuisine. Not the fault of the hotel, but Barcelona, and particularly the metro system and metro stations are notorious for pick-pockets, and I was a victim on the first day. Hotel staff were very helpful in helping me to notify the police (not that they were able to do much except provide me with a form to use in activating my holiday insurance).
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was friendly, accommodating, and helpful in answering our questions. The location was perfect for walking to all of the destinations that we wanted to see each day, and the room was exactly what we needed for our stay. We would come back and stay again!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Extremely well located, it has a subway station 1,5 blocks away and in path to the subway there is a good "Panaderia" for your breakfasts! Addittionally, it is 13 min walking to Cathedral Sagrada Familia!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a good room with king size bed which was very comfortable. Reception staff were very friendly and remembered our room numbers every time. Great places to eat near the hotel and it was a good walk to La Rambla and the gothic quarter.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked a double room at the end of the high season and were therefore focused on avoiding the rip-off prices of other hotels in touristic areas.Acta Antibes is a 2-star establishment and one cannot expect the level of service and lost of amenities of a 4-star, but the basic requirements were met: clean room, bedsheets and bathroom, free wifi and friendly staff. The breakfast buffet was a bit limited in choice and its price was not included in the room. I found that it deserved to be, all things considered.The hotel location is not exceptional, but we already knew our way around in the city, so it was a minor inconvenience.For the purpose of our trip, Acta Antibes did the job, but it may not have all the frills regular tourists look for.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Air conditioner could have been a little colder but the room was fine. We could check in early after our long flight which we greatly appreciated. It was clean and quiet. The metro was a short walk away. We didn't have breakfast.. there was a cheaper cafe down the street for pastry and coffee,
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed my stay at Acta Antibes. The location made it easy to get around to the rest of the city; just 2 blocks from the Metro station and 4 blocks from La Sagrada Familia. The staff was wonderful and were a great help!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A clean but basic hotel in a quiet neighborhood. Hotel Acta Antibes is reasonably priced, the accommodation for our family of 4 consisted of 2 comfortable rooms with good air conditioning, there are two beds at each of the room, and a bathroom within the unit. Great location for visiting Sagrada Familia, and short taxi rides to Park Guell and Magic Fountain. We were also able to walk to Avinguda Diagonal area to visit La Pedrera and Casa Batllo. A 24 hour supermarket is around the corner of the hotel.We will consider staying here again should we come back to Barcelona in the future.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a fab stay we had in this hotel!!! A smart looking hotel from the outside, amazing air con as you walk through the door from the heatwave outside. Better yet you walk in to some polite and friendly staff.Amazing location, just 2 min walk from metro station, 10 mins from Sagrada Familia and around 25 mins to La Rambla.We had booked this through booking.com and could cancel for free up until the day before and pay at the property. We didn't need to cancel. The staff couldn't do more for us. The room was clean, comfy and was quiet - couldn't hear much from outside. Great shower, clean bathroom and we had our room cleaned/made each day.Better yet, we had a safe in our room - which they didn't charge for!!!Thank you to all the team for a fab stay!!!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've visited during the MWC confrence but even taking that into account, chatging the price the hotel charged was shameful.Other than the nice location near the segrada familia and the truly pleasent staff, the hotel is not a reccomended experience.Rooms are tiny, built in a way that makes them extra uncomfortable, lacking in some basic elements you'd expact, not even a kettle.It looks, feels and is old, as if time froze in the early 80s, and breakfast tastes as if it was made then.Too bad - nice team and in hotel that leaves much to br desired.Eoukd only reccomend if the price was VERY low, and in MWC it was not.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for 5 days at the end of June and thought the hotel was brilliant! The rooms were comfortable and cleaned thoroughly everyday! Didn't get a chance to have breakfast there but overall stay was fab
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean hotel in a really good location, 10/15 minute walk to Sagrada Famila and metro station. Reception staff super nice & helpful. Didn't try breakfast as it seemed a little expensive for what it was but good options in the neighborhood. Only thing missing in the hotel is a small bar, the breakfast area could be a bar in the evenings.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Most importantly, The Antibe is clean, very close to the metro in a nice quiet safe neighbourhood within a close proximity to everything. The front desk staff and house keeping were amazing, the wifi was so-so in my room but perfect in the breakfast area and reception. Their breakfast was adequate. I ate at three nearby amazing neighbourhood restaurants: Portoles, Nogal, and Vic Braseria. This Canadian will be back and would happily recommend the Antibe to my family and friends.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good hotel, nice rooms and a good service. Hotel is located near to the Sagrada Familia and also a metro station with excellent connenctions al over Barcelona. The neighbourhood is quiet and calm. Lot of small restaurants are near.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great little hotel in good location to sightseeing. I booked a twin room for me and my daughter. We got a suite, 2 bedrooms and bathroom. Very clean rooms and beds, air con or heating. Friendly reception staff and free maps were very helpful. Vending machine in dining area. We didn't get breakfast as we preferred pastries from cafes which were to die for. Restaurants 5 minutes away and supermarkets, cafe, bars. 5 minutes walk to metro station and bus stops. Can walk to Sagrada Familia easily.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room although small was well designed. Enough space to unpack. Bed was very comfortable, air conditioning worked immediately, and the shower, although it did not have a strong pressure, worked well. The room's have been updated and are well kept. Elevator worked well. Front desk was always helpful and provided a power adapter for my wife's hair straightener. The hallways have not been updated which can be off putting when you arrive but don't fret. Our room had no view but there was no street noise. The walls were a bit thin and you could hear the shower running from next door but we never heard voices. It was a 10-15 minute walk to the older section of town as well as to the newer restaurants in the quarter of Eixample. We grabbed coffee from the numerous cafes surrounding the hotel. There were many small grocery stores nearby as well. Recommendation; bring your own soap or body wash. The size of the soap bar was hilariously small.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for access to the bus station as we were over for the grand Prix .it was five minutes walk to the bus station and 3 minute walk to get the bus to the beach the hotel is very central for what we required the staff were very helpful and pleasant,our double room was actually a double and a single with the window facing out onto the street ,the breakfast was fine saved us from going looking for breakfast, we had pizza in lucanos just around the corner and another evening up to a kebab place called monumental both places inexpensive and tasty . the only negatives for us was no TV all 71 channels were in foreign language and as a smoker no place to go for a cigarette just out the front door onto the street ,it would be nice if there was a seat outside to watch the world go by
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quiet but small room,breakfast always same,hey we need vegetables.tomatoes etc.friendly reception,view back yard not so nice.small hotel who need center location,ideal walks.around or rent bike or scooter.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at ACTA ANTIBES 3 nights pre cruise from April 28th-may 1st.(-4 couples). Rooms are clean and neat. bathroom has a bathtub and all toileteries. Towels are changed every day.breakfast is very good and above all ,I must point out the outstandingly patient and helpful staff.Returning from our cruise ,we had a late flight , so we asked whether we could leave our luggage at the hotel for the whole day and pick it up before the flight-they agreed and were very helpful with 10 pieces of lugggage.(at no cost)The location is also very good.i highly recommend this hotel
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at Acta Antibes. The staff spoke English, the metro was 3 minutes walk and the neighborhood had lots of pastry shops and restaurants. Sagrada Familia was about a 10-15 walk. Great value with big room, just basic and clean.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff are all welcoming, friendly and helpful. The rooms are basic but clean and comfortable. The hotel is perfect for a city break and is in a good location for the metro and within walking distance of several of the attractions - Sagrada Familia and La Predrera. The breakfast was good value and there was a good range of continental breakfast selections.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel exceeded my expectations for a 2 star hotel. It was very clean and the rooms were spacious and comfortable beds. It is centrally located, within walking distance to most city attractions. I highly recommend this hotel for travelers on a budget.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not far from the Center of the city, connected very well with subway and pedestrian and biking infrastructure to all landmarks. Very pleasant stuff, and decent food.In quiet area, so you can rest well after all day exploring Barsa.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 2 night stay whilst visiting Barcelona. Great location and very close to Monumental metro station and within walking distance of Segrada Famillia. Hotel very clean but basic. Comfortable rooms with air conditioning. No tea/coffee facilities but vending machine available. Optional breakfast but we ate out in the many nearby cafes. Very friendly reception staff who were so helpful and knowledgeable about the amazing city. Would thoroughly recommend this central value for money hotel for a short break and would definitely return.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very nice and clean room! Too close to Sagrada Familia and to metro station "Monumental", this hotel is a good choise. Don' t expect a very big room with outstading view, but is always clean and tidy, with hot water and a helpful staff. Also, has a 24hour s/m next to it!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Me and my husband stayed here for 3 nights, room was quiet small for our standard but it was very clean and quiet . Housekeeping everyday. No coffee/tea maker, no minibar inside the room. We asked for a couple of slippers but they don't provide this kind of amenities. Soap and shampoos amenities could be better,poor quality. Really disappointing. Staff from the reception were all helpful. We left our luggage in the reception upon check out, beacause we had our flight in the afternoon. Wifi connection worked fast all the time in all areas! We didn't get the breakfast in the hotel, but there were lots of cafferterias around the area, and supermarkets just in the corner open 24h.Metro station just 5minutes walking, sagrada familia 15minutes walking. You can also go to the Gran via it is a main road close to the hotel where you can catch a bus (H12) to reach other main spots. Because taking metro wasted more of our time going up and down the stairs to change lines. Overall it was a good stay ,I reccomend this hotel for its cleanliness and its location. We'll surely be back in Acta Antibes!
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel -- 2stars doesn't do it justice.Good, well-appointed room, extremely comfortable beds, very good bathroom, everything very clean.Continental breakfast buffet ample, as much as you want to eat. Everything continually refreshed, tables immediately cleared and cleaned.Small lounge with snack machines always available.Reception manned 24 hours -- exceptionally helpful staff.Reliable free WiFi in rooms.Location ideal -- easy walking distance (10-15 mins) to La Sagrada Familia, which also has stops for the open-top, hop-on-hop-off tourist buses (an absolute must !)Longer walk (25mins) to Passeig de Gracia and Casa Batllo, etc. Also near metro station. Various Tapas Bars and Restaurants nearby.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent friendly helpful staff. My wife chose this hotel because she read good reviews about it,and it was in our price range. We were not disappointed, our room was clean , modern and sufficient. We stayed on a bed and breakfast basis and everything matched our expectations. The hotel is in a good position for exploring Barcelona,as it is close to the Metro. We would have no hesitation about staying in this hotel again.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: At the beginning we weren't sure about our choice. I do not trust 2 or 1 star hotels. But the room was big and very clean.Stuff was very friendly and helpful. It's location was great. I definitely recommend this hotel for your trips.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a Clean room, clean hotel, nice location. Breakfast was also good. I am glad I chose this hotel because I had privacy as opposed to staying in a hostel. Highly recommended. The front desk staff is very helpful and always available.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location walk to centre or take the bus, Close to many centre attractions.The staff on reception were very helpful with directions and gave street maps and information. Room was well presented clean and bathroom small but provided with toiletries, shampoo, soap nice soft towels. Room was rather hot. The air con was off understandable as its winter but it was too warm even with the radiator off so simple open the window. Good breakfast well laid out and good variety. The Metro is ok but at some stations if you have to change lines its can be a bit of a walk under ground to the next platform. Went over to the Yuste Bar opposite in the evening for nightcap two whiskey's 13 Euro. Wow don't look at a price list first. Go to the right out of hotel end of the block Locano two whiskey's 7.50 Euros. Recommend food here as well.
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, room clean and nice (shower maybe a bit small but for a week-end it's ok), Nice people at the reception, competent, ready to help and understand. 24h reception, car park, everything to make your life easier.It was a really nice moment in this hotel !Thanks to housekeeping as well, very often forgetten but they are doing a very good job ! For sure we will come back !
hotelName:
12    Hotel Acta Antibes
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 2 min walk to beach, nice facility and breakfast. Staff was very good. Our ocean view window was very dirty limiting our view. I felt the price was a little high in retrospect but would say I was happy with the facility.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 4 nights and every aspect of our stay was fantastic. All the staff were friendly and professional and us feel very welcome. A special mention to Judith and Bianca for going the extra mile for us to feel comfortable. The facilities are excellent from the bedroom to the roof top pool and bar. The breakfast was delightful. We hadn't paid for for breakfast initially but as soon as we saw it on the first morning our minds were made up and ate in every morning. A great location being near to the spectacular beaches. The taxi cabs were right outside the hotel as was the city bus tour route stop. Beds were extremely comfortable. Would recommend and return.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beach is just half an km to this hotel and the space is open in front of this hotel. The bar is open 24 hrs and it is fun to sit outside the hotel. Staff is very good. rooms are good though slightly smaller for two. It must have some bigger room but I have not checked.It also has a nice terrace swimming pool. But we never used it as the beach is very close.Breakfast was also good, however the choice for fruits was limited. The attendant during the break fast and dinner was very nice person.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Appreciated the room upgrade, which included the breakfast buffet with made-to-order eggs. Quiet room with a great view of the beach and sea. Enjoyed the poolside bar. This was our second stay at this property. We'll be back.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is hard to beat. The staff, the pool, the room service are all world-class. The place is immaculate, modern and in a great location. They even brought me cake on my birthday! I will be back.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel directly at the beach. Friendly service and great breakfast. There are also good restaurants directly next to the hotel. The city center can be reached by bus or metro within approximately 30 mins. Unfortunately, very loud during the nights. The hotel should urgently refresh the sealing of the windows.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: staff tried to charge us on several occasions for items we didn’t have, they didn’t seem bothered by this! This happened 4 times during our stay and they tried to get us to pay for items we didn’t have at all! Or we had paid for previously!!!!!!! Our air conditioning didn’t work for the whole of our 5 day stay which was unacceptable, for a 4* hotel. Our room constantly stayed at 30 degrees with no breeze which was way to hot to sleep in and we didn’t sleep well, the only thing we were offered was additional water. George who worked on the pool bar was excellent! Best member of staff at the hotel. The pool area is the nicest part of the hotelWe go to Barcelona frequently and this was not the best place to stay compared to others in the area! The hotel wasn’t cheap and we got offered no compensation for the lack of sleep, This is unacceptable service I’m a 4* hotel not to be offered a refund or move to another hotel as it is a chain and they have other hotels in the area they could of moved us too!
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a few issues. The first room they gave us smelt so badly of smoke we requested to move. The second room we received had big yellow stains on the sheets, and a dip in the fall which caused me to trip. The shower was hard to regulate heat which made for a very uncomfortable shower. We did mention the stained sheets and they offered to move us a again, however we had been travelling for a while and unpacked twice so just requested a sheet change instead. They staff were friendly but they said there wasn’t too much they could do, they did offer us a free buffet breakfast which was nice. However for me, yellow stains on the sheets are not okay with or without a free breakfast
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want to experience both beach and the rest of Barcelona, Great location and allows you to keep to you health and fitness plan with amenities around and nice running trails. And off course swimming at the beach. But also you can jut walk to areas of interest with ease.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this hotel. We stayed here for 4 Nights, it was close to city centre which you could get to by taxi or public transport, but 2mins walking distance to beach and therefore a perfect combination of what I would like from a holiday. The rooms were perfect, the breakfast was amazing, the staff were friendly helpful and went out of their way to help. Will be returning for sure. Thank you to all the staff members
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location for our short city break. We spent a long weekend and got a great mix of spending time by the beach (right by the hotel) and a short bus ride to the city centre - there is a stop outside the hotel which is part of the open top bus tour. There are electric scooters available to hire at reception - 30 mins free and really fun. The pool was smaller than expected from photos but the roof terrace was a great place to chill out - really liked the beanbags available. Only a small mini bar fridge in the room, we managed to squeeze a couple of water bottles in to chill but would have liked bigger. There is a small strip of restaurants outside the hotel that we ate at and a supermarket a short walk away. Overall the hotel was really well presented and the room had a HUGE bed - very comfy!
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we booked it was very clear that it was “adults only” and it’s across the street from the beach so we expected a bit of a party scene. Thursday and Friday very much had a business hotel vibe. The good news is that the hotel is nice and quiet. There just isn’t much to do socially on site.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Occidental Atenea Mar hotel for a couple of nights with my husband and it’s a wonderful hotel located about 10-15 min drive from the centre of Barcelona. At first I was worried that I had booked too far out of the centre but I’m glad I did. We arrived an hour before we were due to check in, but they were happy to give us a room straight away and given the option on arrival of twin beds or a king size. We were located on the 2nd floor, with a sea view and on the same level as the pool. The room was spotless, the bed was massive and incredibly comfortable. In the room was a dressing table and chair, a single sofa style chair next to the window. There was a mini bar fridge, large wardrobe with iron and ironing board. In the bath room was a bath with shower over (1 hand held wall mounted shower and an overhead rain head shower), large mirror over the sink and shaving/ makeup mirror, a bidet and toiletries such as shower gel, shampoo, conditioner, body moisturiser, comb, vanity kit and shower cap, there is also a hairdryer in the bathroom.I read in some reviews that the air conditioning didn’t work, ours worked fine. There is also complimentary Wi-fi throughout the hotel.The pool terrace is really modern with a mix of sun beds, cabanas, bean bags and bar stools. The pool had a jacuzzi section but it’s unheated so a little cool in the beginning of June. There’s a bar serving alcohol and soft drinks along with some cocktails and a bar menu serving sandwiches, pizzas etcWe opted for breakfast which gave a variety of buffet hot breakfast, continental breakfast and pastries. There are cereals, fresh fruit and juices along with self serve tea and coffee. We really enjoyed it and was served from 7am-10am.We only had one drink in the bar but it was nice.All the staff were helpful and welcoming and although not in the centre of Barcelona, we walked along the Promenade to the centre, it took about 50 mins. There is a taxi tank outside the hotel and there is a bus stop across the road, we saw the open top bus pass frequently, for those who don’t want to walk.We chose to get a private taxi back to the airport and it took around 45 mins but the traffic was very heavy and cost €40.If I come back to Barcelona this hotel would be top of my list.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gorgeous hotel smells so beautiful Very comfortable beds Nice staff Roof top bar staff a bit rude and drinks a bit expensive. Very close to nice restaurants and beach Very relaxing stay Receptionist very nice checked us in early
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really enjoyed the hotel. It’s was clean, had all the facilities we wanted and nice personal. It was also not a problem to leave our suitcase after check out to see the city before heading back to the airport. Further it’s a 2 minute walk to the beach, 10 min to the metro and 8 minute walk to Rambla Poblenou.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean and well presented hotelStaff friendly and helpfulNice sunbathing outside bar and pool for cooling downBreakfast was plentifulOnly issue getting shower temp right in room and then slow flow
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I have just returned home from staying at this hotel. Lovely lovely stay from start to finish. We arrived a little early but we were able to leave our bags at reception. We went for a stroll outside, to find a row of about 4/5 restaurants just to the right of the hotel entrance. Sat down and had some sangria and tapas. Beaut. Went back to check in to our room, room lovely, bonus we were right on the front in a superior room with a sea view. You can hear the noise from outside but it’s not unbearable.Hotel is spotless everywhere, can’t fault it, from the room, the lifts and communal areas. Breakfast had a really good choice compared to European standards, this was included in our rate, but would pay for breakfast if it wasn’t.We made use of the sauna - 3 different types, but not the pool. The beach is just over the road so we spent one of ours days there. Location - perfect for the beach and taxi’s into the city centre (La Rambla, Sagrada Família etc) were only around €15. Plenty around. One of the stops for the Barcelona Bus Turistic hop on hop off bus is right by the hotel too, which helps. We bought tickets from reception and got a discount. Would defo recommend this hotel and would absolutely stay again! Thanks to all the friendly and helpful staff too!
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed there and we loved it! The area, the service, breakfast! Closeness to the beach ! The pool!Near the center and shopping mall! You have the bus stop right there and the metro pretty close. Buses are great in Barcelona.The rooms are fantastic! And there is a gym too although you can walk/run on the boardwalk and go as far as the costa brava!A super experience!Tatiana
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was nice but air conditioning did not work and my room was not ready at 4 PM and had to wait over 45 minutes for it. Pool area is quite nice and the view on the beach was pretty nice. Close to a lot of attractions
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Atenea Mar is far from the downtown, but the neighborhood is nice though. The sea shore is very near, if you have the time to stroll on the beach. The nearest subway station is about 10 min away, and a ride costs about 2 euro per person. I had a premium room to begin with but the noise from the motorway was very heavy so I asked for another room facing the backyard. The first room was bigger and the second one quiet so it was an easy choice. The breakfast was good, but in the evening we had to find some other place for dinner since the hotel restaurant was closed. Also the pool was closed which was a bit disappointing.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: With great views from the bedroom, a humongous double bed and continental breakfast, this hotel made our trip to Barcelona a joy. The staff were all exceptionally friendly and helpful and assisted us whenever we needed direction or advice on the best ways to go into the city/travelling/things to do.The breakfast buffet had different fresh fruits every day, with a range of pastries, cereals, breads, meats and cheese, as well as a hot selection which we did not opt for but seemed very popular. The coffee machines served great coffee, and there was a selection of fruit juices too. The pool was freezing (may) and the weather was quite windy during our stay but managed to sunbathe every afternoon on the terrace. The bar is a little pricey but doesn’t break the bank and the sangria is well worth it!the bar staff were all lovely and very helpful, with the drinks and complimentary snack mix brought to our sun beds. The hotel also has 2 saunas and a steam room, as well as a small but well furnished gym. Depending on which lift you take depends whether you have to walk through the underground car park to get to it, but is about a 5 second walk and not nearly as bad as some of the reviews state!4 given for location purely due to the 25-35 minutes into Barcelona centre, however this was something we knew when booking and what we had opted for - the price you pay for staying in a nice hotel! There weren’t that many paces within walking distance such as restaurants and bars, but a short walk out would take you a range of eating places at the diagonal mar shopping centre, or in the opposite direction along the beachfront were many smaller bars - often there is someone outside trying to drag you in which we hated, but always checked out the menu ourselves and decided. Overall I would definitely go back to this hotel, even if it was just to enjoy the breakfast again! Lovely hotel overall with staff to match.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is recommendable, a very good place near the subway and with a beautiful view if you are lucky and you get a room with a view of the sea. Unfortunately, I did not have this luck :) Maybe next time...
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great location, a cool bar but a hotel that is offering an overall service thats probably best suited to the past, turning off the air conditioning at night is just ridiculous! Room bar had 10 items in the fridge, and 4 of those were water, and 1 British TV channel that did not work....... have to do much better this day and age
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect Hotel and location, excellent and very helpful staff, spoiled only by non- functioning air conditioning in the rooms.For eating out, there are numerous restaurants nearby, some of them quite good!
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from a weekend away with the ladies (8 in total). Hotel clean and comfortable. Short taxi ride in to Barcelona for all the sites. Metro close by however we didn’t use it as taxi rank right outside hotel was our preferred option. Plenty of bars and restaurants in short walking distance.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall I was impressed with the service and overall quality of the hotel. Upon check. The kindly receptionist provided us with a brief guide of the local key areas, closest metro information which is great for a first time visit to Barcelona. Altho I had researched all this proper. The closest metro is roughly a ten minute walk and a small mall with mc Donalds is a similar distance away too. With the beach in front and several restaurants close by. You have everything you need closeby. They also allow hire of electric scooters which unfortunately we did not get round to using. But they seemed very popular in the local area. The room was clean and in Barcelona tradition, maybe Spanish tradition, there was no lock to the bathroom. The hotel isnt in the centre of the city and instead is in the far corner, results in having to take generally more than one metro line to get back after a day out.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here many times for work, as it is in walking distance to the office.Breakfast is a nice buffet. Rooms are very nice here, if a little on the small side. It’s a shame there is no complimentary water provided in the rooms, you can buy water and snacks from reception but they are expensive. Service at breakfast and reception are good and efficient. The metro isn’t too far from the hotel, this will get you into the centre of Barcelona for all of the tourist attractions.It is also around a 15 minute walk to get to Diagonal Mar, which is a huge shopping centre with lots of shops and restaurants.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were greeted warmly at reception by Raquel who described the hotel and provided us with a map showing nearby restaurants and metro stations. The Metro in Barcelona is brilliant, only 1 euro to anywhere, also there are more taxis than you can poke a stick at and they are very reasonable. Our room was clean and a decent size with a bath/shower however there was some black mould round the bath which some bleach would have sorted out. As ever in hotels nowadays the toilet paper was ribbon thin what a ridiculously petty ay to save money. There were 5 coat hangers for two of us for four days and no drawers. We asked for more but they were not forthcoming. A kettle and coffee were provided which was great but once again only one cup each was provided, we went to a supermarket and bought milk and some nescafe (far cheaper than UK) so that we could have a coffee in the afternoon. Other than that the sea views are really pleasant. The lower rooms can be a bit noisy because of the roads and multi coloured limbed moronic brits returning from clubs, luckily not staying at the Occidental. On the very plus side the beds are super comfortable and have 3 pillows of various sizes. Needless to say the TV provides "Russia Today" but not BBC. That is not good enough and many hotels in Europe are as bad.Breakfast is excellent with a very varied buffet including Cava but your breakfast is confined to side plates, again petty money saving. The result is that that you actually use more plates. Piped music is thought to enhance your eating experience.The pool area is excellent although there were not enough mattresses for the sunbeds, again, a bit petty. Pool music drones on. Why do we need music at breakfast or when we are trying to relax by the pool?Both the pool bar and the main bar are not too pricey and have atmosphere.We did not eat in the restaurant at night because it opened at 8.All in all a nice hotel with friendly staff but the silly money saving does it no favours.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed 5 nights in Barcelona, and this hotel was excellent. Great reception staff, 11th floor city view, super comfy bed, breakfast buffet was delicious. Location was perfect with short walk to the beach, a 10 minute walk to the metro, 15 minutes to a big mall, various decent restaurants around if you didn't want to go into town.Watch out though for the overpriced bar, and the dangerously slippery bath tub!Otherwise highly recommended.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic hotel right across the road from the beach and only a few hundred metres from a great selection of restaurants.the roof top terrace was awesome although the drinks were expensive but that was to be expected so that’s not a complaint
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were very capable and friendly. Our room was always cleaned and left in tip-top shape. It is very close to both the metro and the bus stop, thus very accessible for couples that don't drive.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 2 nights in Barcelona for businessQuite and very comfortablegood bed and large room. Mine was not in front of the avenueJust taken breakfast in the morning was good onevery practical to get for a jog in the front of the sea
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room far too cold. Impossible to increase temperature. The team was helpful but couldn't fix the issue. Rest of the journey was find with good bed, nice location and good food even if breakfast was a bit of a challenge for someone having a gluten intolerance.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location to walk along beach, get to la Ramblas and other places. Great views from the sea view rooms Comfy beds and clean rooms.Facilities sufficient. Staff slow on reception. Would stay here again if visiting Barcelona
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: TOP - It is a very good hotel with very nice rooms and the best breakfast ever - View to the sea and central location to the city and to the next shopping possibilities. Rooms very good - Personen friendly and competent. Car garage are also existing. Short ways to the sea and restaurants.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Disappointing room with lay out. Felt out of date. No swimming POOL available during our 8 day stay.Should refund some of my money. We paid for breakfast but only used this twice. The reception area around the bar didn't feel customer friendly as there were no seating and table area. Nothing to watch on TV. Found the break boring
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is amazing. The room was nice and clean, bed was very comfortable. Location of this hotel is also good. Hotel staff was extremely friendly, especially Caroline from the bar ( my apologies if I spelled her name wrong). I can recommend this hotel to everybody!
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has a good view and very close to the beach, and has some close bus stops but you have to walk more than 5 mins to get to subway. Near the hotel, there some good restaurants. You can get to the convention center of Barcelona in 10 mins by walk.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good Hotel, good breakfast but not variety, if you stay more days. you will boring breakfast.room is good. tidy and clean. but hotel far away from city center. you need to take taxi for easy. or you can walk a little for bus or subway.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The process is static and needs to become more like "First-in First Served" than statically allocating a room whether ready or not and you have to wait for that room to become available. Many others got their rooms after I arrived with no premier status (all my colleagues). I ended up waiting for 5 hours - way after the check in time of 2:00 pm.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was spacious and clean, the hotel is just across a street from beach in a modern neighborhood. Just a bit far away from the city center but the public transport in Barcelona is very convenient.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved my stay here the staff was great. The breakfast was amazing and my room was spectacular. The location was optimal as well. Just close enough to enjoy much of the city but not noisy. The view and location were great. Would definitely stay there again
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel location felt little far from center. Closeby areas were not so interesting but there was a bus stop close to hotel where the bus went into city. Staff was helpful and gave good service. Breakfast was good abd tasty. Fresh products. The negative thing about our stay was that I had booked a room with kingsize bed and ocean view but when we arrived they had 2 single bed room for us. The staff helped us to obtain a room with kingsize bed but it did not have ocean view which I paid extra money for. It was very sad, other than that we had a very pleasent stay.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice n clean hotel. Smell lovely by reception area. Staff very helpful. Close by the beach. Train station only 10 minutes walk. Shopping center near by. Lots of food place around. Wonderful stay. Lovely hotel
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would highly recommend this hotel, it was in an ideal location for us with plenty to do nearby. The receptionists were fantastic especially 2 of the female staff so helpful with all questions asked. As our visit to Barcelona was to celebrate my daughter's 21st the hotel staff went to extra efforts on the day to make it even more special for her. We couldn't thank them enough.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Air conditioning not available during certain times of the year. The room was hot with no cool airflow my entire trip. Unbearable. Having the window open at night doesn’t really help, and the road noise outside is terrible.‘Do Not Disturb’ means nothing to these people. They will knock and enter your room with no regard. I was taking a nap due to a bad headache (not helped by how hot the room was), to find housekeeping coming in through the door. They also came into my room every single day that I was there (5 days).
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: perfect for summer, I would say that bed comfort could be improved and we also had some heating issues during january. Overwall indeed it's a 4 star hotel with excellent services and staff. The location is perfect near city center and public transport but also a quiet zone.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel with basic amenities. Staff is friendly but they are quickly overwhelmed; they seem short staffed even for a low season.Rooms could use a little improvement.Bathroom water was unbalanced (cold or scorching hot)...Very nice sea view from the rooms.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at the occidental atenea mar for a few days. The hotel was very modern and clean. Room was very well sized and the bed was huge. 3 of us stayed in 1 triple room, thought we would all have to share but they brought in an extra bed which allowed for more space. Bathroom was lovely, really appreciated all the amenities that came with room like additional smaller mirror, plenty of towels, all small essentials such as shower gels, caps, combs, vanity kits, and most importantly hairdryer! Would have liked to have tried the pool if it was not winter (which pool is closed over) and if staying again would consider trying their breakfast as room also looked lovely.One thing to note is if visiting Barcelona for many city architecture and sights, it can take up to an hour to walk as hotel is near to beach, however wasn’t an issue to find shopping centre and food places nearby. Overall very comfortable stay and would stay again.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really god hotel with friendly staff, amazing views from seaside, really good Breakfast!! Staff very friendly and polite, room clean not big but really big comfy bed. Highly recommend!!! Next visit in BCN soon and definitely we’ll come back there.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although this hotel is not close to the city centre, it was great to come back out to a quiet area after the day of hustle and bustle. Lovely sea view. Friendly and helpful staff. There are a couple of decent restaurants nearby. The walk along the coast into town was lovely. Otherwise, the bus service was very good.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our stay was fantastic the team where all very friendly and helpful i can't find any fault what so ever .The room was clean .The breakfast served was simple and tasty .I cannot find any fault with anything .I would definitely stay here again
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here over new years. I emailed the hotel to say it was my birthday and I got an upgrade of a room. I had booked a sea view already. I booked via booking.com who later wrote to me saying that I could not be guaranteed a sea view room. I wrote to the hotel directly who wrote back saying that I would be getting a sea view room.  The pool is shut for most of the year. I found this out on check in. This should be better advertised. There was also a problem obtaining room service. I had asked in Spanish first and then English for a bottle of water to be brought to the room. This took four phone calls to happen and I was also told to go to the store to get water. I was given very helpful and friendly advice by Francesca regarding sight seeing. On check out, I left a mobile phone in the room. I realised this at the airport and called the hotel. Francesca immediately obtained the phone and put it in the hotel safe. She then directed that I email the hotel with the details of what had happened. I did this and was contacted by the postal company. The phone was delivered to the address in Dublin exactly 48 hours after it was left in the hotel. I place the cause of this directly with Francesca whose diligence and professionalism ensured that the phone would be retrieved and returned within such a short time. I think that Francesca should receive a commendation from the Barcelo Group for her actions in dealing with this. Many thanks Francesca.
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Extremely knowledgeable and helpful stuff, rooms could Not be cleaner, perfect location. I love every single detail about this place !!! I will definitely recommend this hotel to my family And friends. Thank you!
hotelName:
13    Occidental Atenea Mar - Adults only
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Charming, clean and bright. Liz and Tony are great hosts and made sure our stay was enjoyable. This hidden away gem is steps from the Metro and also near Barcelona-Sants if taking the high speed rail to other parts of Spain. The kitchen has everything you need and the separate bedrooms gives everyone their space. The family especially enjoyed the towel warmers. The plants around the entrance and up on the deck are beautiful. We highly recommend staying here if you’re planning to visit the sites in and around Barcelona.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband booked this apartment for a week as a birthday surprise and to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The patio was perfect, beautifully furnished and so cosy and comfortable. The small attention to details made it even better and we were made to feel extremely welcome by our hosts. It had everything we needed for a quiet city break and was very near to local bars and restaurants recommended by Liz, and thanks to her we found some excellent places to eat. A wonderful place to stay and highly recommended. We will definitely go back! Ben and Judy Curtis.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed an amazing experience with great hospitality from Liz and Tony who provided us with lots of helpful information and advice. The apartment was spacious and fully equipped. Highly recommend here
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartment is located in the centre of the city. However, it too close to Entença metro station. Also, many restaurants are within short walking distance, plus couple of groceries are nearby.Tony & Liz who own and manage the apartment and so helpful and respond quickly to any queries.The apartment is spacious and clean. Although the apartment is self-catering, the kitchen is well-equipped and has milk, cereals, coffee, tea, salt and sugar.There is about 100 meter walking from the main road to the apartment, as it is located within a compound.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for an opportunity to meet up with old friends, lovely apartment, with a peaceful roof garden. Best area to stay in Barcelona, loads of lovely bars and restaurants within walking distance and easy to get train/metro too and from the airport.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from a fantastic 3 days in Barcelona with 2 friends to celebrate their special birthday. The Patio had been recommended by a friend & we are so glad it was! In a quieter part of town & easily accessible to both the Metro & Sants station. Spotlessly clean, as charming as it looks on the pics & with friendly informative hosts it was a perfect base. Liz & Tony were very helpful, great communication before we arrived & they also very kindly arranged for a birthday cake & cava to be there on arrival, as a surprise from me to my friends (great choice of cake Liz, it was lovely!).Liz & Tony recommended the bus tour which we enjoyed & some great local places to eat, one of which we got delicious takeaway pizza & pasta to take back to The Patio to eat. I wouldn't hestitate to return as we have only scratched the surface of this wonderful city. Thanks so much Liz & Tony I look forward to returning.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful, quiet, clean and comfortable flat in Eixample, with very lovely hosts. Also very close from underground and shops, and with a little park across the street where children can play. I wholeheartedly recommend it.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a nice discovery in Barcelona...This two bedroom/1 bathroom apartment was just right for us. It includes a full kitchen. It is conveniently right next to a subway station and beautifully located in front of a park. You access the apartment through a back indoor private courtyard. Everything is nicely kept and so quiet...There is a rooftop terrace for us to use. We had a couple of meals there.Tony and Liz are wonderful hosts. They were there when we needed them and not there, when we wanted to be alone ;-)Do not hesitate to book this apartment. We will definitely go back.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We recently spent a lovely 3 nights at The Patio. Apartment is great, very stylish with lots of attention to detail. Bedrooms spacious with comfy beds and ceiling fan as well as air-con. Very well equipped kitchen with comfy sofa, choice of cereals, tea & coffee and Liz thoughtfully put fresh milk in fridge for our arrival. Bathroom great as well with powerful shower.
