Great quiet location with lovely Patio area and sun terrace, unfortunately did not have time to enjoy it. Metro opposite so very easy to get about and Liz & Tony are so kind & helpful in recommending local restaurants etc. Loved our stay and Liz & Tony made it extra special.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We rented the apartment for 4 nights. Hosts very accommodating and apartment beautifully decorated. Situated in a great location for the train if going to Sitges, airport etc with the metro station on the doorstep. Very quiet and peaceful and a great choice of cereals, tea, coffee and milk already waiting. Would definitely stay again!
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very nicely presented two bed apartment in an exceptionally quiet and secure block. Well equipped...surrounded by plenty of local shops, restaurants, bars and bakeries, yet within a few stops of all the major tourist attractions by metro.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Liz & Tony's house for 3 nights. It is really a nice and clean house locating in a quiet and safe block, and near public transportation. The rooms are well furnitured and we could find all the things we need. And we really enjoy the beautiful patio and all the lovely decorations.Liz and Tony are great hosts. We could easily connect with them and get help. I left my necklace in their house. After I went back home, they found it on the flour, wrote me emails and sent it to me. I am looking forward to traveling to Barcelona again and meeting Liz and Tony.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a gem! The location is amazing with metro just across the road plus plenty to do within walking distance. 2 large bedrooms with super comfortable beds and air conditioning. Everything was clean and tidy and Liz gave us plenty of ideas about what we could do whilst we were there. Equally enchanting is the roof top terrace which is a great suntrap and really quiet. We would definitely stay again, in fact we can't wait to go back.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Patio immediately feels as a second home, due to the peaceful and comfortable place and Liz's and Tony's hospitality: sincere interest, basics available, tips of all kinds, etc. Warm and welcome we felt.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and I had a fabulous trip to Barcelona and had a really delightful stay in the Flat, it was very spacious and comfortable! The owners Tony and Liz remembered us from our previous stay in the patio and their hospitality was just as great as the first time! They recommended some wonderful restaurants and helped with getting around. The Flat was in a great location, close to the metro and plenty of shops for convenience. The Flat was a clean and comfy which meant a happy stay for us all. Thanks again Liz and Tony especially for the airport pick up. We will definitely book again for our next trip!! All the best from Simon, Jane and kids xx
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Tucked away in a quiet courtyard in the Eixample district of the city centre, The Patio is very comfortable and spotlessly clean. It's only a few steps from the Rocafort exit of the Entença Metro station, making it easy to reach from the airport. It had everything we needed for a short break and we had a lovely welcome from the owners Tony and Liz, whose recommendations for eating out were much appreciated: we ate and drank at places used by locals thereby avoiding tourist rip-offs. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A peaceful delight in the centre of Barcelona. Totally central to access all the most important sights the city offers. Close to metro and untold restaurants. The accommodation is simple , very comfortable , owner run with love and attention to detail, hosts very knowledgable and helpful with info regarding the city , English and Spanish both spoken fluently . Would happily return .
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Living in Eixample just a few metro stations away from the centre of Barcelona meant that we felt a part of the local community and after a day in the midst of a city that's always crowded it was a joy to eat locally. Liz and Tony, the apartment owners were always available for advice and we enjoyed all the local restaurants they recommended..
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were visiting Barcelona for our wedding anniversary (25th as you ask) and found the Patio online. Elizabeth & Toni were hugely helpful and informative, pointing us in the right directions and providing a vast wealth of information.The room was warm, well furnished and stylish. The bed was perfect and the room was clean and well presented. Our room didn't have an outside window to the outside but there was plenty of ventilation. The other room does have an outside window and as we always sleep with an open window we would choose that next time. The bathroom is well appointed and even though its shared between the 2 rooms there was never an issue. If your are of a shy disposition you may want to take a dressing gown but it wasn't an issue for us. There was a choice of breakfast, cold meats and cheeses, cereals, toast and a freshly made fruit salad every day. The Metro is across the road so although the Band B is a little way from the tourist hot spots you can be in the heart of la Ramblas in about 10 minutes.There are local bars and restaurants if you don't want to travel too far for eats.I am sure we will be back
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First of all you plunge into an oasis away from the hustle and bustle of the outside world. Both rooms are very quiet. Both Elizabeth and Toni are wonderful hosts. If you have a question, they have an answer. They both bend over backwards to please you and make your stay a memorible one. If you have a problem with Spanish, they will give you really good advice (maps/tkts and explanations) on what to see and where to go in english. The location is a few steps away from the metro station. It takes you approx. 7-10 minutes to get downtown to the Ramblas. I myself own a Bed & Breakfast in Bern Switzerland and have high standards. Next time I go to Barcelona, I will definately stay at B&B The Patio. Oh I almost forgot, if the weather is nice, there is a beautiful huge roof patio with chairs and a nice view. A perfect place to enjoy a glass of wine and rest your aching feet due to the marching around all day. Thank you Elizabeth and Toni for everything.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want to live like a local, the Flat is the place. Convenient to the L5, so easy to get anywhere (about 20 min to get to Gothic Quarter, 1 stop from Sants Estacio so it is easy to get to and from the airport).Liz is great and very helpful. She's willing to answer all your questions and provide insight into neighborhood spots. The Flat does not have A/C though I didn't need it for my stay (Sep 22-27, 2016).I'd stay here again.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The place is well located and the tenants very nice. It was a great value for money as it's way cheaper to other B&B we looked at. The room we stayed in was nicely decorated and we enjoyed the coolness of it at night thanks to the fan (there's A/C if needed though). Overall a great experience.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room and beds where perfect, absolutely no traffic noise, we slept better than at every other place we stayed during this holiday. Liz and Tony where very nice hosts. We liked the roof terrace very much. The Metrostation is just across the street.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Liz and Tony were excellent hosts and really made you feel at home. Liz recommend some great local restaurants and very kindly booked a table for us. The shared bathroom was not an issue at all -very clean and always accessible. Our bedroom was a great size, lovely authentic decor and so quiet. In a brilliant central location with easy access to the metro and airport, I can't recommend this place enough and we will definitely be going back!
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a wonderful stay at the Patio B&B. Liz met me on my way inside in the lovely courtyard with all the plants and greenery - great place to sit and relax. Upstairs was another green space to sit, relax and enjoy the view. Rooms were inviting with very comfy beds and very nice decor. The air conditioner was great, especially on our hot muggy days in Barcelona. Bathroom was spotless and cleaned daily and the daily breakfast was generous. Freshly prepared fruit, variety of breads, juices, meats, cheeses... Lots of options for everyone. Overall we had an amazing stay and would highly recommend it. Liz was wonderful with all of her recommendations and advice and even had metro passes available for purchase. Thanks Liz for a wonderful week!
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautifully decorated and clean b & b in a central location in Barcelona. 10 minute walk to Barcelona Sants train station. The owner Liz is very helpful in helping us find restaurants and things to do that are local and not too crowded and touristy! The patio at the b & b is very quiet and serene as well as having many beautiful plants and flowers! You would never know you're in the middle of a big city. Highly recommend this place - it is perfect!
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in a peaceful street away from the touristic crowdedness, but still central in Barcelona and easy to reach, with lots of restaurants and small supermarkets in the area. There is a metro station very close to the B&B.The hosts Tony and Liz immediately make you feel welcome. They are always there to help you out with information about visits or nice places to eat. We were welcome to sit on the big terrace at the roof of the B&B, which is a nice place to sit and relax/enjoy a drink before going to bed after a long day of exploring the city.The room and bathroom were very clean. The room has airconditioning. Breakfast was perfect with everything you need. If we return to Barcelona in the future we return to this B&B!
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was our second stay at The Patio, and I hope not the last. As usual the place was spotless, breakfast delicious, and our hostess Liz welcoming and full of information about good places to go in Barcelona. She is originally from the North-East (England) but has lived many years in Barcelona with her Spanish husband so knows it very well. It is located really centrally but so quiet, being enclosed behind the buildings fronting the street. It was really easy to get anywhere, and there is a tube station just over the road.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Tony and Liz are the best!! What a wonderful, comfortable environment they have created. The property provides such a peaceful place in the middle of a city. On our last day we had a few hours before having to head for the airport and they invited us into their part of the home to wait. We had such a great visit and conversation. My friend and I are walkers so we tended to take our map and just head out and explore. The Patio is well located not only for walking, but mass transportation is right across the street or just a walk down the block. Even though there are great restaurants and bars on every corner, Tony and Liz gave us great recommendations for close in places to eat at night. The biggest asset of this property is Liz and Tony. Just can't say enough about how warm, friendly, and accommodating they are. Telling all my friends to go to Barcelona and stay at The Patio!!
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just back home after a marvellous 5 nights away at The Patio in Barcelona. Visited this superb two bedroom B&B in 2014 and vowed to return. Liz & Toni our hosts are incredibly friendly and hardworking owners who provide a relaxed homely environment in which to enjoy the city. Breakfast is delicious, all fresh ingredients and served at the best time to suit your stay. Traditional architectural design, clean and comfortable, fresh towels provided daily and bedding if required. A small dining room with sofa where you can relax or the amazing terraced balcony to catch some Spanish rays. The 'Patio' is in the ideal location for visiting the region. Easy to get too from Barcelona Airport, train station within short walk and the tube opposite as is a local park. The surrounding Catalonian streets are filled with local bars and restaurants are reasonably priced and extremely friendly. We enjoyed some fantastic food and wine from the region. We both cant wait to visit again next year and highly recommended this accommodation as the best B&B in Barcelona. Liz & Toni always on hand for advice on getting around or the best places to eat. You couldn't ask for more for a superb holiday in Barcelona.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A friend and I only stayed at The Patio for one night but we're already dreaming up ways to return. This B&B is run by charming and friendly people who clearly care greatly about offering the best possibly experience to their guests. The accommodation itself is incredibly comfortable, luxurious and spotless, with every amenity and heaps of charming and thoughtful touches. The location is ideal - in the heart of a proper neighbourhood but convenient for all the main sites of Barcelona - and you feel like you're discovering a wonderful secret as you enter from the street and find yourself in a world of antique furniture, shady terraces, and beautiful flowering plants. Liz was a wonderful hostess who could not have been more helpful to two very tired new arrivals, introducing us to fantastic places to eat in the locality and giving us tips on the best way to make use of our time. The breakfast laid on was perfect, and having full use of the kitchen and dining room to make hot drinks etc at any time makes this a much nicer option than a hotel. All in all - can't recommend highly enough.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a wonderful stay at The Patio! Liz and Tony were fabulous hosts, and Liz gave me some great tips on dining and shopping in Barcelona. The Patio is in a great location, right next to the metro and centrally located for all the sites. I enjoyed the beautiful garden setting on the upstairs veranda, with many plants and flowers with twinkling lights. I'm looking forward to coming back to The Patio for my next visit to Barcelona!
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my third visit staying with Liz and Tony (once in The Patio and twice in The Flat) and I have always had a wonderful experience. The Flat is very spacious, clean and comfortable - you'll find fresh towels, linen a fully equipt kitchen if you decide to cook for yourself ( there are plenty of local shops and a supermarket all nearby - or if you go out to eat Liz can recommend places to eat), there's even an iron and board (home from home). You couldn't find better hosts than Liz and Tony - there're at hand to make your holiday stress free and comfortable and their local knowledge is invaluable. The metro is very nearby and easy to use - but we found it as convienent to walk to most places. If you decide to visit Barcelona (and I recommend that you do) then you'll not do better than staying at The Patio. I hope to visit again sometime in the future - thanks for everything Liz and Tony.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at "The Flat" while in BCN and loved living like a local. From the moment we arrived at the airport from a long overnight flight from Toronto, Tony looked after us. From the welcoming sign at arrivals to the private concierge service with where to go and what to see, this was a wonderful Trip Advisor choice. The flat is so handy and Tony was right about the METRO; easy, clean, and safe. We enjoyed La Lubina as well as some other neighborhood restaurants and shops. Everything was very convenient. We would recommend this accomodation to only the nicest people.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my second stay in Barcelona hosted by Liz and Tony at The Flat, just around the corner from their Patio B&B. The apartment was clean, well-equipped, and in a quiet neighborhood within walking distance to many excellent cafes and restaurants. Liz and Tony provided us with recommendations for excellent dining and sightseeing. They also provided transportation to and from the airport, which was very helpful. I look forward to returning for another stay with Liz and Tony sometime in the future!
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you want clean comfort, convenience, and culture, you must stay with Liz and Tony. They are the friendly and attentive hosts in their Catalan home in the heart of a Barcelona neighbourhood. We stayed for 9 days enjoying the proximity of the Metro and Sant station, along with important tips to see the sights and enjoy the nearby restaurants and markets of the district, nourishing breakfasts in our own dining room, and special treats like cool cava. Airport transfers Tony arranged--super helpful. The Patio made an ideal and welcoming home base for exploring some of the city. The roof top tiled patio with lovely plantings really felt like life with locals.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thank you for our marvellous stay at the Patio Bed and Breakfast, Elizabeth and Tony. You truly are exemplary hosts. Your suggestions Elizabeth of places to see and dine were just grand. We were able to immerse ourselves in the tastes, culture and splendour Barcelona has to offer. The Patio Bed and Breakfast was a safe, quiet haven, impeccably clean with a lovely breakfast always promptly provided.It was a wee bit of heaven with all the lovely flowering plants to enjoy on the patio while sipping Cava at the end of a perfect day.Our bedroom was cozy and the dining area was artfully decorated in true Spanish style.I am anxious to return.Karen , Vancouver Island, Canada
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from a great weekend staying at the patio. Hosts Liz and Tony are very friendly and helpful,they helped us to find places to visit and recommended places to eat during our stay,breakfast consisted of fresh fruits,cereals toast and croissants, eggs and cheese were available should you want them. There is free WiFi which is very good. The rooms are really cosy and clean, and there's a nice roof top patio should you require to relax with a glass of cava.It's all in walking distance of the metro and other tourist attractions.would highly recommend and will plan to stay again in the future.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I highly recommend this place because it’s very comfortable and very quiet. You enjoy the different area of the city really easily. Lisbeth and Toni are really helpful for restaurant suggestion (for exemple). The breakfast is delicious with fresh fruit and you can ask what you want in fact. My 3 years son has just been really welcomed. We would like to come back without any hesitation.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We highly recommend a stay at The Patio for visiting Barcelona. Bed and Breakfast well situated close to a metro station hence access to city centre easy. Owners friendly but discrete and always available to give advice and provide recommendations on where to visit and eat. Bedroom cosy, clean and calm. Superbe breakfast served each morning. The Patio is the perfect place to stay whilst discovering Barcelona.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect B&B in Barcelona! This is a private 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom, dining/living room apartment across the hall from Elizabeth and Tony, who are the owners and are fabulous hosts! Walking home to the secure building made us feel like locals. Safe neighborhood and good location for walking to the highlights of Barcelona. The apartment has its own entrance. We, 2 couples, stayed 4 nights in Dec/Jan. The walls are brick and so very charming, warm and welcoming. Everything was spotless: bedrooms, linens, bathroom, towels changed daily, heated towel rack in each bedroom so if you want to wash out a belonging or two it would be dry in the morning. Beds were comfortable. The apartment has some lovely antique pieces. The breakfast was huge and so much more than we could eat. The table was set every morning and Elizabeth was there to help us with tons of information on things to do. She had a taxi waiting for us at the airport when we arrived and made arrangements for one when we were heading for the ship. We would stay here over and over. Very reasonable prices! Quiet and peaceful. In the warmer months there is a lovely patio or an upstairs roof garden to enjoy. We were there on New Year's Eve, an incredible event at the Plaza de Espangna.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Liz and Tony were very gracious hosts. We felt as though we were guests in their home. Liz gave us very helpful hints on places to visit and restaurants to try. The breakfast was very nice with the freshest of fruit. Tony got up very early to drive us to the airport the morning we left. We even celebrated my husband's birthday with them, sharing cheese, pate and Cava around their dining room table! They helped make our short time in Barcelona a delightful experience.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Patio is ideally situated with the Metro across the road. It is a hidden gem away from the bustle of the Main Street. The interior is an interesting mix of period and contemporary.The owners, Liz and Tony, were extremely helpful in recommending places to visit and eat.There are two quiet outdoor sitting areas ideal for relaxing after a day's sightseeing.All in all a very pleasant experience and we will certainlybe returning.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A fabulous stay had by all, we were 2 couples and thoroughly loved The Patio. Liz was a perfect host and was so helpful and nothing was too much trouble. We were collected at the airport and received a warm welcomed from Liz. The accommodation is comfortable, clean and just lovely, so close to many places such as the Metro, and restaurants within walking distance. The included breakfast was great, beds comfortable, wifi was included. Highly recommend any one staying at The Patio.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had never been to Barcelona before and stayed for 5 nights in September. Everything was perfect - from the spacious room with lots of storage, to the quiet neighborhood with excellent Metro access, to the incredible breakfast with fresh fruit and Elizabeth's amazing coffee. The husband and wife team of Tony and anticipated every need - from being tour guides to giving us neighborhood restaurant recommendations! The Patio was a highlight of our 3 week Spain and Portugal trip.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here on the recommendation of our innkeepers in Devonport, New Zealand, and they really got it right! Liz welcomed us with enthusiasm, interest, and helpfulness throughout our visit. We'd been a little anxious about how to get the most out of our brief stay in Barcelona, but we felt so comfortable with Liz' suggestions for restaurants and things to see. She anticipated our every need. In the middle of the busy city, our room was quiet, cool (air conditioning and ceiling fan), and the price was unbeatable.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I could not have wished for a better first time visit to Barcelona. Tony picked us up at the airport and Liz welcomed us to The Patio with her own brand of hospitality and warmth. Charming, clean and conveniently located, my stay could not have been better. Liz's restaurant recommendations were first class and the breakfast spread was delicious, including the best fresh figs I have ever eaten! I would not hesitate to recommend The Patio to anyone wanting an authentic Catalonian experience with an English twist!
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Barcelona promised to be somewhere special to visit but it was even more special having found Liz and Tony at the Patio. We actually stayed in 'The Flat' which was just perfect for our first visit to this wonderful city. Our lovely very Spanish feeling home had everything we needed, and with Liz and Tony just round the corner to guide us to some excellent places to eat and the best way to see the city made our trip just perfect. Their hospitality and friendliness reassured us to feel totally relaxed as soon as we arrived. We have deliberately left some of the city unvisited in order to return again to Barcelona and the only place to stay:- The Patio!
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our Barcelona home! This is our 4th visit to this wonderful city and wouldn't stay anywhere else! A haven of peace in this buzzing City. So nice to return back to The Patio at the end of the Day to relax and chat to Liz and Tony about the day's events,and get helpful and personal advice on local restaurants, all within walking distance, and places to visit besides the normal tourists attractions. The rooms are spacious, clean, and very comfortable and a great bonus of having your own dinning/lounge area, especially if you are accompanied with friends sharing your visit, and a bonus of a fridge for storing your gourmet purchases SO if you are looking for a marvellous place to stay, and it's available, Book it! We wouldn't stay anywhere else. THE PATIO EVERYTIME!!
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Barcelona was always my biggest dream. Happily - came true. Me and my husband were spending there our honeymoon. The city is absolutely awesome. That is great that you have decided to visit it. Looking for a perfect place? You are in the best one. The localization is great (so close to the metro station and to the city center), the neighbourhood is quiet... and the patio... it is one of the nicest place I have ever stayed in. Walls made of bare bricks, framed pictures, antique fernitures and chandeliers hanging from ceilings. There are also many conveniences like air conditioning or free WiFi. The Patio wouldn’t be so charming and warm place without a friendly and helpful couple - Liz and Tony. Thanks to them we felt there so welcome and homely. They were always ready to give an advice, explain the route, tell the joke or just to chat. They are always around when you need them. The Patio isn't an ordinary place. It can be your second home during your best holidays ever.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The localization of The Patio is perfect - in a quiet and peaceful area near center of Barcelona. The metro station (Entenca) is just across the street. And the nearest attractions of Barcelona are about 15-20 minutes walk from The Patio (Placa d’Espanya, Magic Fountain of Montjuic, Museu Nacional d’Art de Catalunya...). So it’s a great starting point to tour the city.When you arrive, at first you may be a little surprised - to get to The Patio you need to pass through two gates and corridor of an ordinary apartment house, one of many on the street. Then you go through the narrow courtyard decorated with lots of plants, and finally when you pass the door in the end… you feel like Alice on the other side of the mirror.The inside of The Patio looks like from different century - walls made of bare bricks, framed pictures on them, antique fernitures and chandeliers hanging from ceilings and giving some light to shaded rooms…The Patio has two bedrooms, dining room and bathroom. Our bedroom had no window, which surprisingly for me was good, because it increased the magic of the place. And from XXI century the room is equipped with electricity ;) air conditioning, fan and free WiFi.But The Patio wouldn’t be so extraordinary, familiar and warm place without charming couple: Elizabeth and Tony - they are the wizzards of the place - very kind, warm, tactful and helpful. They are always around when you need them. And when you get an advise or help or even just a while of chat, which I enjoyed very much - they became noisless and invisible… Sometimes you can feel their presence only by the fact that the dishes after breakfest are gone or cups and plates are prepared for the next morning…And the breakfasts are delicious. Elizabeth always cares about it and if it's possible she even tries to customize menu to the taste of the guests.So if you want to experience the magic - The Patio is the place you’re looking for.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Don't dismiss this oasis in a beautiful city charming and informative hosts central and safe location would recommend to everyone for long and short staysLiz and Tony are are always willing to give good advise about food and travel just ask
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I recently stayed at the patio and would highly recommend it, not far from the sants station it's a lovely little individual place which is really homely, nice room and nice bathroom. Although the main selling point is Liz and Tony the owners :) I was travelling alone and my first time in Barcelona, Liz could not have been any more helpful and kind, I arrived late on Friday and said I was going to pop out to get a drink and go up to the terrace to which she offered me some wine so I didn't have to go out! The next morning at breakfast she sat with me at breakfast to help plan my day and where to eat . I felt really welcome and would definitely return. As there are only 2 rooms Liz tries to include everyone (max 4) at breakfast and I met a lovely American mother and son on the second day. I did struggle to find the building as it is not obvious from the Main Street where the b&b is but Liz pointed out there are some good directions on the website.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I rented The Flat for our week's stay in Barcelona. The apartment was lovely - clean, well-equipped and located in a quiet residential neighborhood. There were many shops and restaurants within walking distance, and the nearest metro station was just two blocks away. The owners were very friendly and made us feel welcome. They gave us helpful advice about transportation, sights, restaurants, etc. They also provided us transport to and from the airport, at a reasonable price.
hotelName:
14    The Patio Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean and personnel are friendly. Any our expectations were exceeded and area around is perfect to visit all tourist spots of Barcelona!My family enjoyed time spent in here!Thanks for your hospitality!
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A nice comfortable hotel tucked in the busy streets of Barcelona,away from the tourist hustle bustle yet in the heart of the city. Feels like home. The manager/ caretaker is very courteous and helpful.Common area fridge, microwave,coffee machine which is available round the clock. Little hostel but completely satisfied
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The guesthouse is conveniently located by Avda. Diagonal, near Passeig de Gracia. Lots of bake shops and restaurants nearby. Breakfast was included and it was fine. Complimentary coffee was available during almost the full day.The room was clean and nicely equipped, as was the toilet, too, but it was interior, and thus dark and not easy to air. There was an unpleasant damp smell, which probably does not happen in more exterior rooms.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Blanc Guesthouse is located right in the Barcelona city centre. There are different rooms and I accidentally booked a wrong one, the hotel was very helpful fixing fixing it. My room was very nice, large enough, very clean, staff extremely helpful. Really good value for money, recommended!
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was clean and very nice, we had breakfast and it was good, the people have been very kind and they advised us on the best places to eat traditional dishes and they helped us to find the best hour to visit some popular places
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first visit to the Blanc Guesthouse but it certainly won’t be my last. Location was great - just off the Avenue Diagonal. About a 5 min walk to Gràcia station. I must admit I struggled to find it at first but it’s right next to the Lexus car showroom. Host was lovely and helpful. I booked the single single room which had a double bed in it. One of the most comfortable holiday sleeps I’ve ever had! Facilities were fab and spotlessly clean. They provided toiletries, hotel slippers and a proper hairdryer! As a solo traveller, safety is my first concern and I did feel completely safe both in the guesthouse and surrounding location. Will definitely stay again.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Blanc guesthouse was my favorite place i ever been into, although its not a 5 star Hotel, but it has one you would need, with a very friendly staff, i have zero complaints about that place, and i would happily go back to there if i had the chance.The guest house has coffee always available, good breakfast, great cleaning services. and the location is the best .
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect for a budget get away. Great selection of bars and restaurants nearby. Nice non - touristy neighbourhood. Very friendly staff, and there's a free coffee machine available all day!You can have the simple but practical breakfast in the wee courtyard outside. Would defo go back.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: About 5 minutes walk from Diagonal and 15 minutes walk from Diagonal metro, so great location for public transport. A basic breakfast available each day which was fine as it was all that was needed, and a small terrace that could be used up until the evening. Had an interior room which was small and had no windows to speak of (just ones that faced a 1 metre wide gap to the next building) but this also meant no sunlight to wake you in the morning. A great base for exploring but not if you want to spend time in your room, though why would you. Comfortable and air conditioned so no complaints. Mercadona super market next door also which is very handy. Staff very nice and helpful.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Google it first as the entrance door is not obvious. Huge entrance hall leads up to guesthouse floor. Beautifully clean and stylish. Rooms vary in size but are perfect. Breakfast room cute and leads on to small enclosed ouside area. Breakfast good. Staff great. Recommend midweek stay as quite noisy area at weekends. Good restaurants all around and crepe bar opposite handy for local pint or snack.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Blanc guesthouse is a very nice place in Barcelona for a very affordable price. The staff is so kind and eager to help you with your stay. And last but not least, they have a really lovely terrace. Surely Blanc guesthouse is my number one choice for my next visite in Barcelona.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we arrived it took us about 10-15 mins to find the guesthouse, turned out we had walked past the place 2/3 times it isnt sign posted well. When we got inside we was greeted by a young man and shown to our room, the place was clean and the rooms was fresh and smelt lovely. I would stay here again.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, you can easily use bus from just around the corner bus stop to reach everywhere. Rooms are clean and comfortable. Air condition and a fan avaiable in room. Helpful personel. Tasty breakfast.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Generally a very good guesthouse! I could say clean but as you can see in my pictures upon our arrival there were hair in the shower tub. Despite this i can say they are somewhat clean. We had a delayed flight and thus we had a delayed arrival and had to pay 20€ for that. Also on the same day they called me and confirmed our stay there and instead because of the delay they took money from my card where i selected the cash payment in my booking. A good location,near eixample, taxi stop near and gracia station as well. The walls do not have soundproof so you can hear everything and everyone can hear you
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved it ! The rooms were so cute we felt like being home. We shared the bathroom which was no problem at all. The rooms were clean and had small lovely details. The price was excellent! The Staff was very friendly :)
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were greeted by very friendly and polite staff, place is really clean and do a standard breakfast. However don't expect to get a good night's sleep as you can hear loads of noise from the adjoining rooms, especially if you're right next to the bathroom like we were. It didn't help that the cleaner starts hoovering right outside the bedrooms at 8 o'clock in the morning, which isn't ideal when you're on holiday.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great little b&b in a safe area. Beatrix the Mgr is very friendly and helpful. Free wifi and even better is that they have 2 computers that you can use - which is where I am posting this from. The breakfast is typical of what you would expect.I would highly recommend this to anyone who wants to stay in this area.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The very convenient airport Aerobus terminates at Plaza de Catalunya.However, took us 30 mins walk uphill on Passeig de Gracia avenue to Blanc, and towing our luggages - was a real drag uphill. The next few days, even walking from the metro station Diagonal to Blanc took us 10 mins. It's a hassle esp when we're already feeling tired out the whole day and under the summer blazing sun. Blanc is located on a premium street with high end pubs/bar/bistro, however not rowdy. Coming back late, one really have to crept very quietly around the corridor as this is not a hotel; it's really a huge apartment with many rooms, i think at least 16 rooms. I think some rooms rate are without bathroom en suite - and those guests would have to the common bath/toilet - although clean, can be a hassle esp for womenfolk, not to mention noise which other reviews seem to unanimously complained; didn't bother us as we were doggoned tired; hopefully our own snore didn't wake the dead. Our room's only window faces the inside central air well (ventilation shaft) - didn't overly vexed us as we went out immediately after breakfast and came back only when the carriage turned into a pumpkin . Room, linen, pillow, bed,.. all clean. Bed firm, light just enough. Wifi was strong enough as all our 200 photos of the day were uploaded into google overnight. Because of its premium location, the rates are higher. Other hotels closer metro Diagonal or Plaza de Catalunya - might be comparable even if the rates be the same, but one saves in walking distance & time. But perhaps walking 10-20 mins might not bother others; we're just soggy after a wholeday out on foot. Arriving for the first time, passed 10pm, you will have to pay EUR20 extra charge for a special staff to open and register you in. Fine print of our online booking sheet stated that. Subsequent nights we have access card & key to come in anytime of the day and night.Breakfast is pretty filling & good quality comprising buffet of ham, cheese, pastries, muesli, toast, bread, OJ, tea, free flow coffee machine (good); sitting in an enclosed terrace (see pix) Has two 24hrs grocers about 3 mins walk around it. During the day there's a supermarket just 3 mins walk away.a plus for Blanc is that it's easy to catch a bus or metro from Gracias, to Tibidabo, the cathedral on a mountain (good view of Barcelona) and some beautiful quaint gaudy houses along the way there.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It is a great place, well located, is an apartment, so it is not quite visible when you are close to the building. But it is really good, it has the essential for what you need, it is clean, location is great and close to the subway, also the breakfast is tasty/delicious and the staff is friendly and supportive ALWAYS. I highly recommend this B&B when you are in Barcelona, it worth it.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my second time at Blanc Guesthouse: as soon as we decided to go to Barcelona I immediately checked if Blanc Guesthouse was available! Lovely place, clean and well managed, good breakfast, good neighborhood, close to everything! Great staying!
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our experience was great, didn't expect such a charming little place, nice terrece to have some tea or breakfast. Room and bathroom nice and clean. A fine breakfast very reasonalbly priced. Friendly helpful staff. Would definitely recommend it.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was in room 6 which was very small with no natural daylight. It was like sleeping in a closet. Also there was no where to sit in the room apart from the bed. This room is also by the breakfast area so there was no possibility of sleeping late as you were woken by the other guests having breakfast -so my advice is to take some ear plugs. Apart from that the place is clean and well-maintained. The staff most helpful. Some nice touches like the slippers and free tea and coffee but I wish this was available 24 hours not just from 8am, as one morning I woke up early and would have liked a cup of tea. Although only a 10 min walk from Diagonal metro station it felt a bit out the way after a long day walking around Barcelona but the area was very safe at night. As a B&B goes it was okay: it was not horrible but it was not great. Reasonable prices for Barcelona.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Once again Beatriz and her crew were great. Nothing was too much trouble. This was our second time at the Blanc and it did not disappoint. I highly recommend this establishment for exceptional personal service and location.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice budget guesthouse. Not many rooms and only 3 have ensuite bathrooms. Really good breakfast included.Street is quiet after 10 pm. During the day Beatrix is very helpful.Located in the heart of Gracia area and near Metro.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The guesthouse has inexpensive rooms including Room 1 with its own bath facing the street. There is a coumpter and sitting area. The rooms are quite small and very plain, but clean and a good value. The street in front is VERY quiet. We heard almost nothing in 3 daysThe staff wqs very helpful and checkin easy. There is a small sign to the left of the door and you buzz them to get in the building. There are limited checkin hours and I would suggest calling first during the day so they can meet you at the street.The metro is a 10 minute walk. Fine with 1 suitcase, too far with more. Breakfast has excellent pasteries and other goodies. An outside terrace sitting area available in nice weather.A good value for a basic clean and safe place to stay in Barcelona.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just returned from a city break in Barcelona. We stayed at the Blanc guesthouse. It is centrally located. With easy access to loads of sights. The guesthouse itself is spotlessly clean and the staff are helpful and friendly. We would definitely use it again.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed at the Blanc guesthouse for 4 nights recently. The staff were really helpful both before and during our stay. The guesthouse is located on the first floor of a multi-story building. There was a lovely smell as soon as you entered the building and the guesthouse itself was spotlessly clean and beautifully decorated. Breakfast was good, complimentary hot drinks were available all day and a selection of drinks and snacks available to purchase for a small fee. There was also a nice outside terrace area and complimentary wi-fi and computers. The location is good, about a 10 minute walk from the nearest bus tour stop and metro stations nearby. Overall we had a wonderful stay and would recommend this guesthouse. The only downside was the fact that we were in room 1 which is next door to the bathroom for other guests to use and so had to put up with the noise (and smells) whenever it was in use.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A great guesthouse in a nice neighborhood near the upper Rambles vs. touristy lower Rambles, all within walking distance, and close to everything. Super nice and helpful staff, and Beatrice is a most graceful host. Peaceful outdoor terrace that was fab.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My boyfriend and I stayed here for 3 nights. The cleanest place I have ever stayed, the loveliest smell hits you as soon as you step through the front door. Our room was lovely and a very good size although the bathroom was very small but adequate. Breakfast good and a nice selection, guest house in a nice area of Barcelona and easy to get to all main attractions.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This guest house is in the most perfect location for all amenities and places of interest, the guesthouse is absolutely immaculate in all areas and it also smells very nice, it is very well maintained with extremely kind and helpful hosts who are always willing to help, our stay was was lovely but it could of been improved by the shared bathroom and also the breakfast, the shared bathroom which was for three other rooms was right next door to us in the corner which meant that we had a constant stream of people visiting and showering at all various times throughout the day, night and early hours of the morning, they had to walk past our door to enter and leave and also the door lock was really loud it was very disturbing and we found it to be quite annoying as heels on the tiled floor also did not help, we had our own bathroom but it almost felt that every one else was using it too due to the closeness of their bathroom next to our bedroom, the breakfast was poor with very little choice, I had to supply my own as there was no fruit or eggs and no choice of cereals, on the whole we did have a very nice holiday in Barcelona and we would definitely stay at the Blanc guest again if it could have a few little changes which are important and do mean a lot to holiday makers.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time staying in a guesthouse and was pleasantly surprised, a warm welcome everyone who we bumped into was so friendly and willing to answer any questions, very clean, shared bathroom was not a problem! Good location! Breakfast was suitable! Great place loved it!
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I want to say lovely things about this hotel; the staff are friendly, the breakfast is nice, the rooms look adorable and it's cleaned to perfection.However, it is impossible to get a good sleep. You can hear absolutely everything. There's no sleep until at least midnight when everyone else goes to sleep and your woken up by the noise of guests and breakfast from 7am; not to mention anyone coming in at night or going to the bathroom. It's not that they're particularly noisy either - it's just the walls are so thin. One night someone decided to take a 30 minute shower at 1am and our room was so noisy from the pipes it woke both me and my partner up and we couldn't get back to sleep until they had finished. Our holiday was made pretty awful by the fact we're tired every day as we stayed for five nights. With being able to hear every noise, it also took away any privacy which meant there was no romance. Not for all guests though, as we heard "nighttime activities" from another room - which woke us up at 5am. We spoke to the staff who changed our room to the other side of the hotel and it wasn't as bad but still too noisy for a good sleep. This B&B is good for people on business trips who are looking for short stays with Late nights and early mornings but definitely NOT for couples, relaxing holidays or longer stays. Would never ever stay here again and regret ever booking.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I highly enjoyed my stay at the Blanc Guesthouse. It is located in a beautiful & perfect part in Barcelona - very close to everything. Beatriz and her partners were all very helpful and knowledgeable and readily available to assist. Beatriz runs a very tidy ship and it smells it too. I was in the small room with the en-suite bathroom which was perfect for me & very comfortable, the bathroom was nice, modern and big. My room was located in the entrance of the breakfast area but noise was never a problem for me. The breakfast had enough of a variety.My parents stayed in a bigger room which was also very nice. By the way, there is an elevator, which is very helpful for people with big luggage, like my parents. And for those who travel light, like me, just walk up one flight of stairs.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I stayed at Blanc Guesthouse for 5 nights at the end of May 2015. The staff were really lovely and very helpful, highlighting on our maps the places we wanted to visit and provided us with tips as to which metro services to use to get to where we wanted.The room was reasonably sized, clean, nicely decorated and just what we were looking for. The breakfast on a morning was exactly what we needed to fill us up with energy for the days of sightseeing - a large selection was available, cereals, breads, cheeses, eggs, pastries, fruit, yogurt... You name it!The location is absolutely ideal for sightseeing as well. Just a five minute walk from the metro station you're within a good distance for most of the must see places in Barcelona. Would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we stayed end of October 2015. Was a little differcult to find its actually thro' a barred gate next to the large restaurant on the corner. The Blanc is very clean & fresh, the rooms are a good size & staff friendly. Breakfast is small & help yourself but good. Within Walking distance of most of the attractions with the nearest metro stop ( diagonal ) a 10 minute walk away. Ajoblanco a fab tapas/cocktail bar/restaurant is a few 100 metres away on the opposite side of the road & is open till 03.00 am. All in all a great base to explore Barcalona.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Blanc Guesthouse offers very clean rooms in a great Barcelona location. Some rooms share a bathroom so it is important to choose a room with an ensuite if this is important to you. Close to restaurants and public transportation. Hotel staff was very helpful in arranging tours/tickets and answering questions. Superb value for money.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Few minutes from Paddington station. Very clean and spacious room. Fresh croissants and capuccino for breakfast!! Very good service. No elevator!!! So if you have medical issues and can't take stairs it may not work for you. I don't believe there were any rooms on the ground floor.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay there. It is spotlessly clean and very quiet. The staff are always cheerful and helpful. It has good bus connections to all the major sights.The centre of Barcelona is also in walking distance if you are fit and well.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We're currently staying in this guesthouse. It's very disturbing at night, that some of the the people staying here are slamming their doors at night. I won't be writing about the positive things; I've read about this door-problem before we came here and it's actually so! It's obvious that we can't educate and change these grown up people, but the hotel has to find a solution, maybe they can change the doors of the rooms!
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is located in a very convenient area of the city. It only takes less than 10 minutes to walk to the nearest metro station and we had no problem hailing a cab out front. The bathrooms, rooms, and dining area were all so clean and organized. I loved the homey atmosphere that this place offered and it was definitely very nice to talk to the other guests during breakfast out on the terrace. The staff were really helpful whenever we needed to print tickets for our excursions. As for the nightlife, Blanc Guesthouse is located down the block from Sutton, which is one of the hottest clubs in town. If you're not into the nightclub scene, there are about four bars located on the same street as Blanc. Despite the nightlife scene in this area, I didn't feel like it was noisy at all. I would love to come back to stay the next time I'm in Barcelona, and would recommend this place to anyone who is looking for a great bargain.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Tricky to find to start with but we called the staff and they came to help! Very clean, modern and in a lovely area to stay. Staff were always happy to help. It was in the middle of all the sights, and a short walk from the metro so transport was good too. Wonderful place to stay!
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Difficult to find as only a gated door in busy side street with very small sign. Stayed for 2 nights, looking back we wish we'd asked for a different room (one with a window). We had no idea what time of day it was and what weather was like, found it oppressing. The walls are also very thin so can be noisy. Other than that the room was good size, all free toiletries, good shower,nice bed, clean, breakfast was fair choice of continental and coffee machine free and available til 9pm. Staff friendly. Parking was quite a distance away in underground car park although you do get a good discount thru the hotel. This is more of a hostel than a guest house.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotels interior is lovely and couldn't fault the cleanliness especially of the shared bathroom. Rooms have air con and a safe which was brilliant. Free wifi which is always handy. Breakfast was delicious, i loved the fact there were different pastries every day, really couldn't fault it. Lovely smell of lavender throughout. Lots of leaflets and maps just incase you didn't bring one with you.Location is good, just off via diagonal where there is a metro, bus and some lovely restaurants. There is a 24h bakery just a bit down from the guesthouse which was definitely worth admiring!The only problem we faced was when the electric went out one night in which the air con system restarted and made an on/off very high pitched sound most of the night. The rest of the stay was so great that this has really not made us feel differently towards the guesthouse.Me and my partner would definitely return and recommend. :)First time in Barcelona was beautiful, thank you Blanc Guesthouse!
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A small hidden treasure in Barcelona. I recommend it particularly for couples.Friendly staff, nice service and top location. As it is a small B&B, you feel like home, or either as you would be a friend's guest. I am sure, we will go back. :)
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing place ..cant get better place for that price..Clean and stylish,excellent location...i recommend it everyone..I've been work for 5 star hotel in London and all i can say blanc guest house give high level service their guests..
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First things first: the Blanc Guesthouse was friendly, welcoming and clean and I would cheerfully stay there again.My room was pleasant though there was hardly any natural light since the small window looks out onto a narrow space between buildings. The bedside light was inconvenient, with switches either high above the bed or you could get up and use the wall switch.There were a few other annoyances. The first was when I discovered that my credit card (from online booking) was charged at a poor rate since I had been billed in UK pounds rather than Euro. I *always* choose to be billed in the local currency so I have no idea how this happened; perhaps I missed a checkbox. Since this is always poor value for the customer it should default the other way.Second, the rooms are not well soundproofed, which has a few consequences. One is that the (excellent) free coffee and tea is not allowed to be used before 8.00am or late at night. Since I tend to get up around 6.30am this meant I had to go out to get a drink; luckily there is a baker nearby which does coffee early but it would have been nice to be able to make my own drink.I am not convinced that disallowing the coffee machine has much benefit, since you can still hear people taking an early shower which I suspect is noisier.I only had breakfast at the Blanc once, on a Sunday morning; it was fine though I would have liked some fresh bread or pastries; maybe you get this on other days.There is an outside terrace which is nice for sitting outside though not really scenic as the view is the back of other buildings; still very pleasant on a warm evening though.I did like the location, on a quiet street which is not too touristy but has some bars and bakeries; the excellent Barcelona metro system is about 10 mins walk away.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great place to stay. Clean, excellent staff/help. Metro fairly close. Quite professional neighborhood. Good places to eat nearby and a nice laundry service down the street. We would definitely stay there again.Highly recommend.Steve and Tracey Schlabra, Livingston, Tx
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely great stay at Blanc Guest House. Staff were lovely and helpful. Rooms were spacious and spotlessly clean. Breakfast was great and very cheap. The bathrooms seems new and were fantastic. Overall, a really great place to stay.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic staff, exceptionally clean, generous breakfast and as other reviewers have said close to many places. We too were a little hesitant about shared bathrooms but it was no problem at all. Value for the money all around.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely, candid, relaxing, perfumed and clean place. Very good breakfast, clean toilets and rooms. Very nice staff and very cool area, very close to Casa Battlò and Passeig de Gracia. 3 minutes by the metro station.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The B&B consists of about 8 rooms, not all with baths, on the 2nd floor of a 6 floor building, nicely located 5 blocks from metro stations north central off Diagonal. 5 blocks also from Hop-On-Hop-Off stops, 15 min walk to center town or start of La Rambla. Room is sufficiently spacious and very clean and comfortable. No English TV stations, and breakfast is Continental style only. The breakfast start time of 0830 might be a little late for early riser tourists. Reliable Wi-Fi and a nice patio terrace suitable until sun comes around at about 2 or 3 o'clock. The rules of the B&B highlight the thin walls, requesting guests to be very quiet. Street noise is not a problem, but internal noise such as closing of doors, flushing of toilets, shoes on wooden floors is quite noticeable. The staff are extremely pleasant and helpful - thank you all for making our stay enjoyable. Great value for money, we would definitely book there again.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Blanc Guesthouse for 6 nights. We enjoyed our stay at Room no.7. It was a spacious double room with a King size-very comfy bed and an en-suite bathroom. Everything was super clean and our towels were changed every other day. We appreciated the free coffee & tea outside our apartment and the different pastries at breakfast every day. The only slight problem was the noise that came from the breakfast area after 9 a.m. If one wants to sleep more than this it is not easy. The location of the B&B was good as it is between the city center and Gracia area which we really liked. The metro is a 10min walk but you can ask about buses that are nearby. I would highly reccommend this B&B to my friends! Thank you Beatriz for everything.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is my first visit and it's ridiculous how clean and nice it is for the price! It's a "shared bathroom" so I was skeptic at first, but it's super clean and there's self-serve coffee/tea/milk all day long! It's in a great location, metro is close by, clean and comfortable. I will most definitely come back when I'm in Barcelona
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our three nights at Blanc Guest House were very enjoyable. We were two couples in our seventies and appreciated the personal attention of the owners. They were always helpful and kind.The guest house is located a short walk from the metro and the tour bus transfer point. There are a number of good restaurants very close by.Would stay there again.
hotelName:
15    Blanc Guesthouse
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location was perfect, an easy walk to shops, restaurants and public transport. The building and rooms were both grand and exquisite, and filled with beautiful art. We felt privileged to be there. The beds were the best we’ve slept on and breakfast was delicious. The host and staff were amazing - friendly, helpful and accommodating, and gave us great tips on where to visit and what to look out for.All in all, just a great place to stay, highly recommended.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is ideal for walking to sites of interest. The hotel is well decorated and kept - rooms well maintained and fresh. The breakfast buffet was excellent with a wide range of quality meats, cheese eggs, fruits and breads. Only Cristian was the lack of welcome at reception with little explanation of facilities and services. Room safe ( additional cost)failed to operate despite three attempts And vending machine took money without dispensing the item.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Its seems that even when we are abroad, we want to feel at home, and at the very first time I made my first phone call with the hotel owner I realized that I had arrived at the right place.  The room was excellent and spacious, the bathroom was clean and had everything we needed.on the floor we had a kitchen that was available 24 hours a day and the breakfast was varied including bread ,yogurt, various jams, natural juices, eggs, milk, granola, oatmeal. A wonderful house called and its name is, I could not ask for better than I had. So thank you very much for your stay at Barcino B & B I will never forget.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Barcino147 B&B is better than a B&B; its like going home and being catered to by your family. The only difference is that Ferran Font, the owner, has traveled the world and has collected wonderful art etc so the B&B is far more elegant than my parents’ home ever was. Ferran has 3 wonderful attentive assistants who provide a delicious breakfast selection (eggs, cheeses, cold cuts, yogurts, fresh breads, etc) and ensure that your stay in Barcelona is great. You have access to the kitchen, refrigerator, and expresso coffee machines! Quin will help you with information and booking tickets. The location allows you to walk to most places and there are many metro stops very close. This was our 2nd time staying and it was just as wonderful as we remembered. They even volunteered to due our laundry!
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I just returned home after a 3-day stay at Barcino 147 B&B and I'm very very happy with my choiche. Beautifully furnished, colourful and comfortable rooms, mine was perfect. Situated in an ideal location, close to all major interest points; it's a 5 minute walk from Plaça de Catalunya and this allows you to be anywhere fast. The staff are very friendly and helpful, making you feel at home with their kindness and professionalism. I just want to say thank you to Ferran for making me feel so welcomed!I would definitely stay here again...Absolutely recommended!
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I just returned home after a great 8-day stay at Barcino 147 B&B. Our stay there reflected Ferran’s long-term experience, dedication to guest comfort, and commitment to providing high quality, comfortable, stylish, exceptionally convenient, and well-appointed accommodations. We had reserved a room with a private bath, so we were accommodated at the annex flat near the main flat. The main flat is appointed in a colorful, eclectic, sophisticated, and comfortable style. Though we weren’t staying at this location, we saw most of the rooms and thought that the rooms we saw were spacious and well-maintained. Though we liked the main flat, we loved the annex flat where our room was located. It’s a beautiful, well-maintained 100+ year-old building, right on Plaça Urquinaona. You just can’t beat the access to the Metro and buses, just across the street. Likewise, the flat is two blocks from Plaça Catalunya and Passeig Gracia and one block from the Gothic Quarter. It’s a 15-minute walk to the water and about 30 minutes to La Sagrada Familia. Pro Tip: Café Citizen is right next door. Awesome coffee, fresh juice, really good salads, tasty desserts, and friendly staff, if you are in the mood to take an afternoon break from site seeing. Specifically about our room and the flat, there are three rooms at this location, all of which are shown on the Barcino webpage. Our room was on the back of the building and it was very quiet with no street noise. We had a private bath and a separate sitting area, in addition to the bedroom. The bedroom was large but not huge, and the grand scale of the flat, the high ceilings, and its detail and decoration really made us feel luxuriously accommodated. Again, the colors and appointments in the flat are bold and eclectic, which was perfect for us. As a B&B, we used the common area living room/salon to relax in a grand space that overlooks Plaça Urquinaona. The flat feels like - and is - someplace special. We have to note how comfortable the bed and air conditioning were. We slept great. Unusually, we had our own thermostat and were able to keep the room temperature to our liking. Lastly, breakfast was enjoyable. It’s a Continental breakfast. Every morning, we chose from a variety of options: toast, jams, hard-boiled eggs, cheese, cold cuts, various fresh fruits, yogurt, coffee, cereal, and juices. We especially enjoyed eating at the table in the kitchen, where we could meet and share our experiences and recommendations with the other guests. This is much of why we chose the B&B experience at Barcino 147. We left the B&B with a strong desire to return with family or friends, because the flat would be a great choice to call home while visiting Barcelona.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Barcino is a bed and breakfast that has everything!The entire apartment is like a beautiful museum with paintings and photographs. As soon as you enter you feel how cozy it is. An environment where you can totally relax and spend your vacations or work trip perfectly.The rooms and entire apartment are always clean, bathrooms very clean too, kitchen available for you and of course clean, breakfast is perfect!Ferran is such a very polite man who is always there to help you with anything you want or need and also to give you good recommendations about the city. Without a doubt I totally recommend this place!
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My arrival at Barcino 147 was a bit serendipitous; I ended up here after my original bed & breakfast lost my reservation. I really lucked out, as Barcino 147 is in a central location, convenient to everything, and only 4 blocks from Place de Catalunya, 6 from Las Ramblas. I arrived just after 10:00pm and found the staff to be extremely friendly and welcoming. I stayed for 5 nights, and found the experience to be like a home away from home. It was a little bit like a boarding house with a large shared kitchen, and 8-10 rooms off the hallway. Each room was carefully decorated with wall art, sconces, and furniture that made it seem homey; not sterile like a hotel. The entry from the street was like entering any apartment from the street, through a spacious foyer and into an elevator.The apartment was well renovated and modern, but as with buildings of its age, sound did travel down the hallways if people were talking in the halls or with their room doors open. There was a courtyard/ air shaft either within the building, or between the building and the adjoining one where men could be heard outside talking loudly at 1:00am one evening. However, it was quiet for the majority of the time, and the other guests were overwhelming courteous.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband I recently traveled to Barcelona, and I knew just where I wanted to stay. From my travels years before, I remembered staying at this delightful and unique Bed & Breakfast in Barcelona. Well, I looked up Barcino 147, and sure enough it was still open and very highly reviewed on Trip Advisor. I was delighted to see the name of the owner, Ferran, in several of the reviews. I met Ferran 10 years ago when i was studying abroad in Spain. My friends and I spent a few nights at Barcino 147, and he couldn't have been more hospitable. Everything from the unique decor to the close proximity to many places made this an ideal place to stay. We also loved getting to know Ferran. I remember chatting with him from everything about the local culture to jazz music. 10 years later, my husband and I were welcomed once again to this lovely place. It's not what you may expect - a hidden away Bed & Breakfast / Apartment-style that blends in with the rest of the buildings on the street. We actually stayed in the apartment separate from the other Bed & Breakfast rooms. It was absolutely lovely (see photos). We also got to meet Mari (spelling?) who was somewhat new to the team, but was delightful! She welcomed us to the room and took such good care of us with breakfast and keeping our room tidy and beautiful. I cannot say enough about this place. I mean, after all, it was a place I remembered from my travels before. You can tell that Ferran truly cares about the guests who stay at his establishment. I was so impressed that he remembered me and gave us such a warm welcome.If you want an eclectic, fun and authentically-Barcelona experience, stay here! We were so glad we stayed here, and I know we'll be back someday when we travel to Spain again! Gracias, Ferran!
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We enjoyed a large, quiet apartment. There was a large sitting area with sofa. Tv if we wanted it. The bathroom was quite large and had very good shower. Breakfast was served every morning with an array of food that was delicious and gave us enough enery for our three days (not enough) in Barcelona. Ferrer made sure everything was good for us. We would go back again and have recommended it to a few people that we met on the cruise that followed our stay at Barcino 147. The square right outside the apartment was beautiful and the entrance to the subway to take you anywhere in the city was located there as well..
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Oh I was so delighted to have found this place.. wonderful host (not sure if it's ok to mention Your name- but thank You) wonderful conversation and suggestions on the best spots around Barcelona to visit. Pristine rooms, beautiful and in great condition, very clean. I will definitely stay here again next visit. Highly recommended
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Besides the great location, it was an amazing experience to stay in this place. Is in the very city centre of Barcelona and the main attractions are close.The place is very clean, both ladies attending there, are very kind and sweet, breakfast always on time and with variety of options.I really enjoyed to stay in this place.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for a short period, but it was great. The rooms are comfortable, very clean and the service impeccable. Highly recommended. The location is perfect, close to everything important, is possible to reach important places by walking. I'd stay here every time I'll go to Barcelona.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had an absolutely wonderful stay!...A beautiful apartment in a lovely location with all amenities within walking distance.I was welcomed ever so kindly by my host.All in all,a wonderful place,somewhere I would visit again!:)
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Barcino147 is a lovely cool place and loads better than staying in a boring same-old chain hotel. The place is beautiful and just in the perfect spot, not far from Sagrada Familia and Barri Gotic. There are plenty of bars and restaurants within a few minutes.I was a single traveller and actually stayed at the owner Ferran's apartment; the room there is massive and the decor and style are brilliant. Ferran and I discussed a bit of the history of Catalonia, the politics etc., but I stress he did not push this on me, I initiated discussions. On the day I was checking out I asked to leave my suitcase in the apartment. Ferran said this would be fine, but could he have the key to give to the new guests?He trusted me so much he gave me his personal key as he was going to be in all day, which also had his car key on it. He runs the place in this same personal, open and trusting way.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’m one of the lucky few Americans who gets to visit Barcelona regularly. It’s been 12 years now, and I always stay at Barcino 147 B&B. It is the classic, stylish Barcelona apartment and in a great location. But the reason people stay here is that they feel they are experiencing the real Barcelona – the way a Catalan would. Owned by artist and playwright Ferran Font, it is filled with beautiful furniture and art and is infused with the personality of the city. And to make your stay complete, I cannot recommend enough asking for Ferran to take you on a tour of the city or the countryside, even for a few hours. There is no better introduction to the city. The result? You feel connected. Barcelona is not a city to be viewed as a tourist would. Rather, it should be experienced. If you want an experience, and to feel connected to the city, I would encourage you to try Barcino 147 B&B.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's my second time stay in Barcino 147 with my friends. Great service and beautiful room as usual. The owner is so kind and he let us feel we were visiting friend. It's my friends' first time in Barcelona and they were impressed by the elegant decorated apartment which let them feel the taste of Europe. My friends were soooo happy with the location, basically 5 minutes walk, we could reach Passiege de Gracia, Gothic corner and Plaza Catalunya. I saw some reviews mentioned the shared bathroom and I never had problem with it. Not sure why people saying that, it's like “picking bones from eggs”. Anyway, thanks to Ferran, my friends and I had a such great time reunion in Barcelona and I would be more than happy to recommend this place for you!!
hotelName:
