16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staffs are very helpful and friendly .My boyfriend I enjoyed staying at barcino 147 . I love the food and the view . the girl who did check in is very friendly and helpful when she provided all of the information that we needed to be able to start exploring Barcelona right away.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Barcino147 itself is actually worth every penny you pay. From the moment you check-in, you realize you will be having a good time. We arrived early and were pleasantly surprised by being able to check in immediately.The girl who did check in is very friendly and helpful when she provided all of the information that we needed to be able to start exploring Barcelona right away. During our 4 days of stay, the staffs made us feeling comfortable like at home and also let us leaving our luggages for the whole day after check-out.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved this bed and breakfast with artistic and cozy decor, comfortable bed, great wifi speed and PERFECT location (more than 5 minutes by walking to Plaza Catalunya and the other touristic spots). The staffs were so helpful and accommodating. The owner Ferran also recommended me many historical local places during my stay 3 nights in Barcelona. All needed things are nearby: good restaurants, fitness centers, supermarkets, bus and metro stations, etc. Can't wait for our next trip to Barcelona in this August and definitely recommend this beautiful bnb to our friends.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We took the Montserrat Suite. It only met the definition of a suite if you considered a bedroom with an ensuite bathroom as a suite. This definition would make every modern hotel room a suite. There as a bedroom and a bathroom. Most rooms did not feature an ensuite and shared common bathrooms. This lead to partially clothed people in the hall in the morning.The room was nice. The room featured a large leather couch which also had an attached day bed. There was adequate storage space but there was no table, other than nightstands, and no desk. The bathroom was good sized and fully featured.The problem was not with the room but management suffered.We had e-mailed them our train arrival time at the station and said that we would immediately take a cab to the B&B. After they received our e-mail they e-mailed us asking when we would arrive.We responed by repeating the information, but when we arrived at the building the buidling receptionist (The B&B is a large apartment on a floor of a multi floor building.) said that she would have to contact the owner who could let us in and he should be there in about ten minutes. Yes he was there in about ten minutes but since they knew our arrival plans we thought that someone should have been there to let us in. The owner informed us that he really was not into the registration process and that the manager would be there later to fill us in on any details.The back of our room had a litany of penalties for any damages done to the premises including 40 euros if we spotted the sheets and 20 euros if we spotted a pillow case. There was also a list of penalties for lost keys.During our five night stay the towels in the room were never changed. This was not a motel 6 as we were spending over $200 per night.The "manager" was a pleasant enough young woman who had a room in the premises but appeared to have no hospitality industry experience. She would be around (or not) as her daily routine allowed.Breakfast was "served" in a crowded narrow kitchen with about half as many chairs as occupants of the B&B. Breakfast was put out in the time and quantities as the "manager" opted for. One morning she forgot to put out any juice and another morning one of the guests took the last slice of bread for toast until she decided to put out more bread. There was no butter just a tub of margarine. A notice said that guests could choose to take breakfast in their rooms but were encouraged to eat witht the other guests. There was no table to eat on in the room and the kitchen table could not seat all the guests. The kitchen also doubled as her office and if she was seated at the computer it made it hard to use all of the chairs at the table.When we checked out at about 10:00 A.M. after our five night stay one of the manager's friends was around and said that the manager was not there because she thought that we would be there until the noon check out time. We made certain to leave our highly valued keys and left since everything had been paid in advance.It appears that the owner has an arrangement with a young student to act as manager, probably in return for a room.Although, the location was excellent and the room was good, our stay was largely a disappointment.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We wanted to thank Ferran for offering us a larger apartment in the end because we had more guests. The flat was beautiful, with two large terraces , well located and really added to the perfect time we had in Barcelona. Would recommend to everyone!
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Barcino is a converted apartment on the fourth floor of a classic Barcelona apartment building. The rooms have all been beautifully decorated, and the central kitchen is nicely stocked. Be sure to note whether you want a private bath or not because only a couple rooms have them; the common bathroom did get a little jammed at rush hour, with people waiting in the hall. Perfect location on the periphery of several different zones, making it a great place to sample most of what Barcelona has to offer, all within a 20 minute walk. Highly recommended. We'd definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I stayed at Barcino 147 for three days this September after I had to quickly rebook a spot since my original booking somewhere else was cancelled. I like the idea of a more personal spot than just a regular hotel. Barcino 147 was in the perfect location for us - only a couple of blocks from the Aerobus stop and Placa Catalunya - also walking distance to Sagrada Familia and the Gothic Quarter. We walked all over much of the city from here. Barcino 147 was spotlessly clean, and the breakfast supplied was adequate. The coffee was good and the water cooler was appreciated. We were given a good sized room on the 6th floor with a queen bed facing the street. It was very comfy. I think it was a bit better room than we had booked which I really appreciated. The street noise was quite loud, but we actually enjoyed it - kind of a hum for sleeping. The A/C and wifi were both very good. When you arrive at the main door, you have to buzz to get let in. The check in is on the 2nd floor. My only apprehension was that we had issues with our keys a couple of times. There are 3 keys before you get into your room, and a couple times we actually needed help after messing with them many times. Because there was no one there in the after hours and all we had was a phone number, I was kind of nervous we would get locked out later in the evening. We were given Ferran's phone number, but we weren't even sure how to dial a European number on our phone, so thankfully we didn't have to. What would someone do who didn't have their own phone? Also, we never ever met Ferran, so I wouldn't have felt comfortable trying to get him to solve a problem. We had a small shared bathroom, and fortunately, there were only a couple other people using it. I can see how it could be uncomfortable if a lot had to share it. The quad room on our floor remained empty; otherwise, that would have been a lot of people sharing one small bathroom. They keep older looking used hand towels in the bathroom. I would suggest some paper towels for people to at least dry their hands with. As I've read in the past, those used towels are not very attractive hanging in the shared bathroom. Also, the bathroom is way too hot and it should have a better fan system. All noises carry horribly which is uncomfortable for everyone. There should be some kind of cooling and fan system that reaches the bathroom and central areas. I enjoyed speaking to Jimena (not sure how to spell it) - one of the ladies who was there in the mornings. She was very helpful. One day, the maid neglected to do our room at all - not sure why. We were gone most of the day. The elevator worked well but was very small and also very hot. A community sitting room with couches/chairs would have been nice to sit for coffee/etc. The very small kitchen with tiny stools wasn't a convenient sitting area. Quynn (not sure of spelling) was very kind and helpful. The only other negative I have is that they billed my credit card for the largest portion of our bill in Canadian funds instead of Euro without asking me. The receipt clearly says I should have been asked, and if I had have been I would have said please bill in Euro as when you bill in CAD, there is a bigger percentage charged than my own credit card would have. Overall, our stay was alright - our room was comfortable and we slept well. However, because of the things I've mentioned, I don't think I would stay here again.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This B&B is just the best. The host, Ferran, and his lovely team made us feel very welcome and at home. Our room (we stayed in Nonell Master Suite) was extremely comfortable, and we also appreciated the spacious bathroom and powerful shower - a rarity these days! Each morning a very satisfying continental breakfast was prepared and waiting for us in the kitchen, which made for a great start to the day.The decor and furnishings are just beautiful, and reflect Ferran's appreciation and love of art and fine things... The location of the B&B is perfect, within easy walking distance of the Old City and many of the 'must see' attractions of Barcelona. You really couldn't ask for a better place to stay when visiting this beautiful city. Thank you Ferran, Quynh and all the staff for making our first trip to Barcelona such a memorable one.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This B&B is quite good, it's very tidy and the staff is friendly and helpful. However, if you book a room without a private bathroom, it might be a bit stressful in the mornings. I don't know how many people had to share the two bathrooms but at certain times it's almost impossible it get to the bathroom or the toilet (as they're in the bathroom). Also, I had a room next to the bathroom which meant that I woke up every morning at around 5a.m. to people having a shower who came home from partying or having to catch a flight in the morning. I heard ALL the bathroom/shower noises imaginable (someone farting, vomiting or cleaning their palate is not the nicest thing to wake up to). Anytime someone opened their door with a key I thought they were actually trying to pick my lock, which gave me almost a heart attack at 3 in the morning.So, the rooms are very clean (unfortunately, the person cleaning the room also tidied up my stuff - which means, organizing my make-up/bottles, putting my shoes neatly under my bed etc and threw away half-full bottles of water), the staff is nice, the breakfast is okay. All in all - nothing bad to say about the accommodation, just the other guests kind of ruined my stay there.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We could not have enjoyed our stay more. We traveled to Barcelona just after Easter and everything was perfect. The rooms and decor are so beautiful! Our son jack (16 months) had plenty of room to play and sleep. The staff was SO kind, unbelievably sweet. Highly recommended for the area alone, you can easily walk downtown and there is a great cafe on the ground floor. Thanks so much!!
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Extremely nice B&B located just 5-minute walk or less from the closest subway station and few minutes from all major tourist sites in town. Staff was friendly and very helpful as well. This property is nicely maintained, clean and smells good, located just a few block or 5 minutes from a large shopping center and close to many nice restaurants (Thumbs up of that!).The Suite Room we booked itself was much larger than many B&B we stayed in Europe with Double beds, flat screen TV, “strong” wi-fi , many wall outlets allowing us to recharge laptop & cellphones. Pillows were better than normal in that they were full, providing something nice to sleep on. (I guess its memory foam pillow)Breakfast was provided in the Dining area consisted of boiled eggs, toast, fruit, cereal, coffee and tea. It was refreshed as people used it and plentiful.Overall we enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend the Barcino B&B to friends & family visiting Barcelona. One could stay at City Center.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bravo, Ferran! You've managed to build up a true monument of hospitality. Stuff speaks I think all the languages in the world (I've witnessed Italian, English, Polish(?) and Chineese). Rooms are located in well transformed apartments. Very clean (rare for B&B's), cozy and comfortable. Air conditioning works well. Breakfast included. What else do you need to enjoy your vacation?)
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed there for 3 nights with 2 friends, and we actually loved the place. Room in a well transformed apartments, clean and cosy furniture, and great staff all along our stay. Always helpul and smiling ! Air conditioned room, clean shared bathroom. Basic breakfast but OK, Only thing that could be helpful: have more than 1 key/room :)Definitely a good adress to stay close to all Barcelona nice places.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I came with my friends to visit Barcelona, we really enjoy staying at Barcino. Ferran is the best! Rooms were fine, big and with a nice view. Bathrooms - comfortable and clean, We will certainly return the next summer.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were very pleased with this acomodation in Barcelona; the rooms are clean and quiet and the breakfast is very good and complete. The maids are super helpfull and nice :) One of them (Maria) helped us with indications of the places to see :) Barcino is very close to the city center and you can walk everywhere - no need to take bus (only to the airport). We had to share the bathroom with other room, but with no problems, since it was always clean. The rooms decor is very unique and charming. The only thing that bothered me was the matress - a bit old i guess. Other than that i would definitely return there on my next trip to barcelona. we stayed in Barcino one week on May 2016
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We liked everything! The location was incredible! Close to the center, shops, cafe, bars/restaurants, the metro and within a short walk to the Gothic Qtr. Luxury apartments with 2 terraces, lovely facilities. Apartments were gorgeous, very clean and design so nice. Resting and sleeping very well. There is everything you need. Would definitely come back and also recommend.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After doing El Camino de Santiago we went to Barcelona for 4 days. Barcino 147 was a great place to relax and eat well. This b&b was very comfortable although WiFi was spotty and the bed was firm. Friendly staff. Breakfast was fine. Out room was well laid out and cozy. There was extra siting in the room and a writing table. The shower was large and water pressure perfect. Many restaurants and shops nearby. best farmer markets only by a few minutes walking. 10 or 15 minute walk from most of the amazing Gaudí buildings.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 3 great days in Barcelona. Because of the central location it can be a little bit noisy in the early morning. This bed and breakfast is very central, few steps from the old gothic area and the famous Ramblas.The room was a bit small but fully funcional and comfortable. Our room was well decorated and trendy, with cable TV. Best pillows I have ever slept on. Everything you need is here, hairdryer, iron, strong air conditioning, and plenty of places to grab a bite in the area! Great tapas bars! Convenient place for sightseeing-perfect location. Easy to get there from the airport by bus. You can have tea and coffee at any time in the morning or in the evening. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 5 days in Barcelona during the month May. Barcino147 was fabulous, price was really good for a bed and breakfast in the centre of Barcelona. Our room was amazing, very big and luxurious! The view of Barcelona was incredible, and the breakfast was delicious. The staff also wrote us a personal note and gave us a gift for it being our honeymoon. So thoughtful! Were very helpful and friendly. Everything was spotlessly clean. Lots of local restaurants and bars nearby with interesting tapas places. Prices higher than we thought though so didn't really bother us because the quality was good for what you are getting.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From the moment we stepped through the doors, the staff at Barcino 147 went above and beyond. (Special thanks to Mari, in particular, for always graciously assisting us!) We were given personalized recommendations for things to do around the city, and never felt like it would be uncomfortable to ask for more information. The owner of Barcino 147, Ferran, went so far out of his way to accommodate us, it felt like we were his oldest, and most personal friends. He is genuinely kind, considerate, and accessible; not only did we see and speak with him often during our stay, but he also freely gives out his personal number, and responds to messages and calls immediately. I always felt that we had a safety net in Barcelona, should we need help with anything at all. The location of Barcino 147 is ideal! It is a straightforward walk, literally two blocks away from the center of everything. My mother and I did not have to use public transport once our entire time in Barcelona (but the metro stop is very close to the establishment, if you prefer to use it!) The area is also very safe, so one can feel comfortable walking late at night. The rooms were well appointed, the beds were large and very comfortable, the heat and water pressure in the shower were both excellent, and everything was spectacularly clean. We were even upgraded to a much larger room when it became available, at no additional cost. The breakfast was perfect, and served between the hours of 8-11AM. My mother and I thoroughly enjoyed the fresh bread, gorgeous boiled eggs, jam, butter, milk, and made-to-order Nespresso coffee. There were a number of other options for us to choose from, including a variety of cereals, biscotti, and yogurt, but we kept going back to the aforementioned. When the bread was running low, Mari even offered to run down to the bakery and purchase more!I have stayed at a large number of B&Bs and hotels in several different countries, and the customer service here is the best I've ever come across. It is clear that everyone that works at Barcino 147 loves what they do, and that makes all the difference the world. For the life of me, I can't understand why anyone would rate this amazing B&B lower than 5 stars. I would give 10, if I could. Barcino 147 is the #1 B&B in Barcelona.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location. Lovely room and staff very friendly.Unfortunately, there are only 2 bathrooms and there seemed to be a lot of guests sharing the 2 bathrooms (at least 9 that we counted).Lovely breakfast though, free wifii and staff helpful and happy to print out tickets etc.Taxi rank just outside and everything in walking distance -metro and bus stops all very handy.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Useful location, able to walk to all the popular sights from here (Sagrada Familia, old town, plenty of Gaudi attractions etc).Very helpful staff, who helped with booking, printing, local transport etc.Good breakfast. Readily available coffee etc for when you get back in the afternoon.Good rooms. Spacious. Clean. Plenty of DVD's to watch if necessary.Sharing a bathroom does have its fallbacks and can delay you, though it was clean.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed in 5 star hotels a couple of time when I travel for business but I think those hotels are not even better than Barcino 147. Barcino 147 was really cosy and gorgeous. People are so friendly and nice. I can also enjoy the paintings I would definitely go to Barcelona and stay in Barcino 147 again! For me, it's more than a 5-star hotel. A must - stay in Barcelona!
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed at Barcino 147 for 3 nights last week on our stop in Barcelona. We first booked a standard room with a private bathroom, but upon arrival Ferran, the owner of Barcino offered us to stay in a suite in his private apartment at no additional cost. The apartment was huge and beautifully decorated. It had a separate kitchen where a wonderful Spanish breakfast was served daily. Ferran made certain that we had our full privacy and flexibility, while being very personable and hospitable. He gave us great tips about transportation, restaurants, and sightseeing. The apartment is located in the heart of Barcelona, steps from a subway station, double-decker tour bus stop, and multiple restaurants and shops. We highly recommend this B&B and hope to stay there again in the near future.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Even though they had to rearrange our room 3 days before traveling to Barcelona, it ended up being a fantastic stay at Barcino 147. The first night we had to stay at one of the shared bathroom rooms. Not what we had planned, but everyone was very helpful, particularly Quyn, and it was fun to have breakfast at the kitchen table with lovely guests. Quyn helped us get tickets to the tourist bus and other attractions. Next day they helped us move to another room in a location near by, at Plaza de Urquinaona. It was fantastic suite and the location was just as great, even quieter. Ferran, the owner, makes you feel at home and at leisure to enjoy the city from it's heart. The rooms were all beautiful and bathrooms clean. Everything was well kept. Just very easy and confortable. We recommend it.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this on the strength of good reviews - we were not disappointed. Great location, stylish, comfortable, clean, staff super fantastic. Our room was spacious, even though we had two teens in the same room, bathrooms always really clean, breakfast plentiful. We were on 4th floor opposite breakfast room, but not at all noisy. This is an absolute gem and I would highly recommend.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This little B&B is a gem in Barcelona. Close to the center of the city and within easy walking distance of the Metro. Our room was on the 6th floor, spacious, comfortable, and clean. The staff was lovely and very helpful. We arrived too early to check in but were given a place to leave our luggage, clean up, and given breakfast. We never did see the owner but the staff was very nice and helpful. We also opted to pay the extra and have door to door pickup at the airport, which made getting off a red-eye from NY a lot easier to deal with at 7:30AM.Our only (slight) minus was the breakfast set-up. Their rooms are on 2 different floors of what appears to be an apartment building, and when you stay on the 4th floor there is an actual breakfast room with a table and chairs. When you stay on the 6th floor, where we were, the kitchen really didn't have a place to sit for breakfast so you had to take a tray to your room, but our room didn't have a table, so it was awkward trying to eat and balance a cup of coffee. Other than that it was a great bargain and and close to most of what we came to Barcelona to see. Beds are comfortable too. We did opt to pay extra for one of the two rooms with in-suite bathrooms but even with that extra fee it was still very reasonable for a hotel room in Barcelona.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I always try to write reviews about hotels, although I understand that everybody has their own vision. My review could be useful for smb, because I travel a lot and try to be objective. So, in Barcelona, ​​to pause, I chosed this hotel, it has a good location and is affordable priced. You can see a bunch of historical objects near the hotel too . Rooms are located on the 6th floor, clean and comfortable, furnished in Catalan style. There is also a large and very comfortable bed with the orthopedic mattress. Here is also a wardrobe, which can accommodate a large number of things. The nice view on the town square and mountains is opened from the window.Employees of the hotel take care of it , so everything is clean and in correct order, so I have a complete comfort and harmony with all things. You can immediately get from your room to the kitchen, where there is always a snack (fruits, cereals, cookies, refrigerator filled with a variety of food). For the cooking - stove, the microwave, coffee machine, toaster. Wifi works without interruption, internet speed 72Mbps.I recommend this hotel to everybody who wants to live in comfort and coziness, with a tolerant and sociable team.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What lady hadn't have the desire to feel like a princess?:) Yesterday my wish became the truth:) Could you imagine that staying in the BB "Barcino" immediately will help you to have such opportunity?:))  However, magnificent pictures on the wall could help you to feel that you have been spending time not even in the hotel, but much more as in the gallery. Furthermore, Catalonian style of interior makes you to feel that you are an actress of Spanish film:) Moreover, great view from the window( I was staying on the 6 floor) will give you the opportunity to feel like the bird, which doesn't miss anything, because I was staying in the centre of the city and the main sightseeings are located here:) Despite being the guest in the new place, here I feel more as a citizen,not a tourist from Poland, because i have all necessary stuff at the kitchen, including microwave, fridge, coffee maker and etc. It is also pleasant that the room, bathroom and kitchen are very clean.  To sum up, I would like to recommend staying in the "Barcino 147" and it also pleasant to stay in the place is nice and friendly team.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When booking, remember some rooms share bathrooms. This not your usual b and b. You are staying in someone's private apartment.I had always wondered what it would be like to stay in a fin de siecle 1900ish city centre apartment. Now I know, wonderful. Even the lift reminded me of old French films.I will not repeat what has been re. Staff, Ferran and having breakfast in a small kitchen.Just go there, you will not be disappointed.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at Barcino for 3 nights while traveling to Barcelona from Paris with a friend of mine, and I must say everything was perfect. The room was cosy and beautifully furnished, the building couldn't be closer from the metro/bus station, which we didn't even use because all the places we wanted to go to were at a walking distance! The owner is very friendly and welcoming, really makes you feel at home! We were glad he even took the time to give us some tips about what to do/see around the city.Tasty and healthy food for breakfast, a lot of conviviality...I think you can't find a better place to stay in Barcelona!!
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This B&B is the perfect place to stay in Barelona! Every thoughtful detail was just right; from the sumptous yet comfortable decor to the outstanding hospitaility provided by the staff. My room & surrounding areas were clean and beautiful. The location is in the centre of the city so you can walk or take the metro anywhere you like - the staff were happy to provide maps, directions and recommendations. Although the building is in the heart of the city, it is quiet and peaceful inside and I slept well in the comfortable bed. Ferran, the owner, gave me excellent suggestions of what to see & do based on my personal interests. He knows the city very well.Thank you to the staff of Barcino 147 for making my stay in Barcelona so comfortable and memorable!
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This B&B is in a great location, close to sights, metro and wonderful restaurants. Staff are extremely well organised, helpful and friendly. When you check in they not only show you around the accommodation but also have ready maps, tips for public transport, sights and restaurants. Breakfast is lovely. The rooms beautiful and comfortable. Wi-fi excellent. Nothing is too much trouble. On the day we were checking out, our flight did not leave until 22 hours. Barcino was happy to look after our bags and for us to use the common bathroom to shower after a days sight seeing and before heading out to the airport. We highly recommend this B&B and would stay there again any time.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is the second time we have stayed at Barcino 147. This experience was again 5*. Our flight from London was an hour late and still there was Antonio waiting for us with a big smile. We got to the B&B about 10:00 PM and there was Quinn,the hostess, waiting for us and helped us with all our luggage. We stayed in the Montserrat room which was spotlessly clean and spacious and quite. We slept 13 hours and there was then a tap on the door at 11:00 AM telling us that they were holding breakfast for us. Breakfast was great. We took two tours of the area with Ferran the owner. Both tours were very well done - he knows Barcelona and Catalonia. If he suggests a restaurant you should go there. All in all an excellent B&B. We will stay here again when in Barcelona and recommend it to our friends.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I think this place would qualify more as a luxury hotel than what I would expect of a B&B. I was fortunate enough to get to stay here for the few days that I was in Barcelona, and I was honestly so blown away. From the attention to detail in the decor, to the friendly host/staff, not only would you regret not staying here but you would really be missing out on an incredible experience. The atmosphere is absolutely perfect. It is calm, serene, but striking and powerful as well in a sense, allowing you to really relax and enjoy the impressive art pieces in the rooms and hallways, and appreciate the bold colors and exquisite trimmings. The elegance of it all is flawless and stunning. It makes it easy to forget that there is an entire beautiful city outside to explore as well! The beds are large, plush, and cozy. Especially traveling from place to place, I really appreciated a nice bed to sink into, with fresh, clean sheets. I was comfortable and at home. The staff/host are beyond helpful, and even personally showed me around the city a little bit! You can tell they treat the B&B and their guests with a lot of care. They are knowledgeable and ready to answer any questions you have about your stay, the city, sites to visit, history, etc. Barcelona is a wonderful place to be, and my stay here made it that much more impeccable. I could not be more content! I would highly, highly recommend Barcino 147. Be sure to book your visit soon, before all the rooms are gone!
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was one of the best hotels I have ever been! Gorgeous decoration and ornament, perfect comfortable rooms, friendly experienced stuffs, gentleman helpful owner... I would select this hotel If I go to Barcelona again. Thank you for everthing.
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a great place to stay. It's a bit hard to find- it's on two floors of a different hotel, but once you find it its worth the visit. The lady who runs the hotel Quynn is fantastic- so friendly and helpful. She gave us maps of different parts of the city and showed us how to get to the sites and our meeting places for excursions we had signed up for. She also told us about great restaurants to check out. The lady who cleans the rooms is named Maria and is also incredibly kind and does a great job. I stayed in a private bedroom with a shared bathroom but the bathrooms were well kept and I didn't find it a problem to use the restroom or shower. Great experience
hotelName:
16    Barcino 147 Bed & Breakfast
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived for a 2 night stay here and we were greeted by kids running round everywhere, loads of noise... we surely weren’t at the “hip and cool” Generator? Nope, we were. We paid for a private room, it was a very expensive shell of a room. Very basic, nothing to write home about. Amenities, basic. Doing laundry was a chore. For a 800 person hostel, only 2 washing machines and 2 driers? Makes zero sense.Food and drink quality at the bar was average at best. Ordered a caprese salad and the cheese was clearly cut from a generic, cheap block of tasteless cheese. Was more plastic tasting than proper cheese.Both nights of our stay, we had kids running up and down the corridor long into the night and early morning, banging on our door etc. Needless to say, we didn’t get much sleep.We went to reception twice to ask questions / complain about noise. The first time, the woman who was there didn’t even bother looking up from her computer screen. The next time, the guy looked not bothered and shrugged his shoulders.The ONLY highlight of this place is the rooftop where you can see Sagrada Familia above the skyline.Wouldn’t recommend staying here, wouldn’t stay at a Generator again. Shame we spent so much money on such an awful stay, kind of ruined our trip to Barcelona.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice facility at very good location. Most of the tourism spots are near by only.Good hospitality and very nice people.Nice place to interact with people.Highly recommend to others who are planning to visit Barcelona
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel is really nice and clean. Staff helpful as well. However, two things made me lower the rate: first night the card reader to enter the room was not working and I had to ask someone from the staff every time I wanted to enter the room. Secondly, the second night the power went off
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hostel in terms of affordable dorms, place to network and meet people, bars/restaurants with amazing atmosphere. Great place for young people looking to enjoy Barca and have fun! Private rooms however are a bit too pricey- not a great value for your money (it is an overpriced dorm room).
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just returned from a 1 night stay, for a good hour & a half on our first night loads of youth’s all staying on level 4 in different rooms were running riot, banging & slamming doors, shouting & screaming, in & out of each others rooms, when i went to reception they sent the security up, the youth’s all denied they was doing it, i then told the reception me & my family wanted to move as we didnt want to put up with it, the reception then said we couldnt as there was no rooms elsewhere, for €260 for 1 night we would never stay at the Generator again, knowing you would possibly staying on the same floor as a youth football team & them being able to do pretty much anything they want with no reprimand, save yourself any miver & stay elsewhere.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Generator Barcelona is exactly what you need if you are spending most of the day out and just need somewhere comfortable and safe to sleep. Bed was fitted with own light and point to charge your device. This was a huge plus. Only downside is the shower in the bedroom. There is no proper ventilation so it gets very steamy and smells damp constantly. Staff are extremely helpful though and a good place to ask questions about transport and sightseeing.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The design of this place is great, the staff is super helpful and the location is good. The only detail is that breakfast was not great, but the common areas and spaces were clean and really cool. I would definitely stay here again
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I passed through Barcelona and stayed here on a short visit in a 6 person dorm. There was 6 girls aged 19-25 in the room. On our second night we ran into an issue with a security guard. After delivering a noise complaint we let the door swing shut which seemed to set him off. He opened the door without our consent with a master key and proceeded to scream and swear in my face before demanding I speak with his boss, due to the late hour I spoke with whoever was working reception at the time. He demanded I pay 100 euros. When asked what the fine was for he and the security guard proceeded to yell at me for another 10 minute and threaten to kick me out before finally letting me return to my room. There was no explanation and they just assumed I would hand over 100 euros and were very aggressive and threatening when I didn't. WARNING for young women travelling alone. The hostel was nice, the rooms were small but overall clean and nice.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing hostel in Gracia area of Barcelona. The staff was friendly and helpfull. They gave great tips for what to visit in Barcelona. Also a bar and restaurant included in the hostel. So you don't need to go very far.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I took my lad of 8 years old to Barcelona for the week. Although we walked and walked and walked, saw loads there's still loads more to see. Had an amazing time and felt very safe and welcomed by everyone. Loved it and would recommend Barcelona to anyone, it has it all, beach, amazing sites to see, lovely people, great food and full of culture.Stayed at Generator Barcelona which was brilliant. Central, clean, friendly and very well priced. Would definitely go back and stay here again.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed in quite a few hostels during my travels and Generator Barcelona is among the very best! The staff was incredibly helpful and the rooms were very comfortable. The restaurant inside may not be the best food in town, but the bar is always a great place to hang out and the bartenders keep it lively. Some nights we just stayed in and listened to live music in the bar and the local talent really was impressive. I highly recommend a stay here if you're in town!
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, a nice terrace and friendly stuff. I slept well, the room was clean and i had nothing to worry about.The lockers for luggage after check-out are a bit expensive actually. That should be less expensive for guests.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There was so much noise and bathroom smell pee. At night I couldn't sleep becauae of noise. I can recommend this place but no so much. Also they cancelled my first reservation. But problem is that my first reservation was 82 euro. And then i did new reservation. It was 42 euro for same room. It doesn't give me trust.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hostel in a great location. I’m a female traveling solo from the US and everyone here was super friendly and great! I stayed in an 8 bed mixed dorm and everybody was respectful of the space, the bed was clean and there’s a small private toilet and shower in the room. They have additional restroom facilities further down the hall and overall I really enjoyed my stay, met tons of new friends!
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly contact with mails ahead of our booking (11 p/ 6 Double rooms) . Check-In prepared by mail within minutes. Quiet rooms upstairs (floor 6-8). Clean and well decorated. All you need - not much more.Good for Metro or Bus.Many nice restaurants and small shops around. Good and friendly Bar.Felt save and comfortable
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are super clean, comfort.The design is awsome, I really enjoy my stay. I didn’t try the breakfast but everything else was perfect.The workers are really kind. I had my room ready when I came at 10am, so it was perfect I recommand this hostel!
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really enjoyed our staff here. We had ome of the private rooms which had a lovely bathroom and balcony. Staff were very helpful especially with our luggage at checkout. Hotel is near metro station to help get around the city.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: this place was great. the pictures online don't do this place justice. it was close to everything. it was easy to get to. there was so many options for hanging outside of your room. this is probably the best hostel i've ever stayed in. def recommend!
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were in a familiar trip of 7, to Barcelona. First there was a problem with the booking, once that was solved, they gave us a room with four beds, for 4 persons, but not extra towels, not shampoo, you have to buy separately. The other room when we were 3 of us, was clean and nice, once again, no extra towel and they didn't clean the room ( if you don't request , they don't go). The staff was nice, food for breakfast which was included was ok. Is close to the Sagrada Familia church, good location.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Must admit I got a bit pissed off that I had to pay €5 extra for towel! That's not on #Generator! Otherwise a nice central place in Barcelona. Very noicy (loads of school children). Good for a few nights.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is literally the best hostel in Barcelona, I've stayed in couple of hostels as I often visit the city, but this one exceeded my expectations. The lobby is like a 4 star hotel. The design and decorations are very cheerful and lively. The staff are smiley, super friendly and helpful. The rooms, toilets, and bathrooms are clean, they actually couldn't be cleaner. There are many facilities in the hostel, from a loung hall to a football table, lockers (this is for your luggage to keep if you check out early but catching your flight a bit later in the day). And the location is awesome, there's a 24h supermarket down the hostel, 15mins walk from the city center, and 4minutes by metro. There are coffee shops, restaurants, and bars in the neighborhood. I highly recommend this hostel. Well done to the management and the whole team !
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The place is quite nice, very good location, good design, and great team of people. I only thought the price was almost the same to some small hotels in the area with more services provided.My sister and I stayed in a double private room, which was pretty basic given the price we paid for it. It had no tv and we had to pay extra to store luggage on arrival and departure, which would normally be complimentary in any small hotel with a comparable price. So for this type of room I believe value for money was not great.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall it is a good hostel that is more like a hotel. The staff were very helpful and the rooms were all really clean. The main criticism I have is the fact that every common space and public area of the hostel was taken over by young children, who a lot of the time were unsupervised. It was really hard to relax in the common areas when there are kids running around shouting.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Being a hostel this was much more than I expected, everything was great, friendly staff and security, rooms were clean and tidy, good entertainment in the evenings, excellent for a hostel! Would definetly recommend and defo travel again!
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were a group of 6 so we got a private dorm room and were very pleased with the setup. The bathroom was clean and the bunk beds were comfortable. Check in was very easy and they let us get in early as we had a long day of travel before. The location is decent for accessing La Sagrada Familia, however it was a bit of a walk to get to the Gothic Quarter. There is also a bar and restaurant on site and rooftop access. Only negatives were that there was a surprising amount of young children staying there and the elevators are quite slow.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve been to 4 Generator Hostels in Europe and this is one of my favorites. One of the best parts of staying at a hostel is walking into the lobby and really taking in vibe of the place. As 20-25 year olds we couldn’t have felt more welcome. The rooms are clean and the bar is extensive. Pelayo the bartender on the lobby floor made our stay so comfortable and exciting. It’s not very often that you find bartenders that generally care about your experience. Pelayo and many other employees gave us the time we were looking for. Definitely would recommend if your young and want to have a good time.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing place to stay. Close to the station and close to the Sagrada Família. The hostel have a very nice place to drink and spend sometime. The room have a big area that we can enjoy the view and take some sun and read a book.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hostel with fine breakfast in the most lovely breakfast room! Nice shared living room. Unfortunately the pooltable and foosball table didn't work (main reason why I booked this acc. together with my 8-y old). There was always a crowd near the entrance inside and outside. I noticed this is a very popular place with sports clubs.Overall, this is a fine place but I did get a better impression based on the photos before booking. Must add that all the staff were very friendly and helpfull.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived to the hostel and was impressed about the look and feel. The room was great with a very nice terrace. The team made us very welcome and we enjoyed the stay with Generator in Barcelona.Thank you
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No curtains on the bunk beds, at least in the dorm I stayed at (8 bed mixed) - specially in mixed dorms its super nice to have a curtain and have a little more privacy. Also roommates snored very loudly (no fault of Generator, of course) but the combination just made for bad nights and not great sleep. Standard one pillow. No towel included in the price. No shower plate in the en-suite bathroom, which was pretty messy and uncomfortable. In all fairness, there were other showers in the hallway bathrooms that seemed a bit better, but I didn't use them. The hall of the hostel looks really cool and a Sandemans free walking tour guide came to pick us up to do the tour.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we first arrived at the hostel we liked the location, the decoration, everything was fine.But when we went to do the checkin someone tried to steal my bag. There were a large queue and only a receptionist, who seemed quite busy. When I went to get my backpack I realized that a person was going out with my bag, luckily my friends were at the door smoking when I shouted and stopped him. I did not feel very safe there, doesn't have much control of who enters and leaves the hostel.The room was a little small for 6, the breakfast was good. Anyway I will not be back and i won't recommend staying here.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: didn't like the bathroom inside the room, but general a good hostel.not bad hostel, didn't like that house keeping don't speak English, only Spanish which i can't understand it has a supermarket in-front of the hostel which is good and cheap
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have stayed at the generator on a number of times and always felt happy and safe there. However on my last stay during December this was certainly not the case. It seems the rules of no drinking in the dorms or bringing alcohol into the hostel no longer applies. I were kept awake each night with people having their own party not only in my dorm but also other areas in and around the hostel, including the chill out areas and the terrace, giving myself and others no safe or quiet area to relax during our stay. I'm not sure if the rules about noise and alcohol no longer apply or if they have just been overlooked but I can assure you that Generator have really let themselves down this time and I will sadly be seeking new accommodation for my future travels
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 3 nights in December, it is not a hostel, there are children running and screaming everywhere. Only one receptionist, at least half an hour waiting to check-in. We got there at 4 pm and our room wasn't ready yet. We were told that no alcohol was allowed but there were lots of people drinking and smoking weed on the terrace. The lack of organization is evident. The only positive point is the bar's attention.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I went to Barcelona alone for the first time, on one of the first backpacking trips I had ever done and thanks to the wonderful people I met at the hostel and the very friendly staff I had a great experience. The beds were comfortable, the staff was very accommodating and helpful, the rooms had good and safe storage space (although you had to bring your own lock). The good price and the generally relaxed vibe seemed to attract interesting people. The place was very clean for being a hostel with a lot of guests in the room, and there was an amazing roof top one could hang out at. This didn't bother me, but perhaps it's good to know that people were out partying and getting in very late (around 8 am) and then check out was at 10am, so if you're a light sleeper in need of beauty sleep perhaps the dorms isn't the best option.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve traveled all around the world and stayed in different hostels but it’s the first time the hostel was fully booked with hockey kids who were running around the hallways all night, slamming doors, making noise. And nobody tried to shut them down. The next night they front desk promised us they all checked out but there were other kids, running around in the common areas, thinking they owned the place. The reason I stay in hostels is to meet other fellow backpackers, not families with kids?! On the other hand, the room was clean, bed was fine. The showerdoor was broken but okay. Not a bad stay if you like screaming and playing kids around..
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location! Friendly and safe place to stay the staff were very good. Food was ok for fast food there was a patisserie down the road that was amazing and tacos across the street!Comfortable basic place to stay but reflects the price. Clean and maintained well. Great play rooms and the lobby with the swings were great!
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Its location is near to city centre with access to public transport etc. Staff are very friendly and helpful. Since I travelled with a group of 20+ under 12 y/olds kids, the security was good. The main thing is I can take just 1 Metro Bus straight to Camp Nou….
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my almost “last minute” booking as I hadn’t planned to stay in Barcelona before leaving Spain. The price was reasonable and I tough “let it be whatever for one day stay”. The declared check-in was at 15.00 which was quite a problem for me because I travelled with my 10 y.o. son to Barcelona by bus and we were tired. At the lobby the stuff was very polite and helpful. They locked our luggages in the storage room and told us that the room will be ready the latest by 12-12.30. Which was true! We had a nice breakfast in the nearest cafe. This quarter has plants of them along with shops and restaurants. Our room was unexpectedly big, bed linens were clean and fresh, air conditioner warmed up the room, really hot water in a shower. Clean. Quite. No mess. We didn’t eat breakfast though as there were so many cafes outside. My experience was good! Thank you
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The facitiles are clean and standard but the quality of customer service is absolutely disgusting. Staff were rude at check in and continually acted as if it was an effort to try and accommodate. The breakfast was over priced and under delivered by a mile. There is no atmosphere at all and would not recommend for travellers who need to ask any questions, who want to eat or value nice manners
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I love Generator Hostels. I’ve stayed in them across the Cities, but this one in Barcelona is brilliant.Not far from the City Centre. It’s large, plenty of space and a wide range of people use it. Security throughout the day makes it feel safer. The welcome at reception- perfect!! It’s like coming back to an extended family.The reason it doesn’t have 5 stars- the bar could be better priced and have a better atmosphere given the number of people staying! Would highly recommend!
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I been there with my friends for couple nights i wouldn't find better hostel then this. Location, bar, rooms and service great. Staff friendly and helpful. Hostel have really good vibes.Definitely we will come back :)
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In many ways this was the nicest hostel accommodation I have visited in a long time, even better than some hotels I’ve been to.Immediately when you arrive you get an upmarket feel, the lobby is nicely decorated and you feel more like you are in a hotel really. The staff all spoke fluent English which was helpful as well. This continues in the bedrooms. Each bed had an individual light and power socket and there were plenty of pillows stored in the drawers. The shower, toilet and sink were all separate which was incredibly useful because if someone was in the shower and another guest needed the toilet, that was available.Everything was spotlessly clean and freshly decorated. One minor fault here was that the plug in the sink did let the water out slowly so I had to keep the tap running all the time.Now onto the reasons why after such a good review I’m not giving 5 stars.First was breakfast, when you check in you are given a wrist band which is essentially a voucher for breakfast. In the morning I went down and saw what looked like a beautiful buffet breakfast in the the dining area and I thought this really tops off this place. I showed the waitress my wristband and I was pointed to another room with a closed door where she said I would find the breakfast for groups and that the buffet was an extra 8 euro. I followed her instructions only to find a breakfast offering half the selection so when you see the difference obviously you are going to pay the extra €8. I just thought it was a bit of a sales tactic doing this.Secondly, Barcelona is the pickpocket capital of Europe but you had to pay for lockers to store your valuables such as passport etc. I think Generator could do their bit to ensure guests safety by providing these for a refundable deposit.I probably won’t be returning but this is NOT the fault of the Generator because it really is excellent quality hostel accommodation. There is just so much stealing in the city I didn’t feel safe there at any time of day and I can’t say that about many other cities I’ve been to. Two of our group of 16 were victims of pickpockets in as many days. I will definitely stay in another Generator hostel, just not in Barcelona.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had the chance to visit Generator Barcelona on our last visit to Barcelona and it was a truly great experience.Great taste in design and attention to details. From the terrace to the lounge areas to the bar on the ground level.Juana, at the Bar, was a great host and her hospitality made our visit more enjoyable for sure, thank you again!!We'll definitely reccomend Generator to our Friends and Family.Keep it up!!!
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good place to stay. Clean, wonderful staff, you can rent a bicycle (which I highly recommend). But the breakfast was awful, considering the price. Poor choice, orange juice diluted with water so much it barely had any taste.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed the hostel overall. We had an ensuite double room with balcony. The decor in the room was really smart and the room was clean. Towels and shower gel were provided as well as bottles of water on the first day. Air con also available.We were really pleasantly suprised by how quiet the room was and the hostel in general.The overall look of the hostel was lovely and the staff were very helpful and thankfully spoke excellent English.We had breakfast on one day but the neighbourhood is full of bakeries and cafes that can provide breakfast at a cheaper price. The hostel is within easy walking distance of Sagrada Familia and attractions at the upper end of the city. It took up to an hour to walk to the beach and to walk tonight gothic area also took some time. As someone who loves to walk I might have liked to be closer to the gothic quarter however if you like to use public transport it won't be a problem. Ice stayed in Barcelona before and have paid a lot more for a central location with facilities that are no where near as nice. I would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My friend and I opted for our own room, rather than a multi share. It was clean, quiet and cute. Not super central, but resonably distanced from restaurants, and cultural sites. Busy hostel, but it’s pretty big,
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great 3 days at the hotel. Huge help from the employees after my spouse got his Iphone stolen. Busy downstairs with the bar, etc. But in the room, you hear nothing. Spacious room, simple, nothing fancy. Glad there is a security guard at the entrance, there was lots of entry/exit especially Friday and Sat nights. It was very nice to be in the center of Barcelona, around so many local cafes and restaurants. Bikes are available, 12 euros per day though.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms are well cleaned, the actual hostel bars and reception area is pretty and quirky. The place also really cheap in comparison to surrounding companies for what you get for the price. Will be back!
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE FOR MANY NIGHTSFor more than 30 USD a night, my friends and I were stuck in a hostel that took more than what they gave back. I did not like that there was no food allowed in the hostel, no events coordinated with the hostel that were free, the roof top closed at 10pm, everything thing you had to pay for (especially overly priced as well) Very ridiculous. The whole point of a hostel, is to meet other travels and have fun but generator took all that out of it. My friends and I barely got to meet other travels and because of all the stricter-demanding rules is was frustrating and hard to have a enjoyable time. I hope the charges of the towels would go down to 1 euro instead of 5 euros. In my 8 bed room, one of the soap did not even have soap. On the 3rd floor, containing the 8 bed rooms, the shared shower, 2/3 were broken. All this hostel did was suck travelers money dry. My friends and I are very upset with our many nights here. All the shared from the 8 bed room to 6 bed room to shared shower were all so cramped. My friends and I DO NOT and WILL NOT be recommending this hostel to anyone ever!P.S. The reception at night, the man COULD NOT BE ANY MORE USELESS. When asked if he could look into our upcoming room if we can check in prior before 2pm. He gave me a blank stare and said no. At least do your job.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself and my partner spent 5 nights in total at this hostel in a private double room. We were extremely impressed with the hostel overall - it was fun, lively, clean, friendly and the location was fairly good for us! It was a fair walk into the centre - I think it took us about 20-30 mins however we enjoyed stopping to view various bits and bobs along the way. Staff were amazingly friendly and couldn't help more with anything you need - I believe a lady named Roberta helped us when checking in and we mentioned we previously stayed in a certain room which she tried to get for us again! She was lovely and a credit to the company! Thank you Roberta and Generator for making our stay as good as it was! I'm sure we will be back.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the Generator Barcelona as the base for our first trip to Barcelona.Where this review references our accommodation it only extends to the Penthouse - as for the other accommodation options in the hostel (and there are a few) I can’t comment.As we were travelling as a family group (3 adult and 1 child) we needed extra space beyond what a hotel room generally offers and discovered that the Penthouse (room 801) had separate king-size and queen-size beds - perfect.The Penthouse is essentially a self-contained apartment with bathroom / rainwater shower / kitchen / dining area / lounge and two bedrooms.Almost the entire space opens out onto a spacious dual-aspect terrace with good views across the city.All the expected appliances are installed - large TV (although only Spanish channels...not a complaint, just an observation) / fridge / cooking hob etc. Staying with the kitchen space, you get a 2-ring electric hob only - no oven or microwave. Hardly a show-stopper but this is a review...Cutlery (basic table knives, forks and spoons) is provided along with plates, bowls, glasses etc.One thing worth pointing out is that when we arrived the fridge was stocked with beers, a bottle each of white wine and cava, several soda waters and cola etc. A very welcoming touch, thank you.Lounge has two large sofas (one of which converts to a bed) although we spent most of the time outside on the terrace.The 3-zone aircon did a great job of keeping the space cool and the free WiFi worked pretty flawlessly for us.The space has lots of sliding partitions to provide privacy (not soundproof) but it’s worth knowing that none of the sliding doors have locks - if your life could be ruined by someone inadvertently walking in on you in the shower you might feel a little uncomfortable. For us it wasn’t an issue - a bit of a system and “announcements” cut the risk.There’s a sound system installed with speakers throughout the lounge area into which you can connect your phone / pod.The hostel itself is pretty vibrant with lots of people / nationalities coming and going..Bar & restaurant are off the main reception and are generally busy. At the other side of the reception space is a chill-out space (and an ATM) with a games room.Notable mention to the staff we encountered - all friendly, helpful and interested in sorting issues. A credit to the hostel.All in all we had a great stay at Generator and we would love to return.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Friendly and helpful staff, good accommodations, clean and comfortable rooms and bathrooms. Good price-quality relation. Very close to a subway station that connects you to every major attraction in Barcelona. 10 minute walk from Sagrada Familia. Surrounded by a wide range of restaurants and cafes.
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stuff always expecting to help although sometimes they are overpaased with people in the check in desk.The hostel is very nice and well place it I would like to have a cheaper breakfast. The room is OK
hotelName:
17    Generator Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a wonderful hotel. We had some (self-inflicted) problems after we booked, and although they shouldn't have, the staff were amazing moving our dates for us. We honestly thought we'd have to cancel - I could have hugged them!Great location off the Rambla. The room itself was wonderful - I really recommend the rooms with the bath on the balcony. It was heaven. Absolutely my only criticism is that there is no corkscrew in the room, so we had to borrow one from the bar (I know - it's not much of a criticism really is it?!)Some of the best restaurants I have ever eaten in were just down the road - Disfrutar was the most astounding experience, and I honestly can't recommend it highly enough. If you love food - make sure you go. I'd go to Barcelona just to eat here again!Loved Barcelona - what a great city to visit. Thank you xx
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I stayed here for the last two nights. We found the hotel exceeded our expectations on a number of levels. I will list a few of the positive elements of our stay:1. Staff was very helpful, both during check in and throughout our stay. We arrived fairly early in the day and our room was not yet ready, but they were very concerned about our situation and called us as soon as our room was available.2. We are diamond members and received a wonderful upgraded room. The room was both classic in design, but also had a well-appointed modern bathroom with an excellent shower.3. Breakfast was very nice and included both Spanish and American options for those who might want either—leaning toward the Spanish, which is how it should be. The staff in the dining room was very helpful and attentive.4. The room had both a pod-style coffee maker as well as instant coffee and a hot water kettle. We used the pods in the afternoon of the first day and they brought new ones for us for the morning when we were out to dinner.5. We loved the neighborhood. It is just half a block each way to great shopping and restaurant streets. Very lively nightlife, but also not loud where the hotel is situated—kind of the best of both worlds.We had made a reservation at another hotel two days later, but decided to cancel that reservation and stay at the Alexandra instead of move. We had a wonderful few days at the hotel and would definitely return. Highly recommended!
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: OverallWe felt very welcome in this Hotel and I am glad we choose it!One of the guests had a birthday during our stay and we got a complimentary champagne bottle, thank you!We liked the hotel, because it is not that big overall and can only host a limited number of guests at a time. This somewhat gives you a bit of a more personalized approach by the staff, for example one of the wonderful staff members remembered that I prefer short style espresso coffee, instead of instant or American type, and offered me such on the consecutive days without me even asking!We checked in and out in no time, and on the last day of our stay we managed to walk around all day with our luggage safely stored at the hotel, so we do not have to carry it around until flight time!Location and transportThe location is simply perfect, we got from the BCN El Prat Airport to the hotel in literally 20 minutes time.When you look at this part of the town from the sky, it looks like perfect squares, amazing place and atmosphere!You could book a limousine or premium van chauffeur with meet and greet, who will wait for you even if there is a fight delay, can help you with luggage for about 40 - 180 euro (single or round trip), depending on the limousine type. The hotel can also offer airport or port transfer, but I have not made an inquiry about the price. There are also limousine tours with a guide who drives you around and tells you all about the city. We choose to walk instead, clocking an average of 25000 - 30000 steps per day and the cool thing was we were never more than 1 - 2 hours of walking distance from the hotel! Alternatively one can reach the hotel via public transport (3 Euro per person I think), regular taxi (about 30 Euro) or a line called Aerobus which we used about 6 euro per person for single trip. The other cool thing about the location is that is is situated next to a lot of interesting places you can see, be it historical landmarks, architecture marvels, museums, specialty cafes, craft beer bars, food places, sightseeing, etc.We used the Hilton Honors app and choose what the local Hilton guide Andre had recommended on a few occasions and we were not disappointed!HotelThe carpeting in the corridor is very soft and plush like and makes you feel like you are walking on clouds. The elevators have blue tinted see-thru glass doors! Overall the hotel is very posh.FoodThe Hotel itself has few different restaurants to choose from, how cool is that!The food is top quality all the way! If you do not have a prepaid BB package, the added price for a full continental breakfast is 20 euro per person.RoomThe AC is a brilliant unit by Japanese company Daikin, I think is it a chiller type unit, because it is virtually silent and very efficient. You can turn your room into an ice cave if you want! It is not centrally controlled by the Hotel, but by you!We had the "Twin Collection" room 508 and it was gorgeous! Initially I though we are on the upper most floor, but there appeared to be a total of 7 floors, but 2 are somehow hidden and accessible only via a key card.Inside the room there was a marvelous wooden parquet and the bathroom was finished in a very nice anti-slip way.The bathroom amenities are high class and it overall is very cozy!The beds and pillows are nice, comfy and are not fixed to the floor.I am very tall but the shower had plenty of headroom and the bed was long enough.We had a smart TV by Samsung, but it was not connected to a network, so that Netflix, Hulu, Amazon Prime, HBO Go and such can be used, but there are a ton of programs on the local channel list - we liked NHK Japan. Btw the Smart TV set does not have any physical buttons itself (like an on off switch) and is only controlled via the remote. One evening it somehow got stuck on one menu, (due to a software glitch I would presume - i.e. me pressing to many keys on the remote at the same time). Special thanks to the reception staff member who was kind enough to help us our "restart" the TV set by plugging it on and off, because it is wall mounted and I was afraid to touch it by myself.Also if you have a laptop and an HDMI cable - you can plug it in and cast something to the TV or you can use a flash drive with movies or series to watch while you chill in the hotel. There is also a small radio clock with BlueTooth and 3.5 mm audio aux jack, where you can listen to tunes from your phone, tablet or laptop.We got an amazing artwork on the wall!The sound insulation on the windows is absolutely next level, the room was perfectly silent when you close the window down!GymThe gym is small, has a total of 3 cardio machines - one elliptical, one treadmill and one stationary bicycle and a set of (light) dumbbells, but you can can a decent workout there with slow and exaggerated movements and lots of time under tension. The feeling is ballistic - the this is the first time I lifted in such an atmosphere (ps check out the floor!).Special thanks to the staff member who helped me get in the gym 5 minutes before its official opening time, and despite the fact that my key card wouldn't work to unlock it (i had forgotten to ask for an extra Gym card).There is also a small sauna there and a massage room.Patio and poolThis is among the best features IMO, I had a few beers on the Patio and received a wet towel to cool myself down even further alongside the brews, such a nice threat from the cool and friendly bartender! It really feels like a hidden gem in the heart of the city!All the staff were very nice, you can ask them for interesting restaurants and other recommendations and they are very happy to assist!
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I were thankful to stay here this past week. What a wonderful location and nice property. The staff in all areas are so helpful. The hotel is very clean and our room was so well appointed.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I paid for a "collection" type room that would have a "view" and received a room with the "view of a column" behind an extremely small window. The room was very dark that we could not see our clothes and there were no lights on the ceiling so it was even harder. The decor is also vey dark, so you can imagine how uncomfortable it was. Then to make matters worse, on our 2nd night the AC broke down in the entire building. It was summer in Barcelona, therefore we could not sleep and my kids who were in the room next to us could not either. I spent most of the night fanning my kids to sleep. So uncomfortable! The worse experience I have ever had at any hotel. In fact, I heard the staff complaining at the problem and the maintenance people saying that they should have gotten use to this problem as it always happened in summer. WOW!!! Do NOT stay here you are better off in so many other hotels in the area.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time in Barcelona and the Hotel Alexandra was a great spot for our three days in the city. We loved being so close to Casa Mila, Casa Batllo and both Passage de Gràcia and Catalunya. Easy walk to las Ramblas, El Born and Gothic Quarter.What really stood out was the helpfulness and friendliness of the staff. Morning breakfast was a highlight, and we enjoyed drinks and swimming on the rooftop. Highly recommend!
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location in a very pleasant part of the city. Room had a small balcony which was great to sit out on a warm morning. Room was fine, but wasn’t particularly well finished. Felt like it needed some improvements especially as it comes under the ‘Curio’ brand.Breakfast was excellent with plenty of choices.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location excellent service and room quality. It was a a cozy hotel but superior in all respects. The only negative is they do not have a half charge for breakfast in case you just want a continental breakfast.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are big Hilton fans and were excited to book a couple of rooms (and use some points) for five nights in Barcelona. The Alexandra was perfectly located for us. We were able to walk everywhere except for Park Guell and Camp Nou. The hotel staff were uniformly friendly and helpful. (Front desk staff member Ignasi was particularly service oriented and acted like a personal concierge.) The breakfasts were great...lots of variety and fresh. Some of the best oranges we've ever eaten! We used the business computers to book reservations and print tickets. We also took advantage of the fitness room, but it was sorely lacking in terms of space and machines. The dark (black) hallways were a bit eerie, but opened up in to well appointed rooms. We'd stay there again.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The reviews for this hotel are all over the place and there is a reason for that. Our stay was pretty terrible but had good moments.
