Everything from the rooms to the service seem to run the gamut. The real question is at this price, is it worth the risk? As for our stay, where to begin? As Hilton Gold members, my wife and I have been pleased with all of our Hilton stays up until the Alexandra in Barcelona. When we got there on our first day, we were offered an “upgraded” room which was supposed to be a king bed from a queen. Excited we headed to our room to discover two twin beds pushed together. It looked like two cots or a pull out couch. The room was dark with a tiny window and completely bare walls. It looked like it was halfway through construction with floors that were dirty and unfinished. We went back to the concierge, as we thought there was a mistake with the bed, and they were condescending and rude. They tried to convince us that the bed was a nice king but finally agreed to move us back to our original room which had nice normal bed and a good view but still looked as though it was under construction. The floor was not finished, the walls were bare, and the bathroom floor dirty. Also, it seems like the 5th floor is the floor not to be on. It is ascetically different from the other floors and was the only floor that did not require a key for access in the elevator like all the other floors. The floors in the hallway looked like they had not been vacuumed in weeks and the walls are paper thin. Also, while in Barcelona we had a mess up with our reservation at the famous Tickets restaurant that we made two months in advance. We talked to someone at the concierge who said they would call the restaurant on our behalf and sort it out. They said they would touch base with us later that day or email us. They never followed up, called, or got back to us (we ended up going to the restaurant in person and the got it sorted out ourselves - ps. Tickets was amazing). It seemed every interaction we had with the front desk was either a lie, met with a rude response, or a different answer from someone else. We asked for a late check out: one person said the hotel was sold out the next day and could not accommodate (which was not true after a basic google search), another person later the day said you have to come down in the morning at checkout time and request an extension at that time, finally we got someone who just said no problem and gave us an hour late checkout no issue. Then, even when we went to check out, we stood waiting for a while in line and when I finally asked the woman at the front desk who was ignoring us she said “you’re already checked out” without offering the final receipt or asking our room number. Confused, I had to ask if she wanted to room keys back! She didn’t ask, how was your stay? Or say thank you. Would not recommend. The reviews on here are all over the place for a reason. 50% of the time is was fine and 50% of the time it was pretty bad service and dirty. Not worth the price at all!
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: To Rambla Great location Slow , old and small elevator Good breakfast The team speaks English and some of them even Arabic and they are lovely Little expensive Near to metro stationNear to bus tour lines
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Firstly, as most reviews have noted, the location in Barcelona is great. All of the staff was very professional and nice throughout our stay. The bar on the first floor was a great place to hang out. Our overall rating would have been higher but we experienced a few issues:Physical plant: The elevator accessing our room on the 8th floor was broken on 2 out 3 days. My wife got stuck in the elevator on one of these days. We had to use the other elevator and walk up to the 8th floor several times. In addition, the hallway carpets on the 8th floor were not always the cleanest. Service inefficiency: We experienced a couple of annoying issues (keys were not programmed properly for 2 out of our three rooms; HiltonHonor points were incorrect since it appears the folios were uploaded incorrectly. The hotel indicates it was Hilton; the HiltonHonors customer rep says it was the hotel). Management is aware and apologized, so I hope these issues are addressed to benefit future guests. All in all, I would return because of the location, value and staff courteousness.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was well located for walking and public transportation. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The bartender was not attentive to customers. The food was well prepared and there was a wonderful variety.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you're looking for a great, central hotel then you've found it. The staff couldn't have been more helpful, the hotel was clean and my room was perfect. All I ask for from a hotel is cleanliness and peace and quiet at night and you'll get it here.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The entire staff is professional, courteous and friendly. Accommodation exceptional. Dinner incredible...the menu customizable, beef and meats awesome. Location is perfect is for walking about. Great local ambiance.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here a couple of nights before a cruise to explore Barcelona. This was a fantastic location!! The hotel is very nice and the staff was mostly helpful. Front desk staff and concierge were all great with my many questions. There’s a beautiful terrace with a small pool that we wanted to enjoy. However the pool was closed very early each night so we kept missing our chance. And the staff at the terrace bar were quite stuffy and made us and the other table of Americans feel unwelcome.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our four nights in the Alexandra Barcelona could not have been better! Laura at the front desk was delightful and most helpful with all of our questions about sightseeing, restaurants, travel details, etc. All of the staff was very accommodating. The Dream Suite was awesome and the breakfast buffet was delicious. The location was convenient for exploring. We were very pleased with our decision to stay here.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I booked this hotel as it is part of the Hilton Curio Collection and as a Hiton Gold member, we usually find these properties to be above average and quite nice. This property failed to live up to our expectations however, the location was fabalous, but the rooms and hotel were average at best. We also had a problem with the air conditioner and spent 2 nights in a very uncomfortable room as we were told nothing else was available, we were finally given another room on our last night. The staff were very friendly, but they did not seem empowered to fix problems. I must say the night manager Fran who finally assisted us was a great help.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was highly recommended by a luxury vacation agent as very reasonable for the high level of amenities available along with an ideal location. Our upper level corner room had a beautiful spacious view and within walking distance of the Sagrada Familia.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the Alexandra for 4 nights in May before a cruise. It’s surrounded by lots of great tapas cafes and restaurants and is close to two major Gaudi buildings: Casa Milá (La Pedrera) and Casa Battlo. Interesting walkable neighborhood. The best feature of this hotel, however, is a great staff. I had a private tour arranged that did not show up. The morning bellman, especially, went out of his way to make phone calls trying to clear it up and, eventually, patching me through to Viator to request making refund arrangements by email, not phone. He was the star, but everyone was terrific.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location of the Alexandra Barcelona was ideal. Access within a short walk to the Gaudi houses and the Sagrada Familia. Endless choices for food also within walking distance. The Shopping opportunities ranged from $$$$ to $ and all good. We stayed in the Junior Suite on the seventh floor and took advantage of the outdoor patio every evening (we stayed a week). Our room was spacious with large shower area and private facilities. The maid service was impeccable so that when returning from our walks/tours, we came ‘home’. The front desk staff ware very helpful and knowledgeable about the area and the better places to eat. Their recommendations were always spot on (especially for food). The hotel restaurant specialized in steak. The servers were helpful in navigating the many choices offered for one entrée’ (Choice of breed, size in grams, extras, and heir definition of rare, medium and well were standard (I ordered medium rare and it was, while my wife ordered well done and it was – both were very tasty and full of flavor. They offered great dessert as well!
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the perfect location in Barcelona during our pre cruise visit. Walking distance to a lot of good restaurants and shopping. A nice walk to Sagrada Família which David at the front desk recommended. The young lady ( sorry I forgot your name) at the desk, recommended Gaudin restaurant for dinner which we had the best ever seafood paella. The staff has excellent customer service, all were very kind and made you feel welcomed. The bell hop seemed like he really enjoyed his job. The accommodations meet all our needs. We would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel accommodations and staff, perfectly located to explore and experience Barcelona from. Outdoor patio terrace and pool create the perfect getaway to recharge after a full day of shopping and site seeing. Hotel is easy walking to world class shopping and dining experiences!
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family and I had an exceptional stay for 3 days in the Alexandra Hilton. The manager David and his staff made great recommendations for Barcelona restaurants and tours. They were accommodating and helpful. The hotel location was perfect! The common areas and rooms were clean, modern, and comfortable. The restaurant Solomillo food was amazing. I consider myself well traveled and had the best steak of my life in their restaurant. I plan to return to the Alexandra Hilton my next trip to Europe.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had some issues at the arrival : keys not working, room light out of order and no attention to the benefits included in the price as silver member. The staff was very kind to fix all problems. By the way, I would expect another To finish at the end I received an invoice included of some services I didn’t had, fortunately the concierge was really helpful.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my fourth trip to Barcelona in the last year. I keep trying different hotels, hoping to find a good fit for me. THIS WAS IT! I had a wonderful room (large, nice furnishings, bathroom), pool area (though small), and a great location.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’m a loyal Hilton customer, but didn’t really know what to expect when I booked this well-located Curio branded property. What a nice surprise to find this quiet little boutique hotel right in the middle of everything. We arrived super early in the morning and were able to check in immediately to our street-facing room with a little balcony on the Hilton Honors floor. Loved the unique calming black hallways, the combination of historic features (cool ceiling medallion and awesome tile floors) and modern décor in the guest room. The bathroom was cool with the high-tech shower which was a welcome feature after long days of touring on foot. Despite the street exposure, the room was quiet and restful. Appreciated also the in-room safe and fridge, and the use of the computers in the lobby for buying tickets to Barcelona attractions and checking in for our flights. Front desk staff was super helpful with every little request, even having a taxi waiting for us at 4:00 am. We will be back to Barcelona and will stay again!
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for three nights before getting on a cruise, and I selected the Alexandra for location and price. We arrived pretty late after traveling for 22 hours and were greeted warmly and quickly - up in our room inside of ten minutes. The staff during our entire stay was truly nice and top notch.We booked a king room, which for *European standards*, was pretty spacious with a nice large bathroom. The room was clean, comfortable and sleep quality great. I run pretty hot, so I was pleasantly surprised that I could cool down the room adequately given many hotels govern the HVAC systems during different seasons. The location was fantastic and we could walk to almost anywhere that we were not getting to via a Hop On/Off Bus pass we had for two days. There were tons of restaurants, shopping and coffee shops within half a mile of the hotel, many of the big sites to see in Barcelona were within an easy 1.5 mile walking radius. We had breakfast one morning in the restaurant which was buffet style and quite good. Another evening we had dinner in their restaurant Solomillo which was excellent.The only two negatives were -- housekeeping did not refresh in the in-room coffee each day (I hate that) and the shower was kind of weird with the shower head coming from the wall not working, so you had to remove this side shower head to rinse off and shower.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay at this hotel, and couldn't have requested a better location. Walking distance to many top tourist attractions and ideally located near dozens of great restaurants and bars. If you are visiting Barcelona for the first time and have plans to go sightseeing and tasting great local cuisine, this is your ideal hotel. Additionally, they have great amenities, friendly staff, onsite parking if needed, and their nightly rate is great, compared to most other QUALITY hotels in the area. Once you stay here, you'll be recommending this place to others.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This property is full of lairs and ignorant people. Worst staff and management. They don’t care if you are a diamond member and they don’t treat you right. Room was not ready even when I was told it will be ready by a certain time.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this room at the last minute via the HHonors App. We liked the location but were very disappointed with the room itself. The room was dark, poorly furnished and reminded me of a college dorm room. The breakfast was good and the location was excellent. I travel quite a bit for leisure and this was the first time that I was truly disappointed on my choice of hotels. They also made me pay in advance for the room upon arrival which I have not done in the past and thought that was a bit strange.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One kilometer from the Sagrada Familiae and perhaps 1.5 kilometers from the port and less than one kilometers from the Ramblas shopping district. Could you possibly come up with a more central location that this?Very modern interior and extremely comfortable. Small cozy bar that serves food if you need it.Service staff here are very friendly, and will quickly resolve whatever issue you put to them.Yes, the reviews for this hotel are all over the place, as is typical. But our experience was top notch and we would have no problem with recommending this hotel to anyone.By the way, the hotel is on a busy street but street noise is minimal due to the excellent sound proofing in the exterior walls.Since we did not drive here, I have no idea of the parking, so cannot comment on that aspect.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As a loyal Hilton customer, I had high expectations for my first stay at a Curio Collection but my experience was average. The staff is great - kind, customer oriented. Breakfast is great. The patio and pool area is very quaint and has a nice vibe. However the King Suite room was very plain and small. Walls were empty and bland. Some Barcelonian art or pictures would add a nice vibe to the room. The walls are paper thin - you can hear everything on the adjacent rooms. I would like to recognize David from the Front Desk for going above and beyond in helping me when I was under the weather. This was a positive.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This boutique hotel is perfectly located one block off La Rambla, 15 minutes walk from both Sagrada Familia and the Gothic Quarter. We safely walked every where day and night. The rooms are smartly decorated and up to date. A lobby bar and a restaurant totally dedicated to meat, coupled with the nicest staff we have encountered lately make us already dream of a return.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A strange thing happened during my stay. I left valuables in my room.Xavier Martinez and the manager David went above and beyond to get my items back to me.The hotel is fabulous but the service and integrity are unmatched at the Alexander.The location is exactly where tourists and businessmen want to be. You won’t regret this and I’ll remember both David and Xavier for years to to come! Muchisimas gracias.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is within walking distance to hotels, restaurants and shopping. The hotel is clean, breakfast is great and the staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel is safe. The area is safe. Getting transportation was easy. Close to the airport.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I very much like to choose Alexandra Barcelona as my accommodation, again and again! Amiable staff, professional as well as personally friendly. Also at the bar, where you can be sure that Alesandro, Arlan & Co. have a good drop of wine to go with the exquisite Joselito Jamón. And the location is excellent, even 50m further my beloved Tapas Cerveceria. The breakfast buffet is abundant, also with local delicacies on offer (tomato bread, olive oil, and Jamón ibérico). Warned in time and therefore not tested myself - I have been told that the hotel garage is only designed for real professionals with mini cars, so when traveling by car, it is better to choose a P alternative near the hotel.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I have to take this moment to thank the other members who have written reviews about this hotel and given spot on information. Conveniently local, with access to transportation around the city and harbor area. Cafes, tapas and restaurants everywhere. Rooms are modern and wire-fi ready.However the walls are very thin and you are going to need to have the television on in order to handle your business.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I'm really surprised at the poor reviews I've seen here. I also booked on points thanks to a lot of nights in Hilton hotel properties and we were treated very well by every single person on staff. we stopped at the front desk a few times for restaurant/shopping and sightseeing suggestions, to hail a cab, etc. and every time was a very good experiencevery centrally located with high-end shopping 1/2 block away and a ton of great restaurants within walking distancethe room was fine. seemed clean if a little dated. there weren't enough toiletries in the room when we arrived, that that was easily remedied next time we stopped at the deskminor nit: the rooftop pool could use some updating. it's not as inviting as you might expect from the photoswe didn't have time to try the beautiful restaurant, but had we more time we would have for sureI definitely recommend this hotel and would likely re-book next time we're in Barcelona
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall a very nice property . The staff was very friendly and helpful Some things to keep in mind The rooms are sparsely appointed. Meaning there is very little storage. You will be living out of your suitcase If you are an honors member , you will get breakfast for 2 people only ( regardless of the number of rooms you have )The rooms are quite loud , meaning you can hear everything from neighboring rooms , upstairs , etc There is free WiFiThere is a small grocery next door (which is convenient )There is a small bar and also a restaurant on site You have to walk about 4 blocks to the start of the shopping district (short walk)You can walk to the Basilica (15 - 20mins)
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed at this excellent hotel whilst watching Man Utd play in Barcelona. The location is very good . With a main railway station 5 mins walk away . And diagonal metro station round the corner . It’s situated in a superb upmarket shopping area . Staff were excellent and knowledgable. We had a problem with the entry to our room which was corrected quickly with a complimentary bottle of champagne for our inconvenience. The room was spacious and comfortable. The bathroom was superb . Bar open until midnight... all in all highly recommended.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time in Barcelona and a very big part of the amazing experience we had there is due to the staff (recommendations).Great location! You MUST have a dinner at the hotel's restaurant! Best meat I ever had!I surly going to return to this hoter again
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This boutique hotel has an excellent location, helpful staff, pleasant rooms, and a delicious breakfast. (They don’t seem to tell you about it but you can special order any egg dish.) An easy walk to shops, restaurants, and Sagrada Familia. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I enjoyed my stay at the Alexndra Barcelona Hotel. The location was walking distance to Gaudi's La Padrera and also a 1 mile walk to La Sagrada Familia. The staff was really friendly and helpful, too, recommending a delicious restaurant and helping us find our way around. I would return!
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Beautiful accommodations. Nice modern hotel in the center of town. Rooms and bathrooms modern and clean. Delicious breakfast. Beautiful bar and restaurant with delicious drinks and food. Gracious and helpful hotel staff. Very helpful in finding locations and providing information about Barcelona. Definitely worth staying here as it provides more than just a regular hotel experience.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed five nights at this hotel. The location was ideal for exploring the city. Easy walk from the Aerobus drop off spot. Sleeping area is kind of small but we liked the big modern bathroom. Thoroughly enjoyed the free breakfast daily. The buffet offered a wide selection of fruit, meats, cheese, pastries, cereal, eggs,and yogurt. Staff (all fluent in English) was super helpful and helped us find restaurants and plan a class. Forgot our converter and we were able to borrow one from the hotel. Super pleased with this hotel!
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location. Awesome staff across the board. 5 ⭐️ Service!!! Will be back.......especially enjoyed personalization by all staff members. They knew who we were! Also great recommendations on where to eat for lunch and dinner
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great stay at Hilton hotel. The bar food and bar drinks were just beyond belief. The outside tables and chairs to people watch made it even better. Great lobby staff and very helpful. Just a great place to stay in Barcelona.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a fantastic stay in Barcelona - very central location and a great bar to have a drink coming back from our tours and after dinner.We got some good recommendations where to go as well.Our next stay in Barcelona will surely be in the Alexandra Hotel as well.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: No air conditioning working. Old hotel, not updated, terrible service. Toilet in one room not working. Street facing rooms. Very loud, book through Expedia and you are a 2nd class citizen, even if you are Hilton honors gold or above. Solutions were a fan or two lower quality rooms. DO NOT stay here!!!!
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a lovely stay. It was my mom, myself and my husband. We took a dream suite which was large and had a magnificent bathtub in the room. The bathroom was large with a fantastic shower. We had the included breakfast due to Hilton status which was very good. WiFi was very reliable. The pool terrace was lovely and on our arrival day we took a nap there before our room was ready. Do have the cheesecake from the restaurant!The staff were very helpful. My mom got sick and staff assisted us to get clean towels and remove waste. I usually really enjoy hotel lobbies but the furniture was very uncomfortable. It was too low for you to easily get up from and had no support. I would recommend replacing those sofas. The location is lovely. You are within walking distance of many lovely cafes and landmarks. I would definitely return!
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at checking/out was always very friendly and helpful.The restaurant staff every morning was like a ray of sunshine.The rooms, restaurant menu and fitness area were my larger issue. Not a huge negative compared to the location and very friendly staff. Rooms: bathrooms lacked towel racks and drying bars. Also, sink and toilet, in totally separate rooms.... to many doorsWith contaminated hands! Restaurant needs a non beef meal and fitness room at least needs a bench for dumbbell use. Stairs with black and white create depth perception issues.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time was with kids and wife in a suite. This time just wife for work in regular room (should have gotten suite). Place is as good as I remember last. Location great, by all shopping. Cant wait to return.
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for two nights in a pre-paid King Deluxe room because their website says it's a "larger" room.Upon checking in they gave us a tiny King Superior room that was so small there wasn't any room to pass each other. We asked for another room only to be told they were sold out....After complaining about the " bait & switch" we felt had happened they miraculously found the room type I had paid for. Not a best practice but many hotels do it - so beware not only here but at all places that offer a pre-paid rate. You pay for the "larger" room upfront and they give you a tiny shoebox - hoping you don't notice. Our room had the strangest layout of any we've ever stayed in. Crazy bathroom and shower combination and the mosaic tile floors looked dirty - our feet confirmed that every night getting in bed.As for the general feel of the hotel, it's dated - really outdated.The lobby furniture is from the 60's mod era. the sofas are so low to the ground anyone over 50 will have to roll onto the ground to get up, and then only with assistance ! LOL The hallways are dark brown/black - floor to ceiling all black with black carpeting and low lighting - felt more like a fetish club than a major hotel chain. The area is noisier than staying on Las Ramblas - very busy streets day & night and with the hotel not having air conditioning at this time of year, we had to open the windows just to moderate the temperature but it came at the cost of noise.After a long day of sight seeing, we came back to the hotel without elevator service because they were using both of them to unload furniture...I agree the furniture needs replacing, but not if that forces the customers to walk up flights of stairs, it was poor judgement.Probably one of the worse Hilton branded properties we have stayed in.Note to self.... go back to Le Meridien, Hotel H1898 or The Royal all on Las Rambas. you'll be happier !
hotelName:
18    Alexandra Barcelona Hotel, Curio Collection by...
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel. Clean. Smells beautiful throughout. Modern. Good facilities in the room.. ie decent size TV, kettle, water & fruit daily. Helpful English speaking reception staff. Nice touch on arrival with fizz, fruit & pastries. Also has a check out room to use if leaving later than check out time for freshening up before flight etc if you are making the most of the sunshine on the terrace before leaving Beautiful Barcelona. This hotel is within walking distance of tourist spots, metro station.... and the big red tourist bus...which is a must!!! Enjoy.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I recently visited Barcelona, Spain, Andorra, and France and our first hotel for this trip was the Leonardo Boutique Hotel-Sagrada Familia....We took the Metro from the airport and had about a two block walk to get to our hotel. Real easy.Upon entering we were greeted nicely and were told we would have to leave our luggage as it was early and rooms were not ready yet. We dropped off our luggage and headed down the street. About a 15 minute walk and we were right in front of the Sagrada Familia...This hotel's location could not have been better !When we checked in we headed to our room and were delighted on how nice it was. Small but well organized and very clean. All the halls and common areas were well maintained. We then headed up to the rooftop terrace and solarium to check it out....And the views were amazing...There were lounge chairs on the solarium side and it was very comfortable and relaxing....In fact we went to the solarium every night to sit and check out the Barcelona skyline as it lit up for sundown....It was a great spot to share a glass of wine, local Estrella Beer, and a baguette.....Perfect way to end the day.....The Leonardo Boutique Hotel-Sagrada Familia was an excellent choice for us and I am sure you will love it too.....
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 1. Location is good for metro and direct train line to Brcelona airport2. Room - we had a balcony which was great but the room itself was not the biggest. The bed was huge and comfy and the cleanliness was good. The little fridge is good for keeping your drinks nice and cool.The shower once you got used to it was great and the toiletries were replenished daily.3. Balcony - it only had one lounger so there was a daily bun fight to see who got it as the chairs were not comfy.4. Breakfast - The usual continental choices supplemented with hot ones; however stop messing with beans they dont need herbs!The cava at breakfast was a nice touch so do it yourself bucks fizz or Belinnis were puzzled.5. Staff- helpful and courteous at all times 6. No bar area but plenty locallyOverall not a bad stay but not quite theboutique experience we were expecting and had recently experienced in Seville.Overall I would say the hotel was
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Traveling with baby is always a challenge , but we make a great decision by choosing this hotel to stay ! Suite room was a blast ! Big room with kitchen, comfortable bed, breakfast is quite good. Staff were kind, helpful even help us to book our ticket to Camp Nou and the hotel also provide welcome drink, snack.definitely will stay in this hotel again if we go to Barcelona
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean room with air conditioning and hotel location near clot metrostation (by metro easy access to Rambla and sagrada familia, without change). Nice local small restaurants, beauty salongs and minimarkets near. Would choose this hotel again.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here with 7 friends for my stag weekend recently.Location wise it’s easy to get Into central Barcelona by metro, which helps as there’s not a lot to do in the evening in this area.There is a really cheap bar next door, so good for cheap start to a night out.Ask for rooms on lower floors, as the lift isn’t reliable.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For overseas tourists, the most important criteria is location.This hotel scores full marks for that. It is within short walking distance to the Clot Metro station. From there you are connected to the entire Barcelona, places of interests, etc. The El Clot-Arago Renfe train station is also nearby which connects to Barcelona Santa for onward train connections to other cities and Barcelona International airport or Aeroport.The staff were friendly and most helpful with whatever questions you may hv. For €9, you can avail yourself to their decent albeit limited budget breakfast.Room was comfy, clean and well maintained. The free WiFi is good.Just next door to the hotel is a supermarket with super afforded prices for take away food such as roast chicken, BBQ pork ribs, sandwiches, pastries, drinks, etc. There are plenty of cafes around too.Recommended by a seasoned traveller.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived at the hotel and the staff were very welcoming, within 10 minutes I arrived to my room. Breakfast was include with my booking. Gorgeous continental breakfast, plenty of choice and variance within the stay. Room was very clean and spacious, just enough for three guests. Beds were comfy. The room was cleaned everyday, even mopped the floor. Quite a central locations, considering all the areas we visited were between 10-40 minutes walks. Clot metro line is literally around the corner. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel to my friends and family, very welcoming and very clean.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a trip for 4 people (3 adults, 1 child) for the 6-11 April 2019 and when I booked the hotel, I was basically looking for a reasonably priced hotel in a decent location and the hotel far exceeded our expectations! We were able to check in a little earlier and the reception staff were very helpful and confirmed that the entrance to our room was a little walk away as we had a "VIP" entrance! The little walk was literally around the back of the main hotel entrance and was secured by a door and entrance buzzer. When we got to the room, we were really pleased with it (room 008). It was a suite with bedroom, living area (with double sofa bed), kitchen area, spotless bathroom (with free goodies) and a balcony/terrace area. Two large telly's in both rooms (we hardly used it) and wardrobe in the main bedroom. Room/hotel was very very quiet with the Clot metro station literally outside which provided easy access to the attractions. Room was cleaned every day and free bottles of water and apples were left. The hotel is definitely on the list for future visits and I'll be looking for the Leonardo hotels in other locations in the future.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 3 nights. We booked a superior double room. It was big, night and airy. The shower was fab. The place was clean with a big comfy bed. Breakfast was lovely, with lots of choice. The staff were super friendly and helpful. The Metro / train stations are close by, so it’s easy to get around. Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Quite a small room, cheapest available but to be honest we only used it for sleeping and showering, was far too busy otherwise seeing the sights of Barca. Very good reception staff, small supermarket right next door & very close to clot metro station. I’d stay again if I wanted to be based in this part of the city but would probably stay elsewhere next time for a change.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here in April with my girlfriend for a long weekend, the hotel location is pretty good it’s not too close to the centre but there is an underground station no more than 2 minutes away or about a 5-10 minute Uber ride into the heart of the city. The style of the hotel is very modern and a good place to stay for young couples, the room was really clean with comfy beds and a nice bathroom, the windows give you a good view of other buildings around. Didn’t have much interaction with any staff but they seemed friendly on arrival and departure.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location, easy access to public transport, friendly staff (bubbly on arrival is always a winner!) nice room, good breakfast - everything perfect for a quick weekend away. Would happily stay here again
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is in a good location, not far from the Clot metro station and some attractions, shopping and many cafes. It has the best shower we have ever experienced, but one of the worst WiFi connection-- uneven and slow (less than 0.5 mB/sec at times), with a very weak signal. The rooms are small but well equipped, however, they have the most peculiar "decoration" in the form of a window between the bathroom and the room. Forget about privacy in the bathroom, or visiting the bathroom at night-- you'll wake up your room-mate if you turned on the light there.They have neither a restaurant nor a bar, but serve breakfast (for extra charge). We asked for a second blanket and took several requests until we actually got one, hours later. The AC is noisy and its thermostat seems not to function at all. In short-- very expensive for what you get.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived a little early for check in and was met by Marie on the front desk she was efficient, friendly and very helpful. We left our case without any problem at the hotel and had a look about when we came back our rooms had been upgrade. Can i just say WOW room 901 and 902 are spacious and stylish and the balconies are just superb a lovely space to spend some time. The hygiene and cleanliness could not be faulted very high standards. Location is amazing! It's a straight road to the sagarda de familia and only takes about 15 minutes. Don't miss out in the cafes close by the food is so good. A wonderful experience thank you!
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This modern design hotel is located near the Tube, which is the best way to move in BCN. The rooms are nice though the views from the window are nothing special. The bathroom is fine but needs some maintenance soon. Good breakfast. Good option for a short stay.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is ideally situated to explore Barcelona being 5 minutes from the Metro & 10 minutes from Sagrada Família which can be seen from the hotel roof terrace.The rooms were cleaned daily & our room was a good size.There was a good selection for breakfast & there were many tapas bars near the hotel.All in all this is a good place to stay & a bargain at the price.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights and secured a good rate to include breakfast.The plus points:Polite StaffClean Room, good towels and linen.Good Quality BreakfastEasy Access to Metro (Clot) & Renfe Station (Clot-Arago)The Negatives:Lift is noisy if your room is nearby. Long wait at breakfast for lift. There is only one!Room not cleaned by 3pm on day two - this is too late if you want to rest. THis needs to be reviewed.Area is Clot - not Sagrada Familia. Don't be fooled by name.Street can be noisy.We would return if we needed too. That said, we would likely find somewhere else which must be an indication that we were not 'wowed' by this hotel.If you have booked here, you should be fine. Just be mindful of the need to use the Metro for a quick transfer to the city centre (buy a T10 card).
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So the location is great in a safe neighbourhood. The rooms were very clean and the bed very comfortable. The breakfast is mediocre at best. Staff are lovely. Room size is good but just feels very dark. Would try a different hotel next time we come.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We Did not book the hotel as it was part of our trip, organised by the travel company. It was about a 25min drive from the airport and about 40 euros - there was a tube station very nearby but with our luggage we decided to take a taxi. The Reception area was lovely and clean -with lemon infused water and apples on the counter.The staff were friendly and their English was very good. We were told we had been upgraded to a larger room (although I do wonder if they were overbooked) This meant that we had to go outside, round the block and ring the bell which was answered remotely by the reception staff at the main hotel. The lobby was impersonal and smelt of cigarettes. Our Key card did not work and my husband had to ring the bell again to contact reception. Initially, we were asked to collect another card key - but the male receptionist quickly overode that and said he would bring it round. To be honest, I was glad not to be left outside our room door as the area was a little bit scary late at night..Once inside, the room and shower room were great - and we were very surprised to see a two ring hob, a microwave, fridge as well as utensils, saucepans, plates etc. There was also a medium sized bottle of water and 2 large apples.The bed was big and comfy and in the morning, we were able to walk across a roof terrace to breakfast in the main building (this was only open at breakfast time) The meal was 10euros each - a buffet - but a good choice was available.We were able to leave our luggage locked behind the reception area until we needed to leave for our cruise - and were directed to the terrace/library or solarium. The library had wonderful wallpaper looking like bookshelves and just a very few books but the plus side was that there was a loo there as there was not one in reception. The terrace was peaceful with a great view over Barcelona - Hubby went exploring and came back to get me as the solarium was actually a sun terrace with loungers. I spent a wonderful 15 mins enjoying the sun,We went back to reception and they called a taxi to take us on the 20 min trip to the port -about 35 euros. If we return to Barcelona, I would definitely use this hotel again but would probably ask to stay in the main building.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very conveniently located within a 5-6 minute walk to the “Clot” Metro subway station in a very safe comfortable neighborhood. The hotel has been recently remodeled. Rooms are a bit small by American standards but adequate. The breakfast came with our rooms and offered a great assortment of beverages, breads, meats (cold and hot) , fruits, bake goods and juices. You will not go away hungry. The Metro provide very economical, safe, quick transportation. Purchase the 10 –ride pass at its only $1.05 euros per ride.Do not buy ham or sausages to bring back to the USA. The vendors will tell you "no problems" but if you declare it at customs they will confiscate meats. Note that Parc Guell and Sagrada Familia both issue time sensitive tickets, giving you a 30 minutes window to enter. We went and tickets were sold out for the day at Park Guell and for the next four days to Sagrada Familia. We were able to purchase a ticket on line for both venues from a ticketing agency for the 50% premium.The hotel may be rated 3 stars by amenities but we received 5 star service. As first-time tourist to Barcelona we had a lot questions.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Situated just outside main city but close to top attractions, and close to good public transport connections, including to/from airport, the hotel was Ideal. The staff were helpful and friendly, and the room was clean and comfortable, some bathroom fixtures were beginning to show some wear but again was clean and worked as a base to enjoy Barcelona from. The breakfast was typical continental style, and again the staff there were helpful and friendly, ready to show how things like coffee machine worked (watched staff member happily show grumpy ungrateful American "lady" how to work equipment and where plates/cups etc were stored.. don't you love our American friends?). I used the laundry facility and had the item back same day, washed and ironed and hung in my room, great. I'd use this hotel again if visiting Barcelona.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First time in Spain, Barcelona - booked for 4 nights. The hotel was clean and pleasant. Everyday my room had a tidy up which we didn't expect but most importantly the service we received from the hotel staff was excellent. I don't know the name of the asian receptionist but she worked late shifts, she made our check-in smooth and helped us with the touristy locations and was extremely helpful. Would recommend to stay again in future. Thanks for the brilliant stay!
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our room including the bathroom was larger as we expected, a pleasant surprise. It was very clean with modern furniture. The staff was very kind and for that price we had a great stay for one week in Barcelona. The close proximity to the metro station is perfect to easily get all around the city. If I were to visit Barcelona again I would probably stay at the same hotel again.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed 3 nights while on a business trip, it is such a great location just off Las Ramblas.Hotel is clean & modern, rooms are small but that is to be expected in the city centre. Bar downstairs is pretty quiet but a good location to work from during the day.Breakfast is a cold buffet & it was tasty.I didn’t have any meals other than breakfast in the hotel as it is literally 5 minutes walk from dozens of restaurants, bars and La Boqueria food market which has everything you need!
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is very well located in Barcelona as it is within 15 minutes by metro of the main activities in Barcelona, it is 15 minutes walking ti the Sagrada Familia Church and it is also 5 minutes away from the next metro station. Rooms are comfortable clean and with good air conditioning and that counts a lot as it gets hot in summer in Barcelona. The hotel offers for breakfast for 11 Euros per person but I didn't try the breakfast. Their personal is attentive courteous and willing to help. The area is safe to walk around and there are many shops bakeries restaurants in commercial places in the same street of the hotel.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel have very knowledgable friendly staff especially Maria on the front desk, the breakfast has lots of variety inc, , fruit, pastries, cereal, toast, croissants, Cold meats, endless different tea & coffee, for 10 euros. It’s near Metros stations & hop on hop of busses. It has a two showered curtesy room with aseperate llo with hairdryer , which is cleaned before the next person uses it! .... I totally would recommend it & stay there again.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, comfortable, quiet - and within a reasonable walking distance of the Sagrada Familia. Also very handy to the Clot metro station. Staff on reception were helpful and friendly but reception got very busy with only one staff member on, and multiple groups checking in/out. Would happily stay again however.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here as an unexpected extension to our holiday in Barcelona (emergency case including a hospital visit). Choose the hotel last minute over the price and the relative proximity to our previous hotel. The hotel itself is new and modern, in a residential neighbourhood with many small shops and restaurants in an immediate vicinity.Location: Slightly outside the central zone, in probably 20 min walk to Sagrada Familia (it is located in the same street, but the streets in Barcelona are very long). Metro stop of two lines in 2min walk, so you can easily reach the central part of the city.Room: Stayed in a comfort room that looked exactly as hotel's web site. Decent size room with big flat TV, AC, small table. Small wardrobe, so not many space to hang your clothes. No mini bar (the fridge is empty), but you get tea/coffee set as an compliment. All rooms facing the street, so nice views over the city. Nice bathroom with great shower.Service/amenities: The hotel itself is not big and there is no place to hang around apart in your room. It is 9-storey building with sun terrace on the last floor. There are small "library" (which was used as a luggage storage room for a big group) and TV room with vending machines for those needing a refreshment late. Both rooms with no natural light.The hotel's lobby is small, with only a small sofa, that it looks more like an waiting room than a lobby of a 3* boutique hotel.We did not take the breakfast (so I can't comment on it), but saw there is nice terrace adjoining the breakdast room where you can sit in the mornings.Do not get me wrong, the hotel is nice, new and modern. In a city like Barcelona probably you won't be staying much in your hotel for more than sleeping. But I personally would prefer to have a little more space where you can sit and do not feel like you are bothering the reception's personnel.Will I stay here again? For the right price and if there is nothing more central, probably yes. Otherwise I would look for an alternative.Note to reception's and hotel management: do not forget that hotel guests may understand what you are talking about even if they are not from spanish speaking country. I may prefer to speak in english, but that doesn't mean I can't speak and uderstand spanish perfectly fine.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I LOVED our 4 night stay at the Leonardo Boutique Hotel at the end of May. The staff are so professional, lovely and accommodating. They efficiently organised my request for dry cleaning and promptly sorted out an extra night in our room when our flight out of Barcelona was unexpectedly cancelled. The room and ensuite we had was GREAT. It had all we wanted. It was clean, modern, comfortable and just the right size. The location is very good with a metro and a standard railway line both in close proximity to the hotel. The Sagrada Famiglia is about a 20 minute walk away or a quick few minutes on the metro. There are also buses and a tram close by. The tapas we had in the neighbourhood and a homely restaurant we went to close by to the hotel were fantastic with flavoursome food. We had the best chat with the shoe shop man where I bought a pair of sandals. There was a small market on one of the days; and the local cafes, serving jamon rolls are fantastic. Everyone is so friendly. We loved Barcelona and we loved the Leonardo Boutique Hotel. We would recommend this hotel to anyone. It's great.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed 6 nights in a one-bedroom suite with kitchenette and spacious deck in the hotel's adjoining apt. Hotel staff were enormously helpful and the housekeeping was a very high standard. A 15-minute walk to Sagrada Familia, and 15-minute Metro ride to Las Ramblas, from Clot station which is metres from the hotel.We liked staying in this quieter area with a great local vibe. Would definitely stay there again.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've been in this hotel for a 4 days trip to Barcelona at the end of April with my girlfriend.It has nice,clean and comfy rooms and the receptionists have been really nice and accomodating. They speak perfectly English.In 20/25 min walking you are at the Sagrada Familia, otherwise there's the metro just a few meters away from the hotel.Honest prices for the quality they provide, breakfast maybe a bit too expensive.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although the apartment unit was a little inconvenient as to the location to the reception and main hotel, it was clean, comfortable and well equipped. The biggest complaint I had was no one knew how to operate the on site clothes washer or dishwasher and no instructions were available. We ate breakfast in the main hotel area. The breakfast was a pleasant European buffet selection of cold cuts, yogurts, breads, sweet rolls, fruits and juices.There was a selection of hot foods along the lines of European fare (read "soggy bacon").The physical location is close to the famous Sagrada Familia. (within a 20 minute walk)
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It’s ok for short stay but the “double bed” was 2 joined single bed and it keeps moving around. so if 2 people plan to sleep together, either you stick to 1 bed and squeeze in or forget about it. also the mattress seems like it’s the cheapest one you could find in the market.the sofa was super old but they still put it there. the leather of the sofa was chipping off ALL over! it would be way better to just take it out, maybe the rating would be higher. though it’s good location super close to the metro station and super market. and the staff are nice.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great service from reception staff. Room small but comfortable. Aircon frustratingly too warm and not controllable so we had the window open all night. Breakfast good but a little overpriced. Good location with buses and metro close by.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 5 days in the Leonardo Boutique hotel and from the first day, the staff was very attentive and helpful. The room was always nicely cleaned by the housekeepers. The hotel has a good location, close to the metro. At the breakfast was always plenty of choices and all of them was very tasty. There was no question or request that the reception couldn't manage. It was amazing 5 days in Barcelona and this hotel was one of the main reasons why we really enjoyed it.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros: location near metro, friendly staff, very good breakfast, priceCons: small and not very comfortable room which was cold the first night and heated very slowlyAll-in-all the hotel is ok for staying a couple of nights
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Boked for one night on way back to France. Very friendly staff and the room was great, very clean and spacious and wifi access fantastic. Great access to Metro and Sagrada Familia within walking distance. Plenty of bars and cafes nearby and would stay here again no problem.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is clean and staff is helpfull.We had big room at the streetside on first floor.. Without opening Window you don 't hear the street. Bathroom was also very good. Shower had enough power. Breakfast is perfect. In summerdays they have a terrace where you can chill
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just two streets, less than 5 minutes, from the Ramblas. Direct access to the metro. Clean rooms and very friendly staff. Hotel has a great atmosphere nice design several spaces in the lobby to sit and enjoy a drink, each section another theme.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was on one of the main streets of Barcelona, but in the room was very quite. The hotel is very nice, clean , the prices were more than ok for this location. The personal was very nice. The bathroom was exquisite for a 3 stars hotel. I truly recommend this one.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for four nights. We were satisfied with our stay. The hotel is very clean, there is a handy sun terrace. The breakfast is adequate and the staff in the restaurant are polite. The male reception staff were very friendly and helpful. We would stay here again.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We has a lovely time here in a suite. Back entrance to the suite was only 100m to the subway entrance. Room was very clean and tidy, well appointed with a nice private courtyard. We had a few minor issues which were fixed most promptly. Staff are friendly and attentative and speak good English.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel location is excellent, 1 minute to a metro stop, which took us pretty much everywhere. 10 minutes from sagrada familia. Rooms were also kept extremely clean, beds were very comfy. Stayed in a room for 3 (2 single beds and a sofa bed) room size was perfect and big enough for us all. Reception staff were brilliant.. only downfall poor wifi.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is nice form the design point of view, the problem at the check in was that we had to wait for 2 hours before entering in the room that was anyway not ready yet.The receptionist (a very professional guy) tried to push the room service to end the cleaning job asap.Breakfast is nice but nothing special.Rooms are ok, clean and not noisyWhat we didn't like is the behavior of the other receptionist (a girl) that even didn't say hello to us while entering in the hotel, she just stared us and ignored me while I was waiting for her to ask an information, she was not smiling at all and answered in a very cold way (just the opposite of the receptionist man that was very gentle).If you need just a place for sleeping and nothing more then this hotel is ok, becasue is 10 minutes far from sagrada familia.Maybe price is a little too high for the service they propose.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good hotel for a short stay in Barce. We had an issue checking in, we paid upfront for the room when we booked so the room was already paid for. When we checked in the 2 slightly rude girls on the desk said we needed the card we used to pay for security reasons to prove who we were despite having other cards in the same name & our passports this wasn't good enough for them. They said we couldn't check in without it so we had to leave our bags with them while we went into the city & waited for a relative back home to take a photo of the card and send it to us. This meant we couldn't use our room to freshen up after a long day of traveling. This was sorted later that day but some basic common sense from the hotel staff would have fixed this. Very stupid.Location is a little way outside of the city but good public transport links solve this problem. We got the train from the airport to Clot main-line station which is only a 5 min walk away. Also Clot has a metro stop with an entrance just meters from the hotel.The rooms are basic but nice for what you pay. Shops in the area for food and drink if you need any in your room. Bed was comfy & the was pretty quiet at night, our room faced the main street.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent hotel, very good attention, rooms, centrally located, with possibilities to use the metro and bus, I recommend the hotel for its services, location, comfort, attention The metro that can be used is the red line and the bus 62 also take you to plaza catalunya
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the hotel is just a short walk from the Sagrada Familia, there is a metro station very near to the hotel which make it easy to reach the city center and old town. The rooms was comfortable and reasonable for a three star hotel. the staff was very friendly and breakfast was tasty.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hotel for a surprise trip for my fiance'. When making the reservation I told them that it is a birthday surprise and when entering the room we found it decorated very nicely with balloons and chocolates and even a birthday note. It was so thoughtful and sweet. The room was clean and staff was very friendly. Would highly recommend this hotel because although it is not in the centre , the metro is only 2 mins away.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is just a short walk away from the Sagrada Familia. Breakfast was delicious, nice view of the Torre Glories from the rooftop at night. It's less than a ten minute walk from the train station which is also very convenient. I would stay here again!
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here with a group of hoteliers from my country.The hotel is 10-15 minutes walk from the Sagrada Familia, at the 9th floor they have great sun deck and balcony.At breakfast the variety is limited but very tasty, the staff is great and they refreshing the buffet fast.As a receptionist I wanted to see how other receptionist contact with guests,Juan- he is the perfect example for a good customer service, Emill is very nice and polite and the morning staff as well.The elevator is slow.I didn't liked the smell of the soup/shampoo the hotel offers.Near the hotel there is a supermarket which is open approximately until 2AM,I would definitely come back and stay in this hotel.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel has been the best we've experienced in Europe by far, I am very surprised it only has 3 stars. They offer fresh fruit water in the lobby daily and free big bottles of water in the room daily as well. The rooms are spacious and very clean. Air conditioning works very well. The breakfast is also very good, a lot of options and delicious. The location is great a short walk to the Sagrada Familia and literally 3 minute walk to the metro which takes you into the city area. The staff is very friendly and always there to help and answer any questions. I would definitely recommend staying here and will stay here again if I visit again. Do bring your own adapter though to charge iPhone.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location right in the center of town. Room although a bit cramped are perfectly OK, as is the bathroom and very clean. The rooftop poll area is small and was not much space to sit and lounge by the pool. Only had a breakfast one morning as wanted to get out and about but was very good and plenty of choice cost 11 euro. We got what we wanted from this hotel , only used to sleeping a just so much to do Barcelona, you really dont spend much time in the hotel.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our 'Park Guell Cozy Apartment' AirBnB host Patricia let us down badly (cancelled with less than 48 hours' notice), and we found this lovely hotel in another part of Barcelona which turned out to be a gem. El Clot - Agora is on the train line from Girona where we began our trip and adjoins the Metro line, great for getting to Urquinaona (Paula del la Musica Catalana) and to San Andrea - a real village atmosphere.The staff were extremely helpful and friendly, the room (although not large - it is a boutique hotel after all) was clean, comfortable and quiet. There are two patisseries within 3 minutes' walk where you can but the most amazing croissants.Great view of Sagrada Familia from the roof terrace.
hotelName:
19    Leonardo Boutique Hotel Barcelona Sagrada Familia
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We traveled three of us. The room was clean with good AC, covenient to go many places and didn't hear loud noses from other rooms nor street. Located walking distance to Sagrada Familia, major brand shopping street. The restaurantes and cafes close by were very reasonablly priced and delicious. Recommend to go La Musclira for seafood dinner right next door. But the bathroom smelled very bad. I am assuming coming from old drainage pipes. They could have used fresher bath towels. Front desk person was helpful fro getting around places.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for 3 nights in May in the Economy Triple Budget room. There was nothing Triple about it. The double rooms next door were the same size. Ours only had an extra bed. Even the double room is really tiny. And expensive at 100 euros a day.There is no table in the room to keep your things. Near the bed there is a small shelf 6 cm x 4 cm. Enough space to keep a smartphone. Ridiculous. Nothing else can be placed on the table. We actually had to keep our glasses, keys, watch on top of our bags.No kettle in the rooms. So you can forget hot water for tea coffee. And the coffee machine and water machine in the lobby did not work for the entire 4 days we were there. I complained about this on the 2nd day and the reception arranged a kettle for me.The location is good yes. But I really cannot recommend this hostal to families. For singles/ backpackers maybe yes. But again at €100 a night it is just too expensive and for a room which does not even have a table!I've done a lot of reviews on Tripadvisor if you see my profile, and I've mostly given 4 or 5 star ratings to even 1-star hotels because of the value they give. But Martinval has to get 1-star rating only. The rooms are just ridiculously tiny. They need to drop the price by 40% to come to fair value.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can confirm the validity of the previous reviews, this place is a great little find! Excellent location & their customer service is what would be expected from a 4* hotel which is really what elevates this from wanting to call it a "hostel". Rooms are cleaned each day providing you hang your tag outside and expect a refreshment of shower gels and lotions along with a chocolate/sweet on your pillow. The guys on the front desk (24 hours a day) are always on hand and more than happy to help.We opted for an economy double room with its own private bathroom, the room was modern and clean with all the amenities you would expect in a standard hotel room. The only thing I would have liked is to know before hand if my room had a balcony, didnt expect it given it was an economy room but maybe something the listings on the booking websites could include as sitting outside in balmy weather with a glass of wine really would have been the cherry on an already great cake.What you really need to know if you are looking to stop here is that at the heart of it this is still a hostel. Our room was opposite the shared bathroom and while those on our floor were polite enough to shower from 7am am the same couldn't be said to anyone else staying on a different day and so earplugs may be required. While it may have only been in our room we did find the temperature of the shower struggled to get past warm, not a particular issue for us but if you need a scalding hot shower each morning this may be something to consider.Over all I imagine you could pay 3x as much to stop at a sub par hotel with a mediocre breakfast included, instead you should pass on that and book a room here then get yourself up and explore the neighbourhood which is full off fantastic restaurants, coffee shops and bodegas along with being 15 minutes from la sagrada familia. When we come back to Barcelona we will be booking here again (but making sure we opt for a room with a balcony next time!), muchas gracias Hostal Martinval.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent a few nights in the hostal and it was amazing. I definitely agree that this hostal should have an elevated rating. The staff are so welcoming and friendly, they helped answer all my questions and upon arrival provided us with a map highlighting the main attractions. They are always happy to assist you and we enjoyed our stay here - also prior to our stay I would email the hostal and they would always reply so promptly which was so helpful. Will not hesitate to book again. It is very central and close to main sites as well as close to many restaurants. Loved our stay!
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Decent location. Cleaner in every day. Shampoo and little extras provided. Doors to balcony were a nightmare to close. No kettle which was disappointing. We were on the fourth floor and the lift broke down the last two days of our stay. Overall ok but I wouldn’t go back.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Positivo: good localisation, clean place, roomy apartment and bathroom, fair price, comfortable bed, wi fi, good services, helpful attendants.Negative: tighty and old elevator, Strongly recommend. Very good
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Came here for Chelsea vs Barcelona, decent sized bed and tv. Fit for it's purpose as somewhere to sleep and shower. Would recommend with mates or as a couple but maybe not for families. Nice distance from the city.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely apartment. Much bigger than we expected. Clean rooms. Friendly staff. Air con room. Nice old fashioned lift in the building. Good location -surrounded by shops and restuarants. Nice tapas restarants nearby.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Only 15 minutes from Sagrada familia, these rooms are very central,comfortable ans clean!!!the receptionist was very hospitable and well informed about the sights of the town!The price was very good too!
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here in mid june for 2 days. The location is not too far away from the happening areas at La Rambla and we walked to and fro without any problems. There are loads of shops nearby for food or to buy things you need.The Big sagrada church is also nearby.The best thing about his place is the staff. They go out of their way to help you. The two young women who were at the reception were very friendly and gave us a lot of advice on where to go and what to see.There an ancient lift in this hotel which is something to see in itself.I recommend fully. The price is very reasonable and the service exceptional.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Pros: great location, big spacious triple room, clean and updated, balconies, fun antique elevator, 24 hour front deskCons: uncomfortable beds, zero air conditioning, thin walls, faulty outlets, extra hidden charges at check in
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We 4 people stay in a spacious apartment and it's equipped with literally everything you need! Front desk and cleaning staff all are super friendly, we have great and comfortable stay here, and the most important is they have stable hot water!!The location is superd, you could walk to all famous Gaudi architecture and to all shopping area as well, there's also lot's of bars or restaurants nearby.Definitely recommend to stay in Hostel Martinval apartment while in Barcelona!
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent 3 nights on March with my friends at this Hostel. We arrived early morning and there was no problem leave our luggage there until late check-in. People on the reception are very nice and helpful (I have also very good experience with email communication before booking). Hostel is in great location just about 10min walking time to Sagrada. Building is old but rooms are nice and clean with every day housekeeping. Our room had balcony which was great. If I come back to Barcelona, I will book the same Hostel for sure . Thank you
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For a hostel the level of service is really high. The rooms are clean and tidy, and they changed our sheets and towels every single day. It is a great location, waling distance from almost all the famous sightseeing.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights in November in a single room with shared bath. The hotel is in a good location to visit Segrata Familia, La Rambla and the Latin quarter by walking. 2 metro lines are nearby and it is easy to get to the hotel by Metro from Saints train station. If you are driving, I did not see any parking nearby and would not recommend this hotel. Hotel is an older style and worked put fine for us. I did not see an air conditioner and would be lery of staying here in hot weather. I would stay here again and would recommend it to others.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: You can't really expect much considering the price. The room was small and clean, so it is a good choice, if you don't plan to stay in it much. The staff was friendly. Hostel is in a nice district, not far from Sagrada familia. However, I would recommend taking a bus or metro to reach other parts of the city. The only reall disadvantage was very poor WiFi. Overall quite nice experience in a budget hostel.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stay here for 5 nights. The room was so clean, basic and comfortable. Aimilia at the reception was so helpful and kind. The location was good near Sagrada familia and casa Battlo. We had great breakfast at Balaurd, a bakery at carrer del Provenca, 2 blocks away from the hostal. The room was quite because the balkony looks at the back side of the building. Some noise from the next door people but this wasn`t big deal. All the time hot water, every day cleaning the room, new towels.Thank you, guys
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely sized room, very clean. We were on the first floor so had no issues with the lift or with the apparently rude resident that lives upstairs.
