There are a number of supermarkets, restaurants and bars nearby and location wise it is smack bang in the middle of everything with a 15 minute (ish) walk to the square and la Rambla. I can imagine it would get quite cold in the winter - there were a couple of nights when we had to turn the radiator on and it was only small for such a large room. Staff very helpful. Great value for money.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This place is like a crossover between a hostel and hotel. Spacious room and bathroom. Can't really complain about the actual room itself. I would have expected a little more comfortable beds for the price. Also the couple times we were out late we got yelled at by security even though we were not being loud. It's as if they did not want people to go out at night at all. They were very rude following us to our rooms. The location was pretty good. All in all okay stay but there may be better options out there.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Upon checking in, we were immediately given tips on where to go to eat, to shop and sight see by the member of staff at reception. The staff in general were very helpful and lent us an iron and an adapter plug when we needed one. They also have a safe to store important items such as passports in.The location of the hostal was perfect as we were around 10 minutes walk from Sagrada Familia and Passeig De Gracia which was super convenient. If you're worrying about food then that's not an issue as there's a SPAR right next door to the place where you can buy fresh watermelon, water and cakes for super cheap. I recommend going to NOSTRUM which is on the same road for breakfast/lunch as it's super cheap and tastes great. There's also an ice cream parlour directly opposite the hostal which is always a plus.The only issue that we did have however was the noise. Particularly if your room is facing the street you'll find that you can practically hear everything and anything such as litter trucks to pedestrians speaking loudly. Because of this I only recall sleeping well only once, which was a shame. The fact that we had noisy neighbours didn't help. Overall we had a positive experience with this hostal and is perfect for short stays.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I could see that Barcelona's turism has increased so much that rent property has become a good business...The hotel is proper and clean but I would have expected to pay a little less although I must say that my room was fully equipped and the cleaniung was impeccable. The negative side was that there were many people in the premises and I definitely needed earplugs...
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice place to stay in Barcelona. Clean, enough space, good mattress and close of many attractions in the city. There is always someone in reception in case you need something. Very friendly staff. My sisters and I enjoy our stay here.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean and nice, the room had a beautiful balcony as well! The matress was a tad hard on the back but it was still alright! Close to town and main attractions and people working there were so nice and polite! Will probably stay there again when back there!
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel is a beautiful typical building of the Eixample area. The wrought iron door the marble hallway and the birdcage lift to the first floor reception. Our room and bathroom were, as always, spotlessly clean. With fresh sheets and towels every day. The Sagrada Familia, Casa Milla (la Pedrera) and Casa Batllo are within easy walking distance of the hostel. QqAmeilia and the rest of the staff couldn't be more helpful. We are already talking about our next visit.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very clean room (are cleaning every day), friendly staff and the most famous attractions are near the hostal. I would come back again. If you have any requests, just ask the hostel's staff. They will help in any situation.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel is located 15 mins walking from Placa Catalunya and around 5 mins away from Psg de Gracia and Gaudi's famous buildings. There are lot of nice restaurants and cafes nearby and a number of grocery shops.The staff were really nice and helpful and spoke really good English. The reception was open 24/7 which was a huge advantage. We had a room with a bathroom which was great. But the bathroom's floor was not profiled properly and everytime we took a shower the whole bathroom's floor got flooded. Our room had two windows but when we opened them we found out that there are shafts there so there was no daylight reaching our room whatsoever. We spent the whole days outside but it is nice to see bright sun in the morning especially in a place like Barcelona. There was a smell, I think it was coming from the bathroom or from these shafts and you could hear people in other rooms or apartments using toilet because of these shafts behind the window. Generally though, the hostel is a good base for tourists to get some sleep and rest ;)
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's a very neat and tidy place to stay in BCN. Very clean rooms, great location and great service. I have nothing to complain about. If you rent a private room for 2 persons it is better to stay in a room with a bathroom and shower, otherwise you will have to share bathroom with another room like I did.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for a long weekend with my gf. It was good value for money (location, cleaniness, room, staff). Man called Alvin at the reception was really helpful with everything. Grocery store 50m away + metro and bus also close. Only downside is AC which is not possible to adjust or turn off. Therefore I rate this place 1 point down.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: At the beginning, the hotel seemed reasonable. However, we had to share the bathroom with another couple, who took ages when they used the shower. Also, we had an incident with a man that lives there In the attic. He was incredibly rude to me and made us feel really uncomfortable. If you want to have a good holiday in Barcelona, I would advise you to find a different hotel, because this man lives there and if you have a problem with him it will ruin the whole experience.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: "Flat screen TV in every room" sounded great .. till we found out that not one of the over 50 channels was in English. "Triple room with a bathroom" - didn't mention that we had to share it with some Asians who flooded the place every time they used it. I am a positive person generally but many things here left me disappointed. The bedside lights don't work. We reported it and were told that they knew about it but could not do anything about it. So no reading in bed, and the overhead light was too weak to read by. They couldn't exchange the double bed in the room for two singles, so two men had to share a bed. There was a SMALL hanging closet and only 4 hangers ...for three people. No facility to warm up any food. I'm sorry but when all that's added up, that's not good customer service. .The manager, Emilia, was great though, very helpful and informative ... and good at apologizing. The location is good though, very central, and the daily servicing was excellent.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a four night stay there. Clean comfortable rooms. Friendly helpful staff. will definately be back. It was very central to the main shopping areas and nearby metro was superb for getting around the city
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 3 nights here. The room was clean and there was a nice big bathroom, and the hostal is in a good location near a metro station that goes to the airport. However we were in a room right by reception and it was very loud at night because you could hear people coming and going at all hours. Also it would be nice if they did breakfast or had a vending machine or something (there was a coffee machine but it didn't seem to work), however there is a Spar over the road.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's a very nice place to stay for several nights. Location is perfect and the service is brilliant! The staff is very kind and professional-ask for Emiliya she is wonderful! I recommend that place to everyone.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent four nights in Hostal Martinval with two of my friends. We were given a 2nd floor room at the front of the building.Towels, Shower gel, shampoo, make-up wipes, shower cap & a shoe shiner were all provided for each of us on our beds upon arrival.The used towels were changed every day as well as the room being cleaned.During our stay, the bedside lamp bulb blew - the receptionist changed this for us immediately.The only downside is the rude night receptionist (male). Whilst my friend was going to the toilet in the shared bathroom at 2am(ish), the night receptionist came up and shouted into our room "DOES SHE WANT TO SLEEP OUTSIDE?".Apart from that, I thoroughly recommend this hotel. Perfect location.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There was no fuss and no frills here. The hostal was cheap, centrally located and had friendly and helpful staff! We had a swift check in and were able to leave our bags as our rooms weren't ready. The room was comfortable and spacious and we had opted for a private bathroom. All in all I had no complaints and I was certainly not disappointed.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Is a small hotel in the city center of Barcelona, very suitable for someone who needs a clean and pocket friendly place to rest and to have a tour of the city. Well behaved staff who are ready to help and accommodate last minute requests. Very good wifi too
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent accommodation, clean and spacious - Hostal staff extremely friendly and helpful - would recommend this to anyone who wants to stay in Barcelona but be away from all the hustle and bustle but still be in easy walking distance - Girona metro only 5 minutes away along with the Passeig De Gracia - would love to go back!!!!!
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room was clean enough. Cute little patio area to drink coffee on. Walls were a bit thin so it was difficult to sleep on some nights. Location was excellent. Front desk was very helpful with recommending local spots to grab food etc. No major complaints...good value!
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Honestly before travelling to Barcelona, we really wanted to love this place as we read a lot of good reviews about Martinval. Our double bedroom with private bathroom was smaller than we were expecting. Unfortunately we were put off by the dirty bathroom (a lot of hair in the bathtub strainer and sink). Also the water pressure was so low that it was really hard to wash hands.The room was reasonably quite (no street noise) although our room was attached to a dorm room (I suppose) and we got some noise in the middle of the night when the young guys were getting back drunk.However, this place is located in a very nice spot, it is few minutes walk to everything (Casa Batlo, Casa Mila, diagonal, subway stations, ...). The staff were also very helpful and nice. We also loved the art-deco lift which was fun to ride.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Positives:Very clean and comfortableCool temperatureFriendly staffGreat showerMaids happy to come back and clean later Able to leave bags on last dayGood locationQuietNegatives:Surrounding area at night is quite quiet and possibly not good for tourists (not a massive problem though)No safeWould definitely return.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've stayed there for two days at the end of june 2016. The location is very good at 5 minutes walk to La Pedrera CityBus station. The apartment is very big, cleaning is beeing done daily, the receptionist was nice. We recommend it!
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a family of 4 and we were looking for a one room to stay in while visiting in Barcelona. I was a little skeptical, but was pleasantly surprised. Granted, it's more for young back back travelers, but the apartment we stayed in QS perfect for us. No bathroom sharing, 3 bedrooms, living room, up to date kitchen. A grocery store right next door. Walking distance from many tourists and shopping locations. The only thing that didn't make me give it 5 stars was construction in a nearby building and because the building are so close to each other you could hear it during late hours of the night and early mornings. I realize it's beyond the hostal control, however it is something to take into account if you are a light sleeper. The place is clean, the staff is so friendly and helpful and speaks English very well. So if you are a family on a budget this place will suit you very well.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I wouldn't say it's a hostel, as you not sleeping in a shared accommodation.My room was nicely furnished, spacious with private bathroom and a balcony.Located just 10 min from Girona metro station, 15-20 min walk from Sagrada Familia, there are shops and cafes nearby.The only minus that there could be a kettle with cups provided.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Near Av Diagonal, one of the most important streets in Barcelona, you can go everywhere using the metro station, close to Verdaguer, Girona and Diagonal stations. It´s located near many restaurants and you can walk from there to La Iglesia de La Sagrada Familia in 15 minutes. The hostel staff bring an excellent service, they are always willing to help you. The room was clean up everyday and is according to the price paid.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hostal is in a very good position, close to Sagrada Familia. We have been there in November 2015 ,our room was big, confortable and really really clean. Staff kind and friendly . Good value. I really recommend it
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hostal is located at a quieter place in Barcelona but it is only 10 mins walk to La Sagrada and Passeig de Gracia. Staff are friendly and kind. Rooms are very spacious. Toilet and shower room are fine. Bed is not bad, Wifi is very good as opposed to some comments. We did nit have problems with the connections and it was fast. We cannot give an excellent ratings due to the following: walls are not soundproof so you can hear people's conversations, there is no proper climate control, there's just a vent at the top of the door and on our first night we woke up in the middle of the night perspiring because it was blowing hot air. We spoke to the staff and they did listen and on the next night there was no hot air blowing in ou room. The staff told us that he did not know what to do because some guests were complaining that it was cold and some were saying it was hot. The solution is SIMPLE, just install proper air-conditioning in every rooms where the guests have the ability to control it.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff was wonderful and very helpful guiding us around the city. Location was great a 15 minute walk to sangrada famelia and the short bus ride to the beach. The hostal was very basic but very clean and pretty comfortable for the price. If you are looking for basic hostal very clean and pretty comfortable for the price. If you were looking for basic hostal at a very affordable price then look no further.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The position is the best thing about this place. you can reach various interesting places on foot and by bus. the room was clean and nice. the bathroom did not have any soap for face or hands and it was not provided upon the request.Electric drill sound was disturbing in the next door. I woke up in 3 a.m. went in the salon to get a water from the vending machine, put the money but the machine did not give the bottle. I repeated 3 times with the same result. so frustrating.The worst part is the internet. If you need good wifi internet, this is not for you. it had a very weak hotspot, which was not available 80% of the time.The staff however is very kind.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed during MWC and loved the warm welcome, including a packet of ham and olive oil wrapped with a personal note! The bed was comfy, the room a good size and the bathroom very roomy. Everything seemed very recently redecorated and clean. Location wise, there are a couple of coffee shops and restaurants nearby and you're ten mins from the city's main shopping street. Sagrada Familia is close by but the old town is a 30 minute walk away. There is a metro station very close though! Really recommend this as an affordable option.
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This review is coming from a very fussy girl... I had a GREAT stay at this hostal. My friends and I stayed here before Christmas and we had a great time. The location is perfect! Super close to the Sagrada Familia and about a 5 /10 min walk to Passeig de Gracia! When I come back to Barcelona I will for sure stay here again! Great value for money and friendly staff. All round a great stay!
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were impressed with the service, especially from Abel. The toilet made a noise and he had it replaced the next day! The room was large enough for 3 friends. The elevator was there to use but we chose to go up 5 flights of stairs for the fun of it. The view out the small balcony was enjoyable and the street was quiet. The bathroom was updated/new and the shower was huge. The things that kept it from being an Excellent rating: slippery in the shower, room too hot unless window was open, no breakfast (but we knew that going in), and not a good light over the sink to do makeup or shave. The wifi had to be found by walking around the room, but it was there. We would return to this place again!
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Such a nice stuff, have been really helpful with getting to the airport. Gave some good advise what to see. Room have been cleaned even if we didnt ask. We had everything we needed. Close to the sagrada familia, casa batllo, metro and etc. 20-30min to the airport by car, 30min to the see by walking.definitely would be coming back. :) Tanks!
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: it was a really nice place and the location was perfect.just so near to every thing that a traveler needs.there were good restaurants around .reception was very friendly and helpful.the most important thing about this hostel was the safe neighborhood just was very safe even at 4,5am
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was really good, they have 24 hour reception, the staff was really helpful and the location was great, we were four blocks away from the nearest metro station and the main street. Highly recommend this place if you're visiting with friends :)
hotelName:
20    Hostal Martinval
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We (nine friends) stayed at La Casa Gran for a weekend and had the best stay! Victor and Anna are amazing hosts, and the b&b is so charming with a great atmosphere. The breakfast was delicious, and we enjoyed the beautiful balcony and lovely rooms. The b&b is located very close to both shopping, sights and great restaurants. Will recommend this place to everyone going to Barcelona!
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We visited one year ago and it was a pleasure. The venue is awesome. The owners were more than nice and the breakfast really good. We felt like visiting some friends. It was very private and we are glad we chose this place.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here as a couple with our 11 month old daughter. The owners were very welcoming, friendly and approachable and more than happy to accommodate our extra needs with a baby (cleaning bottles/sippy cups and providing a cot). The location was great, easy to walk to the main tourist spots or catch a metro and it felt like a very safe neighbourhood. The deluxe double room was spacious enough for 3 of us and we didn’t feel like there was any need for air con even in the low 30 (Celsius) temperatures. As previously mentioned, the breakfast and beautiful balcony is a highlight! Definitely highly recommend and will stay again if we ever come again to Barcelona.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for three nights and were so glad we chose this fantastic place over any other bland hotel in offer. It has a lovely, warm calm feel about it, delicious organic breakfasts and very comfy beds. We found the location excellent for getting to.all the sights and some real!y good bars and restaurants nearby. We loved the originality of this bed and breakfast and were enchanted by the little touches like the handmade soap, honesty bar and jazz records to serenade us.over breakfast. We hope to return ....just need to convince the grandparents to look after our four children again first! Thank you for such a special stay.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a very positive experience to stay at Gran Casa B&B. Very conveniently located, friendly atmosphere and interesting style. Good beds and wonderful breakfast. Really a place to recommend. Guests should be aware of the location at a noisy street, but earprops are to be fount at the night table
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great stay in La Casa Gran. The B&B is centrally located near plenty of cafes, restaurants, bars and public transportation. Ana and Victor were very welcoming, accommodating, and the breakfast spread was an excellent way to start our day. Overall we could not have asked for more and La Casa Gran would be our top choice if we were to visit Barcelona again.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was the first time for us in Barcelona, the B&B was perfect, 15 min walk to Pg. De Gracia, one of the best shopping promenade in the city, and some attractions like Casa Batllò or La Pedrera. The B&B is situated on a very busy and noisy road, but when you colsed the windows the room became very silent.The room was essential but clean and perfectly supplied with everything you need. Breakfast was delicious, with homemade cake, fresh fruit juice, local hams and cheeses. The staff was very kind and helpful.We hope to be back in La casa Gran B&B soon
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thanks to Victor and Anna for a fantastic stay. The B&B feels more like a boutique hotel, the rooms were basic but clean and perfectly formed. Breakfast was fabulous! Homemade cake and fresh fruit juice as well as delicious cheeses and hams- we had it to take away one morning which was great. The outside terrace is so calm and tranquil yet the hotel is centrally located with a bus stop right outside. We 100% recommend and look forward to returning sometime soon.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The B and B is located in a wonderful 1920's building on Avenida Diagonal - this is not only an incredibly central location but provides excellent access to the bus network and the fastest journey out of the city as this is the main thoroughfare (half an hour to the airport by taxi). The surroundings are reminiscent of Kensington or the Champ Elysee in the sun with fashionable stores and bars in close proximity all located along tree-lined avenues. Anna and Victor are the wonderful hosts and could not do enough to help! We arrived with 2 bikes and lots of luggage which they helped us to accommodate. They also cater for vegans. We arrived during the taxi strike and they advised us what our best options were. They also helpfully provided useful instruction on the local attractions and booked a taxi for our return journey. Most importantly they maintained a nice, calm and friendly atmosphere - especially during breakfast when Victor played his prize jazz record collection. Fresh fruit and meats and homemade bakes were accompanied by other choices making this a fine continental breakfast! And where could be better to eat it than on the expansive and calming terrace - carefully decorated with pot plants and flower baskets. Although the location does mean that there is some street noise - this adds and does not detract from the personality of the B and B. It makes you feel part of the living, breathing and exciting cityscape. Although fans are provided, there is no air conditioning and this does result the room feeling a little warm at times. Ventilation is adequate and high ceilings and the fans mean that this not a massive issue. If anything these (open shutters and ceiling fan) add to the period feel of the property. Additionally we travelled during a heat wave at the beginning of August and there would be no issue at all throughout the rest of the year. The room was very clean and spacious with comfortable futon style beds (double or twin options available) and a lovely en suite bathroom with a great shower. Travellers will really enjoy the style and personal feel of this place as well as the welcoming nature of the hosts. We will be sure to visit again!
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thanks to Victor and Anna, the stay in this beautiful city is even more fun! You can go here very well if you have a food allergy. That makes the stay even more special. Bus stop and metro on walking distance.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: La Casa Gran is small BnB run by the couple Anna and Victor. They are both extremely nice and calm, and are already on first name basis from the first moment - perhaps I was just a touch emotional after a long weekend hiking in the mountains, but for hosts to address guests by their first names it always a plus for me.The location of the BnB is fantastic, one is on average 20 to 30mins on foot to most places inside the city centre, 40mins at most if you go to the seaside. There are also two Metro stations nearby as well so you have plenty of options to get around. The place itself is a huge lofty apartment with 5 guest rooms, their office area, a breakfast area and a balcony where one could sit outside for breakfast and breaks. The couple also lives on the premise. It's a place full of character and personal touches, antique collections, old furnitures and an admirable collection of LPs.Breakfast every morning is with jazz from one the LPs (¡me encanta!), organic bread, delicious homemade juice, and the one that takes the prize: Anna's home made, no fuss, very delicious vegan biscuits and a blueberry cake with no added sugar. I am a fan of no fuss, home made bake goods without all the icing and dressing, and I have NEVER been to a BnB, where the host would home bake things for guests! I love that extra personal touch.The room I was in was very clean and comfortable. Interesting thing was having the shower/ bath tub almost next to the bed. I rather enjoyed that but I was there alone. There also a little sunroom with a table and two chairs, should you like to move around in the room a bit without feeling claustrophobic.The price might be slightly higher than some BnBs in Barcelona but not by that much, honestly, as Barcelona is an expensive city. For the price you pay here, you receive a lot more than at places of similar prices. And I would say I am a seasonal traveller, who have stayed in hostels, BnBs, no star to starred hotels.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I flew to Barcelona direct from Australia, so were very grateful for the warm welcome from Anna on arrival. She and Victor were fabulous hosts, with Anna providing a different home cooked delicacy for breakfast each morning, along with all the other choices. Victor also has a great selection of music playing at breakfast time. The apartment is quite grand, with a beautiful terrace. It is centrally located for sightseeing and Victor and Anna are very helpful with suggestions and information on buses and the metro etc. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thanks to Anna & Victor, we had a such fabulous stay in Barcelona. I was traveling with my 2 daughters and we enjoyed a lot to stay in our charming spacious room with bathtub, which helped us to relax after long walking. The breakfast they serve was delicious. We loved Anna's hand made croissants, which were the best one we tried in Europe. If we will go again to Barcelona, this is the place we will stay definitely.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is convenient for public transit, the rooms and terrace are beautiful. Our hosts were gracious and hospitable; helping with transportation and travel plans, providing a delicious and sustainable breakfast, and just generally kind and helpful. Not sure when our travel plans will include Barcelona again, but we would definitely stay at La Casa Gran B & B if the opportunity arises!
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Anna & Victor were so helpful via email correspondence from the start and they were just as lovely, friendly & helpful when we met them.Myself & my husband had a very comfortable 4 night stay at La Casa Gran last month. The room was very comfortable, clean and spacious and had large double windows that we could open and look out at the hustle & bustle of the city. Every morning at breakfast we were welcomed with the sound of easy listening jazz played on vinyl which gave the place an even cooler vibe.Breakfast was different each morning, delicious.Perfect.Definitely stay here next time we visit!
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I faced very strange situation with this hotel. I was reviewing La Casa Gran Barcelona on the April, 09 as I was searching for the hotel for my weekend from the 8th till 12th of June. Finally I booked the other hotel on the April, 09 and I received the confirmation from the other hotel immediately. As I it was non-refundable rate the other hotel charged the money for the room on the next day, April, 10.More than in a month, at the end of May I received the email with confirmation from La Casa Gran Barcelona. At the same day I was charged non-refundable rate. I wrote to the hotel that it was a mistake and asked to refund the money charged. They declined to do that and now I try to return my money through my bank and payment service provider.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved this elegant B&B. The entry was very discreet and elegant with a beautiful old elevator. There was a beautiful terrace to sit on. The breakfast room looked out onto the terrace. Our room was small but immaculate, sunny, had huge double windows you could open. There were gorgeous white plaster moldings and a little fireplace in our room.The owners were young and so very nice, calm, and natural, Anna and Victor. They were very helpful if you needed them but otherwise they left you to your own devices-it felt as if we lived there. The office was full of art books about Barcelona architects and artists. The location was excellent.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Right in the centre of Barcelona, personalised individual rooms and delightful hospitality from the owner managers make La Casa the complete opposite of the big chains.The Catalan breakfast every morning with Anna's brilliant bake off was a special highlight and a great way to start each day.Highly recommended and enjoyed by all the family.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This B & B is such a great find. It is super stylish in a quirky way. Although small, it feels spacious and has an amazing terrace. The breakfast was great, topped off with homemade cakes and I loved listening to the Jazz on the record player. A great way to start the day before a busy sightseeing schedule. Victor and Anna are the perfect hosts, very welcoming and gave excellent recommendations for bars and restaurants. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will be back soon.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Don't read but just book a room here. My wife and I stayed for one night but it's been a memorable experience from the moment you are standing in front of the door. Both Anna and Viktor, the owners, are extremely kind and helpful in the broadest sense of the word. Breakfast is amazing and especially the room is breathtaking. If I'm correct we had the most spacious room including balcony and bathtub. In short, everything is well thought through, from the hand-made soaps, till the local breakfast, and most of all the delicious authentic feel that the whole environment gives you.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A charming hotel, quite central (in close proximity of many city attractions) with a beautiful open terrace and home-like dining-lounge area. Our room was not big but it was clean and had pretty details. It's really nice to start your day opening the balcony and letting the city life enter the room, when the shutters are closed, not much noise is heard. Tasty breakfasts. Thanks to the hotel owners Anna and Victor, who welcomed us in every way. Felt like home. Highly recommended
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had three wonderful days in Barcelona with our hosts Anna & Victor. It started with a very warm welcome. Each breakfast was a real highlight (extraordinary good orange juice, Manchego cheese, homemade cakes,...). We enjoyed the atmosphere in the dining room. Bedroom and bathroom were well equipped and clean.The site close to the city center is nearly perfect, Bus and metro are available as well in a short distance to the hostel. We intend to return soon.Many thanks again to Anna and Victor. Kind regards, Heidi and Stefan
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Anna & Victor are great people who will do everything to make you feel at home. The hostel looks really nice and is nicely decorated. Victor helped us with booking tickets for sagrada familia and park Guell and gave us tips for restaurants, explained how to get there etc. Really took all the time to help. Besides that, the room was fantastic, the location great (just outside the realy busy and touristic part) and the breakfast was amazing. All fresh and delicious. If you are looking for a small bed&breakfast with a lot of personal attention and a great breakfast, this is the place for you.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First of all the owners Victor and Anna are extremely nice and helpful. However, I am reluctant to give this B&B two thumbs up. I must say that we usually do not stay in B&B’s and our experience here will not change our minds. There is very loud traffic noise and the walls are paper thin. The breakfast has extended cold offerings and the fresh orange juice was delicious. There is a lovely patio for sunny days but you would still have the noisy traffic. The fact that there are earplugs provided tells you that noise is a problem. It’s a hike to the Gothic Quarter where you will probably spend most of your time. Also hike to subway.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Typical Barcelona house of the early twentieth century.The apartment was very bright and large, furnished in a vintage style but with every modern comfort.We were welcomed by Ana and Victor, the owners of Casa Gran B & b, two very kind and hospitable young people. The feeling was that of being like at home.I was struck by the beauty of the living room windows overlooking the terrace.Coffee, tea, water were always available to guests.Breakfast was very accurate in details and quality of the desserts, jams, fresh bread. All accompanied by jazz music played on an old turntable!The room was very pretty, basic and spacious. The only flaw was the tiny toilet with a tiny sink and rather dark.Also you will find the bathtub, and not the shower, inside the bedroom!You will feel like being back in time!La Casa Gran is located right in the center of the Example district, overlooking the Diagonal Avenue ,very close to the subway and shops.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had an absolute EXCELLENT stay at La Casa Gran and I would highly recommend it. From the moment we arrived we felt welcome and comfortable. The room was lovely and the owners Victor and Anna couldn't have been more helpful. Helping us figure out which bus to take, to making us fresh juice in the morning we couldn't have have asked for more. If you are looking for perfect place to stay in Barcelona then I suggest this place, you won't be disappointed.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in this lovely B&B for three nights in the fall. We really loved the athmosphere and everything was arranged very well. The room and dining area were cozy and we especially loved the patio.Location was excellent for exploring the city on foot. We are so thankful for the warm service we recieved from the hosts Anna and Victor. They prepared perfect breakfast for us every morning, and also gave us some to go when we had to leave too early for our flight back. From them we got great tips for dining out and sightseeing. Thank you so much❤️!
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I stayed at La Casa Gran, an intimate 5 room B & B in Barcelona, for 5 nights in October 2017. It was our first time in Barcelona.The location was so convenient for walking to many of the sites - La Sagrada Familia, Las Rambles, Casa Milia. There were many restaurant and wine bars only a few steps away. The public bus stopped right outside the building making it easy to navigate the city. The Hop On Hope Off Bus stopped just around the corner. Our hosts, Anna & Victor, were delightful and so helpful to tell us the bus to take to different tourist destinations and make restaurant recommendations. There was a lovely outdoor patio to enjoy the beautiful weather while eating breakfast or having an end of the day glass of wine. The breakfast was wonderful with Anna's homemade baked goodies each morning! There was a small refrigerator for the use of the guests. A variety of teas were always available for your convenience. It was a charming place to stay with equally charming hosts. We will definitely stay there on our return to Barcelona in the future.P.S. There was some street noise - after all you're right in the city. It lulled me to sleep each night. If you are sensitive to noise, the hosts provide you with ear plugs in a cute little bag.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visited Barcelona for a couple of days in June 2017 and had a lovely stay at La Casa Gran in Barcelona. The B&B is in an historical building in the Eixample District (on a major shopping avenue), central to several bus and metro lines and to plenty of great restaurants and shopping and good walking distance to other neighborhoods and sights in Barcelona. Victor and Anna are great hosts, have appointed the B&B beautifully and maintain it very well (modern comfortable style with lots of light and open spaces - and with great period pieces to accent and decorate), and know Barcelona very well and can guide you around to different things to do and restaurants to visit. They also provide a terrific breakfast, and Anna makes a delicious lemon cake. I would highly recommend a stay here - you won't be disappointed.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: La Casa Gran B&B is a wonderful place and Victor and Anna are marvelous hosts. We felt very welcome and enjoyed our stay: the nice and spacious room, the delicious breakfast, the excellent taste in every detail, the nice music in the morning... We hope to come back!
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Victor and Anna are the absolute best hosts ever. We were so excited when we realized the location was on the major avenue in Barcelona. We were in walking distance to everything we needed...great coffee, great tapas, great people. Initially I was concerned that the building may be old and I would have climb quite a few stairs. Anna quickly assured me the building had an elevator. What she did not tell me was the elevator is absolutely gorgeous...like out of a period piece beautiful...swirly-wrought- iron-glass enclosed elegance.La Casa Gran is decorated with lovely artwork from around the world with a country chic feel. Our room was spacious with a balcony view of Ave. Diagonal and rain shower en suite bathroom. Breakfast was served daily in the tradition of Catalans...savory with some sweets while Miles Davis' Kinda Blue classic on vinyl filled the air. Victor helped us plot our site seeing and Anna directed us to an exquisite art gallery in the hills featuring a native Catalan artist Joan Miro.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Anna and Victor, the owners of the B&B, made us feel welcomed from the moment we arrived. The B&B is a very charming place in a great location. It was not our first stay in Barcelona, so we were happy to be a bit further away from the crowds and very close to the Gràcia neighbourhood. I would recommand it to anyone looking for a great atmosphere and local products. It is however important to know that it is quite noisy in the rooms. The owners provide you with earplugs, but if you are a light sleeper, you might want to stay elsewhere.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our first visit to Barcelona and we were really happy with our choice of accommodation. Anna and Victor are perfect B&B hosts providing a relaxed, homely atmosphere. Excellent information provided for travelling to their apartment, so we had no problems finding the address. If you are new to the city Anna and Victor will assist with recommendations for sightseeing, eating out etc. Many of the ‘must see’ sights have to be pre-booked but they are happy to help with this. Lovely buffet style breakfast with fruits, cold meats, cheeses, fresh artisan bread and Anna’s homemade cakes. Some guests may find the traffic noise a problem, but we kept the wooden shutters firmly closed and were able to sleep without resorting to the ear plugs provided.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Central location. The staff is so lovely and warm that you feel at home all the time. Very Nice styling. Good bed. The street in front is a little noisy. Beautiful room. Breakfast is amazing. I Will be back.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: La Casa Gran is on the second floor of an historic 1926 building in the Eixample, just a few blocks from Passieg de Gracia and La Ramblas. Our hosts, Victor and Anna gave great customer service even before we arrived, sending us directions on how to get from the airport to the hotel via the Metro. Our room was large and comfortable with a high ceiling and simple furnishings. A balcony looked out onto the street below. The bathroom was small but ample with a hairdryer, shampoo, and soap, and a little cabinet below the sink to store your stuff. The common areas included a comfortable lobby/living area, a large diningroom with adjacent, windowed breakfast nook looking out onto a rooftop patio. Breakfast was superb, with freshly baked croissants and cake, fruit, rustic bread, tomatoes, olive oil, butter, jam, yogurt, local cheeses and meats, coffee, milk, and tea. La Casa Gran is located on Avinguda Diagonal, a bustling street near bars, restaurants, and shops. It's a noisy location but the owners provided earplugs that worked well. We loved the place--it felt just like home--and would stay there again.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I fully enjoyed Lacasa Gran. Not a 5-star hotel so please don't make that an expectation & give a low rating later. It's a Bed&Breakfast that scored 5 out of 5 in every category. Managed by Victor & Anna; Very Friendly respectful helpful people giving it a most relaxing touch. Clean, laid back, nice location. I enjoyed breakfast on a nice big patio overlooking the street which gave my day an excellent start. All for a good price. If you are visiting Barcelona & haven't booked a place yet, I recommend checking it out. Just make sure you leave my room before I get there coz I'll definitely be back. An added bonus they Mailed my phone to me in US after I left it behind.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at La Casa Gran a couple of years ago and had a great time. And when we returned to Barcelona this year we decided to return. I am very glad we did.The place has changed hands and is now run by Anna and Victor who made us so welcome and gave us lots of good advice about places to eat, places to see, transport, beaches, etc, etc. They went out of their way to help us.They have opened up the terrace for breakfast which was a very relaxing way to start the day. And breakfast itself was great with lots to choose from. Particularly liked the bread, with local meats and cheeses, and also homemade carrot cake.Room was very clean and comfortable for myself, my wife and our two kids (16 and 12).We wouldn't hesitate to go back and have already recommended to our friends.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at the wonderful La Casa Gran for four days in May 2016. The B&B is located in a great district just outside the city centre. Transport links are excellent, and the district of Eixample offers plenty on its own, with great restaurants and shopping, and certainly the best craft beer bars that the city has to offer. The room I stayed in was perfect, a great size, the bed was super-comfy, big windows open up to the street, a Japanese-style deep soaking bathtub in the corner; a perfect spot for a mid-afternoon siesta after earlier adventures. Victor & Anna were the most welcoming hosts I have ever encountered. Their English is perfect, everything was made very easy, they had lots of great local tips, such as a one-of-a-kind ancient local bodega just around the corner where you can pick up Vermouths and wines straight from the barrel. Breakfast was excellent, with fresh, locally baked breads, awesome Catalan cheeses, home made treats and the option to dine on the sun soaked terrace. So happy to find this place, as Barcelona is a wonderful city, and I won't have to look for a hotel here ever again!
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband, daughter and I have just returned from a long weekend in Barcelona and chose La Casa Gran b & b for its central location. We're so glad we chose this beautiful b & b, much better than a hotel. Victor and Anna are lovely, nothing is too much trouble and it was like staying with friends. Breakfast was relaxed and delicious (especially Anna's cakes and Victor's gazpacho ). We had room one which had three wonderful balconies overlooking the street allowing the light to flood the room. The room was spotless with extremely comfortable beds and lovely fresh white linen. There is some noise from the street ( I don't think Barcelona ever sleeps!!) but we put the ceiling fan on full and closed the windows at night so as not to be disturbed. Everything is easily accessible from the b & b. Tour buses and normal buses stop outside and Diagonal metro station is an easy 10 walk away (we took the metro to and from the airport with no problems at all - much nicer than London Underground). I would highly recommend staying here and can't wait to go back again and see the rest of Barcelona that we didn't have time to see this time.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We compare the choice on Tripadvisor and this is the first time to visit Barcelona.VN team is very good service and always care about the feeling of us, just like every people in this city, warmheart and kind.The apartment just opened 7 months before and very details design for make people relaxing!!good chocie for me!
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Midnight arrival by Aerobus (Placa Universitart + 20 min. walk). Late arrival wasn't a problem for Victor, who was waiting for us to ring the bell. Great room - lot of space, comfortable beds and shower. Breakfast is a nice mix of local specialities and Anna's pastries. Bit of traffic noise during the night but that shouldn't even be mentioned. If you have a few days, all ''tourist'' attractions can be reached by foot. Definitely recommend this place.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Finding La Casa Gran trust your GPS. Although there is no large B&B sign out the front there is a small sign at the building entrance. The building is an apartment building and not obvious as a B&B. Easy to miss but once you are in the B&B all is well. Anna and Victor are wonderful hosts in a B&B that offers the complete package. We arrived by car,unloaded our large bags (travelling for over 5 weeks), travelled up the lift to the B&B and then Anna directed us where to park the car for 3 nights. You do not need a car in Barcelona. Anna and Victor have negotiated a rate at the car park about 2 blocks away which is extremely generous. Our room was large with a good bed, a bath in the room and toilet and vanity in a small functional room. The room as described by other reviewers is a mixture of old and new. The shutters do work quite well in shutting out the Barcelona noise but you are in a big city so you do get some noise so be prepared for that. The people in the room next to us from Labrador in Canada had ear plugs which they were happy with but I must say the only noise problem we had was a young couple in the next room arriving home late mistaking our door for theirs and then being a bit noisy. We are travellers so in bed early and they were night owls so in bed late. That can happen in any hotel or B&B so was just a minor issue. Both Anna and Victor spend a lot of time assisting with maps and guidance where to go, what to see and which restaurants to go to. They put us on to a delightful seafood restaurant in little Barcelona and recommended the restaurant over the road when we were very tired from the long drive to Barcelona.on our first night there. Breakfast was as other reviewers describe a mix of local produce combined with fresh baked offerings from Anna's kitchen. A nice room with plenty of light made it a very pleasant room to chat with Anna and Victor and fellow travellers. There is a communal fridge in the breakfast room if you need to store cold drinks etc. This B&B is delightful and by now is offering a little extra. When we were there Anna and Victor were developing a courtyard entertainment seating area on the back terrace. This will be a delightful place to spend time and perhaps have breakfast on lovely summer mornings. This is an excellent choice as a place to spend time in Barcelona. Maybe one day we might come back and get to enjoy the back terrace.Overall we have no hesitation in recommending this B&B. Writing this brings back happy memories of three lovely days spent with wonderful hosts who added something to our time in wonderful Barcelona and also added touring suggestions on our way to France. Anna suggested a slight detour to Dali's holiday place on the coast which ended up being another highlight. They also made good suggestions about prior bookings to ensure gaining admission to Gaudi's Park Guell and Familia Sagrada.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've just spent 3 nights in La Casa Gran and had a wonderful time. Where to start? I called Anna to enquire and booked direct ( better than using one of the booking agencies). She was so helpful, welcoming and efficient . She and Victor have lived in London, so their English is superb. The room was a very good size with high ceilings ,original shutters and balconies on both the bedroom and the bathroom. The walk in shower is fabulous with excellent water pressure, big fluffy towels and a very comfy bed. a great combination of original features and modern amenities. Free Wi-Fi. As others have commented the breakfast is delicious with all products sourced locally, with the addition of a lovely lemon cake made by Anna that day. She and Victor are excellent hosts and can't do enough to make your stay the best experience possible. There isn't a bar but you're welcome to bring in your own beers/wine etc. and store them in the dining room fridge. the local area felt very safe, with good access to buses and an extensive range of bars/cafes and restaurants nearby. A unique experience and so much better than staying in a characterless formulaic hotel; also excellent value for money. We will be back!
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was at La Casa Gran for a couple of days and it was a wonderful experience. The hosts, Anna and Victor, have managed to put together a very homely B&B where one feels warmly welcomed from the very beginning. They are not only very good at what they do but also extremely caring and helpful (they gave me great tips for cultural activities, restaurants, bars and everything else I needed). The location is great (Example Esquerre) and, for what I've learnt, the building itself is a listed construction from the early 30s. The interior perfectly blends the traditional with contemporary and modern amenities. The rooms are spacious, confortable and superbly clean. Special mention to the breakfast they prepare every morning that includes a delicious orange juice, croissants, yoghurts, a wonderful selection of Spanish cold meat amongst many other things. All products were local and they explained me how their philosophy is based on environmental sustainability and the support to local businesses (a great plus for me)I regularly travel to Barcelona so La Casa Gran will undoubtedly be my first option. I fully recommend it.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We made a 4 day-trip to BCN with our 18 month old son.This Casa Gran B&B was the perfect choice. Anna and Victor have done everything to make us feel at home.They have four rooms with individual interior in a big old 100 year old house in the typical art-déco style.Excellent breakfast when ever we woke up. Located on the Avinguda Diagonal with permanent traffic it is not a really silent place.Beautiful elevator that looks like in an old movie, but with high-tech inside.We can fully recommend
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great bedroom (very nicely decorated, very clean), great location (very central) delicious breakfast (local products, fresh juice, yoghurt, ham and cheese,fruit) and charming hosts (very helpful)! We will definitely return to la Casa Gran.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed one night in this place. It is so beautifully decorated you feel you are living in a fancy flat in old times. Very clean. This is part of the place the owners live so they are always available and extremely helpful and nice. The lady in charge is called Monse and she is so classy and professional. Breakfast was plenty and good quality. It is in middle of diagonal where the shops and nice restaurants are.Yet it is not noisy.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We sadly just had one night at Montse's beautiful home (and just one extremely high quality breakfast). Montse was incredibly welcoming and helpful, the location of the apartment is great and we slept wonderfully. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best to see this place as a homestay rather than a typical B&B as these are a few rooms to let within an apartment in the first floor of an old-style block in the heart of Barcelona. Facilities are sparse but the hostess is caring and helpful. Good for older couples who prefer a home rather than a hotel atmosphere and a laid back attitude.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: La Casa Gran B&B Boutique is just perfect for a short or long stay. Montse is a real gem! She is very polite, generous. Every day breakfast was different: the most expensive Jamon Iberico was always present and that was marvellous! Different cookies, cakes, tartas, etc., freshly squeezed orange juice… We did not want to leave the table because it was all so tasty, fresh, natural, and delicious. We are very grateful to Montse and the next time we come to Barcelona – we will definitely stay in the same hotel. Montse also gave us two guides: one to the most popular sightseeings in Barcelona, and another to the most recommended restaurants and bars locally. Should be noted the hotel is located in the center of Barcelona, so many attractions are just walking by foot. So far this is the best hotel with the warmest atmosphere we have ever stayed at. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Warmly welcomed even if we arrived around midnight. The executive room wich is spacious   with two balconies facing avenida diagonal, the bed is very comfortable, nice bathroom  with a deep bathtub/shower combination, there's also a gardrobe and a little safe. Simply and tastefully decorated. The BB has only 4 roooms it is in an apartment one floor up and has an elevator, our room was cleaned with a fresh bed every day, we were also given fresh towels. In the  dining room there's for free tea and Nespresso, and some fruit  and a little fridge with water, milk and some yaghourt. Somebody could be concerned about the noise in the street, there are wooden shutters that would help for this issue. There's a ceiling fan, for us was enough.The perfect breakfast is served in the dining room from 9am to eleven, with good selections of ham and cheese, croissants , fruits, cereals and breads and fresh orange juice. Wifi is very good.The location is good the metro and bus stops are near and walking distance from the center. Montse is really kind and very helpful she helps us with a map with list of restaurants,bars, she helps to call taxi ecc...
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: La casa gran had been a wonderful bnb experience. Their owners are just outrageously nice and I felt at home from the moment I stepped in. The place is wonderfully decorated with artsy and post-industrial furniture.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for one night on a business trip and chose it because I didn't want a "business" hotel. La Casa Gran is quirky - there was a big bathtub in my room and each room is uniquely decorated. There is a dining room with tea and Nespresso, fruit and pastries for you to help yourself to and the owner is so friendly and welcoming. The room was a little noisy at night as it's on a main road but I did sleep with the window open, which I didn't have to as there is a ceiling fan. I will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent two nights here on a trip to Barcelona. it is one of the most unique places I have ever stayed, and has left a lasting impression. there is a lovely atmosphere in the apartment, and Montse is an exceptional hostess, in a very straightforward, generous and informal way. the rooms are lovely and the overall sense of being in a place that is loved about and cared for by someone with exceptional taste and design sense was probably the most memorable thing. I came home with renewed energy to re-think my house design...and a sense of being visually nourished by the experience in a deep way. we had one problem: we struggled a little bit with being on first floor above diagonal. one of us is very noise sensitive, and this meant that, as we are used to more quietness, it really took time to get used to the traffic noise. but a beautiful, memorable place, a sense of having been 'within' Barcelona instead of visiting on the 'outside' you would get from a large hotel. and a lovely hostess
hotelName:
21    La Casa Gran B&B
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For a city break hotel, this is the best! I went just for one night to Barcalona coming from outside the city. I looked for a well located and modern hotel, and I found it. The bonus was the great service, cleanliness and value for money. When we came back from a dinner out we went to the bar downstairs to shoot some pool and have a superb cocktail.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Genuinely fun and interesting to stay here. Great room and location but perhaps the best bit was the free access to drinks/food etc. Also enjoyed the rooftop bar and the basement bar. If you have the $, this is a great place to stay in Barcelona
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an artsy, cute, ultra modern hotel ideally located just if Las Ramblas, a few blocks south of Placa de Catalunya. Nice location, great, English-speaking staff, all-day refreshments including sandwiches, drinks and fruit. Somewhat quirky (but in a good way) rooms. Very quiet (on the "A" side) with a "living wall" outside your bathroom. We loved everything about it
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Spent 4 nights here. Perfect location. Very close to La Rambla but quiet. Quirky fun decor. Excellent breakfast. Fantastic all day snacks available and a great rooftop bar. Lovely helpful staff who gave a great dinner recommendation
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff, location and rooms are just amazing at Casa Camper. Just returned from a 2 night break and will certainly be back. They have taken the time to do all the simple things perfectly. A great recipe for success! Well done and thank you to all at Casa Camper.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything is perfect, from friendly staff to stylish spaces, super comfy beds, free healthy snacks and excellent cocktail bar. The location is in the coolest part of town yet is still quiet. I wish I could stay for longer. The restaurant, dos Padillos is super cool too.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had stayed in the suburbs for 10 days then Pamplona. Upon returning to Barcelona the day before our flight home we chose this hotel for our last night in the City. The reviews are correct very friendly, great location (unless you are driving). They have no parking at all. The public garage is quite close but cost €48 per day. And it is not easy to park there. The hotel is a little claustrophobic almost like a prison. The elevators, halls and rooms feel closed. That said the amenities are very nice. Free 24 hour snacks and non alcoholic drinks. Honor bar and hot breakfast served until 11am. So some people live this hotel and some not. BTW, Camper hotels is a chain in Europe: this is not a camping type hotel.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is best place to stay. There crew was so kind and helpful, I enjoyed everything during my stay. I would like to recommend this to everyone.You need to book online before landing to the Hotel and ask for meal pref.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved it. Wow! Wow! Wow! This gem has the look and feel of a classy, contemporary hotel that would be a hit in any city. Rooms are cool with lots of great features. Great location for seeing Barcelona which has an excellent subway system by the way. Snacks 24/7 and a roof deck who could ask for anything more? Free breakfast with a chef making food as requested.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good overall stay at this hotel. Bed was comfortable. Location was good, within walking distance to sites and metro. Our room was located street side and it was noisy well into the morning almost every night we were there. Amenities were good. Breakfast selection was good and the cooked to order breakfast was very good. Most staff were friendly but the concierge were very reserved. Also, you need to use your key to get in to the lobby even though the concierge was right on the other side of the glass. I guess it's secure but it was frustrating after a long day of touring, and not very welcoming. That aside I would recommend staying here.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I researched all the local hotels best I could. Location, safety and amenities were important Came across the Camper and it looked good. Got a great deal on a corner room, three balconies. Nice sitting area. Nice bathroom. Place looks brand new. The lobby is very eclectic Fresh and modern Only one con. I was in room B36. Which overlooks a side street of a side street off la Rambla. I thought that far away from the action it would not be too noisy. But there are skate boarders until late at night. Can be very noisy if you are a light sleeper All the rest are awesome comments Front desk staff super friendly and helpful Can’t day enough about them Breakfast is superb. The chefs are very friendly and accommodating It was tasty and free!!Snacks and drinks throughout the day. Including sandwiches and all kids of soda and juice. Really a nice touch 6th floor terrace great to sit and chill Bedroom super comfortable. Great bed. Black out curtainsGreat bathroom Super convenient to La Rambla, the subway, the market to eat and all the sights to be seen Felt like a small cozy B and B Yet has all the amenities Street in front of hotel has the perfect mixture of local buzz, places to eat and drink and just hang out We were so happy and surprised by how nice it was My congrats and thanks to the staff Can be difficult for a taxi or car service to find as the street name changes Call the hotel for directions
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I did my reserch prior to booking and very high expectations prior to arrival. We arrived 2 day prior to our cruise to spend some time in Barcelona and did I ever PICK THE RIGHT PLACE TO STAY--CASA CAMER EXCEEDED MY EXPECTATIONS!!! Everything was perfect from the room to the wine waiting for us to the hot spot they give you for wifi while out and about to the breakfast to the personal service at the desk for whatever you need. No question as to were I will stay next time I am in Barcelona.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This should be the template for all hotels!First, the basics, a large clean room, super comfortable bed, amazing shower and friendly helpful staff. Then the really unique things that eliminate all the irritating things about hotels. Instead of an overpriced minibar....how about free food, snacks, coffee and soft drinks all day. How about a free device for visitors from overseas that eliminates the use of roaming data everywhere you go. Then throw in a 10% discount on the cool shoes at their stores. Stay here.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is by far the most enjoyable hotel stay I've had in ages. The staff makes it personal, they were sincerely friendly, and incredibly helpful. Food and beverages are available all day and gratis. It's has a lovely rooftop terrace with honor bar. The location is ideal, just a few minutes from Plaza Catalonia and the Rambla, but in a quiet setting on a walking street. It's surrounded by restaurants and shops. The rooms are very nice, and perhaps a bit quirky, but in a fun way. Did I mention the hammock? We stayed in a garden suite. Highly recommended. It's not a high-brow Ritz feel, but the service, family ambiance, and location could not be more perfect. We will stay here any time we visit this great city.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot say enough good things about our stay at Casa Camper. Its luxury hotel at a reasonable price. The staff is friendly, beyond helpful and have a great attention to detail. The amenities exceeded our expectations. The tentempié always had a great selection of food, beverages and snacks AND it's complimentary. The rooms have nice robes, Camper branded slippers, and nice toiletries. We booked this hotel as it was one of few that had Queen beds for my tall family. Our rooms were huge by any standard, large ,comfortable beds and well appointed (great showers). I highly recommend the rooms on the "B" side of the hotel: Bx6-Bx8. They are street facing but it's a quieter area but there is skateboard traffic at night. The only issue I had was on our last night the bar downstairs was open. I was on the first floor and I'm guessing directly above the kitchen. I could hear music but just turned on white noise on my phone. After bar closing it got much louder and woke me up. After 30 minutes I went to the lobby in my robe to ask the front desk if they could do something about it and the music immediately stopped. My recommendation would be to ask for a higher floor.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were supposed to stay here for two nights last summer before our cruise. Unfortunately, we only got to stay one night because our flight was delayed 24 hours in Canada on the way to Barcelona. The staff at the hotel were very accommodating about our delay even though they didn't have to be.When we arrived, the staff were amazing showing us around and making sure we knew where everything was and had everything we needed. We LOVED the unique layout of the room in this hotel with the lounge across the hallway. My daughter absolutely loved the hammock and amazingly slept in it all night (possibly because we were totally jet lagged!) The bed in the bedroom area was fabulously comfortable and I slept like a baby. It was also so nice having the outside window shade that came down to create an amazingly dark room.The food and snacks available was very nice. We found some new things that we really liked. The convenience of this hotel to everything was also great. There were great restaurants nearby and it is only a short walk from the famed La Rambla. It was very easy to get to transportation to other places in the city. Despite our time here being cut short, we were able to see Park Guell and La Sagrada Familia. If we go back to Barcelona, we will definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was recommended by a colleague who had been there last fall. While it was not near my meetings, we loved the casual and cozy ambience, access to free snacks and beverages 24/7, the very helpful staff, location in a small neighborhood off the Ramblas. We had a suite and enjoyed having a sitting room since my husband hung out there some while I was in meetings. Priced reasonably for a suite.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would go to any city where there is a Casa Camper Hotel! So far we've been to both hotels - in Berlin and Barcelona - and their Barcelona location was just amazing! The staff was professional, efficient, and still very warm. The room we had was so comfortable and easy to navigate. There's lots of space to hang clothes, big bathrooms, and a whole separate lounge are across the hall. Everything worked perfectly. Beautiful lighting and lovely design details throughout the hotel. They even provide a thoughtful turn-down service, which included classical music being played quietly so you enter peaceful, music-filled room at night. I enjoyed every moment I spent in the dining area downstairs, the rooftop terrace, and the nextdoor bar. Delicious snacks and a solid breakfast are included making this a truly outstanding and affordable home base on a picturesque in the lovely Ravel neighborhood of Barcelona.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We checked in at 10:30 AM after responding to an email from the hotel about our arrival time. How wonderful after a long overnight flight from the US. We took the Aerobús from Barcelona airport ( only 5 Euros ) to Plaça Catalunya and walked 8 minutes from the center of the city to Casa Camper.We were offered breakfast, which we declined having had it on the plane. The hotel is amazingly well situated, nearby almost every major attraction or subway station. The room was perfect in all respects. They serve breakfast from 7 AM - 11:30 AM and a 24 hour buffet. The hotel is in a converted 19th-century Gothic building in the Raval neighborhood and is a 5-10 minute walk from both the closest metro station and the lively Mercado de La Boqueria. It's 6 minutes on foot from shops and restaurants near Plaça Catalunya.The room has free Wi-Fi and flat-screen TVs. There is a sitting room across the hall from the bedroom with a separate living area and a pull-out sofa and a flat-screen TV.The service was excellent.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot say enough about the uniqueness of this gem hotel in Barcelona. Starting with the super friendly and supportive personnel who attend to every single inquiry you may have. To the unique design of the rooms (a bedroom and a separate lounge with a hammock:) to the minimalistic design that is so modern. To the great food and snacks that are generously served throughout the day and night. To the honesty bar (wow where can we still find that??) that speaks so much about the positive culture of the hotel. And finally the great location. Close to almost every attraction, yet so secluded and away from the hustle and bustle of the city. I have always been a Camper fan (oh and you get a discount on shoes purchases) and am definitely a big fan of casa camper hotels. Can’t wait to come back again and explore the Berlin one.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel with exceptional service.I stayed just two nights while on business. Service was second to none. When I arrived I was given all the information I needed and front desk recommended a great tapas restaurant for me to eat at. I was travelling alone and so needed somewhere I would be comfortable dining alone.Room was nice and has all the additional details. Worth noting there is no minibar in room, however you have access the self serve drinks etc in the foyer. Excellent central location.Would stay again if in Barcelona!
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great hotel. Central location. Incredibly helpful staff. Lovely breakfast. Very comfortable room. Slightly unusual with a associated sitting room across main corridor with a hammock. Might appeal to some but we never used it!
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Unique! We were surprised to find we had two separate rooms separated by the hallway. The bedroom/bath and "sitting room with a hammock! Bedroom faces a garden courtyard so is very quiet. Great location! Staff was friendly and very helpful. Excellent buffet breakfast. Snacks available all day at no charge. "Honor system" untended rooftop bar. Pool table, fitness facility. A small quiet hotel which has everything! Would highly recommend. Wonderful stay.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you are looking for a place where to be inspired that s the place to go.This is my first choice when going to barcelona.Rooms unconventional but confortable and big! The extra office is a plus for business travelers!I will reccomend it for everybody
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very friendly helpful staff, 24 hr snack bar (coffee, tea, sandwiches, wraps, fruit, cakes etc), central location but quiet, great breakfast including cooked to order, funky decor, free WiFi in hotel and hot spot modem for around the city.....What more could I ask for .Also discount offered on their equally unique shoes at the Camper store a few doors down.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved everything about this hotel. The neighborhood was a bit sketchy, but we never had any problems around the hotel and we did feel safe there. The location was very central and we walked almost everywhere. The staff was informative and helpful, calling for taxis whenever we needed them.
