The room was huge for Europe with a separate sitting area, an enclosed bathroom and a very large shower. The snack bar was a huge plus, with coffee and snacks available for free all day. We loved the honesty bar and sat on the roof after dinner drinking a cocktail. They give you a mifi, so you can stay connected without paying for international service each day. Bar Lobo was right around the corner, which was a wonderful tapas restaurant that we enjoyed a few times. Highly recommend!
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived early on a Sunday and did not expect to be checked in, but we had a friendly reception and our bags were held while we enjoyed Barcelona. When we did check in, we were upgraded to a corner room which since it was the corner of a mostly pedestrian street and a lane, was quiet. The room was very large with a very efficient heating and cooling system, a large sitting area with large sofa and very comfortable wing chairs and comfortable bed. There was a safe in the hallway, tuned to a classical station, which was nice. Also in the hallway was the toilet, all on its own with quite a few steps to the bathroom and the sink. The bathroom was again spacious with very good lighting and mirrors and - a great surprise when Europe tends to have a huge aversion to electricity in the bathroom -, two adjacent plugs for the hair dryer. There were no glasses, not even plastic. These had to be claimed from the buffet area in Reception but the good news there was there were snacks and cold drinks available free of charge round the clock. There was also an excellent shaded roof terrace area with a wonderful view and an honour bar, and a bottle of wine was a very reasonable 13 euros. In the morning, the shower turned out to be a wonderful rain-head affair, with also a hand-held and even a bidet nozzle. Tons of really hot water. Breakfast was the usual continental offering, marred by hard rock music. The staff, except for the supercilious night clerk, were wonderful, the bicycles hanging from the reception ceiling added to the feeling of something a bit different. It's expensive, and the immediate neighbouring restaurants are not up to much, but La Rambla is a short walk away. The final quirk was that the bathroom had no curtains except net and there was a building opposite, but I was able access the small balcony and lower a blind.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Casa Camper is a boutique hotel run by the Camper Shoe Company. It had modern European, eclectic decor. The rooms were spacious and the bed was one of the best we had in Europe. Loved the bath as well, as it had a large window looking out to a giant wall filled with stories of stacked large plants. Amazing! A tip-ask for a suite. The space was wonderful and included a sitting room with a comfy couch and large hammock. Otherwise, your sitting room is actually across the hall from your bedroom which is a little quirky.The hotel provided an excellent location on a small side street off La Ramblas in El Raval. This we found to be a tremendous plus as it is surrounded by diverse restaurants that aren't as tourist driven. It's a great place to meander around, people watch and explore. The shopping was also fun nearby and 2 metro stops are quite close . Take a taxi from the airport! At this time Barcelona has no Uber and because the location is a bit tough to find, down a really narrow street, it could be harder to navigate after a long trip with bags using the metro. We loved the amenities here. The ever open snack bar provided water and healthy alternatives if we just needed to grab something quickly. There was fresh pressed juice and wonderful cured meats at breakfast too which we really enjoyed. The front desk staff there was really helpful with directions and recomendations and they even included a bottle of cava in our room to celebrate our anniversary! We would return for another stay at Casa Camper in a heartbeat!
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When we arrived our room was not ready but we were offered an upgrade and were given a complete tour of the hotel and it's amenities while we waited plus a chit for two free drinks at the bar. Our room was a corner room with three small balconies, a sitting area and a very large bathroom.the staff were all very friendly and extremely helpful.Breakfast was very good and offered hot egg dishes to order.The breakfast area was transformed to a free snack area for the balance of the day and included fresh fruit, sandwiches, soft drinks, coffee, tea and a variety of true munchies- chips, nuts, chocolate etc. A very welcome feature given that dinner in Barcelona doesn't start until 8PM at the earliest.You are a 2 minute walk from the Ramblas but being on a small laneway was not busy with pedestrian or vehicular traffic.Good restaurants within a 5 minute walk.The only negatives were: No drinking/wine glasses in the room and the absence of a desk height writing surface.The honour bar on the top floor was a nice touch as well.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and I have traveled extensively for the last 17 years in Europe, Scandinavia and S. America. We found Casa Camper to be a truly unique travelers hotel. It provided every comfort, wonderful food and friendly helpful staff. We loved it and hated to leave! The roof top terrace and honor bar provided a calm respite from the hustle/bustle. The kitchen with made to order breakfast and 24 hour food was amazing. The basement bar was a fun spot with Archey eager to work his bar tending magic. We interacted a lot with Lucia at the front desk. She was always helpful with restaurants, transportation and any information we needed. All of the staff were great and quick to please. When our hairdryer wasn't working they responded before we got to the room to remove the Do Not Disturb. We also loved the location, just off Las Ramblas but far enough to have its own cafes, stores and restaurants. It was an enchanting experience. If we are lucky enough to return to Barcelona we wouldn't stay anywhere else.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Best hotel I've been in Barcelona. The location is the best - minutes walk from stores, tourists locations, metro/buses.The room was wide, well equipped and fun to be in.the terrace on the roof is great!The crew was wonderful, helpful and nice.For sure - I'll be back :-)
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: First off did a lot of research on hotels for Barcelona because we are a family of 4 and traveled with a 1 year old and a 3 year old. All I can say is that this place made my trip to Barcelona more enjoyable. I have stayed and various cheap and expensive hotels in Europe but the service here takes the cake. Communication: this place answered my email promptly after booking the hotel, they even help book airport transfer because I didn’t want to deal looking for transportation with the kids, bags and strollers after a long flight from the US with cranky children with no sleep.Check-in: I was so surprised when we checked in they where so nice, showed us the hotel facilities, gave maps and suggestions of places to go around the area.Location: For me this was important, I had two strollers to push and a far hotel or a unsafe location was out of the question. Even when we did not have kids location for me was alway key. This place was 2 minutes to Las Ramblas the main street which took a 5 minute walk to Plaza Catalunya where all the hop-on buses started. Our bus for Monserrat also started there and was 15min to the Sans trans station which we took to Girona and Madrid. The Boqueria market was 5 minutes away too.Food: Breakfast was included, loved it, you can have eggs cooked any way with bacon and sausages, etc. had selections of Spanish cold cuts, cheese, bread, they make the coffee for you, juice, bottled water(to me that was important). But the main thing here is this breakfast area after serving breakfast closes for an hour and they set-up snacks that the guest could just get anytime of the day. This was worth the prize of admission alone if you had kids or even adults. Had coffee anytime I wanted, juice, yogurt, cookies, sandwiches and chips for the kids and bottled water (yes I had to say bottled water again).People: ok everything I listed out above you can also probably get at other places but the people here are so nice, I never had personal service at a hotel in Europe (my sister works for the 4 seasons so I know how personal service works staying in a bunch of them) everyone was helpful but this place was above that, decided to go to Girona a day before and I was helped booking a tour and transport that night by the guy at the front desk. I do have to mention one of the hotels employe named Anna, my 3 year old daughter really loved this place because of her, she was really nice to her gave a casa camper ball, help her during breakfast etc, these are intangibles that you don’t get in a big chain hotel (when was the last time your 3 year old kid remembered the name of the person at the hotel helping you guys?)Room: garden suite, this is what I got and did not regret it at all, it had a king bed and a queen pullout bed, even got a pack and play of the one year old that they had ready when we arrived. If you are like me and torn which one to get i suggest to pay a little more for the garden suite and thank me later. Oh those hooks in the wall was the smartest thing I have seen in a hotel room.Internet: to some people this is important and I have to say it was US fast here so your good, plus they gave us a mifi hotspot to carry around town which gave us data on our cellphones when we are out. That way I just tuned off the roaming data on my phone and used this the entire time. If your asking yes it work with google maps and Facebook and also iMessage.Negatives: ok every place has negatives and for this place don’t know if it’s even worth to mention but I’ll throw it in to make a balanced review. The location was a little bit tricky specialty for taxi cabs because you have to drive in from Las Ramblas. Some of you might want carpet in your rooms but with kids I prefer non carpet rooms, lastly no bellhop but who cares they will help you with your bags anyways. These are minor items and just nit picking which I did not even care.Conclusion: when I booked this hotel it was #2 in TripAdvisor and I didn’t want #1 because of its location that’s why I book this. Did I mention that the place was clean, even the rooms and hallways. If I go back to Barcelona I would not even think of booking any other place in fact I got 2 families already booking at this hotel because of my experience and the pictures I showed them and my daughter who told them about the nice people and free snacks she got at the hotel. By the way when people read reviews they also look at the options the reviewer had, only thing I could say is I could have book one of those fine hotel and resorts locations on my Amex card but a picked this and never regretted it.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located right in the middle of the action, this hotel boasts spacious rooms, and 24/7 access to a pantry with all sorts of beverages and snacks, included in the room price. This includes grab and go beverages, croissant sandwiches, snacks, salads yogurt, etc. In the morning, the breakfast, also included in the room price, provides cooked to order eggs, pancakes, sausage, bacon, etc, and a buffet of local meats, cheeses, fruits etc. The pancakes were not what I was used to--very fluffy and delicious. Staff are very courteous, and the decor modern yet inviting.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect location,perfect accommodations,perfect service! We loved this hotel, if we could give it more then 5 stars we would. Deep red walls worked perfectly with the room decor. Breakfast was better then usual, and loved the snacks offered 24 hours. Wish we could have stayed longer
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My son and I stayed at Casa Camper in B-28 for 3 nights. It’s a large room with a sitting room next to the bedroom. The room was well equipped and modern, the staff at the hotel quite friendly. The location is off La Rambla on a small street that’s walking distance to sites and restaurants. I chose the hotel because of the location and 24 hour snack bar. I figured that with jet lag and odd eating times it would be helpful. The only thing to note about the room is that it’s a bit dark and faces the street. The street is usually empty but skateboarders tend to skate by and the noise is loud as well as garbage trucks in the morning and people walking by after leaving the bars at night. Would definitely stay here again though.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Casa Camper was such a surprisingly positive! The location is just perfect, centered but yet very quiet. Located is an area of beautiful narrow alleys, with lots of excellent places to ear and shop. The design of the hotel is brilliant, modern, clean and welcoming. The rooms are cleaned every day thoroughly. the staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel has a beautiful terrace over the whole roof, up in the 6th floor. You can have a drink and relax. Casa Camper is one of those hotels you feel sorry to leave! Extremely recommended!!
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel announces its different nature right from the start. They buzz you in, for security. After you check-in you can use your room key to get in on your own. Although if they see you, they will buzz you in. The room setup we chose is unique, at least as far as I have seen. There are two rooms. The first is the bedroom with bathroom. Across the hallway is the second room, a mini lounge area with a second TV, couch and hammock. This arrangement came in very handy, as right after we checked in, my got sick, very sick, coughing her guts out. She stayed there for three and a half days in bed, completely drained. Luckily, I could stay in the other room. While the sofa was very narrow and uncomfortable to sleep, very uncomfortable, it sufficed. And the fact that it had a TV made the arrangement tolerable. What made the stay better than tolerable was the fact like the Artiem Madrid hotel we had just come from, the Casa Camper had an upgraded version of the free food and drinks. Sandwiches, drinks, desserts, salads, soup, potato chips, wonderful M&M's, cookies. A rotating set of choices kept it interesting. They had chicken, salmon, crab, sandwiches, a greenbean/potato salad that was very good, cheesecake, carrot cake, etc. 24 hours a day, even during breakfast. Speaking of breakfast, it was included. It was also the best breakfast I ever had. The incredibly friendly cooks made me pancakes were perfect and made even better by the real maple syrup they offered. I was tempted to have a second helping. I decided, instead, to try the omelet. Good choice. Great choice. It was hands down the best omelet I ever had. Moist, luscious, cooked perfectly, with completely fresh ingredients. Ever mouthful was heaven, sheer joy. I literally savored every mouthful. If it wassn't too late and beside I was stuffed to the gills, I would have got another one. I had omelets the next two days, but unfortunately they were only delicious, not life changing as the first one was. C'est la vie. The hot chocolate and the coffee they made and brought to you, like the food, was excellent. The OJ was very good, too. When I told the kitchen staff how extraordinary the food was, they were genuinely touched. It was an Oprah kind of moment. I think the last day I had breakfast twice, because I knew it would be a while before we got back here. What I was unaware of was that they had a lounge area on the top floor and you could sit outside, too. They had drinks, chocolate bars, etc. there. We went to see the sunset on our last day there. And while the view was not as spectacular as the one at our hotel in Segovia, it was still very nice and relaxing. I wish I had spent time there while my wife was sick. What I did know and didn't use was the pool table in the basement bar area. I should have, but I did not. Next time.The staff was top notch, as helpful as they could be and friendly, too.The location was good, too. Not terribly far from the cathedral, Palau Musica and almost next door to the modern art museum. What I particularly liked was that it was very close to a laundromat and we had to wash our clothes.What else? The bed and pillows were very good. So were the towels. The shower was very good. The back of the main room had the sink and windows all across. The view was this matrix of plants going all the way down to the ground, a little strange, but interesting. After we checked out, they stored our bags and when we came back around dinner time, they allowed us to go to get some food. I thought that was very gracious of them. And as I said, they allowed us to go the terrace area, as well. Of course, I had also told them and I was serious, that I would like to stay for a month the next time. A customer like that you want keep happy. And they did. And there is no doubt we will back. The month stay may be next year or later, as we have changed our plans for the rest of this year and Barcelona is probably off our itinerary and even if we come, it will be for a short visit.We paid more for this hotel than any other on our trip, including a 5 star hotel in Lisbon, but it was worth every penny. If you want an incredibly relaxing stay, this is your place. If you aren't sick, you may not want to leave the hotel.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was recently traveling alone for business in Barcelona and stayed at the Casa Camper for the second time. Sadly, the first day of my stay, I developed a severe pinched nerve in my spine and was debilitated by the pain and could barely walk. The staff at the Casa Camper were unbelievably kind to me and treated me like family. They found a doctor to see me, went to the pharmacy to pick up medications, brought food and drink to my room. Their attention and kindness made my trip bearable despite this awful new medical problem. I cannot thank them enough! Know that if you stay here not only is it a lovely hotel, with good food, great location, clean and interesting rooms, but you will be well cared for if the need arises.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room was spacious for a European hotel, but we also got a corner suite, so it was expected. The amenities were average as many are what you would expect of a standard hotel. I did not think any of them were remarkable. Front desk was generally courteous, but they were not very helpful when asking for restaurant recommendations. They would usually resort to Googling, which I could do - they didn't have many good recommendations of their own. That was a bit surprising. The free food in the kitchen in the lobby was not very good; sandwiches were dry and salads were gross, so we did not utilize this very much. Turn down services was nice, and so was location, but overall I'd say it was a very average experience. Definitely did not live up to my expectations. There are other hotels in a similar price range and similar location, which are far better.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A very nice small hotel located a couple of blocks from La Rambla, very close to the Barcelona Contemporary Museum ( a great place to visit). Rooms are quiet, with a comfortable bed, interesting interior spaces. A small room, lounge comes with the room across the hall from your sleeping area. The hotel provides "snacks" 24hrs, that are great, you could make a meal at lunch or dinner from them. The staff is very friendly and helpful. We will definitely return on another visit to Barcelona. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent staff from check-in to check-out. Very quiet room. Very good location. Very good beds. They cater for your special wishes: on checking in we asked for some extra coathangers, and extra topsheets. They were supplied at once. I asked if I could have the newspaper El País every morning. And without fail I gor it every monrning (and for free). On checking in I explained to the friendly lady at reception that I was here, among other things, to practise my little-used Spanish. And so we never spoke a word of English to each other.Niggles? At breakfast you get three kinds of pre-cut Manchego type cheese, which all taste pretty much the same: brittle, acid, and little else. Mean ten gram portions of butter which would require tin openers.Same opening problem with yoghurts. And the wall colour in the rooms: abattoir red, is not to everyone's taste. It certainly is not to mine. But so what. The many positive points prevail by far.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was an excellent hotel. Very comfortable bed. There was both a shower (with overhead as well as a hand-held spouts) and a separate bathtub. There was conditioner, shampoo and soap. The bathroom had two sinks. The hotel included breakfast, which had lots of options, included hot eggs made to order. Additionally, there was food available for guests after breakfast, including sandwiches desserts and a variety of drinks. It was all tasty. They also left bottles of water in room when they made up the room.The hotel staff was very helpful. They gave us great recommendations for dinner. They were always helpful when we were trying to sort out directions. They arranged for an early morning cab to the airport. If I had one nit-pick it's that the room was rather dark, and there was an area of the room that wasn't lit at all. Overall, we loved this hotel.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This may be a great hotel according to the travellers reviews but for sure this hotel is not child friendly or at least they don't welcome children.I was close to make a non-refunable booking at Casa Camper but I could not see any children policy on their website so I checked on booking.com where they simply say "all chilren are welcome" and "no room capacity for extra beds".After this I had the great idea to contact the hotel and ask about any extra costs for my 7 yo boy sharing the existing (and only available) bed with me and my wife.Their blunt answer was that any child above 3 years is qualified as an adult and would be charged EUR 88/night to stay with us. The rate for 2 adults is EUR 150/night and the extra fee for a child is EUR 88/night!!!!While most of highly rated hotels in Barcelona (and aroun Europe) charge only the cost of the child's breakfast (or even offer it for free in case of big hotel chains) Casa Camper probably prefer to keep the children away by charging this outrageous extra fee for a child without extra bed.Be aware before you book!
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a great discovery !!!!We were not guests of the hotel, we went to the Dos Billares Bar in the hotel. We say the sign from the street, entered the hotel and had a lovely chat with Enzo at the reception of Hotel Camper, we were shown downstairs to the bar. The space is VERY VERY nice, they have 2 pool tables and a lounge area with a projection screen, that night we went they played football; BCN vs TOT.The cocktails are very good, Archie served us an exceptional gin and tonic and he treated us very well.We will return without a doubt !!!
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I cannot say enough about this hotel. First the location is ideal. We were able to walk to just about everywhere. The room was large and immaculate. The sitting room across the hall was lovely although we didn’t use it much. The breakfast was delicious and plentiful and the all-day snack bar had everything you can ask for. But the best part of this hotel is the staff. Everyone in the kitchen to the cleaning staff were all so friendly. I must call out the young woman who worked the desk in the afternoon (I’m sorry for not remembering her name) who went above and beyond, always full of good ideas of where to go and what to eat. Every one of her suggestions was terrific and that she would make the reservations for us was so helpful. All of the staff was great but she really went the extra mile. If we return to Barcelona, I wouldn’t hesitate to stay there again.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have stayed at Casa Camper twice and we wouldn't stay anywhere else in Barcelona. They strive for excellence in everything they do, from answering all of your questions pre-visit to every aspect of your stay. Take advantage of the rooftop honesty bar, a great way to relax at the end of day. If the service wasn't enough the rooms are superbly appointed, made to order breakfast and snacks, small entrees and drinks (Free!) all day.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for two nights the hotel is perfectly located off Las Ramblas. Staff all very welcoming and friendly. Breakfast variety good with food cooked to order, omelettes were very nice.There is a rooftop honesty bar with great views and in the lobby there is a 24 Hr complimentary snack bar for guests, this is a great additional extra! Perfect for a light snack or refreshment any time you need it.Hotel is immaculately clean and rooms are spacious with very comfortable beds and pillows. Opposite your room you have another room containing a sofa, table and hammock! Perfect for relaxing. Best area for hair and makeup in a hotel room I have ever had a table and chair at perfect height, big window for great daylight, two mirrors either side of you and a plug sockets for hair appliances just perfect! Everything at this hotel is very well thought out.Highly recommend couldn’t be happier with our stay here.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is excellent. The staff is exceptionally friendly and helpful. Breakfast is cooked to order. There is a unique separate little living room with hammock and small balcony across the corridor from the bedroom. Free snacks are available all day in the breakfast area. There is a rooftop terrace with honor bar open 24/7. The location is perfect, just off Las Ramblas near Placa Catalunya. I am now spoiled and will make this my first choice of accommodation in Barcelona.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our 4 night stay at Casa Camper was amazing. The location can not be beat. Only a short walk to Las Ramblas and Plaza Cataluna. When we first checked in they took us to a large map on the wall for an orientation of the area as well as everything that the hotel has to offer to make your stay incredible. What other hotel does that??? The breakfast was wonderful, even homemade pancakes, omelettes, or anything else you want. Our room was very large, very modern and with a nice sized bathroom. On top of that, they have a wide assortment of homemade salads and sandwiches, yogurt, breads, cheeses, other miscellaneous snacks, soda, juices, coffee AVAILABLE ALL 24 HOURS FOR FREE! Just go into the breakfast area and take what you want anytime. But, best of all is the staff who were always incredibly friendly and smiling everytime you walked by. Like all of the previous reviewers have stated, this place is a gem!!
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my first time to Europe and this was our first stop in Europe and I cannot even comprehend a more perfect stay. The hotel was in an ideal location just steps away from a busy street. The hotel staff was immensely friendly and greeted us each time we went to and from the hotel. The rooms were large and modern and my favorite part was the snack/food area that was available 24/7. There were various bottled drinks and snacks available and that made our stay that much more enjoyable and wished other hotels did the same. Highly recommend and will definitely come back and look into other Casa Camper hotels!
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you prefer your hotels a little different to the norm and maybe a little quirky then the Casa Camper should be your first choice.Just off Las Ramblas and superbly central we were immediately greeted at reception by very happy helpful staff who got us booked in straight away, gave us a mini tour and made us feel extremely safe and welcome.The whole feel and layout of the hotel is deliciously different from the separate living room with hammock to the 24/7 inclusive snack bar to the super garden roof terrace with well stocked honesty bar!Nothing was too much trouble for any of the excellent staff but I must give a special mention to Archie. Archie was in charge of the cocktail bar and on a couple of occasions we weren't sure what we quite fancied, so after a couple of questions Archie said "leave it to me!" then came up with some quite exquisite drinks! We love coming to Barcelona but our stay this time was made that little bit more special and pleasurable by staying at this lovely little hotel and its wonderful staff, we will be back!
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: While this is not a luxury hotel, it is extremely comfortable, welcoming and clean. The customer service is excellent. The staff members are attentive and helpful. We were quite impressed when Valentina oriented us to the hotel as our paperwork was being completed. At first I was disappointed because I was under the impression that our room would have a view. As an amateur photographer, it’s always nice for me if I can take some pictures from my hotel window. After being shown other available rooms, a view that I’d photograph wasn’t a reality. On the positive side, Casa Camper is in the middle of the old town, the original part of Barcelona. Nearby you can find interesting sights and excellent restaurants. If shopping is your thing, you will be very happy. Breakfast is very good and as others have mentioned, snacks are available 24hours.Our room is large as is the bathroom.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: There are fancier hotels, but for value and comfort, no one can beat Casa Camper.Our room A42 was large with a comfortable Kingsize bed, lots of storage space, a huge walk in shower and a safe with a plug for your phone or iPad, ingenious.The location is convenient to Las Ramblas and within walking distance to many of the sightseeing attractions such as Gaudi’s Casa Batllo, Gaudi’s Museum next to the old Cathedral, La Pedrera and the Medieval Roman section.For the price of your room, you get a free breakfast that includes eggs, bacon or sausage, breads, cold cuts, fruits, yogurt etc. you can order your eggs how you want them and Paola or Constanza will bring them to your table with a lovely smile. You can have Caffe Americana with real cream, not milk. Also available 24/7 sandwiches, soup, desserts, yogurts, breads, tea, soft drinks, juices and coffee....all free.The Terazza on the 6th floor has an honor bar. You mark what you drink and how much on their form. The bar has a wide selection of Scotch, brandy, wines, beer etc. for a bargain rate. We spent every evening there playing cards, drinking wine and meeting fellow guests. The staff speak English and are friendly and helpful. There is no downside to staying there. I already miss Paola’s radiant smile and fried eggs with the best bacon anywhere.
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is a hidden treasure. The breakfast is made to order, fresh and delicious. the rooms are spacious and very clean. Loved this hotel .We had two rooms, one room had the bed bathroom and all amenities. Across from the room was another room for us that had an additional TV and a hammock. It was a private sitting room. What a surprise!
hotelName:
22    Casa Camper Hotel Barcelona
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at Inside Barcelona Apartments (Mercat Duplex) for 3 days in May-2019. Apartment is located at very convenient location , 30 mins away from airport, 15 mins walking distance to beach, Zoo and Park just few mins away , close to grocery store , There is also 24 hrs grocery store just 5 mins away. Highly recommend this place.I am overwhelmed by the services provided, They arranged birthday cake for my wife on my request from one of the best place in Barcelona (Bubo), also arranged the taxi for our journey back to airport for early morning flight.Few downsides1. Apartment is duplex so it was not child friendly, we had to be extra careful with the stairs2. Bit expensive.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartments are on a very quiet pedestrianised square. No noise from bars or restaurants either. And most bedrooms look onto the quiet inner courtyard.Within easy walking distance of centre and main sights, and 3 minutes walk to beautiful gardens, 15 minutes walk to the beaches.The apartments are newly renovated and modern in an 18th century house, with a modern lift. We had an "attic" apartment, with bedroom, good bathroom, sitting room, dining area for four and a modern kitchen. (Although they're called attic, they have high, full ceilings and full-length windows with masses of light). There's also dining-table and chairs for six on the rooftop terrace, and 2 loungers on the upper part of the terrace, which has great views over the rooftops of Barcelona. Heating/air-conditioning too.The staff all speak English and were very helpful.The apartment was spotlessly clean. There's an Aldi small supermarket on the far corner of the large square.To sum up: beautifully peaceful, spacious and comfortable, with great views. Virtually unique in Barcelona, and very good value.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 3 nights and it was a great stay. Apartment was large with two bedrooms on a split level and was plenty large enough for 3 people. The block also had a lift which was very handy as were on the 3rd floor. Check in was efficient and they allowed to check in earlier which was an added bonus. The area itself El Born is lovely with some great bars and restaurants all within a short walk. It's nice and quiet which is also an added bonus. My only gripe was that there was only salt and olive oil in the kitchen and there was no sugar or very minimal coffee but there is a supermarket very close but it would have been good to have it in each apartment. Would definitely stay here again.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was the third time staying in one of these apartments in close proximity to a part of Barcelona we love. The apartments are amazing they always feel like home. But as great as the stay and city are the team are TOP for me. They make it very difficult to leave. Their effort has not gone unnoticed THANK YOU
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean, well appointed, roomy and comfortable. Plenty of tourist attractions, bars, restaurants in walking distance. Perfect for family. Kitchen well stocked. Can walk to Gothic quarter and beach. Bike rental nearby.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Apartment is nice and clean. Mercat apartment is located much wider place than Esparteria and interior seems to be new. All the staff at Inside Barcelona Apartment were extremely kind and respond to all the requests, mails and queries quickly. They try to do their utmost best to make customers happy. We forgot something to bring home but they immediately reported us to send it back to us together with our extra requests which they actually do not have to do. They are the best of Barcelona! We recommend this place as the No. 1 loading of Barcelona.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I waffled between a 5 star and a 4 star review. I believe the 5 star is accurate if you are looking for practicality and not flashy. If you are looking for luxury then this is not it. Perfection:- location in el Born area where you can walk to everything. This is the place to be. Access to markets, restaurants, local life and transportation. - Inside Barcelona staff are great (helpful and available & willing to assist). English speaking is certainly a bonus. - great newer appliances - everything you need. As a North American we are not use to dual duty appliances (washers with dryers and stoves with micro waves - thank goodness for English instructions) plus dishwasher and full size fridge and freezer. - well stocked kitchen - everything you need including dishes, cutlery, pots and pans and cookware, paper towel and dish cleaning and drying cloths and soap. Better stocked than at home. - Included is a nespresso maker with 2 coffee tabs to get you going (you can buy non-nespresso tabs at the market or Starbucks for a fraction of nespresso costs. There is also a drip coffee maker available & kettle. - air conditioning if needed. - shower is great. - large safe in bedroom. - Free wifi. - good size apartment for city living. - second bedroom if need for a 3rd person (but no second bathroom). - elevator is great for luggage but with lift-style apartment not mobility friendly. Bedroom and bathroom main floor, living and kitchen up. - tv has limited English speaking stations: satellite news (us and Britain) plus one station on tv (channel 11). - security good. Not as good:- not sprinklered (not unusual for Europe). Fire safety a bit iffy. Outside (electric) blind in bedroom if down would be a concern. - only 3 bath towels and no laundry detergent supplied. - couch is dreadfully uncomfortable, needs replacing with something more comfortable and doesn’t sit so close to the floor. - not enough toilet paper supplied but cheap enough to buy at market. I highly recommend with some considerations.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fast checkin at Inside Barcelona office and Andree took us over to the apartment and informed us well of instructions needed .We stayed in top floor apartment with terrace which had a nice view of the city. Apartment had all facilities you need in the kitchen for 4 people. Very clean and tidy apartment with efficient airconditon for heating at this time of the year.Lots of good restaurants just around the corner ,we can recommend Llamber who has excellent tapas! Short distance to the beach which is a nice change when you get tired of narrow crowded streets :-)
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Located in a quiet yet very picturesque part of Barcelona with plenty of lovely bars, restaurants, shops and attractions within walking distance. The apartment was clean and modern, bright and had great views. The staff were very friendly and went out of their way to assist with anything you needed during your stay. We will definitely return on a future visit.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a nightmare journey from the airport which really didn't get us off to a good start! We were sent an e-mail prior to our arrival on the best ways to get to the apartment. We always ignore the taxi recommendation as it's too expensive, so we went for the other option which was the train. First of all it took about 15 minutes to walk from the terminal to the train station; then we waited 10 minutes for the train. The train was incredibly slow and by the time we got to the place where we needed to change, the final services had finished for the night. We then had to leave the station and get a taxi for the rest of the way. In total it took about 2 hours to get from the airport to the apartment. Simply ridiculous! We spent about €22 for this ridiculous journey when a taxi would only have cost us €35! Two years ago we travelled from Girona airport to Barcelona and that was actually quicker and far less stressful! Not only this, but the apartment asked us to phone when we landed, which I did, only to be told to phone again later. In total I phoned 3 times at various stages of our journey. The woman who met us was very nice, but when asked about our journey I said it was awful and her response was, 'Well, yes the train is very slow'. I did point out that it's probably not best to recommended it from the airport then!Aside from this bad start, everything else was pretty good. The location is very quiet, but very central. The apartment itself was fairly spacious for 3 people, but could have done with another/separate toilet. The kitchen was very well equipped. I'm never a fan of two single beds posing as a double so that wasn't overly comfortable, but there was lots of storage space in the bedrooms. The local office were incredibly helpful and we went there everyday. They even booked tickets for us and gave us discount vouchers. Overall, I would say this was a 'good' apartment. I've stayed in much more luxurious and spacious apartments in other major cities in Europe for the same price. It's also a shame that they've only picked an Ikea sofa to furnish it with (very uncomfortable!). The apartment's main appeal is its location, so I would pick it again for a few nights away, but not for anything longer.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We kicked off our Spanish honeymoon in Barcelona with a five night stay at Inside Barcelona Mercat and are so happy to have found such a wonderful place to stay. El Born is definitely THE place to be in Barcelona - it's tourist friendly but not a tourist trap and has a lot of great bars, shops and restaurants that are frequented by locals and tourists alike. The apartment is in a gorgeous old building but is very clean and modern inside and has a full kitchen and spacious living area that is separate from the bedroom. It felt really comfortable and homely and we loved it. Check in was really easy and all of our communication with staff was great. I would absolutely recommend staying here to anyone coming to beautiful Barcelona.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family stayed here for a week at the end of March. It is a wonderful location, very quiet and close to lots of cafes and restaurants. We have two children, aged one and two, and the staff were very accommodating and helpful. Especially when one of the children got ill.We stayed in a two bed apartment on one level. If I had one comment, it would be that there is a step in the middle of the apartment, but the girls coped fine. The lift is big enough for a big buggy. I recommend this to anyone with small children, there are two play areas in the local park, and public transport is very accessible. The staff are close by and just so helpful, nothing seemed like too much trouble.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Can't say enough about the excellent customer service. They go above and beyond with helpful information and recommendations. The apartment was spread over two levels, which we loved. You walk into a foyer area, bathroom and bedroom to the left, (back side of the building), and a unique curved staircase to the right, up to a living/kitchen area and also another bedroom, smaller, with a desk and juliet balcony. Living also has balcony, facing the Barcelona Cultural Center that has the prettiest rooftop. El Born shops and restaurants galore on the other side of the Cultural Ctr, and half-a-block on the other side is Parc de la Ciutadella, which is oh so beautiful and amazing. Perfect location. And train station is very close, not quite two blocks. It was very quiet, but so close to "the action." This was also a working vacation for my spouse, and we won't stay anywhere that doesn't have a good fast internet connection. The separation of the floors was also nice in that regard. Having a washing machine was so nice in that we could travel lighter. Also has an elevator! Loved this place and hope to stay here again sometime.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here for 6 days, and the apartment was very good. Traveled with a kid, and bedroooms in different floors was very nice for all three of us. The aircondition was almost too good, but perfect for me! The beds are a bit hard. The employees at Inside gave us very good service, og we will choose them next time we travel to Barcelona.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartment is on two levels with the main bedroom and bathroom downstairs and the kitchen lounge and second bedroom upstairs.The standard of furnishing and kitchen appliances was excellent.The apartment is very close to the main area of the El Born district which is characterized by wide pedestrian areas with many pavement cafes.The check in process went smoothly and the staff at the Inside Barcelona office were friendly and knowledgeable.The apartment is well situated with the seafront promenade in easy reach ( about 15 minute walk).The metro system in Barcelona is good but it should be noted that the nearest station is about a 15 minute walk.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A year ago visited here:Apartment: Mercat Duplexstreet “Comercial”nº15This was just directly behind El Born building. Similar named streets are several, so taxi drivers won't find there.Correct address is more like "back door of El Born building".There is wine shop for restaurants in down street, but consumers can buy also wine bottles from there.So location is great!2floor Apartment was clean, basic this century decor.It was little scuffed but ok.Beds were bad, those were teenage beds (max weight 50kg), not suitable for adults 70-90kg. So back pain whole holiday...Kitchen was good with dishwasher, ceramic electric cooking plate, oven/micro, fridge-freezer and narrow variety of kitchen utensils (little bit more would be nice).Toilet door was problem because it open insine so if you are fat, you can't use toiletseat what is behind the door without going bathtub.These are just minor issues what needs to fix... Otherwice we just loved to be in the hart of El Born. Short walk everywhere and easy to get metro (about 300m), small grocery about 50m, trainstation 100m, beach in little bit longer walking distance and lovely marina.We kept those large windows open in the evening and just enjoi the view with good wine.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Not much to say about this perfect apartment in El Born. It is well equipped, it is spacious and comfortable. The neighbourhood is calm and quiet, still near the busy square Passeig del Born. Maybe the beds could be a little better but that is a minor problem. We were very satisfied!
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the2 bedroom Mercat rental. Beautiful two level apt. Gorgeous bathroom big shower. Wonderful view from balcony of the rooftops of Barcelona. Lower level bedroom super quiet. Faces inner courtyard. Bedroom on top floor facing street was slightly noisy but ear plugs did the trick. It was National Catalan day/ week so probably a little more noise than normal. Washer and wifi all worked. There is a full kitchen but we did not cook.It was warm but we did not need the A/c at all. Loved El Born district. Lots of unique stores, cafes, restaurants, food everywhere. EL Born Cultural Center is fascinating. The apt is Close to Parc Ciutadella and beaches and Gothic quarter. We walked everywhere. Franca train station very close. The staff were very helpful and accommodating. They were really exceptional! It was nice to have an office to go to with questions.There are other apartments offered by Inside Barcelona but this one worked well as we are a brother and sister and it was nice to have our own space. That is the real advantage over hotels. I would absolutely stay here again !
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Arrived late Thursday and our initial impression of the area could not have been further from the truth. We stayed at Mercat in a 2 bed duplex. The district of El Born has the remains of the ancient market as well as lots of cafes, restaurants and bars and is lovely to walk around in the day or at night. It has a vibrant atmosphere but is not noisy and we felt very safe. The apartment was spacious and modern, tastefully decorated and well equipped with free Wi-fi, fridge, cooker, microwave, toaster and kettle. Air conditioning was effective.The view from our 2nd floor apartment was of the museum and the surrounding streets was a welcome bonus.It is about 10 minutes walk from metro stations, the best way to get around Barcelona. It is close to North train station and Barcelona zoo.Inside Barcelona were efficient throughout and very helpful in providing advice on the tourist attractions and all staff were a pleasure to deal with.If we return to Barcelona I would not hesitate to stay here again.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Second time we stayed here. We usually choose the apartments in Mercat but I'm sure their other properties are as good. The staff are very helpful right from king reservations to storing your luggage for you. The first time when we stayed (August 2014), they explained everything; how to use the metro, book tickets for museums, where are the supermarkets, the quieter beaches, etc. The apartment itself (Mercat Duplex) was perfect for us, a family of 3. The location is perfect to visit the the city on foot, take the metro, take a taxi for 5 euros to the quieter beaches and the apartment is really quiet and well equipped. I would however seriously recommend they change their cleaning lady who obviously takes shortcuts. In out first visit in 2014, we were offered a mid- stay cleaning (we stayed 12 nights) which was really poorly done however we didn't mention it. In our second visit (July 2015), we again found that the floor was leaving our feet black (and no that is NOT pollution) as we had checked in 2 hours after the apartment had been cleaned. The staff at Inside Barcelona were really helpful and resent the cleaning lady and this time the floors stayed clean for 5 days! Otherwise, a perfect stay and we intend to return.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This MERCAT apartment which is located opposite of the el born centre, is very quiet. Even though we are just on the 2nd floor (lift available), we could sleep peacefully without any disturbance, sometimes we overslept. One room faced the inside building and the other facing the walking street so one room is quiet and the other not so. Other than some noise from people on the street (better than traffic noise) and we stayed during the weekdays and not weekend, this apartment is very comfortable and peaceful. This modern clean 2 bedroom apartment could accommodate up to 4 adults and 2 kids. But maybe 1 bathroom could be a disadvantage for more than 3. Location is good with many tapas and restaurants nearby but a 25 minutes walk to plaza catalunya. Subway is near. Anyway taxi is easy and convenient especially on a hot summer day. From here to sagrada familia, a taxi costs us about 7 euro and to the plaza espanya about the same price too. Every morning, we had breakfast in the apartment since it is easy to get coffee, bread, ham and cheese from the nearby mini market. It is more economical this way for a family especially in Europe. And this kitchen serves well functionally. We also had a good size balcony at the back of bedroom which you could chill out with a glass of wine. Or even hang and dry your clothes with the clothing rack provided, if you do not want to use the dryer. They do not provide cleaning service for us since we only stayed about 5 days. Maybe more days, it will be included. Paula has been very helpful to make sure everything works and how we could explore Barcelona. Inside apartment provides good service and from their website u can choose from many apartments they have that suits your needs.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Immaculate apartments , ideally located . Tv ,wifi , fully equipped kitchen .Staff on arrival were very helpful . I would recommend this apartment wholeheartedly for a city break . Located in trendy El Born district within easy reach by train and metro to get around the city .
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: In a quiet part of beautiful El Born. We stayed there for 4 nights with our teenage daughter. The location is superb. 15 minutes’ walk to the beach and just some minutes away from many good restaurants (like Cal Pep). Very clean apartment with wooden parquet. High ceiling and free Wi-Fi. Inside Barcelona was very (very) helpful and the service was beyond expectation. In addition, the beds gave us a good sleep quality. Highly recommendable!
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We've stayed in this apartment for 8 days in February and absolutely loved everything about it. First of all the location is absolutely excellent, right on the edge of wonderful El Born and right next to the Ciutadella Park. The complex is situated on a quiet road at the back of the Mercat del Born museum. El Born is probably one of the nicest areas in Barcelona, with lots of small streets with literally hundreds of restaurants and boutiques. The rest of Barcelona is awesome as well, but returning to El Born each night was always a pleasure.The apartment itself is great. We were welcomed by Helena, who explained everything and helped us get started. Our apartment had 2 bedrooms with double beds, a kitchen, a bathroom and quite a large livingroom. There was a nice tv, a bluetooth speaker, great wi-fi reception all throughout the apartment, a coffee machine, a dishwasher, a washing machine, a toaster, water cooker, etc. We stayed in the apartment with two small children and got an extra cod for the littlest one. I highly recommend staying here if you like a nice neighbourhood with plenty of shopping and dining facilities, a very nice apartment and of course if you like to visit Barcelona.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a two bedroom apartment. Large enough for a family of four and a very well appointed kitchen.Location was excellent and as usuall for central Barcelona there were plenty of places to eat within a short stroll. It was a quiet apartment as there is no road at the front or back and there was almost no noise from the pedestrians. Wifi download strength was excellent.The girls at inside Barcelona were very helpful.Remember this is not a hotel so they meet you at the apartment to let you in. Extra charges if outside normal hours . After midnight was a 40 euro surcharge.Fully airconditioned and light apartmentVery clean.The downsides ?;+Biggest issue was a very small hot water tank. They warn you that you only have 14 minutes of hot water for a shower. That is not long for four people ! It takes 2 hours to reheat the water again.+ second biggest issue- the double bed was two beds put together. The bases were tied but the matresses were two singles and not able to be zipped together. Meaning you could fall between the matresses as they moved apart.. +No curtains in the Main bedroom- net curtains which gave privacy but would not block light. Fine in winter but in summer it would not provide a late morning sleep +Lots of cable channels........ unfortunately all but the eleven news channels are in German- There is a DVD player so if you have english speaking kids take DVDs to amuse them if you were expecting the TV would do that+ the shower is situated in the bath with a shower screen attached. Because of the way the bathroom is designed it is a narrow gap to get out of the shower because of the toilet. Could see an issue for the elderly or those not so able to safely get out of the bath.Would i stay again ? absolutely even with the limited hot water.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Inside Barcelona provided a great apartment for us. Efficient, clean, right size (2 bedroom) and a fantastic location. More important, their staff (thank you Paula) helped us in planning the trip and in the bumps on our trip (US Airways--no thank you).The apartment was very safe, clean and fit our family well (2 parents, 20 year old and 17 year old.)It was quiet, had good beds an a decent shower. Being in the Born was perfect for great restaurants and access to the subway and a 15 minute walk to Eixample--but much hipper than the Eixample neighborhood.Gracias Inside Barcelona.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This apartment was fabulous. Perfectly located, lovely décor, everything we could possibly want including excellent wifi included in the cost. Cannot speak highly enough of the service offered by the great staff at Inside Barcelona. We felt so at home and so comfortable and any questions, directions or bookings for tours was organised without any hassle by staff at the office which was just a short stroll away. It was such a great experience to have an apartment instead of a hotel, especially as we had a lengthy stay in Barcelona due to work commitments.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in a duplex apartment which was located on the 5th floor for 5 nights at the end of October.The apartment layout had the main bedroom (window on to the rear of building)and bathroom on the lower floor, the kitchen, second bedroom and sitting area were on the upper floor.The main bedroom had its own air conditioning and there was an outer shutter on the window that could be lowered to block out light and any noise.Windows from the 2nd bedroom and sitting area overlooked the restored Mercat del Born.The kitchen was very well equipped with fridge, hot plates, oven, dishwasher and washing machine. There was also plenty of utensils such as kitchen knives, pots and pans, bowls and glasses. Unusually for Spain there was also a toaster and a jug. It was also great to have mugs rather than cups for tea and coffee. The beds were comfortable, the bathroom was a good size, there was plenty of storage space, the upper floor windows opened to provide plenty of light and fresh air and both areas were very quiet.In addition, the El Born area is a great spot for bars and restaurants, is great for window shopping with lots of old streets to wander along. It also very close to sights such as the Picasso museum, the beach and the zoo and surrounding gardens. It is about a 10 minute walk to the nearest Metro ( the station is closer but the trains are less frequent). The market (a highlight) and Las Ramblos is about 20 minute walk. An added bonus was our apartment is just up the street from the La Paradeta so we couldmonitor the queue from the balcony!Finally, as other reviews have noted the staff at Inside Barcelona are very friendly and helpful. They have also thought about what visitors need and so provide easy to follow written instructions on how to get to their offices from the airport, detailed information on how to use the facilities in the apartment and maps of the surrounding area showing facilities you might need.The result is a very professional and through approach to providing excellent accommodation whilst maintaining a friendly and personal touch in delivering the service.One small example, I asked about getting back to the airport from the apartment. Paula produced written instructions on the process and then found and printed the timetables relevant to the approximate time of our departure: friendly, thorough, professional.My thanks and congratulations to Inside Barcelona on providing such a high quality experience.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was absolutely perfect. We got detailed instructions how to get to the office from the airport. It was really near to the train station. All the area was really nice. The apartment is close to the office and nice park. There are a lot of restaurants. Supermarket and pharmacies are very close. It is about 15 minutes from the beach.Paula was very friendly and helpful. She walked us to the apartment from the office. She explained us everything necessary about apartment. We got map with nearest supermarket, pharmacies, and recommended restaurants for breakfast, lunch and dinner and so on. We got list of basic information and extra services. Paula showed us he most interesting places of Barcelona on the map and she told us how to get there.We were surprised that we have a terrace as we didn’t expect it. It was great. We felt there as home. The apartment was very nice and clean. It looks like exactly as on the photos. It is very well equipped. The air conditioning was really necessary in the hot weather.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We have just had a fabulous 3 night stay in the 2 bedroom Mercat apartment. Inside Barcelona were extremely helpful from the moment I booked a few months ago, up to the moment we left to return to London. Their wonderful staff escorted us to the apartment, ran through all the information regarding the accommodation, location and best places to visit and on departure allowed us to leave out luggage at the office for our late flight. The location of these apartments is perfect - El Born is a quiet location away from the hustle of the city and is home to countless little cafes, tapas bars and delightful shops. We were also perfectly located to be easy walking distance from the fabulous beach, gothic area, Ramblas etc. and had no need for the metro or buses other than the fab tourist bus that took us around the town. Apartment was spacious, clean and very well equipped that we could have stayed a month! Loved it!
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our apartment overlooked the Old El Born mercat. It was very clean and well equipped with a washing machine/dryer, dishwasher, Foxtel and large fridge/freezer. The apartment was secure and also had a safe. We felt very secure in the El Born area which is close to Bari Gotic. Inside Barcelona provided very helpful information as to nearby restaurants, markets and transport. The closest metro station is Jeume I which is about a 10 minute walk away. It took us about 20 minutes to walk to La Rambla.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My partner and I spent five nights in a two bedroom apartment and absolutely loved it! Fabulous location with easy walks to sights, transport, restaurants and supermarket. Check in was easy and the staff were efficient, helpful and friendly. The apartment was bright, clean, well equipped, air conditioned and very comfortable. We had a great stay here and have recommended it highly to friends and family. Perfect!
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Travelling with teenagers, we've learned that apartments are so much better (and no more expensive) than staying in hotels - and so much nicer and more family friendly. We have just stayed at the Apartments Mercat and I am delighted to report that this place has totally made our short trip to Barcelona completely wonderful ! What really delighted me most however was the neighbourhood; I echo everything already said by other reviewers about the apartment itself and the helpfulness/friendliness of the staff, the proximity to everything and so on. But what I wanted to highlight was the El Born district itself - beautiful old town feel, narrow winding streets, the park on your doorstep, and hundreds of bars, tapas restaurants, little shops, plus the beautifully restored market building which contains some carefully preserved excavated remains of the old city. I will without doubt stay here again, next time dumping the kids so we can explore more of previously mentioned bars!
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: These lovely apartments are located behind the newly refurb'd Mercat del Born, now known as the Born Cultural Centre, at one end of Passeig del Born. The one I've stayed in several times is on two levels, with a bedroom and bathroom on the ground floor and 2nd bedroom, kitchen & living space upstairs. They are modern, spacious, clean and in a great location - a winning combination! The Inside BCN team are great and I have booked with them for years. Carrie in their booking office is friendly & helpful, as are the staff who actually take you to your apartment. They make everything very simple & easy for their guests i.e. leave the keys inside the apt when you leave - so no big treks to an office to drop them off. I can't recommend the company and these apartments highly enough!
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I booked a 4th floor apartment (with terrace) in a Mercat (El Born) apartment from 4th to 7th May 2014. The Inside Barcelona website accurately reflected what is actually there.We had no problem re the original booking or with our subsequent direct email contact with Inside Barcelona staff. Any queries or advice we requested before travelling and also whilst in Barcelona were dealt with very efficently and promptly. The staff were very professional but also warm and welcoming and could not do enough to make sure that you enjoyed your holiday. The compact apartment located in a quite well lit street was very clean and comfortable and was absoutely great with a nice open air secluded sunny terrace. It was in a great position for a whole range of sites including the Gothic Quarter, Picasso Museum (free entry but big queues on a Sunday afternoon), Barceloneta, beaches, zoo, train station, aquarium, Port Veil, La Rambla etc. The Sagrada Familia is also within 25 minute walking distance of the apartment. There are a lot of great bars for tapas and also all manner of restaurants depending on your preferences in the immediate vicinity of the apartment. Overall a great location for exploring this part of the city.Prior to travelling I did a lot of research online to try and identify top rated tapas bars to visit when we got to Barcelona. I strongly recommend that you don't bother. All of the supposedly top rated tapas bars are full to bursting with tourists who have all been online identifying top rated tapas bars!! We eventually ended up just trying places we liked the look of and within which we thought the customers were mostly Spanish. This paid off for us on a visit to Barceloneta when quite by chance we ate lunch in La Bombeta, Carrer de la Maquinista. Great food, very Spanish - and few tourists at the time of our visit.Since this was our first visit to Barcelona via El Prat T2 we wondered how easy it would be to access the flat. On leaving the inside of the airport turn right and walk up to the Aerobus stance where a single ticket into Placa Catalunya cost 5.90 euros per person. On arrival at Placa Catalunya we had a pleasant 20 minute stroll downhill to the Gothic district and to the Inside Barcelona office. In overall terms a great short break much enhanced by having a great Inside Barcelona apartment with superb staff.Killieman
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in the 2 bedroom apartment. The location is convenient to everything...the beach, the park , Las Ramblas, the metro, even though everything is walkable. The apartment itself is spacious and has everything you will need to be self sufficient if you prefer. The staff at the office are wonderful...so helpful and cheerful! Would definitely stay here again and totally recommend it for others on their first visit to Barcelona. Thanks again, Paula! Pat and Susan Matthews.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at Inside BCN office are amazing, so helpful, attentive, knowledgeable and they genuinely want you to enjoy your holiday/break to the full. They suggest trips and will print off tickets for you from their computers saving money on visits to Sagrada Famillia and the Hop on Hop off buses.Positives - Location is fantastic, right in the El Born district, lots going on, lovely shops, bars and restaurants very close at hand. We stayed on the top floor apartment 1, excellent views from the roof top patio. Very clean apartment and well equipped if you wish to cook meals etc. Bathroom has just a shower, toilet and sink. Negatives - The bed linen was old and worn, the towels hard and wash worn and the bed (2 single beds pushed together and made of memory foam) was hard and extremely uncomfortable. There is a sofa bed in the lounge which is the main comfy seating spot - not comfy at all. Old, lumpy and stained, it's covered over with throws and cushions. Certainly not enough comfy seating for potentially 4 guests.All in all acceptable, but I would not stay here again.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartment could not be in a better place, both central and quite. It was a joy just to walk around the El Born area. The service was fabulous. The staff were helpful and very kind. Could not think of a better place to stay.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in the Atico apartment (I believe there are two Atico /pentouse apartments) which is a one bedroom apartment on two levels with a stunning terrace with wonderful views over the city. Bedroom and bathroom is downstairs with the living room, kitchen and terrace being on the upper level.Could not fault this accomodation in any way. The terrace gets the sun all day and is lovely and private and comes with two sun loungers and a table with six chairs, there is also outside lighting. The apartment is well equipped if you wanted to be self sufficient and there are a few supermarkets within a couple of minutes walk. There`s also a fabulous wine shop a couple of doors down if you fancy a night in. Satellite tv was brilliant as was free wifi. Apartment was nice and quiet at night.. Bed was nice and comfy and shower was excellent.This is in the El Born district which, having extensively explored Barcelona for 5 days,i can say with confidence this is the best area to stay. The area is safe with charming streets all a buzz with activity from numerous tapas bars, restaurants and open air cafes and bars. You could eat in a different restaurant every night for a year with ease. You can easily walk to the beach and all major sites from here. If you choose to use the metro I suggest you get a T10 ticket which gives you ten trips for appox 9euro. Both of us shared a card and still had a few trip left at the end of our holiday. This also gets you to and from the airport and if you go and see Barcelona play football it`ll get you to the stadium and back as well.We booked this apartment directly from www.insidebarcelona.com who were fabulous. They give you all the info you need for a wonderful holiday in Barcelona. They provide you with maps of the city which showing tourist sites,bus, tram and metro routes and they are able to book trips and visits to tourist sites sometimes getting you a discount and helping you to avoid queues. They can recommend and book restaurants They give you a 24 hour phone number so if you experience any problems they are only a phone call away which is quite reassuring. I would like to visit Barcelona again and would most definitely stay here again as this apartment totally enhanced our holiday.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was glad i booked this apt and not a hotel, located in El Born great restaurants steps away from the apt, a lot of cute boutiques, the apt was clean and cozy just what you need after a tiring day a lot of space to move around not like a hotel but best of all were the staff of inside barcelona who manages the apt very helpful and friendly , we really enjoyed this apt and will definitely recommend it to our friends who plans to visit barcelona
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff at inside Barcelona were incredibly helpful not only with check in but also with assisting booking tickets and advising on sites to see, restaurants etc. The apartments are in a great location for sightseeing as well as eating out and shopping. Apartments are clean and comfortable and opposite a beautiful park. Fantastic for ease of access to the port where we took our cruise from.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We will definitely be back and are recomending it !! This apartment is perfectly located. It is in the historical district of Born and walking distance to restaurants, great shopping area, the site will most certainly charm you. It is a clean, bright and modern apartment. You can expect a great briefing from the Inside Barcelona Staff about do's and don'ts before you start touring the city. They were also very helpful cues on how to visit different historical sites. The location of the apartment is great because it is quiet. Our unit was facing the market and had a small balcony. The beds were very comfortable. You will find everything you need to fix a meal, wash your clothes.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed with Inside Barcelona, Mercat, with my two teen age children 17 and 13 this August 2013 for six days. We could not have had a better choice of a place to stay. even before arrival Paula and Carme were so helpful to set plans for activities; my son was thrilled to go to a Barcelona FC soccer game...! Paula was amazing and helpful throughout! The apartment is very modern and spacious; the location is the best in Barcelona.. El Born is close to the beach and the city centre, while not in the middle of the noise of the overrated Ramblas.. The apartment at Mercat was very convenient with trendy shops and restaurants close by.. le Franca train station is a block away... overall incredible stay with Inside Barcelona!
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a perfect place to stay if you're visiting Barcelona. Location is superb, located in El Born, it's within walking distance to Las Ramblas and Barceloneta beaches and restaurants and Ciutadella Park. Close to the apartment is all you need: supermarket, pharmacy, lots of cafes, restaurants and tapas bars. Transportation is also very good, metro and Estacion de Franca are two minutes away from the apartment.Park and Barceloneta are perfect for jogging, and there are two swimming pools and a gym, just around the corner. Apartment itself is very clean, modern and well furnished with all amenities you might need (including washing machine and dish washer) and air conditioning. Beds are very comfortable, so we had excellent sleep, the area is very quite, so there was no noise outside during the night. Special kudos go to InsideBCN staff and first of all to Paula for being one great host. From the moment we booked the apartment to the moment we checked out she made sure our stay was perfect. All the recommendations she gave were perfect and overall her assistance and hospitality were outstanding. I've been to Barcelona quite a few times (around 10 actually I think), and I can easily say, that one was one of the best.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at the end of June for few days in one of Mercat apartments; we weren’t lucky enough to have the access to a terrace, but except that, we had everything we need it for a great stay: a very good location (very close to Las Ramblas and the beach); all the instruments for a self catering style; nice furniture. Speaking about furniture, this was one of the points that make me decrease the stars: the single bed in the small bedroom was making such a big noise that my little boy was not able to fall asleep, but only with difficulty. The same noise we could hear it from our bedroom. We did not ask for a change in this matter, so I don’t know if they would have been able to help. Another minus for the apartment is the fact that you have to pay in order the towels to be changed/refreshed. This is going only to increase their expenses, as the guests will use the washing machine in order to correct that…Other than that, I would recommend the apartments to anyone looking for a great location and great staff (the girls are having the answers to all of your questions!).
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We are a family with a young child (almost 2) and we decided that for our city break, we would pay a little more and have an apartment. We seen the positive reviews on here and they really are not exaggerated. The apartments are spotlessly clean, bundled with nice little features and in a really great location. Our taxi cost 35 euro to the drop off point suggested by the company and the apartments are approximately 10 minutes walk from their offices.
