We were given a thorough explanation on the features of the apartment, places to visit and general transport advice by the representative who assured us they were always available if we required anything.Travelling with a young child, we did require a cot and a baby bath (as our apartment only had a shower) and they were there on arrival.The apartments came with WiFi included and had automatic closing window shutters to keep out the early morning sunlight if you wanted to sleep in. There is plenty of other information on what to do in Barcelona so I will not echo that. I would try and split your time between Las Rambles and the harbour, as both offer different things.The apartments were ideally situated, with the park and zoo behind you and the market in front. It is around 20-30 minutes walk to Las Rambles and about 20 minutes to the harbour. The walking is the best thing as you get to take in the city and the quaint shops and cafes it has to offer. You are far enough away not to be amongst the liveliness of Las Rambles but close enough for it to be easily accessible.To conclude, the apartments offer you a great self catering experience at an ideal location.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can't say enough good things about our stay in Barcelona with Inside Barcelona. The staff are extremely knowledgable and professional, and service is always given with a smile. They answered all our requests promptly and efficiently. Our apartment was very well appointed and we were lucky enough to have had an apartment with a large terrace. The location of the apartments made it easy to walk everywhere, and the El Borne area is charming. If you have to visit Barcelona, stay at Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed in tow of the Mercat apartments, the terrace apt on the top floor and a second floor apt. They are lovely apartments, well renovated and equipped with everything you need. They are quiet but in the heart of the Born area. Inside Barcelona have their office nearby and offer amazing customer service, no request seems too hard. They helped us with bookings restaurant advice, advice on visiting the sites. The are available 7 days, really good service.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Overall a good experience - we had a junior delux apartment with terrace. A couple of downsides though, the bedroom was very small, but made up for by the large upstairs lounge, kitchen & terrace. Also the shower wasn't very powerfull - not really delux standard. Staff are all amazing though. Location is great for access to the old city and some trendy restaurants and shops around, although the area is still under development with a large market building almost complete. If the weather's nice, the terrace is a great plus.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for 4 days. It was honeymoon and I informed it to the apt office before I get there. Then Dana prepared a terrific wine! How sweet she was!! Location, facilities, cleanliness, expense, kind crews...everything was perfect!! It couldn't be any better!!
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sister, her son and I stayed in this apartment from 8/26 to 9/2. This is a fantastic apartment, very comfortable and ideal for exploring the city of Barcelona. They are decorated in a modern style, very comfortable and well equipped. Magnificent terrace, where we were able to enjoy breakfast and dinner. Very friendly staff, ready to help at any time! Thank you very much for them all! Excellent location! Nearby is the Ciutadella Park, the zoo, chocolate museum (mmm.. ticket here is a chocolate bar), a famous seafood restaurant La Paradeta, the main sites (Barceloneta, Gothic Quarter, La Rambla and Plaza Catalunya, etc.) Are within 10-15 minutes walking distance. I really hope to come back on your next visit to Barcelona!
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I stayed here 8/5 - 8/12, and it was the ideal center for exploring Barcelona. Wonderful neighborhood, close to everything and very comfortable. Staff was extremely helpful - they spoke good English and also tolerated my awful Spanish. I went running every morning in the almost-adjacent Parca de la Ciutadella. Nearby restaurants and bars were amazing. Apartments seem to be well soundproofed, since we could barely hear the very loud (from outside) work on the Mercat that was being restored outside. Can't recommend this place highly enough!
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The property is in popular el Born district and very close to lovely Ciutadella Park. Close to many other places to see but away from the crowd. The apartment is well furnished with modern equipment. Washer-drier was very useful. We had a comfortable stay though there was some noise during day (restoration of the mercat opposite to the apartment.) The building does not have a reception. They meet you in front of the apartment to give your key. But the office is 10 minutes away if you need any help. Recommended but beware that this is a duplex and there are stairs inside which might not be very attractive for seniors.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartment--Mercat Duplex--was perfect for 3 people. The location, in terms of Barcelona is excellent--however there is a huge construction project right in the front of the building. They begin working before 8 on the weekdays and work until 6, so you cannot open the windows unless you enjoy the sound of breaking cement. On the bright side, we were always able to find our way back, due to the two giant cranes out front of our building. I was told of the noise upon check-in. It would have been nice to have known sooner, which would have given me an option to stay somewhere else, but I guess no one would rent the apt if they knew about the noise, so that is probably why we were not told. We had come from Paris where we had a lovely week, so the noise did not hamper our stay that much, but would have if this had been our only stop and we were looking to relax during the day. The neighborhood is very safe, even at night, and the tapa bars and restaurants are wonderful. The shopping is good too. I would suggest, if you rent an apt from this company, to ask whether it is next to the construction site. The people who work at Inside BCN are very nice and helpful. But one time when I needed some assistance with a cell phone they loaned me, they were all too busy to help. Overall, I gave them a very good rating, due to the nice apartment. The kitchen was well stocked, the coffee maker worked, the fridge was cool. I guess it's not their fault that the construction is taking place. (And is supposed to take years to complete, from what I gathered.) I probably would have stayed elsewhere had I known about the construction. The other thing that bothered us was we were only given three small hand towels and three bath towels to last six days. A few extra hand towels would have been a nice touch.
hotelName:
23    Inside Barcelona Apartments Mercat
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: From check in, which was done professionally and invitingly, to the clean and spacious apartments, the recommendations for local dining, it was a great experience. The location is also good, need to walk about 20 minutes to many of the touristy locations.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family of 4 stayed in Barcelona for 2 nights after exiting a cruise. We were promised a secure luggage location since we were arriving so early. Upon arrival, Eric was there to greet us and secure our luggage with a large locker for each family. Quick check-in that included a briefing on everything we needed to know about the hotel which also included a map with descriptions on places to see and eat. The room was very spacious with everything working and a kitchen area that was ready for long term stays if cooking meals etc... Plenty of hot water and since it was very hot (Heat Wave) the AC system took a while to cool down the room. The only suggestion I have for the rooms is to leave the AC running so the first few hours in the room have a better welcoming experience. We stayed on the 6th floor in room #63. There was some noise pass into the room so if you had loud neighbors that could be a problem but only 2 or 3 rooms per floor so our stay was very quiet. Nice place to stay and we were all very happy with things all the way around. Thanks Eric for taking the time to explain your lovely city and Boutique Apartments. Will stay with you again!!
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My husband and two teenage daughters stayed 3 nights here and it was absolutely wonderful. The 2 bedroom apartment was very clean and modern. It came with a well stocked kitchen that included glasses, coffee cups, wine glasses, plates, cutlery, pots, pans, a toaster and a coffee maker. The apartment was conveniently located to several places to eat, supermarkets and shopping. The Rocafort Metro was just a block away and made travel extremely easy. The AeroBus A1 also dropped us off from the airport a couple of blocks away. The front desk staff was very informative and super nice. We would definitely stay here again and recommend to anyone.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here in 2 rooms which connected 11/12 slept 10 of us. Super convenient and quaint location. Felt very comfortable there. All the amenities you’d want/need! Super friendly help at front desk!
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's a little gem in the heart of the city. We were able to walk to most of the attractions and have a taste of being a local folks. The apartment was very clean and efficient. The front desk person was friendly. Probably will stay at this place if I come back to Barcelona.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everyone that works at Eric Vokel is so helpful and friendly answering any questions we had. The apartment is huge and provides everything you need for cooking, cleaning and making yourself feel at home. As a young couple had a very enjoyable stay. A metro stop is 2 minutes round the corner which takes you to all the key places in Barcelona as well as it only taking 25 minutes to walk to Catalunya square (central Barcelona). All I would say is that one morning the room next to us was being cleaned and you can literally hear everything very loudily next door, it's as if the cleaners were in our room! This didn't effect our stay though. Would defo recommend :)
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My family of three had a wonderful four-night stay at the Eric Vökel Gran Via. The rooms were clean, spacious and provided with all the essentials to make ourselves at home, including full cabinets of kitchenware, dishwasher detergent, olive oil and other condiments. The staff were friendly and the location is conveniently located within walking distance of Metro, restaurants and supermarket for those who want to like to do a bit of cooking and try living like a local.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This has been a very good experience. Quiet different from normal hotels. Very clean, has everything that website mentions. The only problem we had was that space was very limited. We had a 2 bedroom apartment and we were 5 people. It barely fits the belongings of two people. Apart from that it was a very good stay. Service was very good. Not 24/7 but whenever receptionist are there they were very helpful. Location is very good. Overall very good experience.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Dear all,Excellent apartment, for once just ad advertised on the website. The location is excellent, just three blocks for the plaza España and the magic fountains, a renovated former bull fighting stadium into a shopping center, and a 15-minutes walk from the plaza Catalunya.The bathroom is rather small but more than adequate. The staff is super friendly, quickly responding to e-mails even on Sunday.If you want to be picky, you could say that there is more than usual street noise compared with a comparable hotel, due to the busy street where it is located. However, this is a minor point In short, I would recommend this apartment to everyone looking for alternative to a hotel.Rodrigo
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This boutique hotel was amazing, the service was great and the room was clean and modern. We were four girls who stayed for four nights and we have nothing to complain about. All the rooms have a dishwasher, a washing machine and a big fridge which I believe is very nice if you are staying a bit longer than we did. The area is clean, safe and close to everything. The metro is 20 meters from the hotel and there are many nice breakfast restaurants nearby. I recommend this hotel to everyone who is considering visiting Barcelona! Thank you for a pleasant stay!
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Lovely apartment, nice location. Massive double bed room for a party . ( joking ) Very clean and well equipped kitchenetteEasy access and self check in . Lockers available if you check out early saves you carrying your bag all day . Great weekend stay with a trip to see Mary Poppins.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved everything about my stay here - staff were lovely, the appartments were clean and staples like towels etc replenished regularly. Our flight arrived slightly too early to check in but they were very accomodating and allowed us to leave our bags in a safe place and took them up for us once they were ready. I would definitely come back - thank you so much.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I would recommend staying at this location to friends visiting Barcelona; the location is excellent close and yet just away from the main tourist attractions. Our room had a private terrace, which gave us a private outside area for breakfast and some relaxing time. We felt very safe walking at night to various restaurants or local stores. Guillermo was very helpful and willing to share his knowledge of the area. Guillermo often provide excellent advice and made our stay very enjoyable. The apartment is fully equipped for an extended stay, the ability cook some quick meals and do laundry was an added benefit which we enjoyed. We are planning to also stay at the Eric Vokel location in Madrid given our experience in Barcelona.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I don't comment usually on the places I've been and things I've done but I feel compelled... Regarding the time I've spent in pitoresque Barcelona; thanks to my lovely fiancé who surprised me and organized it.Never stayed in a Eric Vokel apartment before but let me tell you, it was almost perfect. Like a glove for this trip. I say almost perfect as we have some small issues with the room but nonetheless Andy, who I consider my top man as he put up with the fussy British couple to accommodate us without hesitation. Let's just say I am used to rent another genre of hotel rooms per se but. I was pleased surprise of the large room as it was cozy and didn't stress my eyes as it was pleasant decorated. It sort reminds me of a family apartment. Long story short...I will defenetly check in again with pleasure in a Eric Vokel style apartment
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Didn't know what to expect while visiting Barcelona for the first time with my family. But the apartment, safe location and staff help made the trip a very memorable one. Would look forward to maybe someday retiring in this wonderful city. Guillermo at the front desk was always helpful each time we approach him for help and advice on the where and how to get to some of the popular spots in Barcelona. His tips were very helpful in making our daily walk and commute an easy one. It really makes a difference when you get the local hospitality especially on a first time visit to anywhere in the world. Looking forward to staying here again in the near future.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Service was excellent . They couldn’t do enough for us . Apartment spotless and modern . Would def recommend this property. Very centrally locates . Walking distance to the touristic sites . Couldn’t fault anything
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an outstanding way to get to know Barcelona being right in the middle of the city. The staff is very eager and helpful. The hotel is beautiful, clean, and smells beautiful!Very nicely upgraded, its a much more preferable stay than the hotels we’ve used before.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: These apartments are absolutely amazing, they are well kept, I have nothing negative to add, oh and the staff are really helpful and welcoming especially Andy. I would most defiantly stay here again 100% recommend
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked a one bedroom apt for the 3 of us for 5 nights on 26 Nov. The room is just right for us since we can all fit into the king size bed, but if 3 adults, will probably need to use the sofa bed in the living room. Which might be a little cramp.The apt is fully equipped with washing machine and all the cooking appliances. Can replenish all the necessities like, washing powder, shower gel, shampoo, oil, salt and pepper from the reception. The apt we had was quiet and clean, no complains at all. Nice balcony too with beautiful sunrise. Staff were friendly and helpful.Great location especially travelling to Monserrat since it’s 10 mins walk from Espanya. Rocafort Subway is juz round the corner. And the fish and chips shop near the apt is a must try.But think they should add some hooks in bathroom for the guests to hang the clothes and towels while showering. For those travelling to the apt using the Aerobus, do note that the bus stops are not very obvious and you need to press the bell for the driver to stop. We missed our stop and dropped at Catalunya instead.Would definitely stay here again if ever have a chance to visit Barcelona.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I loved this place! The location was perfect. In walking distance of everywhere. The staff were so friendly and the apartment was immaculate. It had everything in thee you could want for. I felt like i was at home there. Would absolutely stay there again!!
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Our family of 16 stayed in 2 apartments. We absolutely recommend it. Thank you Andy for your excellent care. You helped get us into our room 2 hours earlier and that was a great help after we traveled 16 hours. The apartment was safe, clean, spacious, and well stocked with 2 roomy full baths. We enjoy buying local ingredients and used the kitchen fully. It was great. We also appreciate Erics corner. You must go there to know.. also So many conveniences close by- Condis market, metro station, buses, eateries, Plaza españa, cafes .. las Ramblas was close enough but far enough to avoid the chaos. Renting a bike nearby is cheap. Whatever we needed, the staff was there to help. We wish we could step out into the lanai area by the kitchen but maybe its to keep us safe. Have ¥1.50 fresh squeezed OJ at Condis and get a cafe next door- they are rated best coffee in Barcelona.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartment is really well located and appointed, with good-sized rooms and all the amenities you would need to stay for either business or pleasure. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. BUT... either the soundproofing between floors is truly terrible or we had elephants upstairs. Morning and night we could not sleep or relax due to the constant heavy footfall, chair scraping and noise from the apartment above. Hopefully, we were just unlucky with who was above us, but it ruined our stay.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Confirtable, very clean, well furnished. Non far from the city centre and very close to Montjuic.P.S. only notation the apartment was a little noisy (occupants of near apartment were not so silents....)
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very helpful and friendly stuff. Clean apartment. Supermarkets, bars and little shops in the neighborhood. Our children loved especially the small bedroom in Japanese style and, as the Metro station is just around the corner, the short ways to the most important places in Barcelona.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We very much enjoyed our stay at Eric Vökel. Nice accommodation, clean rooms, well equipped flat, helpful staff.They sent us an email a few days to confirm arrival date/time and give us essential information. We were arriving out of hours so were expecting to use the self check in machine - but this didn't have our details on it. However we were expected and there was still a member of staff available to help us check in and we had no real issues.There's tea, coffee, apples, soap and condiments downstairs which are free to take (during office hours). The building feels pretty secure and despite being near a big road it's really quiet inside (except for a few clanging metal doors). There's a small but very functional lift if you're on a high floor. Our room faced the rear, with a balcony overlooking a very Barcelona housing area - so you feel like a local!Downstairs lockers are available to use on the day you arrive or leave, so no worries if you have an early or late flight. They use a refundable one Euro. Also toilets in the locker room.The building is maybe 20 minutes walk from La Rambla, 45 minutes from Sagrada Familia. But there's a metro stop less than 100m away, for those who don't want to walk. It's also pretty close to aerobuses to/from the airport.There are a few grocery shops within 500m, including one two doors down.The kitchen has pans, crockery, cutlery, coffee machine, toaster, kettle, etc. All clean and functional. (Note to Eric Vökel - would be great to have plastic utensils for use on the non stick pans!).All in all, a nice place to stay. We'd definitely look at staying again if we come back.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This "hotel" is more like an apartment as the name states. I really wish that I had more time here, great amenities! Full kitchen, dining and living space with a beautiful outdoor terrace. The location could not have been better with immediate needs met-metro, bank/ATM and market all readily accessible. Check in was easy, and I've forgotten his name, but very friendly and welcoming. The office, unlike most hotels, isn't 24hours, but it appeared that they have a 24hr check in to make it easy for those that arrive after hours. The only down side I experienced was the bedding was uncomfortable and felt scratchy on my skin. If I was with a larger group or had more time I would absolutely stay again!
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: was a very good .Your desk clerk named andy was very very helpful and pleasant.Because of him i would stay there again.Your location was great ,it was easy to get around to see the sites .Andy helped us with using the metro to get around .I feel he did more then he had too.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Couldn't fault it, the service, location, rooms and facilities were all fantastic and all at a really great price. Will definitely become a regular visitor (hopefully to all Eric Vokel locations! ) thanks Eric
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We only stayed for two nights at the Erik Vokel apartments but they were fantastic! The apartments are spacious and clean and the reception staff were exceptionally friendly. There are well-stocked boxes in the reception area with everything you need for your stay from fresh coffee to cooking oil! The apartment kitchen is well-equipped. The only thing we would note is that there was no mirrors other than in the bathroom and with four women sharing the apartment, this had to be managed :-) They are quite some distance from la Ramblas but we discovered the city bus tours were just a short walk down the road and as we had a two day pas for them, we could just hop on and off between 9am-8pm easily. We would certainly choose these apartments again and are also looking at their other locations now too.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really loved this hotel. It felt like home. very spacious, very clean. Great!! location. beautiful streeet view. very nice staff. well equiped. we reccomend it! don't hesitate-order!we're sure we'll return to this hotel.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our visit! The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, the apartment was even better than expected and the location was great for our family. Everything we needed was close by and handy.Thanks for making our first night in Barcelona easy and very comfortable.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stay somewhere else if you’re a family traveling with kids. The building has been poorly renovated with paper thin walls and loud doors slamming shut at all hours of the night. Large groups of young LOUD singles, there to party. One lift that is SLOW!!! Loud street traffic. Silverfish bugs in bathroom. On the plus side, it is close to metro station and staff are helpful.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent service, easy check in and check out.Very available and helpful employees.Nice, clean and spacious apartment for European standardGreat location, close to all services and tourist attractions.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Location is fantastic. Check in was absolutely flawless, welcoming, helpful and just lovely staff. The apartment was perfect , the whole experience was great. Will definitely return and have already recommended. Thank you!
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Customer service was great, helpful staff gave some very useful tips on what attractions to visit and how to get there. The apartment met all our needs, was very clean and comfortable and in a great location, easily accessible to all the main attractions and within a short walk from Pl. Espanyol with its many restaurants and shops. Would highly recommended!
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Before booking accommodation in Barcelona we checked TripAdvisor. We were surprised not to see even one negative comment in the last few years about these apartments. The pictures on the website also looked too good to be true. However, from the minute we arrived until we checked out we were able to understand.We stayed 8 nights in the apartment and all members of staff we came into contact with offered excellent service, all were polite and terribly patient with all our questions.The apartment itself was the perfect size for a family of six, including a couple of older teenagers. As we stayed over a week, the apartment was cleaned half way through, and on a further night we came back to unexpectedly find more fresh towels added.The breakfasts were beautifully presented and everything came wrapped separately. During our stay, it was our daughter's birthday and we came back in the evening to find a small gift waiting for her from Eric !!I cannot recommend Eric Vokel highly enough - from the courteous staff, to the clean and beautiful facilities, to the perfect location - halfway between Placa D'Espanya and Place D'Catalunya.Look forward to Eric Vokel opening up apartments in other cities so we can stay there too.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff at Erik Vokel were extremely accommodating! My family and I arrived 2 hours before check in time, however, the staff allowed us an early check in with an incredibly clean apartment! They were very welcoming and told us everything we needed to know during our stay! The apartment itself is hard to fault, with beautiful views overlooking Spain and it’s mountains! It was also fully equipped with everything needed for a family stay. The cleaners came and cleaned our apartment once, providing us with fresh towels and bedsheets! All in all, I would highly recommend this apartment to stay at as not only are the staff incredible, the apartment is situated in the middle of town making it easy to travel between different places via metro/bus or by foot! Thank you for your hospitality!
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked in late but very easy to do had lots of details rooms were very clean helpful staff especially Ana on reception not sure about the bread they use for breakfast but I would stay again and highly recommend it
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After our Madrid visit , we were confident that Erik Vökel will comfort us again in Barcelona . Indeed it was super warm in its hospitality and we loved it again. Barcelona has lots to see and the apartment is situated right in the city centre with shops and 24 hour grocery stores serving all needs . Staff as always is helpful at Erik Vökel . Will stay again anytime .
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Absolutely delighted with this place. Stayed 2 nights after a week at loret de mar. With 2 kids. Martina at reception friendly and very helpful. Loved the quirky retro lift! Great modern apartment. Great location. Would definitely recommend.☺
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed here as a family of 4 for 3 nights, lovely clean apartment. Just enough for what we required space wise. Reception were extremely helpful on arrival with maps and information on buses and metro stations. Plenty of help yourself coffee and sugars etc in reception to take back to your room. Lockers for storing luggage if you check out and have a later flight.Actual location of apartments were very good , literally a metro stop just outside and even if you chose to walk , not too far from some of the sights, heat depending of course. Would definately reccommend .
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Really nice and modern apartment! We absolutely loved the aesthetics/design of the place, and it was nice that there was a reception to the hotel apartments (and with very nice and helpful receptionists).We will 100% book this hotel apartment again when we visit Barcelona in the future. And we will look for the The Erik Vökels apartments in other countries as well. Thumps up from our family :)
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartment is very nice and clean, fully equipped with everything you need. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The apartment is close to metro station.Towels, sheets and toilet paper can be found at the lobby desk.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great experience. All staff members were very friendly and answered all of our question. Apartment was clean. The linens (sheets & towels) were very nice. The location was great. a 10 min walk to several attractions.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is an excellent apartment, with friendly staff, and an excellent, central location. It is close to the Praca Espanha and next door to the Rockaford metro station. There are gelaterias, cafes, and bakeries a few steps away from the property.The staff were very friendly and helpful. Very clean with a terrific kitchen.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Although not central these Suites are just 50m from the Metro and close to some good Tapas bars. The suites are comfortable and roomy with the full range of appliances and A/C.. In addition to all the regular tourist locations and exhibitions we escaped the City for a day excursion to Girona and Figueres (Teatro Museo Dali). Well worth it. We used an agency called "withlocals" who provided a local guide using his own car.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a wonderful stay in Erik Vökel apartments, Barcelona. Our host Martina was very courteous and helpful. She made sure that our stay was comfortable and advised us on all our queries. A big thank you to her.The apartment was nice and cozy with a terrace all to ourselves. The location of the apartments is very central with short walk to supermarkets for all our needs. There is also a metro station nearby to commute to all city’s attractions.All in all, a great stay and will definitely revisit.Thanks,Ash and Vidya
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 1. Room was clean and good for a family of 4. Of course it was small but you are in Europe. Kitchen and freezer + washer. Balcony was a plus and complete room darkening shades (hard to wake up in the morning though).2. People are fantastic. Very nice and attentive.3. Right next to the subway which is very easy to understand and master within a few hours. Don't be intimated by it. Buy a pass for as many days as you will be there and you won't regret it.4. Summary: Excellent value for what you get. Go for it. Enjoy Barcelona.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The apartment was perfect, clean, well located, all kinds of kitchen supplies.The staff was very helpful with everything we needed. The only negative aspect was easy to solve, but the shower was a bit slippery...I would gladly come back and I will forever recommend this chain
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great location - very clean, modern & spacious. We stayed for 3 night with my husband and 2 young children. Very spacious and. Comfortable. Nice to have washer and dryer. Close to Metro , restaurants and supermarkets. They also gave tea, coffee , biscuits, apples & washing detergents.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved the room. It was large. Had a washer/dryer. Full kitchen. Balcony looking over the Main Street, Gran Via. Close to restaurants and super markets. A 5 min walk away you can catch the City bus tour. That you can get off and on over the city to see all the sights. Was wonderful and like to go back someday soon.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We loved our stay at Eric Vokel - loved the layout - one bedroom plus mini area with two beds for our kids, full kitchen and living area. Furnishings nice and modern. Super friendly and nice staff. Nice fresh apples to use as snacks. Really easy to arrive on Aerobus from airport (10 minute walk from aerobus station). Super close to Subway. Taxis drive by every 5 minutes (or less!). Enjoyed having balcony overlooking street (and windows that closed out most of sound).Went to Sevilla for few days and then came back and able to leave luggage in lockers, which was great.We ended up spending most of time in Barrio Gothic, so might have enjoyed staying closer, but this was great value for 2 bedroom and perfect for our family.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Eric Vokel suites are apartments that are run like hotels. The apartment was perfect--3 BRs (one with Queen, one with 2 twins and one with 1 twin), 2 BA, a kitchen stocked with everything you could want if you were going to cook, a living room/dining room area with a coach and eating table, and a washing machine/dryer combo machine. There was even a heated towel rack in the bathrooms.There were blackout shades on the windows that were so dark we had no idea if it were day or night outside. The view from our 8th floor apartment was beautiful. The staff--incredibly nice and helpful. It was near to a metro stop and a 15-20 minute walk from many places in Barcelona. We got the free breakfast kit, which included milk, OJ, and then some bread, jams, hams and cakes. There was unlimited coffee to use in the apt's coffeemaker and "Eric's corner" in the lobby office, where you could not only get the coffee but hot chocolate mix, soap, shower gel and shampoo, apples, and a few other things. Housekeeping came to clean in the middle of our visit. We could not have picked a better place for our family to stay.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The perfect location to access central Barcelona. A minute from the metro and only 15 mins walk from las ramblas. The decor is clean and modern, well equipped kitchen with dishwasher and washing machine. Delighted to discover electric blinds providing complete black out - we had great nights sleep. Very reasonably priced. We would definitely stay again.
hotelName:
24    Eric Vokel Boutique Apartments - Gran Via Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The first impression in a hostel is the front desk, in this case it was disappointing. Francis from Dominican Republic was so plain, not kind and careless, he did not explain about the way the hostel works, the places you have right to, he was chatting on the phone all the time. I had a luggage bag, 2 backpacks and a little Ukulele he had me walking around the hostel without even offering any help. The hostel was very basic, but quite dirty. I just stay one night and I’m glad I didn’t stay longer.
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really liked the location of Gràcia City Hostel. It’s in a very earthy bohemian area. The hostel itself was a decent deal but by no means cheap. We rented a 4-bed room for ourselves. Shared bathroom. Noise was tolerated by staff late into the night which was annoying and the bathrooms were not clean. Basic Breakfast Bat downstairs was a great deal at only €3 per person.
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked the hotel some time ago. Through the intermediary side, I booked a two-story bed (exactly as it was written) only when I paid I received an email confirming only one person. To make sure I wrote an email to the hotel. I received a response from I only booked one place on a bunk bed for one person. (I booked 1 bunk bed). I wrote a request for a refund of 10% down payment because the booking site is misleading and gives false information. Of course I did not receive a refund and no initiative from the hotel. I do not recommend!!! Fraudsters !!!
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I’ve stayed in hundreds of hostels over the last 10 years. This is the first time I’ve been compelled to write a negative review. Stayed in the 8 bed standard dorm. It was small and cramped, which is fine as we were expecting this from a cheaper room. The floors were filthy with hair all over. It seemed the only cleaning that took place was to throw out my toothbrush and toothpaste while I left it on the sink for 5 minutes to get something from the room. Aside from this, and by far the worst problem, was the <6 month old baby in our dorm. Why anyone thought this would be acceptable is entirely beyond me. The baby slept on a bunk with the mother each night - which in itself is dangerous. Obviously, being an infant, it kept our whole dorm up all night. The hostel’s website stated that it’s family friendly, which is fine, but this is just not ok. Why not upgrade them? There’s no changing facility, so the baby was changed on the bed. In an 8 bed dorm. In a hostel. When the baby wasn’t crying, the water moving through pipes upstairs was super loud and grating. So we basically got no sleep the entire 4 nights we were here. The location is good. Garcia is a great suburb. The common area was fine but had 0 atmosphere. Breakfast was fine. Don’t bother unless you’re booking a private room.
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: 12 people in a very small room in the hight of summer is pretty unbearable. Breakfast is hit and miss, they don't seem to replenish the food regularly, it didn't matter when we came down to eat there was never a full spread, and we spent 3 nights here. staff are pretty nice. common area is lovely, kitchen looks good but the hob is really rubbish and it took forever just to boil some pasta. The showers overflow every time you use them and the management seemed unconcerned when we reported this. Cleaning lady is a joy, she will sing loudly at you, its very nice.
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Fantastic location, about 20 minutes walk from the beach but close to metro stations. Very small. Rooms were very basic. No safe. Lockers with no locks, I presume they would provide locks for an extra cost. Kitchen is good. Very expensive to do washing and laundry. Limited bathrooms, showers were faulty but usable. Few power cut outs which were fixed quickly.
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very neat and tidy place! New comfortable pillows, cotton freshly ironed sheets, friendly stuff and a very good breakfast! All at the best price ever! Thank you very much Roger and María for your tips
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For my first journey to Barcelona and fist solo stay in a hostel, Gracia City Hostel turned out to be a great choice! Two meals a day are free but worth tipping for, it seemed like at least one person was constantly cleaning, and the atmosphere is wonderful. I would recommend this hostel whether you're interested in an exciting night-life or a fairly quiet place to rest. The location is great - in an alley off a main street, not far from the metro and bus stops. Thanks Gracia City Hostel for the fun stay and opportunity to meet new people from all over the world!
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a great experience at The Gracia City Hostel. Everyone was very nice and welcoming. They have a really good chef who cooks every night for free but of course tips are appreciated. The food was amazing so I tipped every night. The night tour guide Luciano took us out and showed us a good time. He was super funny and helpful. I recommend staying here even if you are not on a budget because as soon as you get there it feels like home. Cheers!
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So I'm student doing a spot of travelling around Europe, visiting different cities and generally having fun. So by random chance I ended up at the Gracia City Hostel, didn't seem like much and first, but lucky I gave it a chance. Then I met an awesome guy, I think his name was Luciano, yeah Luciano that guy from Colombia? Well he gave me the full "student package", he knew what I wanted. He took me some cool places to have fun and meet new people.I wish I could write more, but I have such a good time, i forgot to log stuff down in my diary. If i ever return to Barcelona, I know where I'm going to stay, as long as my man Luciano is there. Just a wonderful experience, 10/10
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed at GCH for about a week and my experience was great! The staff was always super helpful and the daily tours were a great help in getting to know the city. Luciano, one of the staff at GCH, was super awesome. He's a very welcoming person and he knew the city very well, so his tours were often the best! I plan to come back to GCH when i come back to Barcelona!
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: +Clean and comfy place to stay+Super convenient location (local area away from tourist crowd,but close enough to all the major city sights)+The people who work there are just AMAZING! (it was my first solo trip,so they really made me feel at home). Credits to cool rasta manager Luis,friendliest receptionist Mayra and party guide Luciano who will show you how to hit all the best dance floors in Barcelona!P.S be sure you try Felipe's paella and Luciano's sangria!
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed 3 nights in this hostel and it was amazing ! It's really well placed, clean, the staff is organized and the rooms are really good. There is a guide called Luciano which is a really cool guy and extremely kind. He took us to see a lot of different places and during the night he took us to awesome parties (I'm under the impression he knows ALL the good parties in Barcelona, and that's saying something).
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: とっても良かったです！I had an awesome time at gracia city hostel, the place was well located, clean and the staff was really nice. Specially the night guide, I definitely recommend this place and I will come again!
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had a great stay thanks to Luciano who showed the best places to party in Barcelona (shots included!!). Also the hostel has a good vibe, nice staff, breakfast and an excellent dinner! I will come back!
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a great time here, everyone was awesome and the facilities and rooms were lovely. Definitely great value for money too! The staff were fantastic and Luciano was especially helpful and all round awesome for taking us out and showing us the nightlife! Defo recommended, 10/10 would return!
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was the first little trip on my one, and wow, it was AWESOME. One of the things that makes my trip so wonderfull is the atmosphere of the hostel.The hostel staff kept the stay excellent. Everything was clean, cozy, not to mention every evening delicious fresh food. All of them are friendly. Vinicius Lemes, one off the employees, showed me some nice places in Barcelona. Real good service! Also with the other visitors it became a real family feeling.I really enjoyed my time and i will recommend this place to everyone.
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff and the services were very accommodating for my travelling experience and I will definitely stay here again next time I come. One staff in particular, Luciano, really helped me out and so I want to give him a special shoutout here. I got to really experience Barcelona well because of him.
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Amazing stay during my holidays, great food, environment, clean and near the metro station, great place to start walking through barcelona and near a store (really convinient)... and the parties, the stuff is also great, colombian Guy Luciano became a good friend
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I went to Gracia City Hostel because of a recommendation of another traveller I met. I didn't look up the pictures and came without booking. The staff was super nice and welcoming. The beds were really comfortable and I met a lot of people because of the pub crawl guy Luciano, who made my stay even better. He took us to different bars and a club and it was even for free!!! I had a really nice time, thanks a lot. I definitely come back if I'm going to Barcelona again.
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed almost a week in this hostel. It was a school trip with my class. The rooms were nice and clean. The location is perfect for shopping and sightseeing, points of interest can easily be reached on foot or by metro. We would sometimes spend the evenings in the community room playing games and we also cooked our meals down there in the kitchen and ate there. We bought the food in one of the supermarkets around the corner. There's also a nice placa nearby to go for drinks. The bathrooms were also nice and clean. Staff was friendly enough. Really enjoyed my stay!
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here in a 4 dorm female room in July 2016. It's a great hostel in a perfect location - great base for exploring the city. There's lots of places to eat and hang out nearby and about a 5 minute walk away from a metro station. The rooms and bathrooms are clean which is very important to me and the staff are very friendly! They also do a really nice (and cheap) breakfast. The only negative thing I would say is that it states that it is English speaking but some of the staff I met could not speak English very well but this was fine.
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hostel is located in the neighbourhood Gracia and is really near to the city center. Supermarket is just around the corner and the metrostation 5min walk away. The bathrooms are really clean and the common areas big enough, so you can meet a lot of people. During my stay I was becoming friends with Isi, a really nice volunteer. She showed me around and made me dinner one night. Thank you for that. I really felt wecomed and had a great stay in Barcelona. I totally recommend this hostel!
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really liked my stay in this hostel. The beds are comfortable, bathrooms really clean and the common area has even a television if you just want to relax. You can go walking to the main attractions or take the metro which is just 5min away from the hostel. Apart from all this, the staff is really nice and welcoming. I spent some time with Isabell and she showed me around Barcelona and we had lunch together. Thanks a lot for making my stay so nice, I will definitley come back one day
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for four nights and it's the best hostel I've ever stayed at. The staff are lovely and always there to help if you need anything (Ola! thanks a lot!); they know the area well and will always point you in the right direction. The location is very central. There's a real family atmosphere within the hostel; outgoing and sociable, yet relaxed and mature. Barcelona is an amazing city and Gracia City Hostel is a wonderful place to stay - I'll definitely be visiting again with friends.
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Excellent location central to everything. Lots of local shops and eateries around. Breakfast and dinners at hostel were wonderful and very affordable. Management was very helpful. Some difficulty communicating needs with some employees.
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel is really modern, relaxed and clean. Beds are comfortable and the living room is perfect to meet new people. They also offer free walking tours and pub crawls. A german girl is doing the family dinners every night, which are really tasty. If you want to stay near to the city center and meet a lot of people I recommend this hostel!
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of my favourite accommodations of my trip so far. The staff were so friendly and helpful! They also went way beyond what I'd expect of hotel staff. When I had my purse stolen at the metro the staff were very helpful with directions to a nearby police station, let me use the computer at like 1am to cancel my credit card, and one guy even let me use his mobile when I couldn't work the landline!! Very very impressed with this kindness and sympathy. I know not many travellers will experience this kind of issue but it goes to show the staff are looking out for their tenants :) In general terms as a hostel, the rooms were clean, security lockers large and lockable (byo lock or rent one I believe) and wifi was fast. Other roommates were friendly. The showers were hot and had good pressure. Breakfast was 3.5 euros but was a pretty impressive spread, probably better value than any cafe in the area. Check in:check out was easy too. The hostel was located near the metro and was also within easy walking distance to locations like park guell, the beach, or la sagrada familia. Would definitely stay again!
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I came to Barcelona with some friends and we decided to stay in Gracia City Hostel because of the recommendation of another friend. We definitely don't regret going there. The atmosphere is chilled, bathrooms really clean and the staff super nice and helpful. We went out one night with Isi to some bars and a club. It was such a funny night!:)
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Among previous hostels I have stayed, this place was the best. rooms and bathrooms were clean and cozy. Staffs are friendly and welcoming. They are always prepared to answer questions and they seemed to consider guests sincerely. Also, they provide free tour which was very informative and interesting for me. my tour guide, Kelly, brought me local coffee shops, pizza place, square, and of course other tourist attractions, etc. Without her, I could have not explored this much in Barcelona. throughout the whole tour, Kelly explained about Spanish culture and taught me some cute Spanish words as well. I will definitely stay here again for my next visit in Barcelona!!
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel is really great! I stayed here for a couple of days and had a lot of fun. It's so close to the city center and the Sagrada Familia is only a 20min walk away. The kitchen is so big and clean and the supermarket is just around the corner. Isabell, a volunteer who works there, cooked for us one evening and it was super tasty! I definitly will return one day
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's my first time doing a solo travel and I'm glad to have picked this one! It's a small hostel really, amazing location, clean and friendly. Had a few chats with Kelly when she was scheduled for breakfast duty and we instantly clicked! She then brought me to bunkers to watch the entire view of the city. Had a great time :) thank you!!!
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had so much fun staying in this hostel! Did the free walking tour/bar on Friday led by one of the staff - Kelly and it was so much fun!! I've met tons of people along the way! Really experienced the night life here in Barcelona, it was precious. Would love to experience the same for my next trip back!!
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I very liked my stay here, even if the men bathroom was run downed, the staff was really welcoming and helful. precisely Ola the polish girl, thank you for your hospitalityamoung the 3 hostels I did In Barcelona Gracia hostel was the best !
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staying in this hostel was a really nice experience. Breakfast is great and everything is very clean. The staff is absolutely lovely and they helped me with everything. Especially a lot of thanks to Isabell who showed me around the city! I will never forget my time there!
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean place, staff were awesome, good fun really. Isabel, which was one of the volunteers cooked family dinners for guests, was amazing. Thank you so much! I will come back !! Thinking about booking my next Barcelona trip already !
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed in Gracia City Hostel in July and it was great!! The neighborhood is really nice, and there is a metro station nearby. The staff was always available and very kind, specially Ola, the Polish guide :)
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I was travelling alone to Barcelona and decided to go to Gracia City Hostel because of the good things I read about it and it was the best decision I could have made!! The Staff is super nice, the facilities really clean and the kitchen is perfekt if you like to cook. I also recommend the big breakfast they offer there, Ola is making the best eggs & bacon!! :D
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The staff were incredibly warm and friendly. I hung out with the staff outside of the hostel and always had a great conversation when I encountered a staff member. The rooms were clean. The breakfast was excellent. Everything at the place had a warm, welcoming, homely feeling.
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Gracia is a fantastic local place to be, at night there's entire squares full of people sitting with cans and talking to anyone and everyone. The hostel itself is great, the people are all wonderful and English was pretty prevalent. If you stay here I recommend going to Chiyoda for sushi!!!
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The location is excellent, is very close to the center of Barcelona. The hostel staff was very kind and friendly, and they speak several languages. The rooms were clean and smelled great! Soon we will repeat, sure!
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff is helpful and friendly! they speak and spanish and english.Offer free walking tours around city. Welcomming place, Alex recommends the best restaurants in the neighborhood of Gràcia, she is a happy girl!I recommend!
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: For the most part, I actually really enjoyed my stay at this hostel! I thought MOST of the staff was friendly! A couple of workers at the front desk didn't look up to stay hello, which was unfortunate, but the ones that did talk to you were very friendly! I just wish there was a main lounge to meet everyone. The good news is that I had the whole room to myself the first night! The wifi is great! My second night, I had one roommate who was very friendly! The breakfast is a great deal as well with great food! For a small price, someone will make you eggs and bacon, and that comes with muffins, cereal, and orange juice! It's all really delicious! I really wanted to do the walking tour of Barcelona, but the tour guide was unfortunately not there on my free day there. Overall though, I would recommend this hostel if you're looking for a short stay!
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The picture on the webpage shows a relatively spacious 4-bed room but do not get fooled! The room I got was claustrophobically tiny.Besides, the bathroom next to it was pretty filthy (smelling well, though).It also seem not to attract backpackers but rather party-goers. My roommate came back at 5 o'clock, completely druk, extremely loud and snored like hell. Plus, I forgot my purse in bathroom for a few minutes and when I came back all the money was gone. Breakfast - not worth mentioning. The day I was there you could get toast with marmolade & tea / instant coffee.On the good side, the reception desk service was nice.
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Myself and a few friends went to Barcelona for a week and this hostel was the perfect place to stay. Comfy beds, good wifi, nice bathrooms and great location. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend to others.
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel is located almost in the center of Barcelona between two metro stations. It's in a quiet place and close to many nice bars and restourants, art studios and tallers at the same time. There friendly international workers, who you can ask for many questions and even go out at the weekend. We had delicious breakfast with Russian worker there:) Our room was neat and comfortable enough. Wi fi could be a little better (there's 2 floors, you need to reload it often). Good place to stay if you don't like crowded streets.
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: i do really like the hostel, it is clean and nice, the personnel is very friendly. i also took a walking tour by russian worker, it was amazing! it is also good that the hostel is situated in the center of the town, Workers helped me to plan my walks as i stayed alone there. The persennel are multilanguage.
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: hostel generaly has pleasant atmosphere, helpful staff, especially the lady Misha made an impresion :) We got tips for free time, which was very helpful since we were first time in Spain. It is well situated, nothing is to far to get there by foot.
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: When location is your priority, this hostel is a good choice. Situated in charming Gracia district, it's close to Park Guell, Casa Mila & Casa Batllo. I'm not satisfied with my room (8 beds standard) because of it's size. Comparing to other hostels I've visited this room was very small. Also my bed lamp was not working. On the other hand, the common room and kitchen were pleasant to relax. There was any problem with wifi connection. It's helpful to bring your own padlock. Overall the hostel was clean and people working at the reception desk were courteous.
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very sweet staff, always helpful even if you are a handful, loads of social activities be sure to get in touch with Misha, Valerie and Luciano if they are still there!PS: do not feed the crocodile! :)
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff is superinternational & helpful & friendly! they speak spanish, english, russian, french, checz... Offer free walking tours aroudn city. Can join them for a dinner in the kitchen or go-out with them on friday, saturtday nights after shared sangria & chats in the common area! very welcomming place, especially for those who are on solo or party-company travel!
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for 5 nights and absolutely loved it. The staff is super friendly and helpful. The facilities are clean and great equiped. The kitchen and living room are big and nicely decorated.A check-in in the middle of the night, due to my flight, wasn't a Problem at all.It's not a Party hostel, even though the offered a Pub crawl, which was great. It's a more relaxed community,you will feel welcomed.I loved it.
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I spent four nights in Gracia City Hostel that was my first experience in a hostel and I really loved it.the Staff was sypmatic.Luis organised a fantastc Evening with Acoustic music.In Gracia City Hostel you meet people from diferente nationalities.we had a walking city tour with Marysia it was wonderfull we stayed a little time on the beautiful sandy beach.I recommend it not far from plaça catalunya,la pedrera and Parc Güell.It is a very good experience.
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: nice location near the metro. i was sharing the room with 8 people and the bathroom with 24 people which is crazy , the bathroom was never clean. the computers weren't working. the water was cold at least for the first 5 minutes when you want to take a shower. the staff was good but really low level in english in the reception, and a little bit rude to some people at check out time.
hotelName:
25    Gracia City Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked the wrong date and the agency I booked through refused to help me get a refund. I called the hotel and they were understanding. I got a full refund a few days later. I was very grateful.When I return to Barcelona will definitely stay here.
hotelName:
26    Novotel Barcelona City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: A decent hotel to stay at. Spent two days here. The hotel is directly across Glories mall, and approximately 200m away from the metro. Rooms aren't that modern, but spacious. The hotel seemed busy and queues at the front desk most of the time , which also meant long waits for the elevator (19 floors). The breakfast selection is normal, nothing out of the ordinary. Overall the stay was decent, like the breakfast.
hotelName:
26    Novotel Barcelona City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stay at Novotel I was excited initially but then I was disappointed too Room size was average Amenities average - no water complimentary not even a single pet bottle that’s not expected of Novotel property No body conditioner in the room - not expected of Novotel property Front desk — ok nothing great Don’t expect anything Since I had to catch an early flight I had requested to give me a packed breakfast which was the part of my deal They refused outright to give me packed breakfast too - not expected of Novotel property Rooms shown on net are very different from ones given - despite request to the front desk - no response In India I have stayed at Novotel umpteen times was so happy that I decided to be with this property - was really disappointed It doesn’t look like a star property Felt like I was staying in air BNB For the same price would not suggest this hotel
hotelName:
26    Novotel Barcelona City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for two night in this fantastic modern hotel in a panoramic city family room. The room was clean and spacious however it took 3 prompts to reception to get the sofa bed set up for my kids to sleep in! The roof top pool was amazing and was a welcome place to cool down after taking in the sights of beautiful Barcelona! The pool lifeguards were friendly and charismatic which could not be said of the hotel reception staff who could barely speak English and certainly couldn’t offer any advice/support on transportation options for getting into the city as the hotel is 1.9mikes from the centre! We found the reception staff to be useless and just did or own research but a bit disappointing considering the standard of hotel!! The breakfast was outstanding however the reception staff did not inform us that breakfast started later on a Saturday so we miss out as we had to get to the Airport! It will cost you €42 to get to the airport with four bags by taxi! Amazing hotel but get your reception staff sorted as they will put people off returning!!
hotelName:
26    Novotel Barcelona City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is no way near a 4* rating we had to change our room due to the poor housekeeping the bathtub had mould all around the tub and the hand towel had something red on there and this was just not expectable,the carpet was extremely dirty with lots of stains everywhere, the concierge was extremely rude when we asked for a spare pillow and blanket and we were told the hotel does not have any spare pillows or blankets and the lady called Sarah was extremely rude and refused to give her name, however the most helpful person in the hotel was a very kind and well mannered gentleman called Gabriel he went far and beyond to make our stay as pleasant as possible. This hotel need a complete refurbishment of all rooms, location is great but hotel as a overall is in a poor state.
hotelName:
26    Novotel Barcelona City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel was extremely nice. Child friendly, friendly staff, rooms were clean and comfortable. Beds were super comfortable which is a big plus for me. Location is okay, nothing great. It's about 30 minute walk to Passeig de Gracia which leads down to Placa Catalunya and the Rambla. Around the hotel ther's one small shopping/restaurant street about 5 minute away which was nice. Rooftop pool and bar area was everything we needed. Would highly recommend!
hotelName:
26    Novotel Barcelona City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We arrived at the hotel around 11am after disembarking from our cruise at the port of Barcelona. Upon our arrival the lobby was extremely full and we were told that they were checking in people for a convention and that we could drop off our luggage and come back later to check in and pick up our room keys. This was a good option for us because we were planning on visiting Parc Guell, so we dropped off our luggage and returned a few hours later. By that time the lobby was quiet and check in was a breeze. Our room was clean and comfortable. Didn't have a lot of time to explore the area because we left to Paris the next day, so can't give any information about nearby food or shopping. The only downside to this hotel would be the staff at the breakfast buffet. We had breakfast there the morning before leaving to Paris and were extremely disappointed. We were finishing our breakfast 15 minutes after the buffet had already closed and food had been picked up and were asked to leave because the restaurant needed to be cleaned. We weren't the only ones still eating. There were 2 more tables still finishing up their breakfast and they were also asked to leave. This took us by surprise because usually restaurants wait until you are done eating and leave on your own even if they have already closed, so to us this was extremely rude. Maybe a custom of the area? Not sure, but a complete downer in customer service for us.Anyway, other than teaching their breakfast staff better customer service, the hotel is fine.
hotelName:
26    Novotel Barcelona City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for four nights in June with my spouse. Otherwise we have no complaints, but the first room in the 12th floor we received smelled so bad, that my spouse, who's a sensitive to moisture damage really could not spend time in the room without her allergies acting up. Even I, who am not too picky could smell that everything was not ok. We complained and asked for a new room. The hotel granted our request, and the new room did not have this problem. If they wouldnt have been able to grant us a new room, our review would have been quite different.. This also raises the question if many of the rooms suffer from the same issue.Otherwise our stay was quite pleasant, nothing to complain about. Nice views, decent food and a nice rooftop pool+bar
hotelName:
26    Novotel Barcelona City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: If you value the gym to choose the hotel, stay away from this hotel !! the gym that appears the photos on the official website do not represent reality !! They changed the gym to the basement, no sound, no tv, no mirrors, inadequate floor and no ventilation, lousy place !! do not be deceived like me! bad management decision!But the hotel has a good cost benefit when we talk about location, room size and breakfast!
hotelName:
26    Novotel Barcelona City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Exactly what you'd expect from a Novotel, clean & efficient with pleasant & helpful staff. Rooms maybe a little 'tired' but generally okay. Good value for the money. If I am to criticise anything it would be that the rooftop bar & swimming pool is nothing like the photographs, it is small, cramped & fairly 'run-down', certainly nothing luxurious as portrayed. Also location is not too convenient, distance to both Sagrada Família & Gothic Quarter are each a good 25-30 minutes walk. This is not a problem but literature certainly suggests the location is a bit more convenient. Take a taxi if you're not too mobile!
hotelName:
26    Novotel Barcelona City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can’t comment on proximity to the station as we got taxis everywhere - which were plentiful outside the hotel door.Positives:-Excellent breakfast, although did get busy and congested, and towards the end of the breakfast certain food was not replenished.Shopping mall was opposite making it easy to get food if we didn’t want to venture into town.There was a pharmacy and bank nearby (I used both as my wife fell ill during our trip).Most staff were helpful - although this was a negative too as one or two behaved like it was their dads hotel and need retraining in customer service. I staff member actually located my daughters pink tiger we got from Copenhagen so I was really happy with that.Negatives:-- One or two of the staff were just rude. I don’t know if they are on work experience or just don’t get it, but when I am travelling with young children I want you to make my life pain free - especially if I’m an Accor member and have already checked in. I do not want to be hanging standing with my son asleep on my shoulder while you recheck my entire booking and ask for my blood type.- I was told the location was nearby a metro station, but honestly it was quite a distance to many of the main sites in Barcelona (you realise this when getting cabs to places). This being said the location felt extremely safe and welcoming and I did not feel concerned walking around late at night.- Pool was unheated - which meant the kids while enjoying themselves for 5-10 mins got cold quickly.
hotelName:
26    Novotel Barcelona City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The Hotel is called City but it is a long way from the City, but the local subway and bus links are very easy to negotiate and away from the hussle and bussel of the busy city centres. Standard 4 star hotel and the rooms are spacious and functional, The roof top swimming pool and bar was always very crowded and in our 4 days there we didnt get a seat or a swim because of some many other quests who seemed to be there all day. The check in and check out was very efficient and in particular Gabriel was very helpful and spoke many languages. The buffet breakfast was a major disappointed - whilst the choice of fruit was exceptional, the remainder on offer was pretty standard - just eggs and local meats. OK though for a start for the day and the manager was very good at moving people around in an overcrowded area.
hotelName:
26    Novotel Barcelona City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Well situated hotel, near to Metro station and shopping area, clean, smart, staff very helpful, excellent breakfast selection, lovely rooftop bar, comfortable room, would definitely stay here again if we came back to Barcelona
hotelName:
26    Novotel Barcelona City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed for 2 nights for a business trip.The room was comfy if very plain and there is a great view from the rooftop bar.I would have enjoyed a swim but the pool is so close to the bar that I felt too self-conscious.The location was good for work and within walking distance of Sagrada Familia.Breakfast is good if a little hectic.I think what let it down was the staff. Both in the bar, at reception and at breakfast I felt that they would rather be elsewhere. I had to ask the reception girl what time breakfast was and where it was as she didn't tell me anything.
hotelName:
26    Novotel Barcelona City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Though not in the heart of tourist location, the hotel is conveniently located & accessible by metro, bus & tram. And less costly than similar places near la Rambla or Pl Catalunya. There are numerous eating places & shopping across the hotel in Glories mall. I walked to well known places like Torre Glories (almost next to hotel), Sagrada Familia, La Monumental etc. One quick bus ride took me to the gothic quarters & sea front. Overall, the hotel was comfortable & clean. Check in & out was efficient. I didn’t have breakfast, so cannot comment on the quality, but I would stay here again on future visits.
hotelName:
26    Novotel Barcelona City
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object
