The room was clean, relatively large by European standards, quiet and comfortable. The shower was also amazing - a large rainfall type shower that was quite relaxing. The front desk was very accommodating - even to printing out tickets purchased on-line and boarding passes for us. We walked everywhere and this hotel is central to many attractions. Finally, it was very reasonably priced. When we return to Barcelona we will definitely look to stay at the Praktik Bakery again!
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Wake up to the heavenly smell of fresh baked breads.The rooms are small but adaquete for 2, well thought out and smart use of space.In a nicer part of neighbouhood, posh street just 2 blocks away.Breakfast!! Just line up and buy em! You will see that even the locals flock here for breakfast. Wished I've stayed longer than the 2 nights I did.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We need to pay the apartment, as we arrived. Afterwards we first got the chance to see to see the apartment. It was not as clean as expected and the bedsheet was not wrapped around the blanked, as it usually is. So you’re skin touches the blanked itself: we don’t feel comfortable with that. We also expected a nice view (old buildings with small balconies) as it’s shown on the pictures. Instead there was a backyard and no balcony.We asked very friendly if there is the possibility to get another room. The receptionist told us, that the pictures on Booking must be a mistake. He doesn’t know a room like shown at this Hotel.I need to show him the Booking a few times, till he believes that it is not my own booking fault. All this takes an hour or so. Too much, for getting a solution.By the way. There is no solution yet. The receptionist told us, that he hasn’t the power to take a decision.The Bakery is fine. Products are great. Waiters are very unfriendly.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: What a perfect location! Amazing bakery. Clean and comfortable hotel. Close to everything. Perfect for you Barcelona stay! My husband and I rented bikes from a place near by and this was such a central location. Great restaurants and bars in walking distance too!
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location and very helpful staff. The rooms are very small and stark. Everything is white except for the tile in the bathroom. There is NO place to put more than one suitcase except on the floor. Breakfast at 11 Euros each is way overpriced. Better to buy your breakfast at the hotel's bakery where you have a far better selection. And clearly better to take a taxi rather than to walk in Barcelona. The crooks can spot a tourist a mile away and their bag of tricks to take your valuables and make them theirs is creative, to say the least. Beware.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location. Small rooms but adequate for our stay in Barcelona. Breakfast was good but my family wished we had not done the breakfast included option. They would have preferred to go through the line at the bakery and get fresh coffee and not from a machine. Can't get ice if the bakery is closed.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a very nice and unique Hotel in the Heart of Barcelona. Staff members were very friendly and helpful. The Bakery on the Main Level is part of the Hotel and of amazing quality and variety. The Rooms are spotless clean and modern with a very nice Shower. The downside was that aside from the Bed(s), there is nowhere to sit. Additionally, the HVAC is controlled for the entire hotel as one and will keep resetting to whatever the Hotel as a whole is programmed for. Hence, the Room did not have any air circulation even on relatively warm Spring days.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My sister recently moved to Barcelona so I was coming over to visit her. I have just returned from a recent stay here with my 22 month old daughter. We had originally booked a different hotel and the booking got cancelled by the hotel. We then stumbled across this one. As annoyed as I was at the original hotel I’m so happy it got cancelled. I loved this hotel! I had booked a baby cot and requested early check in. The cot was made up in the room and the room ready early. The room was much smaller than I imagined, but absolutely perfect! Everything needed was there, it was lovely! The shower was great. There is a small shower also if you don’t want to wash your hair (or, in my case, for the toddler to use). The bed was massive and comfy and had enough room to pop my folded down stroller under it at nights. On night one my daughter got sick over the bed and me. I requested fresh bed sheets, we had to wait a long time for them to arrive but there was only one person in reception, and he was busy. When we checked out the hotel kept my bag until I left for the airport. Every staff member I spoke to were friendly and helpful. All in all a most wonderful hotel. The bakery and breakfast was so tasty. The only silly downside for me was there was only 2 English tv channels (which were serious American news channels). Silly complaint, but when my baby went to sleep early, I’d nothing to do as forgot my book. Also, there is no kettle in the room. I had brought my own local tea bags with me, so every night I brought a cup of hot water up from reception for my tea. Totally silly downsides which I can deal with. All in all, I will be staying here again when I visit my sister next. Hopefully it’s soon. I’ll remember my book, and my tea bags and I’ll have just as lovely time!
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It's such a unique atmosphere when you have to go through the bakery to get to the reception. The rooms are really simple but very special and cute in their simplicity. The corridors really smell like fresh bread, it's not just an advertising gag. For breakfast you can either buy something in the bakery or you choose the buffet where you have a selection of mini-versions sold in the bakery. Again, the atmosphere in the breakfast area is great as you can watch the bakery while they're working.The staff is really competent and friendly.Thanks for the pleasant stay.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Room is nice, modern and clean. Nice bed to sleep. Bathroom with great rain shower and very clean. Breakfast is really nice with fresh bakery. Location is perfect in the middle of the city. Friendly staff.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: the location is perfect, and the hotel is one of my favourites in Barcelona. Ask at the front desk some suggestions where you can eat, thay have plenty of nice and interesting places. The bakery is amazing to have breakfast. I suggest to take them not in the included breakfast but make your own selection at the bakery store
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Love this hotel,the location is perfect. The staff super helpful and friendly. And the bakery on the ground floor was absolutely wonderful. The room was super clean ,the shower was huge with great water pressure.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is so cute and clean! We could literally smell fresh bread every morning. The service at the hotel was exceptional. The location of the hotel was perfect for us because we didn’t want to stay in the middle of the busy downtown Barcelona. This hotel is the perfect location, near a lot of the major tourist sites but in a quieter/ quaint part of the city. Highly highly recommend staying here!
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Bakery or Hotel Really a new experience, wake with smell bread bake.A few blocks of Las Ramblas and area of good restaurants, Gentle service and nice peopleI will return next yearYou need know this experience
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My first impression of this hotel was that it was just marginal. The rooms were small and quirky. You have to walk through the bathroom to get to the tiny bedroom which struck me as odd. By the end of our stay I loved it! It was very clean and very efficient. The location was optimal. One block from La Pedrera and the exquisite shopping on Passeig de Gràcia. The hop on and off bus stops across from La Pedrera and there is a metro station right there as well. Who could ask for a better location. The bakery Baluard located in the lobby is to die for and honestly I did not find another of that quality anywhere else in Spain. Don’t purchase breakfast with your stay. It’s is more economical to purchase on your own. Croissants were amazing and we are still talking about them. If you are looking for fine dining, there is a Michelin star rated restaurant in the 5 star hotel next door. Don’t let this little hotel fool you. It’s a hidden gem. I would eagerly stay there again. A clean, quite place with comfy beds to lay my head after a busy day exploring the beauty of Barcelona.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had a lovely stay of five nights here, central location near La Pedrera and the Diagonal metro station. Friendly staff, gorgeous bakery and clean rooms all at a reasonable price. Would definitely use again.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great locations reached everywhere by feet..., comfy room for short vacations since not much space for luggage. Shower is very good., the bakery is amazing. We decided to not take the hotel breakfast but pick single products from bakery and they were all delicious!
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Enjoyed all amenities of this modern hotel, great customer service and downstairs artisanal bakery is big plus. We loved to wake up to the smell of freshly baked bread. Consider quality to price to be a very good value.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel is located in a decent area of town. Has a bakery on the first floor with a good selection of food. PROBLEM: No heating or air conditioning on the rooms. The hotel decides when to turn on the heater or the air conditioning for each room (all rooms selected at the same time, unable to satisfy each customer), and they only turn it on for 2 hour/day. We had to sleep with the window opened while it was 75F outside and it was very very loud (would wake us up even with earplugs). We called the lobby several times and they said there was nothing they could do to allow us to control the temperature.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My daughter and I spent 4 nights here recently. While the location is very good for Gaudi and fine shopping some of the other areas like the Gothic Quarter or El Born seem more charming. The room is very small but very clean with all of the standard amenities. My concern was the lack of basic knowledge from the reception staff. Common tourist destinations like Park Guell required the staff to search the internet for transportation choices. On two occasions we were given wrong information. Once we were sent to the wrong restaurant with a similar name but I was specific in my request. Most times we were only given basic instructions like "you'll get Bus 24" but not where the bus stop was or what direction to go. As an experienced traveller I expect basic information to be available by a knowledgeable staff.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice location, the room is small but meets your needs. Great bakery & breakfast. Only problem is if you have a room facing East you will get a wake up call at sunrise since the window only has a sheer curtain.Hotel has link to welcomepickups which offers limo service to sites, airport, etc. They did a great job for our rides from the Cruise Ship to the Hotel and then to the airport.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is open 24/7. The bakery downstairs is so cute. Delicious coffee and food and nice staff. The hotel room was perfect with a large shower. The perfect stay for Barcelona in the best part of Barcelona, Eixample! Would definitely recommend.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a great long weekend here. Great value and extremely close to the centre, but not too close. Would recommend heading north into Gràcia to eat in the evening, as less touristy, so a great range of bars and restaurants.The bakery does lovely pastries, bread and pizza. Buffet breakfast is good value, but just make sure you don’t arrive just after a large group, which cleared things and meant we had to wait for everything to be replenished.Staff were friendly and embarrassingly spoke faultless English compare to our poor Spanish. Would definitely stay again
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: warm welcome, cosy atmosphere, great bakery smell everywhere !good breakfast in a nice and confortable dining room.The rooms are nicely decorated, shower is extra.Staff is very quiet and we had no disturbance while we stayed a lot in the room.bakery stuff was very good and the restaurants in the surroundings are excellent, (Xavier Pellicar, and hotel One !
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoyed our stay. It's an interesting concept having the bakery on the ground floor and the hotel above and it works well. Room was smart and clean. Staff were really helpful. Breakfast was relaxed and a good amount of choice. The location was good for us, there were bars and restaurants close by.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was a fantastic stay in the heart of Barcelona. Very well located, including being very close to two Gaudi buildings and a short walk to the Sagrada Família.Also, we cannot sell short the day to day benefits of being accommodated above a very fine bakery.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had to cancel this trip last minute as my business meeting was postponed. I contacted this hotel to adapt my reservation to next week. They refused and charged the full amount. I am regularly in Barcelona on business .. I will not look at this company again.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I visited Barcelona with my husband earlier this month and chose this hotel based on it's location and reviews. The location was great, right around the corner was a beautiful shopping street and one of the Gaudi buildings was on the corner. We were able to walk everywhere. The hotel was built with a bakery in the lobby and the delicious smells made their way upstairs, at least to our floor. We are there every morning. You can do the buffet of just buy at the counter which is what we did. Everything is fresh and you can watch them bake. Truly amazing bakery. The room was small but it was fine, clean and comfortable. And nicely decorated. The staff were also helpful. I would recommend and stay here again.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for four nights in February. I found communication with the hotel easy, I needed to check and make sure the front desk would be open for me to check in after I got in on a late train. Was told not to worry and that they front desk is available and open 24 hours. The smell of baked bread in the halls and the rooms was intoxicating and one of the things I missed the most upon leaving. Very easy to access the hotel via public transportation both from the train station (Barcelona Sans) and the airport. I have stayed in a few other Praktik properties in the past and have found this location to live up to the expectations I had from them. The only thing I wished was that there were the possibility to make my own coffee in my room. That would have really made this a fantastic property, but the bakery in the lobby was easy enough to use during the day.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed for two nights, on a business trip. Friendly atmosphere and nice and spacious room. If you can, avoid getting the inner rooms facing the wall. The hotel is well located next to metro, train and major attractions. Although the area is very calm, you can stil find some nice restaurants. I will stay again there.
hotelName:
28    Hotel Praktik Bakery
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We booked this property for a girls week in Barcelona. There were 3 of us and we couldn't find an AirBNB with 3 beds. We figured a suite would be comfy even if it seemed terribly far from the city center. We loved this place! It was only a few (3 or 4) blocks from the metro and you are in city center. The hotel was lovely, quite secure for 3 ladies and the staff was marvelous. Our room had 2 beds and they moved a 3rd into the lilving room area with plenty of room to move around. The suite was quite spacious and we loved the balcony on which we had coffee while each of us had our turn to shower.the housekeeping staff did a great job, we had plenty of towels each day and when asked for extra toiletries, coffee, cups etc we always had them. Room was spotless every day.The only complaint we had the entire stay isn't really a complaint but we arrived at the breakfast buffet right at the time it was closing and even though there was plenty of food out we were denied, which I thought was a shame. However, the desk clerk guided us to a lovely spot next door and it was wonderful.I would definitely stay here again next time I'm in Barcelona.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here for 4 nights for a business trip. Staff are excellent, rooms are spacious and food is great. It is also walking distance to the metro making travel around Barcelona really convenient. The neighbourhood has a park and nice restaurants too, Really want to commend the front desk staff in particular - I did think they were understaffed as often there was only one person there and a crowd of people to attend. But when things quietened down, their attention to detail was awesome. Didn't get all their names except Christina Bley. She is very helpful.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We spent 6 nights at the AC Hotel Victoria Suites during our recent trip to Barcelona for the Spanish Grand Prix.Our suite was large, clean and had comfortable beds. The front desk staff were more than helpful from answering our questions to arranging taxis for us. The hotel restaurant was great. We couldn't have asked for anything more and would highly recommend it.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I had a wonderful stay here. The staff were so friendly and helpful, and the accommodations were comfortable and spacious. We were very close to all forms of transit, including the Tourist bus line. The restaurant was a great place to eat and socialize. A great place for couples to get away and enjoy Barcelona.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Family suite was perfect for our family of 5. The room was clean and comfortable. Heloise at the front desk was so friendly and helpful allowing us to check in early after our overnight flight. Local neighborhood had a nice residential feel with a park and several restaurants nearby. Also ate at the hotel restaurant and enjoyed each of our meals there. A short walk to FC Barcelona football stadium and basketball arena which was convenient while attending games each night. Unfortunately less convenient to many other sites so you may want to consider another hotel in the Old City for more traditional sightseeing.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here for a week during a business trip. This hotel is located outside the main tourist area, but it is close to a Metro stop and easy to access by public transportation. The staff was extremely helpful with all of my requests. Housekeeping was excellent. Good Wi-Fi, plenty of hot water and water pressure, and a nice large room with a small kitchenette. My room came with self-service breakfast, and the breakfast is good. The attached restaurant has a nice patio that is quite enjoyable in good weather. I have two suggestions if you stay here. First, there is a monastery called Pedralbes within about 15 minutes walking distance. While it might not be one of the most popular tourist attractions in Barcelona, it is pretty, peaceful, and worth a visit. Second, there is a nice coffee shop and bakery about two blocks away, SantaGloria. Shopping is also nearby in the Corte Engles shopping mall near the Maria Cristina Metro stop, about a 10 minute walk. I would choose this hotel again, particularly if I were on a business trip and did not need to be right next to the tourist area. Actually, as a matter of personal preference, I found this hotel more pleasant than the hotels I have stayed in near Las Ramblas, which tends to be noisy particularly at night.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is located in the peaceful, upscale residential Pederables neighborhood, a short walk to transportation and shopping on the upper Diagonal, Barcelona's largest boulevard. There are a number of excellent restaurants in the neighborhood, the Upper Lounge Bar and Maria Parilla being of particular note. The hotel staff and accommodations are both quite nice; however, some of the facilities are in the need of (and undergoing) updating. Heloise at the reception desk was particularly helpful in making the stay for our family of four during the busy annual Mobile Week a very enjoyable one!
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: My wife and I just stayed at this outstanding hotel in Barcelona, where we celebrated our 45th wedding anniversary. What made it so special to us was the attention to detail shown by Alberto Cortegoso in the front desk office at the hotel. I started communicating with him prior to our arrival, advising him of our special occasion and he went out of the way to insure everything was perfect! He made sure that all the hotel and restaurant staff was aware of our visit. As a result we were treated like royalty. The location of the hotel is perfect as it is in a quiet neighborhood, but very close to all major attractions.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hotel was very quick to resolve issues & very kind & very friendly. Appreciate all their hardwork and professionalism. Buffet breakfast was excellent and variety of food was excellent. Atmosphere of the hotel was warm and welcoming. Close to banks, public transportation, coffee shops, and so glad is away from the busy touristy area. Needed the quietness after a day of busyness. Thank you for a wonderful stay
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were at the end of our 2 week trip and we have been members of the Marriott rewards program for years and knew we would find a good hotel. We found a gem. Close to Metro and great staff. Alhambra and Nico took such good care of us. We highly recommend if you don't need to be near city center and are comfortable using Metro.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: After a shaky start with couple of issues with the room, they moved us to a different room and offered a tray of food and drink as an apology. Since we had three people staying in the room, they had a roll-away bed ready as well.Excellent location too as it's about a 5-10 minute walk from the Maria Christina metro station.The breakfast buffet is most excellent, offering breads, meats, cereals, fruits, and juices. Best part is that it lasts from 7-10:30AM Monday through Friday and 7-11:30AM on the weekends.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very nice hotel in a nice residential area. Very clean and spacious rooms. Close to shopping and number of restaurants. Very convenient to Barcelona football club and to the airport. Further away from tourist attractions, however with easy access using tram, subway or buses. Restaurant is good for dinner. The breakfast is not the best but is ok. If we return to Barcelona will stay in AC Victoria suite.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We really enjoy our stay at AC Victoria. The room is clean, spacious and very comfortable. The hotel isn’t very close to the metro stations - it’s around 10 minutes walk while it is a good walk. Staff at the front desk are very friendly and helpful - we went to Sitges for a half day trip - a lovely coastal town recommended by a girl at the front desk. :) We will stay at AC Victoria again if we come back again.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The AC Victoria hotel has a great location near shopping, on-off buses, Starbucks and easy access to most Barcelona sights. There's a great restaurant at the hotel for breakfast, lunch and dinner and several restaurants nearby for just about any type of food.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The front desk staff are very kind, friendly and delightful. We enjoyed our stay and they certainly made it memorable by upgrading us to a family room (we are SPG members eligible for upgrade). We had the family suite - it was very spacious and while we were only 4 - it could accomodate 5-6. The hotel is located in a residential area and conviently located to the metro, bus stop, hop and off stops. It's a bit away from the city center, but worked well for us to come back to a quiet place. Regarding rooms:We were on the first floor, but if you are a light sleeper - facing the street on the first floor will result in you hearing all the street chatter. For us it didnt matter as we came back to the room at around midnight and we tired. If you are a light sleeper be sure to take a higher level floor away from the parking on the streetOverall - awesome hotel, even more amazing front desk staff, great housekeeping. Will definitely return. The hotel is extremely clean and rooms are spotless. The housekeeping folks do an amazing job. There is absolutely nothing that was stained in our room. Only downside, they were no USB sockets in this hotel - be sure to bring your own adapter.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel was well appointed and very comfortable but what really made our visit great was the wonderful staff. The airline lost our luggage and the hotel staff helped us contact the airlines to try to find out information. Also the restaurant attached had absolutely fantastic food. We would definitely stay there again and would highly recommend it to other visitors.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had reserved two rooms for our stay in June. We had requested an earlier check in since we were arriving from the United States. The woman at the desk told me my room wasn't ready yet and would not be ready for several hours. I said to her I requested an early check in. She looked at the computer and said yes you are correct. I was not happy with this encounter. I was charged $48 dollars for a roll away bed. We were told that rooms are for 2 people. This was a suite room and only 2 people were permitted in the room which is insane. Then when we checked out we were informed that we had done a points and pay for our stay. We would not have stayed here if we had to pay. We were charged $400 USD. When I returned home I called Marriott who said they would forward this to the hotel and it would be resolved. I received an email from the hotel stating that I had participated in this pay and points program and they would not refund my money. There are no attractions near this hotel and I would never stay here again!
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Whilst staff were attentive and generally helpful and rooms clean and very spacious, this place has a few issues. It is located in a quiet and classy neighbourhood on the outskirts of Barcelona, but some distance from the centre and regular attractions. Suites are very roomy and reasonably well-furnished (though the large beds were quite lumpy and uncomfortable). However, the overall build quality is atrocious. Outside on the pleasant balcony, chunks of plaster had fallen from the roof. Soundproofing is not great either. The bathroom, though clean and modern, was poorly-designed with the toilet jammed next to the tub. Housekeeping didnt show up when we went out all morning and although in the afternoon they offered to come later (after our short siesta), when we called they said it was in fact too late to have the room serviced - and dropped off some extra towels instead. The restaurant is pretty good. The whole experience is relatively expensive, even though we had a discount. Give it a miss unless you need to be in that neighbourhood.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Nice hotel in nice area, not close to most attractions but subway connections were very convenient. Staff was pleasant and helpful, we did have a problem with our room key not working, but staff made it as painless as they could by letting us in when we needed.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The rooms were a bit old fashioned for my taste but functional. They were however very spacious for hotel rooms in Barcelona and were fairly clean. The location is a bit of a journey to the downtown area of Barcelona but still accessible. The staff were professional and courteous but nothing special. The hotel is however undergoing some renovations during my stay and my floor was one of them. Overall, not a bad hotel but be warned of the ongoing renovations they have not advertised on their site. Just another average stay.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stayed here during the MWC in Barcelona. The rooms are suites so very spacious. Big bathroom. The service is great specially front office. The place is quiet. The breakfast is complete and very good. Room 911was quiet. Only issue I had was that another guest walked into my room at 2am. There was some error at front desk
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The suites are quiet, clean and comfortable with king sized beds. The young ladies on the front desk were really smiling and welcoming. I really liked the atmosphere of the terrace and dining area. Breakfast buffet was good and hope to eat here the next time.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Second time in the hotel...such a great place to rest after meetings and work...honestly the best place and very good located, 4 years traveling to Barcelona and finally I got my hotel...comfortable, clean, top 4 stars, convenience and the best the service, specially the reception people and room services...my hotel in Barcelona!
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel is lovely, excellent service. Very clean, very modern - everything you would expect from a Marriott. The staff were very helpful and prompt to deliver any service. Within walking distance to the Metro and to FC hop on hop off bus stop. Close walking distance to lovely bakery and a yummy pizza restaurant.The only negative would be the cost of the breakfast 20.50 euros.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Booked here for 9 nights as part of a business trip. Other reviews mostly fair, but here are some additional points. First, room sizes are really good, especially if you are here for more than a few nights. I stayed 2 weeks at the end of May at a sister AC, callled Irla...rooms were all very, very small and I did my upmost to stay out. The rooms here are a great size, as one would expect of a suites style hotel.Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Be sure to smile and at least attempt a few phrases in Spanish or Catalan,,,,you will be amazed at the reaction this simple courtesy will bring. Did I encounter a grumpy person? Sure, but this was the exception and a very rare one at that.The bed is very comfortable and I don't understand the complaint about the shower. Perhaps they had a room where the clamp was worn out. Mine was fine and it also was a deep soaker style tube..perfect for soaking the body after a full day of walking.There is a little fridge and auto coffe maker in the standard suite. I asked for the refrigerator to be emptied so I could put in my own stufff. No sweat and they took care of things right away.Did I see some mold style stains on the top of the shower area and bathroom entrance? Yes (room 603) but remember, this is an area that gets very humid in the summer. The hotel could do itself a favor by installing vent fans. In any event, that bathroom is spacious, with room for two, if needed, as well as including a bidet.As a Marriot Lifetime Platinum member, there are only a few "perks" for staying. Free high speed wifi and about 50% discount for breakfast. The restaurant is always busy because options seems to be popular with both guests and visitors alike. My only gripe about breakfast was the fried eggs were never hot, however I would had the plate to the waiter and he'd nuke them, no problem. By the 3rd day, they knew me and would just take the plate from me while I was still at the buffet line, heat my eggs and bring them to the table, along with a bottle of sparkling water every morning...they made the effort to get to know me.As for location it is in quite neighborhood. There are many nice restaurants in the area and you are about 15 mins, by foot, from a large El Corte Ingles, which has a big supermarket. If you walk for 5 mins, it's easy to catch several bus lines that can take you to the town center, gothic center, etc (about 30 mins). Is this "walk out the front door and be in the middle of the Gothic quarter" type of location? No, but I will take the trade off of a spacious room and easy public transport any day of the week. Besides, google maps makes moving around the city by bus / metro / tram super easy.Folks, this is not a full 300 room Marrriot so let's stop writing reviews that complain about not being one. ACs are a great part of the Marriot brand, stylish, modern and with their own quirks. My only grump about this location is the fitness center is impractical to the point be useless...like they needed to put something in just to tick the fitness center on premises box.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Staff were really friendly , very smooth check in and check out , what really surprised me that in the unfortunate day with the terroristic ramblas incident one of the staff was waiting in the lobby making sure that we are ok and had a list of rooms to check if there was any missing guests, superb service and extremely friendly environment.Only downside for me is the breakfast buffet need to have more options and varieties
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good value for money! Rooms were very comfortable and spacious, amenities in the room like bed and bathroom are good. Front desk service staff are very polite and professional. Stayed for 4 nights and gotta say the room cleaning/tidying is great.Slightly off city centre but didn't bother me as the direct train from Maria Christina to Liceu brings me there in 20mins (€1/ trip if you get the 10 rides ticket). Didn't try the breakfast as was too pricey but food at the restaurant was good (only thing is staff there don't seem too friendly/ focused on non-hotel customers)Overall still a great stay!
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We had a week in a two bedroom room in August...I will start with the positive.. I think it was decent value for money....the hotel is in a very nice location in the North of the City....It is a twenty minute drive from the airport....within walking distance of the Barcelona Football Stadium and probably 15 to 20 minute drive to the centre of Barcelona....Its a pleasant suburban area and there are nearby Bus stops.. tram stops... and the Metro Station at Maria Christina to take you into the City...It cost about four euros return on the metro into the centre of Barcelona and took around twenty minutes....Its a short walk to Diagonal... a long and busy road which has lots of shops and amenities....The staff at the hotel were friendly and helpful.....the room was cleaned every day....there is a restaurant and breakfast service...the room itself was a generous size...a large double bed and two single beds....there was a coffee table and a small balcony which was nice to get the sun....The negatives were that the room décor could have been a little better...I noticed several scuff and scratch marks on the furniture...I thought there was a health and safety issue in that we were on the ninth floors and the bedroom windows could be fully opened and somebody could fall out.. which at that height could be fatal....also on the small balcony...there was a protective plastic barrier.. but it was only three foot high...and a large child or adult could easily fall over it...which again from nine floors up could prove fatal...better use could have been made of the room space...there was very little storage space in the second bedroom......The worst thing was the kitchenette.... There was a small kitchen area with two hot plates...but no cutlery or crockery...we were told that if we wanted cutlery and crockery we would have to pay fifteen euros per day to hire them from the hotel...this would have totalled over one hundred euros for the week...unacceptable...we could have gone to a local shop and bought our own for twenty euros.....The choice of food at breakfast was limited...Overall I would still recommend the hotel for the money...
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I just stayed at this hotel for two nights in business, leaving on the day of the terrible attacks!The hotel is ideally located for the University where my customer was located and not too far from the airport and the city. The rooms were spacious and had all the amenities you would expect. Breakfast was limited but sufficient.Underground parking was available although at ~€30/night was expensive.The onsite restaurant had a limited menu but was excellent and varied. I ate here both nights and had ex emotional service and standard of food. Excellent presentation and with excellent flavours.Steamed local mussels and the Foie Gras were my favorites. I will be back!
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The food was delicious and the rooms were clean and well kept in the few days that we were there. I certainly wouldn't say that this is a top notch hotel, but it was good for what we wanted. The only thing was that the hotel was considerably far from Las Ramblas and the Gothic quarter, and seeing as there was a taxi strike, we missed out on clubbing, which was unfortunate. In spite of that, the staff was kind and the rooms were good.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed one night and had two rooms for 6 people. Rooms were spacious and comfortable. Did not eat at the restaurant because the breakfast price was outrageous. Within a 3 minute walk to one of the hop on hop off bus tour stops which was convenient for us. Don't even think about getting laundry done - price is per item - $4.50 for a pair of underwear to be laundered! Hotel is in a quiet residential neighborhood!
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This facility is nowhere near the caliber of a Marriott hotel. No respect for Marriott Reward status, no upgrades, etc. Room rates are overpriced. Management will possibly write a response but don't buy it!!
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Great Hotel. Highly recommend. Good room, restaurant, balcony. The price can be expensive some season but it's very good. I highly recommend this Hotel. Have the best days there. Will comeback someday
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: great service, lovely suite room with all amenities if you prefer to stay in a calm residential area to get more feel of the city. Buffet Breakfast was really good, and front desk very helpful.highly recommendedto get to city center you just need a 5 minute walk to the metro station.excellent wifi connection.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel is just splendid in all respects: big clean rooms, large balconies, an excellent restaurant, super friendly and efficient service. There is noting that is not first-rate. The only downside for a short-term visitor to Barcelona is the location. You can walk along the Diagonal to get to the center but it takes almost an hour. Or you have to take a taxi or a bus. Also, if you wish to go to dinner in the neighborhood there are no (good) restaurants around so your best bet is to stay in the hotel. (The hotel restaurant is really excellent, as I already mentioned, but perhaps you wish not to go to the same place evening after evening.)
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Assuming that it is a 4* hotel in Pedralbes (wealthiest neighbourhood in Barcelona) and named "suites", I assumed it would be just a bit better. Do not missunderstand me, I would recommend it and repeat.It is a great hotel, with big bedrooms (suites, of course), good breakfast, etc. However, some details surprised me. The room was really hot, even with the heating off. We had to open the windows to refresh it, even at night!! I could have never imagined I would sleep with the windows open at the very beginning of March.A good pro is that you can park for free in front of the hotel at the weekend since it is a green area. The underground is really close, too.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed here on a couple of occasions very recently. Great location for Camp Nou only 10 minutes walk. The hotel is spotlessly clean and the suites are lovely and very spacious and very modern. The restaurant and bar is of high quality with very professional staff under the leadership of Manuel. There is a pleasant outdoor seating area and a few bars within a couple of minutes walk. The metro station is only 5 minutes walk on Avenue Diagonal where there are lots of bars to choose from. All in all a very nice hotel just a few minutes by metro from the centre of Barcelona or a 20 minute walk. Highly recommended
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The room is like a suite with separate are for making coffee with mini bar, then lounge with sofa and desk & chairs . Also there is a partition to the bedroom with un suite full bathroom superb accommodation for the money paid
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This is a very relaxing place for a business trip. The suites are spacious. There is a airy balcony that has shutters - very private. There is a sizable desk. A sofa area. There is a TV with separate sound system for your own music. This is on a elegant stand that can be positioned for sofa or in bed appreciation.The bed is the vast. The bathroom is fully equipped. Even a bidet. Restaurant area is lovely with a decent buffet.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Clean , calm , close to many attractions like camp nou - l'illa shopping mall. 5 minites walk from maria cristina metro station. Friendly staff. There is a very near station for one of the touristic bus stops.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Had 2 awesome experiences at this hotel. Oscar who worked in the restaurant was a pleasure to deal with. He was extremely friendly and even suggested some local things to visit, his English was perfect. Natalia who works at the front desk helped us get back my wife's jewelry that was mistakenly left in the safe in our room. We can't be more grateful. I am a loyal Marriott customer who spends between 30-40 nights in a hotel and this was one of the best experiences at a hotel I have ever had.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Very good rooms! Breakfast is ok! Location is pretty good! Gym is inexistent (almost) / staff are polite! As I am here at a business trip I can't say about the cost benefit but I would come back to this hotel without a problem.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Many of the hotel common areas are worn and dark. Our room was nice, but chopped up into 3 rooms, one of which was a large useless conference room. The dining area was nice and we enjoyed a great dinner one evening. Service overall was good. The hotel is too far from the city center. We spent too much time traveling to the notable areas of Barcelona. It's okay, but not worth the price given the distance and the inconsistent condition of the property.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: So far our favorite Marriott branded hotel in our 3 week long trip. A bit small suite but adequate. Amenity and decoration was very modern and clean and Nespresso machine in the room too! Breakfast was good as well. Its 10-15 minutes walk from the nearest metro station. Front desk service was great too. They had hard time calling for taxi due to Saturday and lunch time. One staff walked to the street and hailed a taxi for us in humid 90 plus degree heat. Highly recommended.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: An all suites hotel in a quiet, peaceful predominantly residential area. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Breakfast is decent and the dining areas, both internal and external, are attractive. The Metro is only around 5 minutes walk away, for those wishing to travel to the city centre. There are several restaurants close by and a small supermarket. The hotel is ideally situated for those planning to watch Barcelona play or do the Nou Camp tour. The stadium is around a 10 min walk. Staff were helpful and friendly. A few international TV channels would be appreciated. The rollaway beds need to be bigger.Overall, an enjoyable stay. Would be happy to return again.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We traveled to Barcelona as part of our summer vacation to Spain. I decided to stay at the AC Hotel Victoria Suites since I try always to stay in Marriot Hotels for the consistency of its quality . We booked two suites , since we traveled with our two adults sons. The hotel was nice and quiet. Excellent breakfast and very courteous staff. We have a couple of issues with one of the suites: the air conditioning wasn't working and the room stayed warm and uncomfortable during the night. We requested the AC to be checked and they sent a technician who said he has improved the airflow. There was not difference after all. The only way to make it a little bit comfortable was to keep the AC on during the day (while we were around the city. In Spain like in other places in Europe they have a card operated switch that turn off all the electricity when leaving the room). The other issue was the internet access that was offered as part of the rate and it wasn't working most of the time, I consider this as a fraudulent offer because the rates are based on free WI-FI and Breakfast. I suggest Marriott to actually guarantee certain level of speed connection to their customer who paid for that service. And last they only have one of the suites with 120 V switch (just one) . When we asked for a voltage converter we were told that they have only ONE available and they required to be returned at the check out. Just a hint: in the City Tour Buses of the City of Barcelona they replace the headphones as many tomes the customers ask for them. These are approximately the same cost of the Voltage converters (around 50 cents of Euro) so the hotel must have as many as rooms they have to make the stay more pleasant for the customer in these days when everybody carries at least three electronic devices
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hotel does not meet the standards of a Marriott. When I booked the room I felt that I booked the room with breakfast but at registration they stated this was not the case. The room was adequate. Our son was traveling with us and we requested a roll away bed which was very uncomfortable and at an additional 50 euros/night.There was a water main break when we were there. We were unable to take showers until late in the day. I went to the registration desk to see why we had no water, we were never informed. When asked if they could provide bottled water to brush our teeth they looked surprised regarding my request. I did eventually receive a bottled water.We had dinner in their restaurant as we arrived late and were very hungry. Dinner was disappointing. We had grilled fish and was mediocre. Outside patio is lovely for evening drink or to relax.Hotel is a short distance walk to pick up the hop on hop off bus and breakfast restaurants that are nice. Public buses are available also.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed at AC Victoria for 2 nights prior to our family cruise. The staff was very friendly and courteous. Our rooms were beautiful, with all the amenities we needed. The hotel is a short walk from the metro. The city is absolutely beautiful and very easy to maneuver. Las Ramblas was one of the highlights of our time there. Two days is definitely not enough time to see everything. I hope to go back soon.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I stopped here on a business trip and was given room 1003.I'm not 100% sure why there were blinds on the balcony but the room itself I could not fault, it was spotlessly clean, and was composed of two rooms, a living room with a good size desk with two chairs and a sofa.the second room was the bedroom with a very very large bed which led into a very nice bathroom.The balcony itself was very big with a lounger and table and chairs, again I'm just not sure about the blinds.Breakfast had a good selection and the coffee was very good too.The only reason I'm rating this hotel a 4 is down to the fact that the bar manager was very rude and treated made us feel like we were in the way.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Contemporary comfortable hotel. The rooms are contemporary and we were in a suite which was very large compared to other European hotels. There was a refrigerator and stove (which we couldn't use without pans:)). There was not a microwave that we are used to having, but found other places to eat. There was a small pub around the corner called LA Rala that had very flavorful food. Our family ordered some margarita pizzas and veal hamburgers. My teenage boys said the burger was the most flavorful burger they had eaten. They said it was the best food they had had so far in Europe (we'd been there 4 days), and they finally felt they'd had enough food.The hotel was super close (~ 1-2 blocks from the hop on hop off bus, so it was super convenient to see the city sights. Just know that if you book the hop on hop off bus tickets online, you need to print them out before you arrive at the bus. The hotel is on the blue line, which goes to the major tourist site, La Sagrada Familia.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've been there for a conference. I've received a two room suite with a balcony. The room is very modern, spacious and very clean.The hotel gives the guest all that small goodies that even other Marriott hotels don't give anymore such as toothbrush, shower cups, shaving razors and more. Bathrobes and shoes - just like a SPA.Their bath towels - the largest I've ever seen in a hotel.The hotel is located in a nice quiet neigbourhood near the Diagonal avenue. It is about 20 minutes walk from the conference center. It is close by to Palais Raiel, and Camp Nou. It is not a walking distance from the center, you'll have to take the underground for that. Their restaurant is excellent - both for breakfast and dinner. They have a very good bread store in the restaurant.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We stayed for five nights, mostly to sleep as we were out sight seeing the entire day. What we missed most was a kettle to make tea/coffee. The coffee maker provided did not function properly and we had to do with Luke warm water. A microwave in the room would have helped in warming food since the rooms are suites and should have its own. The staff were friendly and check in and check out was smooth and efficient. Would recommend it for business travellers rather than tourists since it is away from the main streets.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good overall - so between Average and Very good!!Stayed three nights (April) at the AC Victoria, conveniently located near the Polytechnic University (but quite far from the sea front (port Olympic) where there are many restaurant and night life...).I had a nice suite at the back - the street was quite but there was quite a bit of noise from surrounding rooms (wooden floors...).WiFi was free and OK to work.Tried the Santa Clara restaurant which was good. The bar was closed.Staff was friendly but not excessively - professional let's say.
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: we had a good Easter weekendeasy accessgood homenice room with what togood advice for tours and restaurantscalm and quiet hotelwe were pampered well advisedgood Buffet breakfastswait for the next staythank you very much
hotelName:
29    AC Hotel Victoria Suites
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The most amazing hostel Ever! Could not fault it!The staff were absolutely amazing! Felt more like family! Went above and beyond to make you feel welcomed! The rooms:I stayed in a four bed female dorm. Beds were super comfy and bathrooms were great!The rooftop area with pool was awesome!All of the tours were amazing! I did the gothic tour and the bar crawl.Honestly can’t thank the staff enough! Wish I could go back! Am missing everyone and can’t wait to stay again!Do not hesitate to book this awesome place!
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I reserved dinner, hit the streets of Barcelona (literally and figuratively), ended up in the hospital, then limped into the hostel well after the meal. They saved my lasagna and heated it up for me. While I didn't get the entire dinner, I wasn't charged either. That was very kind of them. Breakfast was also included with the family room. It's a busy place with seven floors. The family rooms are situated on the 1st floor, where the laundry room and a common room can be found. There are signs designating the floor a quiet area, but one night a group of guys played cards past midnight. They were loud. With the front desk just meters away, someone should enforce the rules. The metro is just a few blocks away. Plenty of restaurants and bodegas in the area. Bike share located directly in front.By far the best hostel I've ever stayed in.
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: As the reviews all show this hostel is really great. I stayed here 3 nights and had very good experience. Clean/comfortable bed, good facilities, nice staffs (especially david and laura - gracias!) and fun activies (pre-drinking and going out clubbing all together). Maybe the only thing I can point out for areas of improvement is that it is really challenging to climb up and down the ladder of 2nd floor of bunk bed. So if you can try to get the first floor of the bunk bed.
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: At first, I was a bit apprehensive about staying in a hostel but Yeah Hostel is not your typical hostel. Three of us stayed in a two bunk-bed room. We decided upon this as we wanted to have some privacy. The rooms were clean and comfortable. The staff were excellent and went out of their way to help!
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: We were here for three nights with couple and 2 children in family room. It was really nice.nice room, clean, spaceous and privât bathroom.they are very helpfull and really friendly. Breakfast and diner can be taken in hostel.top location and top stay.thanks
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Rooms were lovely and clean. Beds were very comfortable and had a great addition of privacy curtains. We went on both walking tours in the day and a nighttime bar crawl. Both were excellent. The walking tour gave a great background of the city. The nighttime tour took us too bars that we wouldn’t necessarily found otherwise. It was great fun. We also ate both breakfast and dinner at the hostel. The food was delicious. We could not fault it, especially because of the excellent price. Overall, me and my friend enjoyed out stay and would defo recommend it!
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: One of the better hostels I've stayed in. Great, clean rooms and very comfortable dorm beds. The bunks beds have privacy curtains and reading lights which makes all the difference. I stayed in a 6-bed room and it's very spacious and airy compared to a lot of dorms rooms.Can comfortably walk to Sagrada Familia. Lots of quaint cafes in the neighbourhood. Nice leafy neighbourhood for walks if you're after some quiet-time.
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hotel and the staff is very nice! There is breakfast and dinner option for a very cheap price and they are offering delicious menu. The rooms are clean and beds are comfortable. Metro station Verdaguer is just 5 min walk away. There are great places around to eat or drink.
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good location, excellent staff, comfy bed and nice meal. What else can you ask for especially for the price of this place. Received great recommendations and a map from staff where to travel, how to use their trams, what worth visiting. They also do tours in the mornings and organizes night outs.
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I can’t recommend this Hostel enough!! Absolutely everything was fantastic. The location is great. You can easily walk and take public transport anywhere in the city. The room and bathrooms are super clean, the beds are comfy, and the staff is phenomenal!!! The atmosphere is also perfect for solo travelers looking to make new friends. Tiago and James were the best night tour guides ever! They were so kind, fun, and welcoming! They really know how to show you a fun time in Barcelona! I will definitely return to Yeah hostel whenever I am back in Barcelona.10.0
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The hostel has a very good location, close to a metro station and you can do a lot of things walking from there as well. The accommodations are very comfortable and spacious, the space for bag storage on the rooms are big and can fit one small and one medium bag easily. The staff is very friendly and ready to help! They also offer breakfast and dinner (which they change the menu everyday), but they also have a kitchen where you can cook your own food.
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved this hostel. So easy to access, great staff, breakfast and towel rental were inexpensive. The free, tip based tour in the morning was as informative as it was amusing and fun. Lucia was a total blast and gave it energy even when people were still tired in the morning. Rooms were comfortable - I'd suggest requesting the lower bunk as it has a curtain if you have fellow guests. Bring a lock for the luggage place.I think I may be pretty allergic to black mold - there was a bit of it on the ceiling of the shower room, and my nose was running a lot while we were there. But I let the staff know and they said they would take care of it. I only mention it in case you know you have the same allergy - if you see it, might want to ask for another room.Otherwise, AMAZING. So easy and just made the whole experience a lot better in Barcelona. Good food recommendations from the staff as well.
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Everything was 100%! The rooms were clean and had everything we needed. It's in a great location and close to the metro. The staff were all extremely friendly and helpful. Can't say enough good things about Tiago! He helped us out a lot and gave us great recommendations on places to go. We loved the pub crawls and he made them so much fun! Luca and Laura were also great to go to the pub crawls with! Best hostel ever and definitely don't miss the pub crawls!! You won't regret it! 10/10 would recommend!!
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I've been traveling around Europe so I've stayed in my fair share of hostels. Yeah Hostel was by far my favorite and my friends agree. It was inexpensive, the bed were comfortable, the breakfast was only 3 euros and was great, they had a wonderful sense of community and even took everyone out to local bars each night, On top of this, they offered free, tip-based walking tours around Barcelona. Do not miss out, this hostel was amazing and I would stay there again in a heart beat.
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Thoroughly enjoyed my stay! Great, friendly staff (especially tours given by Alberto!) the food was wonderful and my bed was comfy. Housekeeping could be a little more considerate as a cleaner walked in whilst my friend was changing! Other than that my experience with Yeah Barcelona was great. Thank you
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I really enjoyed the hospitality especially Alberto the tour guide ! My only negative feedback is the cleaning service barging in without consent (while persons are unclothed) and also not returning in the morning to unlock the window. The breakfast and dinner was great. Maybe it could be made more clear in the beginning that the money for the towels are not returned as me and the rest of my booking were under the impression that we were getting our money back.
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I had high hopes for this hostel after enjoying the sister Yes Hostels in Lisbon and Porto. It did not disappoint; friendly vibe, excellent communal dinners, great to meet other travellers and good quality rooms. The walking tours with Alberto are a great way to see the city, I would recommend taking both if you have enough time.
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Perfect for solo traveller who want to have fun. Stayed in a private room which was the same as a hotel. Loved the bar crawl and the walking tour. As soon as I walked into the hostel bar the bartender introduced me to other travellers so I wasn’t left standing alone!
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was my first experience to stay in a hostel. It was fun, place is clean, staffs were all friendly. Really enjoyed it. Too bad I couldn’t extend it. Special thanks to Alberto who showed us the Gothic quarter tour one morning. He was very energetic, knowledgeable, enthusiastic, caring person. Highly recommended !
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in this hostel for 2 nights in a 4-bed dorm with friends. Came back one evening to realise my shoes were missing from the room — the only explanation is that its taken by a staff of the hostel (they enter the room at least twice daily to unlock and lock the windows), because everyone else staying in the room were out with me. SERIOUSLY, SHOES?! Moreover, it is not even a new pair of shoes — it has been worn, and they even took my socks. Fair enough, it was a pair of Onitsuka Tiger and it's a really nice pair — might just be my fault for trusting the hostel and the staffs, and my fault for not keeping my shoes in my locker.On a more positive note, I'm satisfied with most other things in this hostel. But stay away because you might lose things and the staffs won't be able to help with it. Or you could just lock EVERYTHING (even shoes and socks and everything else).Cheers and good luck with this hostel!
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was such a great place to stay for a couple of days! I highly recommend and would definitely go back.It’s super clean, there are nice communal areas and the staff are very welcoming. The rooms are modern and convenient. The only downside is you can’t open the window to let air in. The walking tour was very informative and I would definitely recommend.Breakfast is worth the €3 but there are also places near by that you can go out to, if you fancy something different. It’s close to the Metro station which makes it easy to get around the city. It’s also possible to walk to the shops and other sights, like Park Guell.
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Yeah Hostel staff were welcoming as soon as I walked through the door. Location - Fantastic, I felt safe the wholetime. 25 minute walk from the Aerobús stop, 9 minutes from Passeig de Gracia and 5ish minutes to the nearest Metro station. Good tapas bars very close by too!Common areas - Everything looked as it does in the photos. The terrace, lounge and bar area were great places to meet other travellers or chill out alone. Activities- The communal dinner (12€) was a nice way to meet people, the food itself wasn’t incredible but filled me up!The bar crawl was 12€ -in terms of drinks, it’s not worth it but social wise 100% is. Met a lot of other solo travellers and small groups this way. The walking tours are free - I did both the Modernism and Gothic Tour with Lucia which were both fantastic and a great way to get to know my surroundings whilst also meeting others from the hostel. Rooms - I shared a 4 bed female dorm. The bed was SO comfortable and the shower was lovely. Bring 2x padlocks with you for the large drawer under the beds and the cubby hole. The cubby hole also has a light and plug socket. It was my first time travelling alone and this was the perfect hostel to do so. Really recommend!Top tip: book popular tourist activities before you get there as they sell out quick!
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Good points:- Welcoming staff. Very helpful. David - you are a gem :)-Very clean room and bathroom. I stayed in a female only room of 2 bunk beds and a shower/toilet.-Perfect location-Free tours...which were informative and amazing.-Pub crawling every evening. Sadly I didn't join them as I was too tired by evening. Only stayed two nights in Yeah!Negative- food wasn't brilliant but I'm going to assume that's normal (ish) for a hostel ?I made good traveling friends from this hostel ! A couple have remained my good friends.
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Just came back from an amazing 3 night stay at Yeah! Hostel in Barcelona. Rooms were modern and had a toilet and shower which you shared between the occupants of the room. Loved the under bed storage where you could keep your belongings as well as the curtains on the bottom bunks to give you some privacy. Many people came and went which gave us the opportunity to meet loads of new people. The hostel offers a buffet breakfast each morning for €3 each which we took full advantage of. They also did a 3 course meal in evenings for €12. The free walking tours that they offered were one of the highlights of the stay. They were very insightful and gave us a lot of knowledge of the architecture of the local area. Our tour guide Lucia was very friendly and was knowledgeable giving us an amazing tour. We just wished we went on the tour of the gothic area of the city. We also enjoyed the roof top pool and viewing area as it gave some great views of the city.We would definitely stay again when visiting in the future!
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Hi, I booked this hostel as a first time experience ever. And it was awesome, one way to describe the experience is that, the people that run this place is supper nice and give a full attention to their guests, no matter what time you come in from the street, the rooms are very nice with a awesome air condition and are supper clean, also the beds are supper comfortable also. The hostel is located in a very nice neighborhood with all kinds of good stuff all around you and with two major metro station just a short walk. Also the free tours they offer is really nice they are free but a very generous tips please is nice, I will definitely recommend and stay on it again.
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Stayed in Barcelona for 3 days. Upon entering the hostel we were greeted by Alberto who was very friendly and accommodating. He gave us a detailed information about the activities the hostel was offering. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. Make sure to get the lower bunk because the stairs to the upper bunk is a bit sharp and kinda painful to step on. They do not provide towels and toiletries so make sure to bring your own.If you do not have any plans, make sure to take the walking tour they offer. The tour guides are very friendly and they give you great insights about the places you would be visiting.Special mentions to Alberto and Aruba for giving us a great tour of the city.If your visiting Barcelona this is a great place to stay.
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Loved staying here! Lots of activities offered, social atmosphere, the walking tour with Alberto was the best!! Dinner was great and bar crawl really fun. Recommend getting involved with the activities. Very helpful staff and made you feel welcome. Room great, clean, modern. Would stay again!
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I want to start my review of this place by saying THANK YOU! ❤️ I booked this hostel about 12 hours, maybe even less before my flight and I didn’t, even for a second, regretted my decision! I had an amazing stay in a fabulous place with super friendly and outgoing people in it. The location is just fantastic, rooms are super clean, beds are comfy, you have your privacy in shared place by little curtain, which for me, is a great plus in the hostel! For 3 euros you have a great breakfast with nice variety of food. For only 12 euros you can have a delicious dinner with salad, dessert and all you can drink sangria and beer! This is not only and amazing deal, but it’s super tasty and you can meet so many new people! If you want to explore the city, take the tour, and know, if your tour guy is Alberto you are in for an amazing, interesting, fun and just outstanding 2 and a half hours of walking and exploring beautiful Barcelona! If you are not in the mood for exploring, and don’t really go to the beach, go to the rooftop with a nice view and cozy pool. My only wish for this place is to stay as awesome as it already is. And of course, special thanks and hugs are for Alberto, Tiago, Miguel (aka John Snow) and the chef ( sorry I didn’t get his name) You guys are just amazing! You made my stay so much better, gave me amazing recommendations on what to do, where to go, you helped me out and cheered me up, when I saw super down. ¡Gracias ❤️
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This was my first time solo travelling so I have looked up everything and I chose Yeah because of the great reviews, I wasn’t disappointed! The staff in the hostel are second to none, always willing to help and to have a chat! I did the walking tour 2 of my mornings and Louisa (sorry if it is spelt wrong) was brilliant, she was knowledgable and tried to get everyone involved! Afterwards she recommended different place to eat, La Funda for paella was fantastic.I did the dinner (€12 for 3 courses) each night I was there and 1 night the pub crawl. These were brilliant ice breakers, I met so many people!The location is brilliant, you’re around the corner from a metro stop, a small shop is over the road.The rooms were cleaned daily and they were CLEAN! I’ve stayed in 4* hotels that weren’t as clean as here! I was in a bottom bunk so had the privacy curtain, it was overall a fantastic room. The roof top terrace was where I spent most of my afternoons after exploring! I will admit that the pool did look a bit grimy, I didn’t hear the filter on, but it was the prefect place to cool down in the heat! Honestly, Yeah Barcelona Hostel has set the bar high for other hostels!
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Did a pit stop in Barcelona prior to my trip to Pamplona for San fermin. Very clean Hostel, friendly staff and a small pool on the rooftop as a plus. Very social hostel with outtings everynight. I loved the bar hopping in Hot Bar and Sutton.
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: I booked this hostel as I was heading to Barcelona for my first solo trip.I initially booked it because of the great reviews and I was not disappointed.The staff are so nice and helpful they made me feel so comfortable and as soon as I got in they were making me laugh and showing me everything I needed to know.The overall hostel is amazing,very clean and tidy and a great smell and atmosphere.It honestly doesn’t feel like a hostel at all and I was very skeptical about going to one originally anyways.The room has separate shower & toilet.The beds are feel very luxury and the mattress is superb and I was in a 6 bed female room.There is a mini light by your head and locker and a charging port also.There is a locker for your suitcase which is super big and can fit literally two hand lugguage suitcases and probs more.The cleaners come in twice a day to clean the rooms so it’s very clean and you’ll have the best sleep ever as you can’t hear anything in the room and it has air con.They do bar crawl and dinner which is €12 (includes starter,main,desert & unlimited soft drink or sangria or beer) or just the bar crawl it is €8 euros.This was a great ice breaker for me as I was a solo traveller and you get to meet other travellers too.The host take you out to 3 pre drink bar & 1 main club which I went to called SHOKO and all entry is included and you get a shot in each small bar but everything is relatively cheap there.Breakfast in morning unlimited is €3 too.There’s also a kitchen there if you want to make your own food they supply fridges,plates,cups,microwave,job and all kitchen necessities There’s a great lounge for quite time too and a rooftop pool upstairs which is amazing with the views too.Overall the hostel is amazing great for a first time traveller they will look after you and the staff are so funny and bubbly and it literally feels like your in a hotel.Shout out to the hosts that were there taking me out too I believe William with the long hair & Tiago is so funny on the nights out.It was so good I’m booked to go back in August too!
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: Yeah hostel was a great experience. It was very clean and well maintained and had a nice communal area to meet other guests. They had nightly dinners and bar crawls planned for every evening. Both of the bar crawl leaders Tiago and Marco were incredibly fun and friendly. The walking tours led by Joe and Alberto were also incredibly informative and fun. If you are looking for a social hostel this is the place to be! Overall highly recommend Yeah hostel!
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: The best hostel in Barcelona. Everything about this hostel is amazing. Very good staff that will give you tips about the city. Stayed in a 4 Bed dorm, honestly it couldn't have been better. The morning walking tours by Alberto were amazing. They serve breakfast for 3 Euros and dinner for 10-12 Euros. If you are in Barcelona, you have to stay there.
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: It was a great place. The rooms are clean, well conditioned and the staff is very nice. They offer a cheap breakfast and dinner but I did not try. The kitchen was very useful and the possibility of doing laundry also.
hotelName:
30    Yeah Barcelona Hostel
Name: hotel_name, dtype: object

review_body: This hostel had everything I would want: great location, friendly/fun/caring staff, communal dinner where it’s encouraged to make friends, pub crawl to meet more people, walking tours that are top tier, clean bedrooms and ensuite, plenty of storage, locking bed stand, laundry, and quiet on sleeping floors, rooftop with small pool.
